response: Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Combine first six ingredients in a medium bowlbeat until crumbly. Press into an ungreased 13 x 9 inch pan. Bake for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely on a wire rack. Beat coffee granules, milk, confectioners' sugar, egg whites, and extract with an electric mixer until frothy. Spread over crustsprinkle with sliced almonds. Chill for 1 hour or until firm. Cut into 4 rows by 3 rows.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut off top of bread loaf. Remove crumbs with a fork. Melt butter in a skillet. Add onion, celery and mushrooms. Cook until tender. Crumble sausage into skillet and cook until sausage is browned. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add bread cubes and seasonings. Transfer to a greased 13x9-in. Baking dish. Cover with bread top and bake for 25 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 5 to 10 minutes. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Soak bread cubes in milk and egg mixture overnight. Preheat oven to 350. Spoon turkey and swiss cheese in the center. Roll up and place in a greased 13x9 baking pan. Sprinkle with remaining dry bread cubes. Bake for 1 hour. Serve with gravy.

Cook broccoli florets in boiling water until tender-crisp, drain and cool to room temperature. Cook spaghetti in boiling water until just barely tender but still firm to bitedrain and return to pot. Combine cooked spaghetti and broccoli in large serving bowl and pour in enough dressing to coat well. Combine peanut butter with stock and soy sauce in small saucepan over low heat until smoothpour over pasta and broccoli mixture. Stir gently to combine. Add dry red pepper to taste. Serve at once or cover and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Cook macaroni according to package directions, drain and set aside. In a saucepan combine mayonnaise, nutritional yeast, milk substitute, salt and pepper. Heat over medium heat until smooth. Pour over pasta and toss to coat. Sprinkle with bread crumbs.

Cook sausage in skillet until no longer pinkdrain fat. Brown onion in same skillet until tenderadd bacon and cook until fat is rendered. Stir in soup mixwater and sausage. Heat to boilingstir in vegetables. Coversimmer 5 minute or until vegetables are tender. Spoon into a 2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with parsley.

Spread the crunchy peanut butter onto one slice of white bread. Top with the whole wheat bread. Spread the grape jelly onto the white bread. Top with the other slice of whole wheat bread. Sprinkle goldfish crackers onto the sandwich. Slice into 36 squares.

Place chicken breasts in a baking dish. Season both sides with salt and pepper. Mix together 1/4 cup of flour and 1/4 cup soy sauce in a small bowl. Place the chicken in a plastic bag and pour the sauce over it. Shake to coat. Arrange the chicken in the baking dish. Add a parsley sprig to each piece of chicken. Cover with foil. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove the foil and bake for 10 minutes longer. Meanwhile, in a saucepan combine the white rice with 1 teaspoon of salt and 1 teaspoon of sugar. Cook over medium-high heat until tender and water is absorbed. Add the pineapple chunks to the rice. When the chicken is done, shred it and stir it into the rice. Serve hot with extra parsley sprigs.

Cream together butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Add eggs and vanilla and mix well. Stir in sifted dry ingredients. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in a 400 degree oven for 8 to 10 minutes. Do not overbake! Makes about 3 dozen cookies.
Combine grapefruit juice and ice cubes in the glass of your choice. Pour vodka into glass, then add lime juice. Top with maraschino cherries and garnish with grapefruit slices.

Mix sugar and water in large kettle. Add frozen orange juice. Stir in almond flavoring. Heat to boiling and boil 2 minutes. Add lemon juice and stir well. Remove from heat. Let cool. Add vanilla and spices. Chill. Serve cold. Makes 10 to 12 servings.
beat eggs in bowl. Add milk and cheddar cheese. Beat until well blended. Add green onion and jalapeno pepper. Cook in buttered skillet and stir until scrambled. Serve with warm bread.

Place the strawberries in a blender. Add ginger ale. Blend until smooth. Place the mixture in a bowl and stir in the milk, the sugar, the lemon juice, the vanilla extract. Chill. Serve in small bowls. Garnish with a dollop of sour cream. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat the broiler. In a bowl combine the hoisin sauce with the orange juice, honey and ginger. Stir until the honey is dissolved. Place the salmon in a shallow baking dish. Pour the sauce over the salmon and sprinkle with sesame seeds. Broil 5 minutes. Turn the salmon and broil 5 minutes more or until the salmon is cooked through.

In a blender or food processor, combine the red peppers, cilantro, balsamic vinegar, garlic and mustardblend until smooth. In a small bowl, combine the coriander, cinnamon, pepper and saltmix well. Add the almonds and toss well to coat with the spice mixture. Thread the chicken pieces onto the skewersbrush with the olive oil. Grill over high heat for 2 minutes per side, or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve with the almond-spice mixture and pesto sauce.

In a food processor combine blue cheese, butter, lemon juice and salt and pepper. Process until smooth. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the vegetables and cook until crisp and tender. Transfer to a serving platter and top with the blue cheese butter. Serve with toast points.

Preheat oven to 350. Sprinkle pork loin with salt and pepper. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a small skillet over low heat. Add garlic and saute until soft. Brush tenderloin with garlic butter. Wrap tenderloin in aluminum foil. Roast for 1 hour. Unwrap tenderloin. Brush with remaining butter. Increase oven temperature to 400. Roast for another 30 minutes. While tenderloin is roasting, heat olive oil in skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Transfer to a bowl. Slice tenderloin. Pour juices from skillet over tenderloin. Stir in onion. Serve.
Combine pumpkin puree, pears, figs, brown sugar and spices. Pour into unbaked pie crust. Bake 400 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees and bake for 30 minutes. Let cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease an 8 x 8 inch baking pan. In a large bowl combine butter and brown sugar. Beat with electric mixer until smooth and creamy. Beat in vanilla. Add flour and stir until mixture is crumbly. Press mixture evenly into prepared pan. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes until golden. Cool completely. Spread marshmallows over graham cracker crust. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and walnuts. Return to oven and bake for 5 more minutes. Cool completely. Cut into bars. Store in refrigerator.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line baking sheets with wax paper. In a large bowl combine oats, almonds, wheat germ, and cinnamon. In a small bowl combine honey and vanillapour over cereal mixture and mix well. Spread mixture on prepared baking sheets and bake until golden brown, about 20 minutes. Stir halfway through baking time. Remove from oven and stir in dried fruit and nutmeg. Cool to room temperature. Store in tightly covered containers at room temperature or refrigerator. Makes about 12 cups.

Wash oranges and cut in half lengthwise. Remove seeds and cut each half into quarters lengthwise and crosswise. Mix caster sugar, liqueur and vanilla in a small saucepan and bring to a boil for about 2 minutes. Carefully pour boiling liquid over orange quarters and place on a baking sheet or dish. Bake for about 30 minutes until oranges are tender and liquid has reduced by about half. Serve with brandy or liqueur to spoon over oranges.

Mix margarine and sugars until creamy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla and cocoa. Sift together flour and baking soda. Stir into creamed mixture just until blended. Stir in chips. Spread into greased and floured 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake at 350 F for 30 to 35 minutes or until wooden pick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely on wire rack. Makes about 3 dozen bars. Cut into bars and store in airtight container.

In large bowl, combine butter or margarine, Splenda sugar substitute and sugar with electric mixer on low speed until well blended. Beat on medium speed 2 minutes or until light and fluffy. Add egg substitute, beating well. Add flour, whole wheat flour, baking soda and saltbeat until blended. Stir in pineapple. Spread batter into 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake 30 minutes or until wooden pick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes. Remove from pan to wire rack to cool completely.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x9 inch pan. Sift together the cocoa powder, salt, baking powder and flour. In a large bowl, combine the butter and sugar until smooth. Beat in the vanilla and eggs. Add the flour mixture in three parts, alternating with two additions of milk, beating well after each addition. Fold in the chocolate chips. Spread into prepared pan and bake for 20-25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
Combine first four ingredients in a medium bowlstir until well blended. Add broccolitoss to coat. Refrigerate until serving time. Top each serving with bacon crumbles and cheeseserve immediately.
Shake all the above in a large pitcher and serve over ice.

Mix currant jelly and port in a saucepan. Bring to a boil and simmer until slightly thickened. Let cool slightly. Slice orange rind into thin strips. Toss berries and rind together. Serve fruit on a bed of rind with the currant port mixture spooned on top. Garnish with mint.

Juice the mangoes, oranges and lime and blend them in a blender until smooth. Add a cup of club soda to the mixture and blend again. Pour the drink into a large glass over ice cubes. Top it off with the remaining club soda to your liking.

In large bowl, combine cereal, sunflower seeds, almonds, coconut, cranberries and raisins. In saucepan over low heat, combine condensed milk and honey stirring constantly until honey is dissolved. Pour milk mixture over cereal mixture stirring to coat. Spread mixture on foil-lined cookie sheets. Bake in preheated 350f oven 10 minutes. Cool. Store in tightly covered container.

In a large bowl combine the cornmeal and flour. Add the baking powder, sugar and saltmix well. In a medium bowl combine the eggs, milk and beer. Pour into the dry mixture. Stir until just moist. Fold in the onion and jalapeno. Heat the oil in a deep fryer or heavy large skillet to 350 degrees F. Drop the batter by tablespoonfuls into the hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

Toast two slices of bread. Spread with butter. Arrange sliced tomatoes on each slice. Top with brie and fresh basil leaves. Top with remaining slice of bread. Heat a panini maker or large frypan to medium heat. Cook sandwiches until the bread is golden brown. Cut into quarters.

Place lamb chops in shallow baking dish or glass bowl. In another container mix vinegar, olive oil and rosemary. Pour over chops. Marinate at room temp for at least 1 hour and up to 3 hours. Bake on broiler pan at 350 for 10 minutes. Serve with your favorite potato, pasta or rice dish.

Cut zucchini lengthwise in half. Bring 2 inches water to a boil in a 2 quart saucepan. Add zucchini and cook until tender (6-8 minutes). Drain and cool slightly. In a small bowl whisk together broth and next 7 ingredients. Pour mixture over zucchini. Toss to coat. Cover and chill at least 1 hour before serving. Garnish with parsley.
In a small bowl, stir together sugar, oil, mayonnaise, mustard. Spoon into a 1 quart bowl or platter. Garnish with dill weed. Serve with pretzels.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a bowl toss together bacon, pecans, and the sugar. Remove core from each pear with a sharp knife. Wrap a piece of bacon around each pear. Place pears in a shallow baking pan. Bake for 15 minutes. In a large bowl toss together greens, bacon, pecans, parmesan cheese, and vinaigrette. Divide greens mixture among four plates. Arrange pears on each salad. Serve warm.

Cut the bread into cubes. In a bowl mix the milk, eggs, salt and pepper. Add the cheeses to the milk mixture. Dip the cubes of bread into the egg mixture. Layer in 13x9 pan. Bake at 350f for 30-40 mins or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool. Cut into squares. Fry the bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towel. Add the bacon to the peppy egg strata.

Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add fish fillets to pan and cook for about 3 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with lemon rind and cook for another minute or two on each side. Sprinkle with scallops and cook for another 2 minutes on each side. Sprinkle with green peppercorns and cook for 1 minute more. Turn off the heat and add lemon juice. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot with rice or mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 375F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, sift together flour, baking soda, and saltset aside. In another bowl, beat together butter, brown sugar, granulated sugar, and vanilla until pale and fluffy (about 3 minutes). Beat in egg yolks one at a time until fully incorporatedbeat for another 2 minutes. Beat in melted chocolatemix until incorporated. Stir in flour mixture until just combinedfold in chocolate chips. Scoop tablespoons of dough onto baking sheets. Bake until edges are golden brown (about 12 minutes). Transfer cookies to wire racks to coolserve or store in an airtight container up to 1 week.

Beat cream cheese until light and fluffy with electric mixer. Add sugar and continue beating until smooth and well blended. Add topping and cherry pie filling and mix well. Spoon into pie crust and freeze. May be served frozen or thawed and served with whipped cream.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add rice, bouillon powder and garlic powder. Stir and cook for 1 minute. Add onion powder. Stir to combine. Add water. Cover and bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Let sit for 5 minutes. Stir in lemon juice. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

In a large bowl, combine cabbage, carrots, and onion. In a small bowl whisk together mayonnaise, mustard, apple cider vinegar and sugar. Pour over slaw and toss to coat. Fold in cayenne. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes to blend flavors. Toss before serving. Serve at room temperature.

Mix the garlic and mirin in a small bowl. Set aside. Cut the sweet potato into wedges about 3/4 inch thick. In a medium saucepan combine the mirin mixture with the soy sauce and water. Add the potato wedges and cook on medium heat until the potatoes are soft when pierced with a knife. Drain and place on a baking sheet. Drizzle with the dark sesame oil and sprinkle with the sesame seeds. Bake until the potatoes are dry and crispy. Serve with nori.

In a large pot, heat the oil over medium heat. Add cherry tomatoes, garlic and cook for about 6 minutes or until the tomatoes are beginning to turn soft. Pour in white wine and continue cooking for about 1 minute. Add clams and cook for about 3 minutes or until they have begun to open up. Add lemon juice and parsley. Drizzle with fresh olive oil. Serve with the french bread soaked in the juices.

Combine flour and seasonings. Coat chicken pieces evenly. In a large heavy skillet heat oil over medium high heat. Fry the chicken in the hot oil for 10 to 12 minutes or until crisp and golden brown. Turn pieces once.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Toss pears with raisins and maple syrup. Place in baking dish with a cover. Bake for 1 hour or until tender. Combine remaining ingredients and spoon over pears. Bake 10 minutes longer until sauce is thickened. Serve pears hot.

Place carrots in large saucepan, cover with cold water by 1 inch. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer until carrots are tender. Drain and return to saucepan. Mash with garlic and butter. Stir in stock. Season with thyme and pepper.

Place biscuits in the freezer until ready to use. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cream cream cheese and sugar together. Add egg and beat until smooth. In a separate bowl, combine flour and cinnamon. Dip biscuits in the cream cheese mixture until covered. Place in ungreased muffin cups or on ungreased cookie sheets. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar topping. Bake in preheated oven for 20 minutes, until lightly browned. Let cool slightly and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. On a baking sheet, place the potato wedges and place on the foil. In a bowl, combine the taco seasoning and the oil and mix well. Pour the mixture over the potato wedges and toss well to coat. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove the potatoes from the oven and top with the mexican blend cheese. Return to the oven and bake for an additional 5 minutes or until the potatoes are golden brown and the cheese is melted.
Combine oatmeal and milk in saucepan. Stir and cook over low heat until desired consistency. Add cinnamon and banana. Serve with cereal.

Heat oil in large pan or Dutch oven over medium high heat until hot. Add onion & cook about 2 minutes or until tender. Add turkey & cook until no longer pink. Add cumin seed & stir 1 minute. Add tomatoes, beans, chili powder & pepper. Reduce heat to low & cook for about 10 minutes stirring occasionally. Add sazon goya & salt. Simmer for about 10 minutes stirring frequently to blend flavors. Serve with sour cream & shredded cheddar cheese if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Pierce potatoes all over with fork and place on baking sheet. Bake until tender but not falling apart, 45-60 minutes. Drain off any excess liquid and return potatoes to oven with oven door slightly open and broil until browned and crisp, about 5 minutes. Meanwhile, combine sour cream and milkseason to taste with salt and pepper. Spread 1/4 of potato mixture into 8-inch square baking dishtop with 1/4 of cheese mixture and 1/4 sour cream mixture. Repeat layers twicetop with last layer of potato mixture and remaining cheese mixture and sour cream mixture. Bake until browned and bubbly, about 20 minutes. Sprinkle with chives before serving.

Wash lentils. Place lentils in large pot. Cover lentils with water. Add bay leaves. Bring water to boil. Lower heat. Simmer lentils covered for 20-25 minutes until tender. Drain lentils. Stir lentils in large serving bowl. In another small bowl, combine olive oil, orange peel, oranges, salt and pepper. Pour over lentils. Stir gently. Chill for 2 hours. Garnish with red onion slices. Serve.

Grease a 13x9 pan. Preheat oven to 350f. Cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the eggs and vanilla. Add the flour and baking powder and stir until well blended. Fold in the walnuts and chocolate chips. Press 2/3 of the mixture into the prepared pan. Spread the remaining mixture over the top. Bake for 25 minutes or until the top is golden brown. Let cool completely before cutting into bars.

Heat oil in 12-inch nonstick skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Add onioncook 3 to 4 minutes or until tender. Remove from heatstir in enchilada sauce and chili. Warm tortillas as directed on packagespread evenly with cheese mixture. Roll upplace seam side down on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 8 to 12 minutes or until heated through. Remove from oventop with cheese. Makes 8 servings.

Heat olive oil in a large pan over medium high heat. Add potatoes and onions. Cook 5 minutes. Add hamburger. Cook until browned. Pour onion soup mix over meat. Stir well. Cook 5 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Arrange potatoes and carrots on top. Fold sides of foil up around vegetables and meat. Fold ends together to seal. Place foil packets on grill. Cook 20 minutes or until vegetables and meat are tender. Makes 8 servings.

Heat oven to 375 F. In 10-inch skillet, fry bacon over medium heat until crispdrain and crumble. Remove from skillet, reserving drippings. In same skillet, melt butter. Stir in onions and seasoning saltcook until tender. Remove from skillet. Beat eggs and cream until well blended. Stir in onions and baconpour into skillet. Bake uncovered 10 to 15 minutes or until set. Sprinkle with cheese and sweet onion. Bake 2 to 3 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease a 9x13 pan. Combine margarine, sugar and eggs. Mix well. Beat in cocoa and vanilla. Stir in flour. Fold in chocolate chips. Spread mixture in prepared pan. Bake for 30 - 35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Allow to cool completely before cutting.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add potatoes, onion, carrots, Italian seasoning, 2 tbsp pesto sauce and saltcook 5 minutes. Stir in pastacook 2 minutes more. Add green beanscook 2 minutes more. Serve with remaining pesto sauce.

Cook the pasta in salted water for about 10 minutes, drain and return to the pot. In a medium bowl add the egg, flour, milk and cheese. Whisk until smooth and add to the pasta. Stir and cook over low heat for about 3 minutes. Pour into an ungreased baking dish and bake at 375 degrees for 45 minutes. Serve hot.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil over medium heat. Add beef, onion, carrots and potatoes. Cook for 5 minutes. Stir in tomato paste. Add beef bouillon cubes and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer for 20 minutes. Stir in corn. Simmer for additional 10 minutes. Serve.

Place dried beans in a large pot of boiling water to cover beans by 2 inches. Boil for about 2 minutes then remove from heat and let stand for 1 hour. Drain beans and rinse. In a large pot, combine the beans, onions, garlic, rice, TVP, chili powder, cumin, salt and 6 cups boiling water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Partially cover pan. Simmer for 30 minutes to 1 hour.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic and cook until softened. Add the bacon and cook until browned. Remove from heat and set aside to cool. Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook the spaghetti according to the package instructions. Drain the spaghetti and add it to the skillet. Add the peas and ricotta cheese. Add the cream and cook until heated through. Garnish with the parmesan and parsley. Serve with more parmesan on the side.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a 4-quart Dutch oven or heavy-bottomed pot over medium-high heat. Sprinkle chicken evenly with salt and pepper. Add chicken to potcook 4 minutes per side or until browned on both sides. Add onion to potcook 5 minutes or until tender, stirring occasionally. Add parsnipsstir well. Stir in brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 5 minutes or until parsnips are tender. Remove from heatstir in mustard and honey. Discard thyme sprigs. Serve immediately with parsley sprinkled on top.

Mix sugar, milk and butter until smooth. Add peanut butter, vanilla, cocoa and rolled oats. Mix until well blended. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10-12 minutes. Cool. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Pour rum and apricot brandy into a shaker filled with ice cubes. Shake well and strain into a tall glass filled with ice cubes. Fill with orange juice and pineapple juice. Top with grenadine and stir gently. Garnish with an orange slice and serve immediately.

Peel the carrots. Cut carrots into 1-inch pieces. Place carrots in a saucepan. Add 2 tsp butter. Cook over medium heat until softened. Add the remaining butter. Add the sugar. Stir for a minute. Add the cider. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Cook until liquid is reduced. Add the vegetable stock. Cook until mixture is thickened. Add the mustard. Remove from heat. Stir in fresh parsley. Serve warm.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion & cook until translucent. Add mushrooms & cook until softened. Add red peppers, cook until heated through. Add pasta & cook until al dente. Top with parmesan cheese. Season with salt & pepper. Top with onion powder & garlic. Serve.

Take 1 pound of bulk sausage and 1 pound of lean ground beef and brown it in a skillet. Drain excess fat. Then add one cup of water and one can of tomato juice. Cook and stir until the liquid is reduced by half. Add one can of cream of mushroom soup and one cup of sour cream. Stir until well combined. Add one can of cream of celery soup and one can of cream of chicken soup and one can of cream of mushroom soup. Stir until well combined. Add one can of cream of celery soup and one can of cream of chicken soup and one can of cream of mushroom soup. Stir until well combined. Add one can of cream of celery soup and one can of cream of chicken soup and one can of cream of mushroom soup. Stir until well combined. Add one can of cream of celery soup and one can of cream of chicken soup and one can of cream of mushroom soup. Stir until well combined. Add one can of cream of celery soup and one can of cream of chicken soup

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In a 13 x 9 x 2 inch glass baking dish, toss eggplant, onion, garlic and roasted red peppers with olive oil. Bake at 450 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Cool slightly. Place eggplant mixture on 4 slices of bread. Top each with diced tomatoes. Add 4 slices of mozzarella cheese. Close sandwiches with remaining bread. Melt butter on a large skillet over medium high heat. Place sandwiches on skillet. Cook for 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Makes 4 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a small bowl, combine the cream cheese, mustard and lemon juice. Shape into small balls. Place on a baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until browned. Serve with mixed nuts and crackers.

In a large skillet brown beef with seasoning mix, drain. Add water and simmer uncovered for about one minute. In each tortilla place a spoonful of beef mixture, layer with cheese. Roll up tightly. Put into a sprayed baking pan. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. To serve, top with taco sauce and sour cream.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel carrot and onion. Shred carrot on grater. Slice onion thinly. Cook carrot and onion in butter until tender. Drain liquid. Add water to cover. Bring to a simmer. Cook until tender. Drain. Blend horseradish with mayonnaise. Add pepper. Fold in carrot. Stir breadcrumbs into carrot mixture. Pack into baking dish. Top with butter slices. Combine cheese with melted butter. Spread over top. Bake until bubbling.
Beat together the butter and cheese. Mix the rest of the ingredients together and mix into the butter and cheese mixture. Chill for 2 hours. Roll into balls and put in the fridge to harden.

Bring 2 quarts water to a boil in a large pot. Add pastastir. Cook 2 minutes. Remove pasta from water using a slotted spoonplace in a large bowl. Add the oil to the boiling water and stir. Cook 30 seconds. Stir the oil mixture into the pasta. Add the garlictoss to combine. Transfer the pasta to a platter. Sprinkle the tomatoes on top. Slice the avocadoplace on top. Sprinkle the basil on top. Season with pepper. Serve with Parmesan cheese.

Butterfish and sprinkle each side with dijon mustard and grate lemon zest over the top. Season with salt and pepper. Add the lemon juice and the worcestershire sauce, and sprinkle with parsley and the fresh breadcrumbs. Broil in the oven until the breadcrumbs are brown and crisp. Serve hot with a wedge of lemon to squeeze over the fish. Serves 4 to 6 people.
Thaw carrots. Place in a heavy saucepan with the remaining ingredients. Stir over low heat until mixture thickens. Serve warm or cold as a side dish or vegetable with meat.
Cook potatoes in a large saucepan of boiling water until tender, 15-20 minutes. Drain. In a medium bowl, mash potatoes. Add butter and seasonings. Gently stir in peas. Serve hot.

Brown sausage in skillet with butter over medium high heat until cooked through. Add flour to skillet to make a roux. Mix in milk slowly until desired consistency is reached. Add sour cream, salt, and pepper. Serve over omelets, or keep in fridge for future use.

Cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg and vanilla and cream until smooth. Stir in flour and salt and mix until dough forms a ball. Divide dough into 3 pieces and roll each out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut into 2-inch squares and bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Cool completely and dip in chocolate and nuts if desired.

Steep tea bags in boiling water for about 5 minutes. Add the cloves, cinnamon sticks and sugar. Simmer for another 20 minutes. Add the splenda-sweetened cranberry juice, orange juice and lemon juice. Heat for another 2 minutes. Serve in mugs. Garnish each mug with an orange slice.

Peel potatoes. Cut into thin slices. Place in a microwave safe bowl. Add butter. Microwave for 3 minutes. Stir well. Place in a large resealable plastic bag. Add cajun seasoning. Gently shake bag to coat evenly. Spread on a baking sheet. Bake for 15 minutes. Turn potato chips over. Bake for 15 minutes or until potatoes are crisp.

Remove tough ends from asparagus stems, about 1 inch from the end. Place asparagus on a clean kitchen towel. Wrap each asparagus spear tightly with the towel to form a bundle. Cook bacon in skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon and place on paper towels to drain. Add asparagus bundles and brown sugar to the skillet with the bacon drippings. Add Worcestershire sauce, garlic and butter. Cook until liquid is reduced by half. Arrange bacon strips on top of bundles. Serve immediately.

Combine sugar, light corn syrup, and milk in a heavy-bottomed 3-quart saucepan. Bring to boil over medium-high heat, stirring constantly. Boil 5 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the unsweetened chocolate and butter until smooth. Return the mixture to the heat and boil until thickened to the consistency of thick frosting, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in the vanilla. Let cool.

Place water in a bowl, add raisins and let stand 10 minutes to plump. Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add garlicstir 1 minute. Add spinach leaves and salt to tastecook 2 to 3 minutes or until wilted. Add raisinstoss to combine. Transfer to a large bowl. Sprinkle with nuts. Makes 2 servings.
Put the coffee in a blender first, followed by the milk, vanilla ice cream and finally the chocolate syrup. Blend everything for about 1 minute or until smooth and thick.

Mash potatoes with cream of asparagus soup & cheddar cheese until well blended. Add ham & mix well. Spread in a greased 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through & lightly browned. Let cool slightly before cutting into squares for serving.

Mix together flour, cornmeal and baking powder. Add sugar and salt. In a separate bowl, mix together egg and buttermilk. Cut in butter and mix with flour mixture until crumbly. Add egg mixture and stir until combined. Fold in bacon and jalapenos. Spoon into greased muffin tins and bake at 400 degrees for 20 minutes.

Slice eggplant into 1/2-inch thick slices and soak in milk for a few minutes. Then drain off milk and dip in beaten egg then the breadcrumb mixture. Place in hot oil and fry until golden brown on both sides. Sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese and serve immediately.

Fine dice the sun-dried tomatoes and combine them with the rest of the sauce ingredients. Place in a covered casserole and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow it to cool for 10 minutes. Serve over cooked pasta with parmesan cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).Place salmon fillets in a shallow baking pan or roasting pan. Sprinkle the top side of each fillet with 1/4 teaspoon garlic clove. Mix together the marmalade and soy sauce. Turn the fish over and pour the marmalade/soy sauce over the fish. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Garnish with orange slices, if desired. Serve with brown rice or your favorite side dish. Serves 4.

Wash lamb sweetbreads under cold running water. Pat dry with paper towels. Slice lamb sweetbreads into strips about 1/4 inch wide. Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over moderate heat. Add sweetbreads and saute until browned on both sides. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add vinegar and bacon and cook until bacon is crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels. Add flour to pan juices and cook, stirring over moderate heat until flour is brown. Add sweetbreads and cook until well blended, about 1 minute. Season with salt and pepper. Serve on warm platter with bacon. Makes about 4 servings.

Peel squash and cut into chunks. In a heavy skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Sear pork chops on both sides for about 3-4 minutes per side. Remove from skillet and keep warm in a low oven. Add onion, garlic, apple and squash to skillet. Saute for about 10 minutes. Add apple juice and scrape up brown bits in the skillet. Bring to a boil and add apple pieces, maple syrup and spices. Cover skillet and simmer about 10 minutes more. Serve with pork chops and rice.

In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter and add the ham and bell pepper. Stir and cook for a few minutes until the ham is warmed and the bell pepper is crisp tender. Whisk the eggs with the cream and spices and add to the skillet and stir to combine. Reduce the heat to low and cook until eggs are set and lightly browned around the edges. Sprinkle with cheese and serve immediately.

Grease a 10-inch square baking tin with a little butter. In a large mixing bowl combine the sugar and syrup until the mixture starts to dissolve. Stir in the butter and golden syrup then continue to beat until the mixture is creamy. Stir in the oats and beat again until combined. Spoon the mixture into the tin and press down with the back of a spoon to make a flat surface. Bake for 20 minutes. Cool and cut into squares. Sprinkle with honey and serve.

In a large mixing bowl add cookie mix, egg and oil. Stir until crumbly. Add water and stir until dough forms. Press into a greased 13x9x2-inch pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree f oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and spread jam over top. Bake for an additional 10 minutes. Spread frosting over top and sprinkle with white chocolate chips. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, soda & salt. In a large bowl combine the butter, eggs & orange peel. Add the flour mixture & blend well. Add the cranberries. Place the batter into 2 greased loaf pans. Bake for 1 hour or until the bread is well-browned & cooked through. Cool for 10 minutes. Makes 2 loaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease 12-cup fluted tube pan. Combine cake mix, Kahlua and half-and-halfmix well. Beat egg with egg substitute until frothy. Add to cake mixmix well. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in cake comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes. Pour glaze over cakesprinkle with pecan pieces. Cool completely. Sprinkle with coconut.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Spread almonds in a single layer on a baking sheet. Toast in the oven for 10-12 minutes until golden brown. While the almonds are toasting prepare the asparagus. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add garlic cloves to hot oilcook 1 minute or until lightly golden. Stir in asparaguscook 1 minute or until asparagus is heated through. Remove from heatstir in salt, pepper, and toasted almonds. Serve warm. Serves 6

Combine cooked rice, milk, sugar and vanilla in a large mixing bowl. Beat eggs in a separate bowl and stir into the rice mixture. Pour into a 1-quart casserole. Mix flour and margarine in a bowl. Sprinkle over the rice mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serves 8.
combine bread crumbs, flour, paprika and poultry seasoning in a bowl. Add margarine and stir until it resembles coarse crumbs. Add salt and pepper if desired.

Melt butter over medium-high heat in skillet. Add tenderloin and onion and cook until brown on both sides, about 10 minutes. Add cranberries, wine and rosemary. Reduce heat to medium. Cover and simmer for 5 minutes. Transfer to platter and cover to keep warm. Whisk together honey and mustard. Pour over pork. Serve.

In a saucepan cook the wild rice according to the package instructions. Add chicken. Add the vegetables. Add the seasoning packet. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Cook until chicken is done. Serve.

Combine the greens in a large bowl. In a small bowl, combine the mustard, vinegar, oil and salt and pepper. Stir in the apple pieces, pecans, cherries and blue cheese. Toss the salad with the dressing. Refrigerate for 1 hour or more before serving. Serve with apple chips.

In a food processor combine basil, marjoram, rosemary, chives and lemon juice. Chop until herbs are finely ground. Add butter and garlic. Blend until smooth. Stir in lemon zest. Spread on toast or melt in soup.

Bring a small pot of water to a boil. Add the cavatappi pasta. Cook according to the package directions. When done cooking, drain the pasta. In a small saucepan over low heat melt the butter. Add the heavy cream and stir. Add the garlic salt, the pepper and the shredded cheddar cheese. Stir until smooth. Add the cavatappi pasta to a large baking dish. Pour the cheese sauce over the cavatappi pasta. Top the cavatappi pasta with the grated pecorino romano cheese. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until bubbly. Serve immediately.
Place all in crock pot and cook on high for 4-5 hours. Serve over mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Pound out breast halves to 1/2 inch thickness. In a medium bowl combine goat cheese, white pepper, salt, and garlic powder. Spread mixture over one side of each breast halves. Roll up breasts. Tie each breast roll with 1 slice of bacon. Place in a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Combine spaghetti sauce and mozzarella cheesepour over rolls. Bake 15 minutes.

Cook the beans in boiling water for 5 minutes or until soft. Drain well. Mix the beans with the tuna, olives, tomatoes, celery and green onion in a bowl. Make the salad dressing. Drizzle over the tuna mixture and toss well to combine. Place over lettuce leaves in a serving dish. Top with hardboiled eggs if you wish.

In a large skillet, brown ground turkey. Drain. In a large saucepan, combine turkey, celery, bell pepper, barley, tomato paste and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 1 hour until barley is tender. Stir in water and season with salt and pepper. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees F for about 10 minutes. Serve hot.
Combine all ingredients in food processor or blender. Puree until smooth. Refrigerate for about one hour. Serve with pita bread.

In a small bowl combine garlic, olive oil, vinegar, oregano, basil, black pepper, paprika and cayenne pepper. Place chicken thighs in a large resealable plastic bag and pour in the marinade. Seal bag and turn to coat well. Marinate 1 hour in the refrigerator. Heat grill to high. Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade. Grill chicken until no longer pink in the center, 3 to 5 minutes per side or until chicken is cooked through.
Combine all the ingredients in a blender and process until smooth. Pour into tall glasses with ice cubes and serve. This makes about six servings.

Preheat oven to 375f. In small bowl, combine rice cereal, flour and seasonings. In another small bowl, whisk together egg and milk. Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture. Dip in rice cereal mixture. Place in ungreased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. In a small bowl, combine melted butter and 1/2 cup water. Spoon over chicken pieces. Bake uncovered for 45-50 minutes or until chicken is no longer pink in center. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add onion and pepper and saute 5 minutes or until tender. Whisk eggs and sour cream in medium bowl until blended. Add flour and picante sauce and blend well. Pour over vegetables in skillet and cook over low heat for 1 minute or until set. Sprinkle with cheese and bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with flour tortillas and salsa if desired.

Grease and flour 10-inch square baking pan. In mixing bowl cream butter and sugars. Add eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. Add almond extract and flour. Beat until just combined. Spread into prepared pan. Bake in preheated 375 degree oven for 25-30 minutes or until golden and toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool completely and then crumble. In small bowl combine ground almonds and powdered sugar. Stir in butter and almond extract. Spread over cake. Arrange cherries over top. Makes 12 servings.

Cook the green beans according to the package directions. Drain and set aside. In a skillet, brown the ground turkey. In a small bowl, combine the cream of mushroom soup and milk. Stir together until well combined. Pour half the soup mixture into the bottom of a 9 x 13 cake pan. Layer one half the tater tots. Pour another layer of the soup mixture on top. Layer on the green beans. Layer the rest of the tater tots. Pour the last of the soup mixture on top. Sprinkle with the shredded cheese. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes.

Cook ground beef in skillet or on grill until browned and no longer pink. Combine barbecue sauce and teriyaki sauce and pour over beef. Add chipotle and stir until well blended. Heat through and serve on hoagie rolls. Makes 4 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two cookie sheets.In a large bowl cream together the butter, sugar and almond extract. Add the egg and mix well.In a seperate bowl combine the flour, baking soda and salt. Gradually mix into the creamed mixture. Gently fold in the sliced almonds.Drop by large spoonful onto the prepared cookie sheets. Bake for 9 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool on wire racks.In a small bowl beat the egg white with the water. Brush the top of each cookie with the egg wash. Sprinkle with additional sliced almonds.

Cut the crust from six slices of bread. Cut each slice into four strips. Butter an 8-inch square baking dish. Layer half of the bread strips in a single layer on bottom of dish. Sprinkle with a third of the tomatoes and half of the onions. Spread half of the mozzarella on top. Repeat layers. Beat eggs, milk and seasoning in a bowl until blended. Pour over bread mixture and sprinkle evenly with the remaining tomatoes and onions and mozzarella. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Bake for 30 minutes. Let stand for at least 10 minutes before cutting into squares. Sprinkle basil on top before serving.
Cook rice according to package directions. Cool completely. In a medium bowl stir together remaining ingredients. Add ricetoss to coat. Coverchill for 4 hours. Serve over lettuce.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl and store in an airtight container. Use on meat, poultry and fish. Makes approximately 6 servings.

In a small saucepan combine the water and cinnamon. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat. Beat egg white until foamy. Add the sugar and beat until thick and glossy. Add the cinnamon mixture and beat until blended. Add salt and cinnamon. Fold in the pecans and spread out onto a parchment paper-lined baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour at 225 degrees. Stir and continue baking for 1 hour. Cool completely and store in an airtight container.

Combine the pineapple with juice, orange juice, sugar, orange zest. Cook over medium heat for 8 minutes, stirring occasionally. Let cool to room temperature. In a medium bowl beat together eggs, vanilla and gelatin. Beat in cheese until smooth. Add pineapple mixture. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 45 minutes. Let cool completely before cutting. Serve with whipped cream or cool whip. Serves 10.

In a small bowl combine all filling ingredients. Set aside. Lightly spray baking sheets with non-stick spray. Brush wonton edges with water. Place a teaspoon of filling in center of each wonton. Brush edges with water and fold over. Press edges together and seal. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Brush with butter and bake an additional 10 minutes. Remove from oven and brush with butter. Bake for 3 minutes more. Drizzle with sauce and sprinkle with parsley. Serves 4.

Combine crumbs and butter and press into a 9-inch pie pan. Beat cream cheese and Splenda together until smooth. Beat in eggs and lime juice one at a time. Spread over crust and bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Cool and refrigerate before serving.

Cook rice according to directions. Set aside. Heat the butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the fresh corn and saute until tender and the kernels begin to pop open. Season with salt and pepper. Set aside. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl, add the cream and eggs. Beat together until smooth. Season with salt and pepper. Add the wild rice and corn. Pour into a 9x13 casserole dish. Bake for 30-35 minutes. Remove from the oven and cool slightly. Serve topped with shredded cheddar cheese.

Preheat oven to 450f. Place green peppers on ovenproof platter. Lightly brush both sides of each pepper with olive oil. Place peppers on baking sheet and place in oven. Roast for 15-20 minutes or until peppers are tender and slightly charred on the outside. In the meantime, in a small skillet over medium heat, add the garlic and red pepper flakes. Saute garlic until slightly golden. Transfer garlic to a small bowl. Add peppers and remaining ingredients to the skillet. Cook and stir until peppers are coated and heated through. Transfer to serving platter and top with garlic mixture. Serve with toasted pita chips and guacamole.
Mix together cabbage, pepper, oil and vinegar in a large bowl. Add remaining ingredients and mix well. Cover and refrigerate 2 hours or overnight.

In blender combine first six ingredients and process until smooth. With machine running, slowly add oil in a very thin stream through opening in top of blender cover until dressing is thick but not pasty. Stir in poppy seeds. Yield:2-1/4 cups or enough for two fruit salads.

Preheat oven to 400f. Remove 1 pie crust from refrigerator and unroll dough. Place dough into 9 inch pie plate. Spoon in peach filling in the middle of the crust. Brush the crust edge with water to seal. Top with remaining pie crust and seal edges together. Using a sharp knife, cut several slits in the top crust for venting. Brush the top crust with milk or water. Bake 45 to 50 minutes or until crust is golden brown. Cool slightly before cutting to serve.

Combine chicken and chilies in a food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Add cream of chicken soup and cream cheese and process until smooth. Add cumin, garlic and pepper and process until well mixed. Spoon into a 2 quart casserole dish and sprinkle colby-monterey jack cheese over the top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until melted and bubbly. Serve with tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with wax paper. In a large skillet over medium heat, warm oil. Add garlic and saute until lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Add spinach and saute until wilted but still bright green. Remove from heat and stir in ricotta, Parmesan and pepper. In another skillet over medium heat, warm oil. Working with one wonton wrapper at a time, brush edges with egg white and place about 1 tablespoon of filling on center of wrapper. Fold over and press edges to seal. With fingertips, press edges and top of wonton to form pleated surface. Repeat with remaining wrappers. Spray with cooking spray and bake for about 10 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm or at room temperature with marinara for dipping.

Place salmon fillets on a greased baking sheet or shallow dish. Whisk together dressing, lemon juice, garlic, salt and paprika. Spoon dressing over salmon filletssprinkle with capers. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with salad.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large bowl combine 2 cups of bread crumbs, 1/4 cup of lemon zest, 1/4 cup of lemon juice, 2 teaspoons of dried oregano, and 1 teaspoon of salt. Place the potato chunks in the bottom of a 9x13-inch baking dish. In another bowl, mix together 1/4 cup of lemon zest, 1/4 cup of lemon juice, 2 teaspoons of dried oregano, 1/2 teaspoon of garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon of ground red pepper, 1/4 teaspoon of ground black pepper, 1/4 teaspoon of dried basil, 1/4 teaspoon of dried thyme, 2 teaspoons of dried marjoram, 2 teaspoons of dried rosemary, 2 teaspoons of dried sage, 2 te

In a large saute pan over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove from pan and reserve the bacon for garnish. Drain the excess grease. Cook the onion and garlic cloves in the same pan until the onion is translucent. Add the black beans and seasonings and cook for about 5 minutes. Add the sour cream and mix until completely blended. Serve over a warm corn tortilla with a sprinkling of reserved bacon. Serve with salsa and avocado slices.

Mix the beef with the salsa and the beans. In a baking dish spread a layer of the polenta and top with the beef mixture. Top with the cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 for approximately 20 mins or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with extra salsa if desired.

Peel the potatoes and cut them into quarters. Boil them in salted water until they are fork-tender. Drain the potatoes and place them back in the pan. Add the goat cheese and butter and mash the potatoes. Add the half-and-half and basil and mash until smooth. Stir in the garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Combine the teriyaki sauce and the olive oil. Cut each steak in half the long way. Open the steak out flat. Spread the teriyaki sauce on the steak. Sprinkle the steak with the oyster cracker crumbs. Bake in a 425 degree F oven for 10 to 12 minutes or until the steak is medium rare. Turn the steaks over half way through baking. Serve the steaks hot.

In a small saucepan combine the brown sugar, maple syrup, butter and water. Stir the mixture over medium heat until the butter has melted. Remove from heat. Stir in the half-and-half cream, vanilla extract, and walnuts. Refrigerate until cold. Serve over ice cream or frozen yogurt.
Make the dressing by dissolving lemonade concentrate in water. Add honey to taste. Pour into a large bowl. Add fruit. Mix gently. Cover and refrigerate. Serve salad in individual glasses.

Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add eggs one at a time beating after each addition. Stir in vanilla. Combine flours, cocoa and baking soda. Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture and mix until combined. Add choc chips. Drop by level tablespoons 2 inches apart onto greased baking trays. Bake in preheated oven 15-20 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Preheat oven to 400f. Prick potatoes with a fork all over and place on baking sheet. Bake for 1 hour or until potatoes are soft when pierced with a fork. Meanwhile mix oil and seasoning together and set aside. When potatoes are done remove and cool slightly. Slice into fries and place in a bowl. Pour seasoning and oil mixture over fries and toss to coat well. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss to coat again. Spread on parchment paper on cookie sheet and bake for 20 minutes. Turn over and bake for 15 minutes longer or until crisp and golden brown. Remove from oven and serve warm.

Slice artichoke hearts in half and place in a bowl. Add the parmesan cheese and mix well. Sprinkle thyme leaves on top and set aside. Pound the chicken breasts to make them even thickness. Rub the olive oil and season with the salt and pepper. Place a slice of the artichoke mixture in the center of the chicken breasts and roll up to close. Secure with a skewer and place in a baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove from oven and brush tops with the remaining olive oil and bake for another 15 minutes. Serve with a side of vegetables.
Place asparagus in microwave-safe dish with mushrooms and dressing. Cover with plastic wrap and cook until tender-crisp, about 5 minutes. Arrange on serving plate and sprinkle with almonds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Line a cookie sheet with foil and spray with cooking spray or lightly grease. In a medium bowl combine oats, butter, honey, cinnamon, and vanilla extract. Stir well until it forms a crumbly mixture. Spread evenly onto prepared cookie sheet. Bake for 5 minutes. Stir mixture well. Sprinkle with nuts. Bake for another 5 minutes or until mixture is golden brown. Let cool completely before serving. Store in an air-tight container. Serves about 6-8.

Soak edamame for 30 minutes. Drain edamame and add to large bowl of ice water to stop cooking process. Drain and pat dry with paper towels. Put edamame in medium bowl with the lemon juice and seasoning mixture. Toss until evenly coated. Refrigerate at least 4 hours before serving.

Slice sausage into thin rounds. Thinly slice onion. In a skillet over medium-high heat combine sausage, onion and garlic. Cook until sausage is browned. Add cream cheese. Cook until cheese is melted. Cool slightly. Stir in worcestershire sauce. Stir in parsley and chives.

Preheat oven to 350f. Lightly spray a 13 x 9 inch baking dish. Arrange the fish fillets in the baking dish and top with thyme sprigs. Sprinkle with the black pepper and salt. In a medium skillet heat the chicken broth over moderate heat until simmering. Add the mushroom and cook until tender about 5 minutes. In a large bowl, whisk the broth mixture with the cream and mustard. Pour the mixture over the fish and bake 15 minutes. Remove the fish from the baking dish and keep warm. Increase the heat under the baking dish to high. Bubble the sauce until thickened about 3 minutes. Spoon the sauce over the fish and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a medium bowl, stir together the flour, baking soda, ginger, and cinnamon. Add the dry ingredients to the creamed mixture alternately with the barbecue sauce. Stir in the pecans. Drop the batter by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, until the edges are lightly browned. Let stand for 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool.

Melt the cheese in the double boiler over simmering water until smooth. Add the cornstarch, stirring until well blended. Add the champagne and almond extract, stirring until well blended. Transfer to a fondue pot or large chafing dish over the heat source. Stir until heated through. Serve with apple slices, breadstick cubes or french bread cubes.

In a medium bowl, combine the tuna in vegetable oil and beans and mix well. Add the oregano and pecorino cheese and mix again. Divide the mixture among four small ramekins and cover.In a large skillet over medium heat, cook the spinach in the oil until wilted. Drain the spinach and season lightly with the salt and pepper.In an eight-inch non-stick skillet or saute pan over medium heat, add the egg mixture and cook until it begins to set around the edges. Place the spinach on top and continue to cook for about five minutes. The frittata will puff slightly in the middle and turn a golden colour. Divide among four plates and serve warm.

Preheat grill. Slice the eggplant into thin slices. Brush with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Grill until soft and golden. Place on the bread. Top with tomato. Layer mozzarella and basil. Sprinkle with coarse sea salt. Drizzle with olive oil. Serve.

Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. Add the eggs and vanilla, blend well. Add the orange concentrate and mix well. Spread the pie filling into the prepared pie crust. Place the mandarin slices on the filling. Bake at 325 for 30 minutes.

Slice carrots, pears and crushed pineapple. Put in a large pan. Add sugar and spice. Add water to cover. Cook slowly until carrots are tender. Add lemon juice. Cool. Add pectin. Put in sterilized jars. Process 10 minutes in boiling water bath. Makes 4 pints.

Cook ground chicken in skillet. Add salsa and mix well. Add tomato sauce and mix well. Add beans and seasonings. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Sprinkle with cheese and bake 5 minutes longer. Serve with tortilla chips or over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together butter and sugar. Add eggs one at a time, beating well. Add flour and cornstarch. Beat until smooth. Stir in jam. Add baking powder and salt. Pour batter into greased and floured 9x13 pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until lightly browned and center is set. Cool and frost with raspberry cream cheese frosting. Cream together cream cheese and butter until smooth. Gradually beat in raspberry jam and vanilla. Spread over cooled cake.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a small bowl, combine the oil, salt and pepper. Set aside. Rinse potatoes under cold water and pat dry. Cut each potato into 4 wedges and place in a small bowl. Pour the oil mixture over potatoes and toss to coat evenly. Place potatoes in a single layer in a baking dish. Roast until potatoes are golden brown and tender when pierced with a fork, about 40 minutes. Remove from oven and garnish with rosemary leaves and additional sea salt.

Trim off and discard any discolored sprouts or brown leaves and rinse sprouts in a colander. Pat dry. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add sprouts and stir. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes until tender-crisp. Remove from heat. Add sriracha and stir. Add honey and lime juice and stir again. Serve.

Place the flour on a plate. Beat the egg yolks with a pinch of salt until smooth and pale. Add the kirsch and icing sugar and beat until fluffy. Add the anise seed and flour in two batches, folding in to form a soft dough. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface and knead lightly until smooth. Roll out to 5mm thickness. Use a 5cm fluted cutter to cut out rounds of pastry. Place on a baking sheet lined with baking paper. Brush with beaten egg. Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees Celsius for 15 minutes until lightly golden. Leave on the baking sheet for 1 minute before transferring to a wire rack to cool. Store in an airtight container in a cool place for 1 week, or in the freezer for 2 months.

To one cup of sugar add 1/2 cup water and 1/4 teaspoon of cream of tartar. Cook until sugar dissolves. Add one teaspoon of salt. Pour into a jar or bottle to store. This syrup will store for months in a refrigerator. Use 1 tablespoon of this syrup for every 1 cup of sugar. To make corn syrup from this simple syrup, add 1 teaspoon of baking soda to 1 cup of syrup. Cook until it reaches a temperature of 210 degrees. Allow to cool. This syrup will store for months in a refrigerator. Use 1 tablespoon of this syrup for every 1 cup of sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 1 1/2-quart baking dish. Combine flour, sugar and baking sodaset aside. In a large bowl, combine bananas and vegetable oilbeat with electric mixer until smooth. Add eggs and vanilla extractmix well. Add dry ingredients and mix until just combined. Fold in chocolate chips. Pour into prepared baking dishspread evenly. Bake 40 to 45 minutes in the preheated oven until cake is golden brown and toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack before serving.

Combine dry soup mixes with water in a medium mixing bowl. Set aside. In a small bowl combine 2 tablespoons soy sauce and 2 tablespoons worcestershire sauce. Add to meat. Cover meat with soup mix and sauces. Wrap in foil and place in a 350 degree oven for 3 1/2 to 4 hours. Slice and serve with brown rice.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Brown the veal scallopini on both sides, about 4 minutes each side. Drain the grease, leaving a small amount for the sauce. Add the butter, garlic, chopped tomatoes, oregano, and salt & pepper to taste. Reduce the heat to low to simmer for about 15 minutes or until the meat is done to your liking. Just before serving, add the white wine and stir to mix. Garnish with parsley. Serve over pasta or with crusty bread. Serves 4 to 6 as a main course or 8 to 10 as an appetizer.

In a saucepan over medium heat, melt margarine. Add onions and cook until golden. Stir in flour and cook until a paste forms. Add soymilk. Add green beans and simmer until beans are cooked. Add garlic powder, salt and pepper to taste. Pour into casserole. Sprinkle with french-fried onions. Bake at 350 for about 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a bowl combine broccoli, oil and pepper. Spray an 11x13 baking pan with olive oil cooking spray. Spread broccoli in pan. In a small bowl combine teriyaki and water. Pour over broccoli. Bake for 20 minutes. Stir. Bake for 10 minutes longer.

Combine rice and 1 1/2 cups water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Cool to room temperature. Stir in remaining 1/2 cup water. Place half the rice mixture in a 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle half of the mini marshmallows over rice. Layer with half of the pineapple. Sprinkle half of the almonds over pineapple. Add half of the heavy cream. Repeat layering. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Pour reserved 1/2 cup water over rice just before serving. Serve cold. Top with additional marshmallows if desired. Serves 10.

In a large skillet add oil and cook onion, mushrooms and bell peppers until tender, about 10 minutes. Add tomato and cook for about 3 minutes more until tomato is soft. Cook spaghetti according to directions on package. Drain spaghetti and add chicken stock. Cook for another minute or two. Add in tomato mixture and mushrooms. Heat through. Pour in cream of mushroom soup and cook until thickened. Add in cooked chicken. Add in cooked spaghetti and stir until evenly distributed. Add in cheddar cheese until melted. Add in spinach at the end of cooking. Stir until well combined.

Saute onion in butter for about 5 minutes or until tender. Add potato and brussels sprouts and saute for 5 minutes more or until potato is golden. Add bay leaf, stock, sweet pepper and salt and pepper to taste. Bring to a boil then cover and simmer for about 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Season with additional salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Wash the beets and parsnips and chop the parsnips into smaller pieces about the size of a dime. Wash the baby carrots and chop them in half. Cut the beets into 1-inch pieces. Cut the mushrooms in half or thirds depending on the size. Place the beets and parsnips in a bowl of cold water to prevent the beets from bleeding into the other vegetables. Place the carrots in a bowl of water with a splash of vinegar (to prevent browning) and the mushrooms in a separate bowl of water (to prevent bleeding). Place all the vegetables in a large bowl and toss with the brown sugar and olive oil. Place in a glass baking dish (with sides) and sprinkle the apple cider vinegar evenly over the top of the vegetables. Bake for about one hour or until the vegetables are tender. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. In a medium bowl combine soy sauce, honey, sesame oil, garlic, green onions and ground gingermix well. Place chicken thighs in a shallow baking panpour 1/2 of the marinade over chicken thighs. Turn chicken to coatreserve remaining marinade for basting during baking. Bake for 1 hour or until chicken is cooked through and no longer pink when center is cut with a forkbasting occasionally during baking. Increase oven to 425 degrees f. Stir reserved marinade, honey and 1 tbsp water in small bowl. Remove chicken from ovenpour honey mixture over chicken thighsbake for 5 minutes or until glazed. Sprinkle with green onions. 6 servings.

Cut sausage patties in half. Place 1 patty on each half of muffin. Cook in a nonstick skillet over medium heat for 2 minutes. Turn sausage and cook for an additional 2 minutes. Break an egg in the middle of each sausage patty. Cook for 2 minutes or until egg is set. Sprinkle with cheese. Makes 2 sandwiches.
In large nonstick skillet, brown beef in oil over medium heat. Add mushrooms, onion, soup, water and mustardheat through. Serve over cooked rice with parsley sprinkled over top. Makes 6 servings.

Slice potatoes into small cubes. Cover with water in a heavy saucepan. Add onion slices. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat. Simmer until potatoes are tender. Drain. Add vinegar. Season with all-purpose flour. Blend in 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a boil. Cook 5 minutes or until thick. Cool. Add cucumber slices, radishes, celery slices. Toss. Add mayonnaise. Stir until well blended. Cover. Chill before serving. Serve with ham or other meat. Serve in a large bowl.

In slow cooker, combine garlic powder, basil, salt and pepper. In small bowl, combine instant minced onion and garlic. Add to slow cooker. In another small bowl, combine olive oil and balsamic vinegar. Add to slow cooker. Add chicken thighs. Cover. Cook on high for 3 to 4 hours or on low for 6 to 8 hours. Remove from slow cooker and serve over rice with fresh parsley.

Soak dates in hot water to cover about one hour. Drain. Preheat oven to 325 degrees f. Grease and flour a tube pan. In a large bowl combine dates with walnut pieces and candied cherry. Beat butter until creamy, add sugar. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Beat well. Add vanilla. Stir in flour. Beat until smooth. Add dates. Spread batter into prepared pan. Bake at 325 degrees f for one hour. Cool. Gently remove cake from pan. Place cake on serving plate. Serve.

Heat the oven to 350 degrees f. Butter one side of each piece of bread. Lay one piece of bread butter side up in the bottom of a 12-inch square baking pan. Scatter half of the cheese and half of the tomatoes over the bread. Add another layer of bread. Sprinkle with the remaining cheese and tomatoes. Cover the sandwich with the remaining bread and turn the sandwich over. Spread the remaining butter over the top and sides. Bake 8 minutes or until the sandwich is golden brown.

In a bowl combine the rhubarb, sugar, flour and nutmeg. Mix well. Roll out the pie crusts and line pie pans. Pour in the rhubarb filling into each pie pan. Brush the top of each pie with the egg wash. Bake at 400F for 10 minutes and then lower the temperature to 350F for an additional 20 minutes or until the filling is cooked through.

Mix soup and corn together. Cut up the cooked chicken into 1 inch pieces. Place half the soup mixture in the bottom of a casserole dish. Top with the chicken and remaining soup mixture. Mix muffin mix, milk and egg. Drop by the tablespoon onto the soup mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.

In a large frying pan, heat olive oil. Add garlic and saute until tender. Add broccoli and cook until crisp tender. Add lemon juice and cook until heated through. Place spaghetti in a large serving bowl. Add chicken and broccoli mixture to the spaghetti. Add black pepper and parmesan cheese. Toss to blend. Garnish with basil.

Trim lemongrass and cut into 1 inch lengths. Thread a piece of lemongrass, then a piece of chicken, then a piece of lemongrass, then a piece of chile, then a piece of lemongrass. Repeat. If you have more lemongrass than you need to skewer the chicken pieces, then add the remaining lemongrass to a large pot with 6 cups water, lime rind and coriander leaves. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Allow lemongrass tea to steep for 15 minutes. When tea is ready to strain, skewer remaining lemongrass into the pot, then strain into a bowl. Remove lemongrass skewers from pot. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large nonstick skillet over high heat. Skewer chicken and add to pan. Sear for 1 minute. Add remaining 2 tablespoons of oil to pan. Sear chicken for another minute. Add lime juice and cook until slightly caramelized and browned, 4 to 5 minutes. Add lemongrass tea and reduce heat to medium. Simmer

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c).In a large pot of boiling water, cook pasta until al dente. Drain and return to pot.In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook sausage in oil until browned.Add stewed tomatoes and tomato sauce. Bring to a boilcook 3 minutes.Remove from heatstir in oregano, parsley, and pepper.Stir pasta into sausage mixturepour into a 9x13 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray.Cover and bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven.Uncoversprinkle with breadcrumbs and cheese.Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted.Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Brew tea. Let cool. Squeeze juice from oranges and lemons into a large pitcher. Stir in honey and orange juice. Stir in tea. Pour over ice and add ginger ale to taste. Garnish with orange slices and lemon slices.

Water: add 1/4 cup warm water to yeast in bowl. Stir and let stand in warm place 10-15 minutes or until yeast is bubbly and foamy. In separate bowl mix together sugar and warm water. Stir in yeast mixture. Oil: add to yeast mixture and mix well. Flour and other ingredients: Add to yeast mixture 1 1/2 cups bread machine flour. Mix well. Add 1 1/2 cups more bread machine flour. Mix well. Add remaining bread machine flour and salt. Mix well. Add milk and mix well. The dough should be soft and supple. Let dough rise for 30-40 minutes. After dough has risen, divide dough into 3 or 4 pieces. Knead each piece of dough into loaf shape. Place loaves in greased loaf pans. Let rise another 30-40 minutes or until loaves are nearly double their original size. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes or until bread is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped.

Place pork butt in slow cooker. Add half an onion. Pour ginger ale over. Cover and cook for 16 hours. Turn off heat. Pour remaining half an onion over. Shred pork with two forks and add barbecue sauce. Let sit for 1 hour.

In a medium bowl, cream together butter and margarine. Add vanilla and cream until light and fluffy. Beat in powdered sugar one cup at a time until light and fluffy. Stir in chocolate chips and nuts. Drop by heaping teaspoons onto a cookie sheet that has been sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 7-9 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool slightly and remove from cookie sheet. Place two chocolate chips in the center of each cookie and press a mini marshmallow on top of each chocolate chip. Place in refrigerator until chocolate is hardened.

Combine beef stew meat, onions, and beef bouillon cubes in crock pot. Add cornstarch, salt, and pepper. Add enough water to cover the stew meat and onions. Stir well. Cook on high for 6 hours or low for 10 hours. Remove meat from crock pot. Keep warm. Stir in red wine. Pour over meat in crock pot. Cook for 10 minutes on high or until hot. Serve over cooked noodles.

Combine sugar and syrup in a heavy saucepan over medium heat. Stir until melted and a candy thermometer reads between 260-275 degrees. Add butter and stir until it melts. Remove from heat and add cream and almonds. Pour onto a greased cookie sheet. Cool. Cut into squares with a sharp knife.

In a food processor add garlic cloves and process until minced. Add parmesan cheese, salt and pepper. With the motor running slowly add the oil until the mixture is smooth. Add the vinegar and continue processing. Add the egg yolk and process until the dressing is smooth and thick. Refrigerate until ready to use. In a salad bowl toss together the lettuce, bacon bits and dressing. Toss well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375. Pound chicken halves between 2 pieces of plastic wrap or waxed paper with a rolling pin until 1/4 inch thick. Combine green onions and jalapeno peppers in a small bowl. Add lemon juice, honey, thyme, garlic powder, cumin, paprika and cayennemix well. Spread chicken with green onion mixture. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 45 minutes or until chicken is done. Cut into serving pieces. Yield: 4 servings.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar. Add the egg and beat until light. Stir in the milk. Add the baking powder, flour and cornmeal. Mix just until moistened. Spoon into paper lined muffin cups. Bake at 400 for 15 to 20 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before removing from pans. Serve warm. Makes 12 muffins.

Combine beef and tomato paste with 1 cup water and place in crock pot. Mix remaining ingredients and add to the beef mixture. Cook on high for 4 hours or low for 7-8 hours. Remove beef and place in a pan or casserole dish. Cover with sauce and bake for 1 hour at 375 degrees F. Serve over mashed potatoes or rice.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Combine flour, baking soda, and salt in medium bowlset aside. In a large bowl cream together butter, sugar, and brown sugar until smooth. Add in eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add vanilla. Add flour mixture in two additions mixing well. Add in nuts if using. Using an ice cream scoop drop batter onto a greased baking sheet. Bake for 12-15 minutes. Cool for about 5 minutes. Yum.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a bunt pan or square pan with a little oil. In a large bowl, cream together the eggs and sugar until thick and pale yellow. Stir in the banana and vanilla until combined. Sift together the potato flour, baking powder and saltstir into the banana mixture with the oil until just combined. Pour batter into prepared pan and bake in the preheated oven until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes. Cool in the pan for 20 minutes before removing from pan to cool completely. To make the frosting, in a large bowl beat the cream cheese until light and fluffy, then beat in the butter and sugar until smooth. Spread frosting over cake and serve.

Spray a crock pot with cooking spray. Put the cheese spread and cream cheese in the crock pot. Spray a bag of rotel with cooking spray and cut open. Squeeze the rotel into the crock pot. Cut up smoked sausage into small pieces and mix in the crock pot. Cook on low for 4 hours. Serve with crackers.

Heat oil and add garlic and yellow onion and cook for 2 - 3 minutes until soft. Add beet leaves and continue to cook until wilted. Add wine and reduce by half. Add bacon and stir well. Add salt and ground black pepper and stir well. Serve hot.
In large bowl beat ice cream topping, milk & pudding until blended. Add COOL WHIPmix well. Spoon into crust. Top with toffee bars. Chill. Yield: 8 servings

Place chicken strips in a single layer on a plate. Combine remaining ingredients except ginger. Pour over chickencover and refrigerate for at least 8 hours. Bake at 400f for about 20 minutes until chicken is cooked through. Garnish with ginger and serve on a bed of rice.

Cook barley in a medium pot of boiling water 35-40 minutes or until tender. Drain in a colander and rinse with cold waterlet cool. Combine barley with vinegar and salt in a medium bowllet stand 10 minutes. Add basil and tomatoestoss to combine. Serve.

Place all ingredients in crock pot and cook on low for approximately 7 hours or until brisket is fork tender. Remove brisket and allow it to rest for at least 1 hour before slicing and serving with remaining sauce.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Combine oats, raisins, and flax seed in large bowl. Stir in oil, honey and cinnamon. Spread mixture onto cookie sheet and bake for 40 minutes. Stir every 10 minutes. When done baking let cool to room temp and then stir in chopped nuts. Store in an air tight container.

Combine 1 cup flour, powdered sugar, margarine, eggs, 1 cup sugar, baking powder and lemon juice concentrate. Blend well. Press into a 9x13x2 pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Melt remaining 1 cup of sugar with 1 tablespoon water until smooth. Drizzle over cooled bars. Sprinkle with flaked coconut.

Place fruit, sugar, dry pectin & lime zest in a blender or food processor & blend until smooth. Press fruit mixture through a strainer into a large measuring cup or bowl. Press firmly on solids to extract as much liquid as possible. Measure liquid. You should have at least 3 cups. If you do not have enough liquid to make jam, stir in 1/4 cup of water or apple juice to measure 3 cups total. Combine lime juice & blueberry mixture in a 3 to 4-quart saucepan. Bring to a full rolling boil over medium-high heat (a boil that will not stop when you stir it), stirring constantly. Stir in dry pectin. Return to a full rolling boil, stirring constantly, and boil for 1 minute, stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Skim off any foam with a metal spoon. Ladle hot jam into clean hot jars leaving 1/2 inch headspace. Wipe rims with a clean, damp clothadjust lids. Process filled jars in a boiling-water bath canner for

Remove stems from the strawberries and wash. Hull and slice the strawberries in half. In a bowl, combine the cream cheese and walnuts. Stir in the Splenda and extract. Divide the mixture evenly between the strawberry halves and press down. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Serve. Yields 8 servings.

Heat oil in heavy skillet. Add onion and green bell pepper. Cook until tender but not brown. Add garlic and cook until garlic is golden but not brown. Remove from heat and stir in tomatoes, Rotel tomatoes and tomato sauce. Return to heat and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring often. Add cabbage and cook until crisp-tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with rice or potatoes.

Toast dried chiles over gas burner until they are darkened and smell fragrant (about 5 minutes). Grind chiles with onion and garlic cloves in a blender until it becomes smooth. Transfer this liquid to a bowl and add all other ingredients. Marinate chicken for at least 2 hours in refrigerator before cooking.
Toss all vegetables and peas in bowl. Toss with 1/4 cup olive oil, 1 tablespoon lemon juice and a dash of salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature.

In a large saucepan heat oil and add onion. Sweat onion for 5 minutes. Add carrot and continue cooking for 2 more minutes. Add ginger, broth and honey and cook for another 15 minutes. Puree soup until smooth. Salt to taste. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve hot or cold. Garnish with fresh ginger.

Preheat oven to 350f. Pierce each squash with fork. Place squash on baking sheet and bake one hour or until tender. Melt butter and brown sugar in small saucepan. Brush squash with the mixture. Sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Bake five minutes. Serve hot.

Sprinkle the filet with salt & pepper. Dust the filet with flour. Add butter to a large pot or pan. When butter is hot but not brown, add filet. When it is cooked to your liking (I like it rare), remove the filet and set aside. Add beef stock to the pan, and boil for a few minutes to get rid of the flour taste. Add onion, and cook a little. Add white mushrooms and cook for another few minutes. Add the prepared mustard and the tomatoes. Stir well. Add the filet and the sour cream. Cook for a few more minutes. Serve hot.

Cut bacon into small pieces. Lay chicken fillets out on top of bacon pieces. Butter each fillet. Sprinkle lightly with salt and white pepper. Heat butter in skillet. Sear chicken fillets until lightly brown. Remove from skillet and set aside. In same skillet add flour. Stir until smooth. Add milk. Cook for 1 minute. Add cream and whisk until smooth. Add chicken broth and white wine. Add chicken fillets. Add oregano. Cover skillet. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with Swiss cheese.
