Cover skillet. Simmer until cheese melts. Serve over rice.

In a skillet over medium heat, melt butter and saute celery and onion until tender. Remove from heat and add rice and orange juice. Stir and let sit for approximately 15 minutes or until rice has absorbed liquid. Season with salt and pepper and fold in almonds. Serve warm or cold. Garnish with orange wedges or a sprig of parsley.
Cook beef and drain. Add remaining ingredients. Bake at 350 for 45-60 minutes. Top with cheese for last 5 minutes. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease and flour a 9x13 pan. Beat butter and sugar together with an electric mixer. Add flour and baking powder and beat until smooth. Add eggs one at a time and beat until smooth. Add vanilla and lemon juice. Pour into pan and spread out. Bake for 40-45 minutes. Let cool in pan. You may have to run a knife around the edges to loosen. Makes a big cake. I made 2 loaves with this recipe. Serve with a fruit compote or your favorite topping.

Peel away the tough outer layer of the button mushrooms. Cut the mushrooms in half. In a bowl combine the mushrooms, shallots, olive oil, vinegar, thyme and a little salt. Toss the mushrooms well. Cover with plastic wrap and allow to marinate for about 15 minutes. Serve at room temperature.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add pasta. Cook uncovered until tender, but still firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain pasta and set aside. Meanwhile, in a large saute pan over medium-high heat, warm olive oil and add garlic. Saute garlic until tender and golden. Add tuna and cook until heated through. Add broth and bring to a boil. Stir in pasta and parsley. Season with cayenne pepper and serve immediately. Serve with grated parmesan.

Wash and slice cucumbers and tomatoes into 1/2 inch slices. Place cucumbers and tomatoes in bowl and add lemon juice and apple cider vinegar. Let stand at least 3 hours or overnight. Add remaining ingredients and toss just before serving. Yields 8 servings.

Peel bananas. Place banana peels in a freezer bag. Blend the rest of the ingredients together. Add ice cubes and blend again. Freeze for 1 hour. Take out the banana peels from the freezer bag and blend with the remaining ingredients. Serve in a tall glass with a straw. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Sift flour, sugar, baking powder and salt into large bowl. Add egg and milk. Stir until well mixed. Stir in vegetable oil. Divide batter evenly between two greased and floured muffin pans. Bake muffins at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes. Remove from oven and allow to cool. Combine strawberries and rhubarb in a large bowl. Serve muffins topped with fruit mixture.

Cube bread into cubes. Spread bread cubes in a buttered 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle bread with cheese. In a mixing bowl beat together eggs, milk, dry mustard and pepper. Pour over bread mixture. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Spray a 13x9 baking dish with cooking spray. Combine stuffing mix and milk in large bowl. Add butter and garlictoss well to blend. In a shallow dish combine melted butter and bread crumbs. Place chicken breast halves in butter mixtureturn to coat both sides. Arrange in prepared baking dish. Spoon stuffing mixture evenly over chicken. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 25 minutes.
Mix all ingredients together. Spread on fish fillets. Cook under broiler until fish flakes when tested with fork. Serve with pasta or rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cut pears in half lengthwise. Remove seeds. Place pears cut side down on a baking sheet. Combine butter and pumpkin pie spice in a small bowl. Spoon butter mixture over pears. Bake 45 minutes or until pears are tender. Sprinkle with slivered almonds before serving.

Preheat oven to 375. In a skillet brown sausage, drain and return to skillet. Add sweet potatoes and apples. Stir to mix. Add sugar and flour, water. Mix well. Pour into casserole dish and bake for one hour. Serves 6-8.

Preheat oven to 375f. Mix together dressing, tomatoes, mushrooms and green onions. Place salmon fillets in a baking dish and sprinkle with seasoning salt. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve with a spoonful of dressing mixture and a sprig of parsley.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat and saut shrimp until they just begin to turn opaque. Season with salt and pepper to taste, drain well and set aside. Combine lemon juice and parsley and set aside. In a small bowl, combine the olive oil and garlic and mix well. In another small bowl combine green onions and parmesan cheese. Combine olive oil mixture and lemon mixture and stir well. Arrange shrimp over salad greens and spoon lemon mixture over top. Sprinkle with green onion and parmesan mixture and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add leekscook, stirring occasionally, until leeks are tender, 5-7 minutes. Season to taste. In a small bowl, combine eggs, flour, nutmeg, and paprikastir to mix. Slowly stir in milk to form a thick batter. Stir leeks into batter. Pour into a 2-quart baking dish. Bake until the top is golden and set, 25-30 minutes. Season to taste. Serve hot.

Combine 1/4 cup water and rice vinegar in a small bowl. Stir in the ginger and saltlet stand for 5 minutes. Drain gingerdiscard vinegar mixture. Toss ginger with the remaining 1/4 cup water and the sugar. Let stand for 5 minutes. Drain ginger. Serve ginger in a small bowl alongside fish dishes. Makes 1/4 cup.

Preheat oven to 175 degrees celsius. Cut the dates in half lengthways and remove the pits. Lightly grease and line a 22cm springform tin. Place the dates in a bowl and add the brown sugar. Mix to combine well. Add the crystallised ginger, butter, bicarbonate of soda and the egg. Mix to combine well. Add the self-raising flour. Mix to combine well. Pour into the prepared tin and bake for 1 hour or until golden and a skewer inserted in the middle comes out clean. Remove from the oven and leave in the tin for 10 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely. Cut into wedges to serve.

Melt butter in skillet over medium-high heat. Add pepper and mushrooms. Cook and stir for 3-5 minutes or until pepper is crisp-tender. Add tomato paste. Cook for 30 seconds. Add water and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Coversimmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Salt and pepper to taste.

Cook bacon in a large skillet over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet, reserve 1 tablespoon of drippings. Discard the remaining drippings. Add onion and garlic cloves to skilletsauté 3 minutes. Add spinachcook 2 minutes or until spinach is wilted. Drain well. In a small bowl combine spinach mixture, bacon and reserved drippings, brown sugar, vinegar and jalapeno. Toss well. Serve warm.

In a large skillet heat the oil. Add the brussels sprouts and cook over moderate heat for 2 minutes. Add the garlic, onion, balsamic vinegar and butter. Cover the skillet with a lid and cook until the sprouts are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Place sunflower seeds in the bowl of your food processor. Add sunflower oil and process until seeds are finely chopped and oil is fully incorporated. Add sugar and process until combined. Add sea salt and process until fully incorporated. Transfer to a bowl and serve.

Melt the butter over a double boiler or microwave it for seconds on high heat. Stir in the vanilla. In a medium bowl combine the sugar and corn syrup. Cook over medium heat until it reaches the hard ball stage - about 250 degrees fahrenheit. Turn heat to low and slowly stir in the melted butter mixture. Stir for 10 minutes or until mixture is smooth. Add nuts to the mixture. Add the popcorn to the mixture, stirring until all the popcorn is covered with the mixture. Pour mixture onto wax paper or a large greased tray. Let stand for about 30 minutes or until mixture has cooled slightly. Break apart the popcorn into bite size pieces. Store in airtight container.

Combine sharp cheddar and flour in a mixing bowl and grate together with a grater or a food processor fitted with a grater blade. Beat the eggs and milk together in a mixing bowl until well blended. Add the cheese-flour mixture and stir with a wire whisk until well blended. Fold in the ham and add salt and pepper to taste. Pour the mixture into an unbaked pie shell and bake at 400 for 20 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool slightly before cutting and serving.
In a punch bowl combine cranberry juice, orange juice and lime juice and stir together well. Add vodka and stir again. Chill in refrigerator until ready to serve. Serve in glasses over ice cubes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Puree beans with eggs in blender until smooth. Add granulated sugar, canola oil, vanilla extract and beat until smooth. In medium bowl, combine baking powder, salt and ground cinnamon. Add oatmeal and mix well. Fold into bean mixture. Bake in greased 8 inch square baking pan for 20-25 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Sprinkle with mini chocolate chips. Cool completely. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Drizzle olive oil in a 10 x 6 inch baking dish. Arrange cutlets in dish. Spread jam over each cutlet. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs. Bake for 20 minutes or until pork is cooked through. In a small sauce pan heat chicken stock and corn to boiling. Pour over pork. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve over rice or noodles.

Sauté onion and garlic in butter for 2-3 minutes until the onion is tender. Add broth and seasonings and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and add pumpkin. Cook for about 10 minutes. Add whipping cream and stir. Heat until warm. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with cheese and cilantro.

In a large skillet, cook the onion in butter until tender. Add the cream cheese and milk. Heat until the cheese melts. Stir in the sour cream. Place some tortillas in a large pie pan. Layer the chicken, cream cheese mixture, and cheese on top. Top with the remaining tortillas. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Top with green pepper. Serve with rice.

Heat a lightly greased skillet or griddle over medium heat and cook each side of bread until golden brown and set aside. In a large bowl beat together eggs substitute and milk. Stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. Dip each slice of bread in egg mixture and coat evenly. Place in prepared baking dish and top each slice of bread with cereal. Bake at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes until set. Makes 4 servings.
Scoop out the olives and fill with cream cheese. Return olives to jar. Fill jar with italian dressing. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. Garnish with fresh parsley and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees fahrenheit. Combine graham cracker crumbs, flour, baking powder. Add margarine or butter and condensed milk. Beat until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in raisins and coconut and then add walnuts. Form into balls and press onto cookie sheet. Bake for approximately 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool slightly. Makes approximately 30 cookies.

In a small bowl combine garlic salt and pepper. Cut the meat into thin strips about 1/4-inch wide. Coat the strips with the garlic pepper mixture. In a large skillet over medium high heat add the oil. When the oil is hot add the meat strips. Cook until done stirring occasionally. In the mean time combine the mayo and water to make the dressing. When the meat is done add the parsley to the meat. Pile the meat mixture onto the rolls and top with the dressing.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f (230 degrees c).Cut tops off peppersremove seeds and membranes. Stuff each pepper with 1/4 of the beef mixturereplace tops. In a small bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and parsleysprinkle evenly over peppers. Drizzle evenly with lemon juice and butter. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Turn peppers over and bake for another 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a medium skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add the curry paste and fry for about 30 seconds. Stir in the green beans and dried shrimp. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 2 minutes. Add the pork, garlic, and onion and continue to cook for another minute. Add the stock and fish sauce and bring to boil. Simmer over low heat for about 3 minutes. Season to taste with palm sugar and lime leaves. Serve pork mixture over rice. Serves 4.

Season chicken with salt and pepper to taste. Prepare grill. Slice bacon, cook until crisp in skillet over medium heat. Remove bacon from pan and drain on paper towel, leaving bacon drippings in pan. Mix together cheeses, bacon drippings, garlic salt, and parsley in small bowl. Divide mixture into four equal portions and shape each portion into a ball. Roll each ball in bacon and place in the center of each chicken breast. Wrap chicken around ball with bacon to hold in place. Place on grill over direct heat for about 8 to 10 minutes on each side or until chicken is done. Serve with rice and green salad.

Combine the frozen limeade concentrate, frozen lemonade concentrate, orange extract, and water in a large punch bowl until slushy. Add 7-Up and tequila, stir well, and serve immediately. Yields 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 f. Prepare pie crust as directed on package. Place broccoli in bottom of pie crust. Crumble salmon over broccoli sprinkle with cheese, cover with foil, bake 10 min. Combine eggs, whipping cream, pepper, dill and salmon in medium bowlstir well. Pour over cheese. Bake 30 min. Let stand 5 min before cutting. Serve warm.

In a small bowl beat together the eggs and milk until well blended. Add the sugar and vanilla and beat until smooth and blended. Set aside. In a medium bowl mix together cream cheese and cinnamon until blended. In another small bowl combine the milk and egg mixture with the cream cheese and cinnamon mixture. Spread mixture over each slice of bread. Place slices of bread on a baking sheet and bake in preheated oven for 10 minutes or until browned and crisp. Spread fruit over each slice of bread and top with sweet cream. Serve immediately.

Preheat the broiler to high. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Stir in the lemon juice and parsley. Remove from the heat and stir in the garlic and pepper flakes. Arrange the shrimp in a single layer on a baking sheet and brush each shrimp with the butter mixture. Broil until the shrimp are pink and firm and the butter mixture is browned and bubbly, about 4 minutes. Sprinkle the shrimp with parsley before serving. Serve over pasta or rice, if desired.

Combine all crust ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Divide dough in half and form into 2 balls. Wrap in waxed paper. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or until easy to handle. Preheat oven to 400. Roll dough out on a floured surface to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place in pie plate and fold over edges. Trim and crimp edges. Place in freezer for 20 minutes. Place raspberries in a large bowl. Add sugar and tapioca. Mix well. Spoon mixture into pie crust. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Bake 40 minutes. Cool slightly. Add sour cream and mix well. Serve warm or cold with whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees C (350 F). Lightly grease an 18-by-18-inch baking pan with copha. Line base and sides with baking paper allowing paper to overhang sides. Beat together butter and golden syrup. Add condensed milk and biscuit crumbs and combine well. Press firmly into prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown. Cool. Meanwhile make chocolate icing by combining all ingredients until smooth. Spread over cooled base. Scatter over nuts and sprinkle over chocolate. Leave for about one hour or until set. Lift from pan using paper and cut into bars. Dust lightly with icing sugar to serve.
Combine all of the crab cake ingredients. Form into patties. Dip the patties into the flour. Fry in oil until golden. Serve with tartar sauce.

Beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add in egg and vanilla. Mix well. Add flour and mix until dough forms. Press dough into a greased 9 inch pie plate or cake pan. Bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes. In a sauce pan mix together cocoa, orange juice and zest and water. Cook over medium heat until thick. Pour over warm crust. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Remove from pan and cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 375. Beat the butter and sugar together until creamy. Add milk and beat again. Add the flour, cocoa and oats and mix until a soft dough forms. Fold in the coconut and walnuts. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on a lightly greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven and immediately press a candy kiss into the center of each cookie. Let cool. Store in an airtight container.

Melt the butter in a saucepan. Add the treacle, sugar and the eggs. Mix well. Add the flour and spices and mix well. Sieve the bicarbonate of soda into the mixture and stir. The mixture will be sticky. If it seems to dry, add a little more liquid. Knead the dough well and then wrap in cling film and put into the fridge for 45 mins. Remove the dough from the fridge and divide into two. Roll each half into a long sausage shape. Cut into 2 cm rounds and place onto a baking tray. Bake at 180 degrees C for 12-15 mins. Turn the oven down to 150 degrees C. Mix the icing sugar with the egg white and a little water and brush over the gingerbread. Put back into the oven for 5 mins. Repeat twice more. Cool and store in an airtight tin.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 9-inch square baking dish with oil. In large pot of boiling water over high heat, cook corn 5 minutes or until tender. Drain wellcool slightly. In large bowl, toss corn with salt and pepper. In small bowl, combine ground nutmeg with remaining 1 tsp saltsprinkle over corn. In large skillet over medium-high heat, saute onions in oil for 4 minutes or until golden. Stir in corn mixturecook 2 minutes or until heated through. In medium bowl, whisk together eggs, milk and remaining 1/2 tsp salt. Pour over corn mixturestir to coat evenly. Sprinkle evenly with cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until casserole is set. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting to serve. Serves 6.

In 2-quart saucepan, combine margarine, lemon juice and seasonings. In a steamer basket, combine vegetables. Bring water to a boil over high heat. Cover and cook 8 to 10 minutes or until tender. Serve.

Combine heavy cream, whole milk and sugar in heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium heat. Stir constantly until mixture comes to a gentle boil. Reduce heat to low and continue to stir until mixture is thickened enough to coat the back of a wooden spoon. Add honey and gingerroot. Cook 3 minutes. Remove from heat and cool completely. Beat egg yolks lightly with electric mixer until they are light and frothy. Gradually beat in the cooled custard mixture. Pour custard into an ice-cream freezer and process according to manufacturer's directions. Transfer ice cream to an airtight container and freeze for 4 hours or until firm. Serves 6.
Mix all ingredients except vanilla and whipped cream in blender. Pour into mugs and top with whipped cream. Serves 4.

Cook pasta according to directions. Melt butter in a sauce pan over low heat. Add turkey and saute until heated through. Remove turkey from pan. Add soup and milk to pan. Heat until mixture is hot. Add sour cream and mix well. Add turkey back into pan and heat through. Serve pasta topped with turkey mixture and parsley.

Combine 2 cups Crispix cereal and 1 cup parmesan cheese in a large bowl. Add 2 cans spaghetti sauce and 2 teaspoons garlic powder. Toss to coat well. Spray 13 x 9 x 2 pan with vegetable oil and spread mixture evenly. Bake at 300 degrees for 20 minutes. Stir. Bake for 15 minutes. Stir again and bake for 15 more minutes or until mixture is crispy. Cool and break into bite-sized pieces. Makes 4 cups.

Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Brown pork chops in oil. Add onion soup mix and waterstir well. Add vegetables and ricestir well. Add broth. Coverbring to a boilreduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes or until rice and vegetables are tender and liquid is absorbed. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat the grill or broiler. Melt the butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and saute until soft. Add the garlic and cook, stirring constantly, for 1 minute. Add the chives and salt and pepper to taste and stir. Place on grill or in broiler and cook until golden brown. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.
Dissolve tea in hot water and allow to cool. Add cinnamon and sugar. Stir in milk. Top with chopped walnuts and serve hot.

Heat 1/4 cup oil over medium heat in a medium skillet. Cook onion and garlic for 2 minutes. Add turmeric powder and garam masala powder. Cook for 1 minute. Add 1/4 cup of water to the pan and stir well. Add the remaining 1/4 cup of oil to the skillet and stir well. Add the tomato paste and 1/2 cup of water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and cook for 10 minutes. Stir occasionally. Strain the mixture using a fine sieve into the gravy. Stir well. Add salt to taste.

Melt butter over medium heat and saute shallot for 2-3 minutes until tender but not browned. Stir in paprika and saute for 2-3 minutes longer. Pour in chicken stock and tomatoes. Cook until liquid evaporates and mixture is very thick. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve over steamed or boiled potatoes. Garnish with a dollop of sour cream and sprinkle with paprika.

Cut tortillas into strips. In a skillet saute the tortilla strips in enchilada sauce. Add chopped onions. Remove from heat. Spray a 2 quart glass baking dish with cooking spray. Line the baking dish with tortilla strips. Pour in refried beans. Top with sauce. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Top with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake for an additional 5 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve with sour cream.
Heat oil in wok. Add broccoli florets and stir fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add red chili and garlic. Add dark soy sauce. Cook for a minute. Transfer to a bowl. Serve hot.
Combine first 7 ingredients. Cook chicken in skillet. Cover with sauce. Bake at 350 degrees 30 minutes. Top with cheese. Bake 5 minutes.
Whip the cream and lemon zest until soft peaks form. Fold in the lemon juice and sugar. Mix in the cream cheese. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

In a large skillet melt butter over medium high heat add the scallops and saute until golden brown. Remove and set aside. In the same skillet saute the garlic, scallions and parsley. Add the white wine and cook until reduced by half. Add the cream and simmer until thickened. Pour sauce over scallops and serve immediately.

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.2. In a medium bowl, combine Neufchatel cheese with butter. Beat until smooth.3. Add eggbeat until smooth.4. Add vanilla extractbeat until smooth.5. Add 1 cup of cake mixbeat until smooth.6. Place 16 paper lined cupcake wrappers in a 12-cup muffin pan.7. Divide batter evenly between the 16 wrappers. Bake 14-16 minutes. Cool in pans 10 minutes. Remove from pans to cool completely. Store in an airtight container for up to 1 week.

Heat the oven to 200c/fan180c/gas mark 6. Cut a small slice from the base of each tomato to stand them in a deep roasting tray. Place the tomatoes on a tray lined with kitchen paper and sprinkle over the basil. Grind over a little salt and freshly ground pepper. Pour over the oil and mix well. Bake for 2 hours or until the tomatoes are collapsed and soft. Meanwhile, make the breadcrumbs. Place the breadcrumbs in a bowl with the cheese and chives and season with salt and freshly ground pepper. Scoop out the soft tomatoes into a bowl and toss with the breadcrumb mixture. Serve at once.

Combine the first five salad ingredients in a medium bowl. Top with lettuce leaf. Place a banana half on lettuce leaf. Top with sour cream, banana split syrup or other desired sweetener, coconut and cherries. Garnish with pineapple chunks. Serves 6.

In large frying pan, heat oil over medium heat. Add pork and stir-fry until browned. Remove pork from pan. Add soy sauce and pepper to pan and cook until liquid has evaporated. Add ground ginger and cook for 30 seconds. Add pork back to pan and stir. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add cabbage and cook 2 minutes or until crisp. Add noodles and cook 2 minutes or until noodles are tender. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add onion and garlic and cook until golden, about 5 minutes. Add spinach and cook for about 2 minutes or until wilted. Add feta and season with salt and pepper. In a blender or food processor, add spinach and onion mixture and creme fraiche. Blend until smooth and season with more salt and pepper. Serve with crackers or breadsticks.

Wash and pat dry the chickens. Melt the butter in an oven-safe frying pan. Place the chickens breast side down in the pan and drizzle each with the melted butter. Sprinkle each bird with half of the bread crumbs and half of the cheese. Pour the remaining butter over the birds. Cover the pan with foil and place in a 400 degree oven for 40 minutes. Remove the foil and place the birds breast side up. Sprinkle with the remaining bread crumbs and cheese. Return the pan to the oven for about 20 minutes longer or until the juices run clear. Serve.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain pasta, rinse with cold water. Drain well and place in large salad bowl. In another bowl combine broccoli, celery, black olives and red onion. Add pasta mixture and mix well. Add ham, cheddar cheese and dressingmix well. Refrigerate for several hours before serving. Serves 10.

Mix margarine and onion salt in a small bowl. Spread both sides of bread with this mixture. Sprinkle with garlic salt. Sprinkle with cheese and corn flakes. Bake on a greased sheet pan at 350 degrees F for 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve hot. Makes 6 strips.

Preheat oven to 350F. In large bowl, beat eggs until well combined. Add maple syrup and milk. Whisk until smooth. Stir in salt and nutmeg. Pour into pie shell. Bake for 30 minutes. Let pie cool completely. Refrigerate until ready to serve.

Combine ground beef, onions and peppers. Cook and stir until beef is browned and crumbly. Add ketchup, relish and mustard. Simmer uncovered for 10-15 minutes. Stir in mushrooms and cheese. Spoon onto hot dog buns and serve.

In a large bowl, combine pork with green onions and soy sauce. Add hoisin sauce and mix well. Add water chestnuts and mix well. In a small bowl, beat egg with 1 tablespoon water until smooth. Put 1 wonton wrapper in hand. Add a scant teaspoon of the meat mixture to the center of wrapper. Brush the edges of the wrapper with the egg mixture and fold to make a triangle. Repeat with remaining wrappers. Heat oil in a frying pan. Fry the dumplings for about 1 minute per side. Remove the dumplings from the oil and drain. Sprinkle with chopped green onions and serve immediately.

Cut chicken lengthwise into halves or thirds. In large zip-lock bag combine soy sauce, vinegar and sugaradd chicken and marinade in refrigerator 1 hour. Heat oil in large skillet or wok over high heat. Add chicken and cook about 5 minutes or until no longer pink in the center and cooked through. Remove chicken from wok or skillet and drain off fat. Cut chilies in half lengthwise. Combine in another large zip-lock bag with remaining marinade and chickenset aside for 30 minutes. Spread inside of each roll with mayonnaise. Layer with lettuce, chicken and chilies and cheese slices. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta according to directions. Drain and reserve. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add garlic and cook 1 minute. Stir in flour. Cook and stir 1 minute. Stir in milk. Bring to a boil. Cook until thickened and smooth. Reduce heat. Add cooked penne. Toss to combine. Stir in parsley. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with parmesan. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium high heat, saute onion and garlic in oil until onion is soft. Stir in cayenne pepper and bacon and cook until bacon is crisp and fat is rendered. Add oysters and cook for about 3 minutes or until oysters are heated through. Remove from heat and stir in bread crumbs and cheese. Serve warm.

In a large dutch oven melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onions and saute for 5 minutes. Add the flour and cook for 2 minutes. Whisk in the milk. Stir in the chicken broth. Simmer for 15 minutes. Whisk together the egg yolks and the seasonings in a bowl. Whisk into the soup. Simmer for 5 minutes or until thickened. Sprinkle with parsley. Serves 4.

Combine butter, orange liqueur and orange rind in a small saucepan. Bring to a boil. Remove from heat. Add pecan halves. Stir until coated. Spread pecans on a foil-lined baking sheet. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until nuts are golden. Remove from oven. Sprinkle with a little kosher salt. Allow to cool. Store in airtight container.
Mix all ingredients and rub on both sides of pork chops. Grill for 3-4 minutes on each side. Let rest for 3 minutes before serving.

Butter the sides of two slices of bread. Spread each slice with about one-eighth of the cheese. Top one slice with the tomatoes, pepper and olives. Place the second slice on top and spread the remaining cheese on the top slice. Butter the other side of each slice of bread and then place the sandwiches into the frying pan or grill over medium heat until golden brown on each side. Remove from heat and cut into triangles to serve.

In 10" skillet, saute carrots in butter and onion until tender. Stir in flour. Cook 1 minute, stirring. Gradually stir in milk. Cook over medium heat until thickened, stirring constantly. Stir in mustard, salt, pepper and 1/4 cup cheese. Spread into 1 1/2 qt. Baking dish. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Combine bread crumbs and parsley. Sprinkle over cheese. Bake at 350 degrees f. for 25 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand 5 minutes. Serve.

Preheat grill to medium. Combine salt, garlic powder, and pepper in small bowl. Rub onto both sides of chicken. Heat grill pan over medium heat until pan is hot. Add chickens and cook for 5 minutes. Turn chickens overcook 3 minutes or until cooked through. Combine apricot preserves, sauce, ginger, and scallions in small bowlstir until well blended. Remove chickens from panplace on plates. Top with sauce mixture. Serve immediately.
Combine all meatball ingredients and mix well. Divide into 1 inch balls and bake uncovered for 25-30 minutes at 350 degrees. Cook until brown and cooked through. Serve with your favorite pasta sauce.

In a large bowl mix honey and spices together. Rinse and dry the birds inside and out and pat dry with a paper towel. Place birds in a large roaster pan and cover with spice mixture. Turn birds and coat well. Bake at 325f for about 20 minutes. Turn and coat well with spice mixture. Bake for another 20 to 25 minutes or until done. Remove and place in a bowl and add lemon juice and toss. Serve with rice or pasta.

Heat butter and oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add edamame. Saute until slightly browned. Add corn. Continue sauteing until all is tender. Add onions. Cook 3 minutes. Add sherry. Bring to a boil. Cook until liquid is reduced. Remove from heat. Add basil. Serve warm.

Wash the plums, then pit them. Dice them as small as you can without them falling apart. Combine the plums, water, sugar, lemon juice, ginger root, lemon rind in a large saucepan over high heat until the mixture comes to a boil. Lower the heat to medium and simmer for 30 minutes or until the mixture is thick and jamlike. Pour the jam into clean jars and store in the fridge. Will keep up to 3 weeks.

In a large saucepan, combine peanuts with 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook, stirring occasionally until peanuts are tender. Drain. Return to pan. Add peanut butter chips, condensed milk, marshmallows and butter. Stir until melted. Press mixture into an 8 inch square pan. Cool. Cut into 2 inch squares. Refrigerate until firm. Store in an airtight container.

Mix all ingredients except nuts together until smooth. Stir in nuts. Spread nuts on two ungreased baking sheets, separating evenly with spoon. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes or until nuts are lightly browned and toasted. Stir once during baking. Store in tightly covered container. Makes 12 cups.

Combine chicken with onion and carrot. Add water just enough to cover chicken and bring to a boil. Lower heat and simmer for one hour. Remove chicken from pot. Boil water and milk and add sour cream. Blend until smooth. Return chicken to pot. Add sour cream mixture and heat through. Season with salt and pepper.

Mix the brown sugar, milk and egg well in a 2-quart mixing bowl. Dissolve the baking powder in the milk mixture. Add the flour to the milk mixture and beat until smooth. Place the crackers in the bottom of a 9x13-inch pan. Pour the milk mixture over the crackers and sprinkle the coconut on top of the mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Cut the bars into 1-inch squares and place a cherry in the center of each square. Cool completely on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Peel the poblano peppers. Rinse and dry them well. Stuff the poblanos with potatoes, sausage, cheese and a little of the enchilada sauce. Place poblanos in a baking dish, cover with enchilada sauce. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 20 minutes until cheese is melted. Serve with rice.

Heat the butter in a heavy frying pan over medium heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until tender. Add the wine and cook for a further 1 to 2 minutes or until reduced. Season with the salt and pepper. Place the salmon in a deep ovenproof dish. Pour the mushroom mixture over the salmon. Sprinkle with the tarragon. Dot with the lemon slices. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until the salmon is just cooked through. Remove from the oven. In a small saucepan heat the cream until it is steaming. Season with the lemon juice. Pour over the salmon. Garnish with the tarragon. Serves 1.

Preheat crock pot. Place potatoes and onions in crock pot. In a small bowl mix evaporated skim milk, soup and cheddar cheese. Stir well. Pour over potatoes. Mix well. Sprinkle pimiento over top. Cover. Cook on low for 8 hours. Stir well before serving.

Grease a 25cm square tin or a 20cm springform. Preheat the oven to 170°C/325°F/Gas 3. In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking powder and salt. In another bowl mix the sugar and eggs until frothy. Add the melted butter, the vanilla essence and the lemon zest. Add the flour mixture and beat for about 2 minutes until smooth. In another bowl mix the strawberry jam, heavy cream and the almond meal. Add the jam mixture to the batter and stir well. Pour the batter into the pan and bake for about 30 minutes until the top is firm and the edges are golden brown. Let cool. Mix the strawberry jam, heavy cream and the almond meal. Add the jam mixture to the batter and stir well. Pour the batter into the pan and bake for about 30 minutes until the top is firm and the edges are golden brown. Let cool. Cut the cake into pieces. Spread the top of each piece with the strawberry jam mixture. Melt the choc

Wash and scrub potatoes. Place in a microwave safe bowl. Add margarine and cook on high for 10 minutes. In a skillet, saute onion and green pepper in margarine until tender. Add onion soup mix and mix well. Stir in potatoes and heat through.

Boil peas until tender. Drain and cool in ice water. Drain and set aside. Peel and slice onion. Mince pimiento. Mix all together and pour over peas just before serving. Top with eggs just before serving. Chill until ready to serve.

In a 2-quart saucepan, cook onion in butter until tender. Add soups. Bring to a boil. Stir in milk. Cook and stir until hot. Add half-and-half. Heat through. Add crabmeat. Heat through. Add sherry. Heat through. Stir in salt and pepper. Serve over toasted bread cubes.
Mix pomegranates with orange juice and lemon juice. Add the strawberries and mix well. Serve immediately in glasses filled with ice, topped with mint leaves.
Mix all ingredients together in a shaker filled with ice. Shake well for 30 seconds and pour into a cocktail glass. Garnish with lime wedge. Serves 1.
Mix mint, rosemary, sugar, and vinegar in a small bowl. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir before serving. Makes about 1/3 cup.

Preheat oven to 400. Melt margarine in a 13 x 9 pan. Layer 1/2 of the burgers in pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the cheddar cheese. Add 1/2 of the eggs. Sprinkle with 1/2 of the chilies. Layer remaining burgers, cheddar, eggs and chilies. Bake 30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x13 inch pan.Combine flour, granulated sugar, salt, and baking sodastir in butter. Mix well. Add eggs and orange extractstir until smooth. Stir in orange zest. Spread into the prepared pan.Bake for 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the blondies comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely.Combine powdered sugar and cream cheese in a small bowlspread over blondies. Drizzle with orange juice. Cut into squares. Makes 24 squares.

Put all the ingredients in a food processor and blend until smooth. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Make 1/4-cup (125ml) balls and fry in batches for 2-3 minutes each side until golden. Serve with a sprinkling of mint and lemon wedges.

Place shrimp in shallow dish. Add oil and garlic. Add herbs and peppers. Toss to coat. Marinate at least 30 minutes or up to 4 hours. Drain shrimp and arrange in a single layer in the baking dish. Sprinkle shrimp with lime. Bake at 425 degrees f for 7 to 8 minutes or until shrimp are firm and opaque. Serve in lettuce leaves.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add carrots and cook until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain carrots in a colander. Add 1/4 cup water to colanderdrain carrots and reserve liquid. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine remaining 2 tablespoons water, brown sugar, butter and bourbon. Cook until butter is melted. Add carrots and parsleytoss well. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

Wrap the mozzarella cheese with prosciutto. In a frying pan over medium heat, add olive oil. When oil is hot, add mozzarella wrapped in prosciutto. Cook for about 10 minutes. Serve with mixed salad greens and dressing made with balsamic vinegar. Serve with a small scoop of cranberry sauce on top. Serve with a toothpick to spear the mozzarella wrapped in prosciutto.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cook cauliflower in a large pot of boiling water until tender crisp. Drain and transfer cauliflower to a large bowl. Mash cauliflower with butter and seasoning. Stir in enough milk to make a stiff mashed potatoes. Shape mixture into a loaf. Combine the crumbs and butter. Press the crumb mixture onto the top of the loaf and bake for 30 minutes. Uncover and bake an additional 15 minutes.

Combine vinegar and sugar in a large bowl. Let it cool for about 10 minutes. Then add in the carrots and radishes and toss the vegetables in the mixture. Now add in the bell peppers and dill and toss again. Add in the salt and pepper and toss once again. Chill the mixture for about 2 hours before serving. Serve with a side of your favorite sandwich or salad.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sausage, onion, carrot and Italian seasoningcook and stir 5 minutes or until sausage is no longer pink. Add brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 15 minutes. Stir in kalecook 2 minutes. Stir in pastacook 1 minute or until pasta is tender. Stir in cheese. Serve immediately.

Place the pine nuts into a pan and place over a medium heat. Cook and stir for 1 minute or until lightly toasted. Remove the pine nuts and set aside. Heat the vegetable stock in a small saucepan. Cook the couscous in a pan of boiling water for 7-8 minutes or until tender. Drain and rinse with cold water. Heat the olive oil in a pan. Add the cumin seeds and cook until fragrant. Add the red onion and cook for 3-4 minutes or until softened. Add the apricots and pine nuts and cook for 1 minute. Add the couscous and the chicken and cook for 2-3 minutes or until the couscous is hot and the chicken is heated through. Add the mint and combine well. Taste and adjust the seasoning with the salt and pepper. Serve the chicken couscous with a dollop of french dressing. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400f. Place salmon in a single layer in a foil-lined baking pan. Whisk together the salad dressing and water in a small bowl. Pour over fish. Sprinkle with the mushrooms. Bake until fish is opaque in the center, 15-20 minutes.

Cut honeydews in half lengthwise and scoop out pulp and seeds. Combine pulp with lime juice, honey and vanilla yogurt. Chill until ready to serve. Line a dish with honeydew balls and top with soup. Serve immediately.

Heat oven to 180C/Gas 4. In a shallow bowl, combine prawns with teriyaki marinade. Cover and set aside to marinate. In a wok or large frying pan heat oil over medium heat until very hot. Add red capsicum, red onion and broccoli florets and cook, tossing frequently, until tender-crisp (approx 3-4 minutes). Add noodles and stir fry briefly. Remove pan from heat. Drain off any excess oil. Stir in prawns. Arrange fillets over noodles and bake until cooked through (approx 10-12 minutes).

Melt margarine in a saucepan over medium heat. Add shallots and saute until soft. Add beanssaute until crisp-tender. Add brothbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer until beans are tender. Stir in parmesan cheesesprinkle with parsley. Serve over rice or pasta.

Prepare a large skillet with vegetable oil. In a large bowl combine catfish fillets and buttermilk. Let soak for 30 minutes. Add the cornmeal, flour, sea salt, and black pepper. Toss together until the catfish is completely coated. Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over high heat. Place 6 fillets into the skillet. Cook for 3 minutes per side, or until golden brown. Serve with hot sauce, if desired.

In a blender or food processor, puree the berries and sugar until smooth. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until well chilled. Stir in the whipped topping and refrigerate 1 hour longer or until well chilled. Stir in the sour cream and refrigerate until ready to serve. To serve, garnish each serving with a few of the whole strawberries, if desired. Makes about 1 1/2 quarts.

In a medium saucepan, combine water, rice, and 1/2 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low. Cover and cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed (about 20 minutes). Meanwhile, heat butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook until tender (about 5 minutes). Add onion. Cook until tender (about 5 minutes). Combine rice, mushrooms, onions, remaining 1/2 teaspoon of salt and remaining 1/2 teaspoon of pepper in a medium bowl. Stir in eggs until well blended. Add evaporated milk. Mix well. Stir in cream cheese until blended. Pour mixture into a greased 1 1/2-qt. baking dish. Sprinkle with shredded cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes.

Mix water with cocoa and splenda. Add other ingredients and mix well with an electric mixer until smooth. Refrigerate at least 4 hours to allow flavors to blend. Before serving, heat and add milk and vanilla to taste. Serve chilled with whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon stick for garnish if desired.

Cook spaghetti in boiling salted water until al dente. While cooking spaghetti heat bacon in a large frying pan and add zucchini. Stirring frequently cook until zucchini is tender. Stir in tomatoes and continue to cook for 5 minutes. Add pesto sauce and cook for 1 minute. Drain spaghetti reserving 2 tablespoons of cooking water. Add to zucchini mixture. Toss together and add parmesan cheese to taste. Add reserved cooking water and toss again to mix. Serve with parmesan cheese.

In a large skillet saute the onion, green pepper and red pepper. Stir in the cheddar cheese. Add the bacon and saute until crisp. Break eggs into skillet and cook until done. Add the cheese and bacon and cook until cheese is melted. Serve over hot biscuits or rolls.

Purée chickpeas, red peppers, garlic, feta cheese, hot red pepper sauce, pepper and salt in food processor or blender. Add oil and process until smooth and creamy. Transfer to bowl and drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with paprika and parsley for garnish. Serve with toasted pita chips or sliced vegetables for dipping.

Place beans, crushed red pepper flakes, whole cloves, and cinnamon sticks in a large bowl or jar with a tight-fitting lid. Add water to cover by 1 inch. Let stand overnight at room temperature. Strain coffee through a fine sieve. Discard spices. In a small saucepan, combine the coconut milk and honey over medium-low heat. Stir until honey is dissolved and coconut milk is warm. Stir in the coffee. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Boil the potatoes until tender, drain and cool. Slice into quarters and toss with bacon. In a small bowl whisk together the mustard, vinegar, salt and pepper. Whisk in the olive oil and chicken broth and pour over the potatoes and bacon. Toss to mix well and add the green onion and parsley just before serving.

Preheat oven to 350. Line a 13x9 baking pan with foil. Combine flour, baking powder and salt. Beat butter and sugars in large mixer bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Beat in flour mixture just until blended. Spread in prepared pan. Bake 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Cool completely on wire rack. Melt chocolate chips and shortening together. Spread over brownies. Cool completely. Cut into bars and remove from pan. Store in refrigerator or freezer.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saut 1 minute. Add chicken and sprinkle with the spices. Cook 6 minutes. Add broth and raisins. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer 6 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Stir in couscous, and simmer 2 minutes. Add peas and heat through.

In a skillet over medium heat, heat the butter. Add the bread and toast until golden brown. Spread the provolone cheese over the toast. Add the olive salad, ham, mortadella and salami. Top with the second piece of toast. Place the sandwich in the panini maker and cook until the sandwich is golden brown.

In large skillet over medium heat combine almonds, sugar, salt and honey. Stir constantly until mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Continue to stir until honey is absorbed and nuts are glazed. Remove from heat. Stir in almond oil and mix until nuts are coated with glaze. Spread on greased baking sheet. Let stand for 5 minutes. Store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cut the amaretti cookie into quarters. Add the rice to a medium pot and stir in milk. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce the heat to low. Add sugar, amaretti cookie quarters, and vanilla extract. Stir until the mixture thickens slightly. Pour the pudding into a 10-inch tart pan with a removable bottom. Bake until the pudding is set but still a little jiggly (about 25 minutes). Remove the pudding from the oven. Cool to room temperature. Place the chocolate on a double boiler (or heatproof plate set over a pot of simmering water) over medium-low heat until melted. Use a small spoon to drizzle the melted chocolate over the rice pudding. Allow the chocolate to set for 20 minutes at room temperature before serving.

Brown hamburger in a skillet. Drain and add water to make a gravy. Add pasta sauce and sliced mushrooms. Bring to a boil and add pasta. Reduce heat and simmer until pasta is tender. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Salt and pepper steak. Brown steak in skillet. Remove steak. Add onions and carrots and celery to skillet. Sauté until tender. Add potatoes and green pepper. Add broth and gravy mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer. Add steak and cook until done. Serve with vegetables and potatoes.

Cook bacon until crispremove bacon from panpour off all but 2 Tbsp of fatsaute onion and celery in fat until tenderadd chicken broth and bring to a boilstir in ricereduce heat to lowcover tightlycook 45-50 minfluff ricestir in baconsprinkle with chervilseason to taste with black pepperstir in cornsprinkle with parsleyserve hot.

Prepare a baking sheet by lightly greasing it with cooking spray. Put the almonds in a plastic bag and crush them lightly. In a small bowl beat together the egg white and vanilla. Add the crushed almonds and mix well. Add the sugar and cinnamon and mix well. Spread the mixture evenly on the baking sheet. Bake for 10-15 minutes, stirring every 3-4 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool. Break up any lumps that have formed. Store in an air tight container.

Steam spinach leaves until tender. Melt olive oil in a small skillet over medium heat. Add garlic and hot pepper flakes. Cook, stirring occasionally until the garlic is golden. Add spinach and toss until evenly coated with the garlic mixture. Remove from heat. Stir in bell peppers. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Boil ziti in large pot of salted boiling water until al dente (tender). Drain and return to pot over low heat until pasta is coated with sauce and slightly warmed through. Meanwhile in medium saucepan over medium-low heat combine butter and cream cheese stirring until melted and combined. Add milk and garlic powder stirring until smooth and combined. Remove from heat and stir in parmesan cheese and season with black pepper and parsley flakes if desired. Serve with ziti and sprinkle with parsley if desired.

Preheat oven broiler on high setting. Remove husks from corn. Scrape kernels off cobs into blender jar. Cover cobs with about 1/2 inch of water and place on broiler tray. Broil 12-15 minutes or until kernels are browned and charred in places. (Be careful not to burn kernels). Let cool, then slip off kernels with your fingers into blender jar. Discard cobs. To blender jar, add 2 cups of water and chipotle chiles. Blend until smooth. Transfer blended mixture to a saucepan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce heat to low and simmer gently for 15 minutes. Stir in feta cheese and serve with tortilla chips.

Spray a cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray. In a small bowl combine refried beans and chili. Spread evenly over the chips and sprinkle with cheddar cheese and monterey jack pepper cheese. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 degrees for 10 minutes or until cheese has melted. Sprinkle with onion and jalapeno. Top with sour cream and green onion. Serve with tomatoes and salsa.

Heat oil in skillet. Brown pork loin in oil. Add mushrooms and saute 1-2 minutes. Remove meat and vegetables and set aside. Add cracked black pepper and stir. Return meat and vegetables to pan. Add wine and bring to a boil. Cover and cook 20 minutes. Stir occasionally. Remove cover and continue cooking 10 more minutes. Add parsley and cook 3 more minutes. Serve with noodles or rice. 8 servings.

Heat oil in a saucepan and add the okra. Cover and cook on a low flame for about 10 minutes. Add the onions and cook till soft. Add the garlic, ginger and green chillies and cook for another minute. Add water and bring to boil. Add ground cumin and coriander and cook for about a minute. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with a squeeze of lemon.

Bake graham cracker pie crust. Combine condensed milk, yolks, lime juice and key lime pie filling in a blender or food processor. Process until smooth, stopping occasionally to scrape the sides of the bowl with a rubber spatula. Pour mixture into baked pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes or until the filling is set. Cool completely. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until ready to serve. Top with whipped cream and lime wedge.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 9-inch square pan. Sift together flour and baking powder. Beat together eggs, oil and sugar until thick. Stir in flour mixture and rhubarb. Mix oats with brown sugar and cinnamon. Add to rhubarb mixture. Pour into pan. Bake 40 to 50 minutes. Let cool.

Combine eggnog and vanilla in a saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in egg yolks and heat until yolks are fully cooked through and mixture is thickened, about 10 minutes, stirring frequently. In a separate bowl sift together flour, baking powder and cinnamon, then set aside. In a large bowl combine butter and sugar and cream together until light and fluffy. Add eggnog mixture and mix until combined. Stir in dry ingredients and mix well. Cover and chill 3 to 4 hours. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Shape dough into 1 inch balls and place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until tops are lightly browned. Cool completely on wire racks before decorating. In a small bowl, combine confectioner's sugar and milk until smoothdrizzle over cooled cookies.

In a 9 x 13 pan, add macaroni and the evaporated milk. Let set for 10 minutes. In a saucepan combine the milk, butter and cheese. Heat over medium heat until cheese is melted. Pour over macaroni. Spread cheese mixture over the macaroni. Sprinkle with the cheese mix. Bake for 20 minutes at 350 degrees or until golden brown on top. Serve warm or cold.

Cut each chicken breast into four strips. Combine all other ingredients in a large bowl and mix well. Add chicken strips and toss to coat. Cover and marinate for 2 hours. Drain and fry in hot oil for 3-4 minutes. Serve with rice and vegetables.

Brown sausage and beef and drain. Add onion and celery and cook until tender. Add green bell pepper and cook until tender. Combine rice, sausage and beef mixture and cayenne and black pepper. Add water to moisten. Pour into greased 1-1/2 quart baking dish. Bake at 325 oven for 1 hour. Stir and bake 1/2 hour longer. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour an 8-inch square pan. Sift together the flour, sugar, cardamom, baking powder and salt. Cut the butter into the flour mixture with a pastry blender or fork until it resembles coarse breadcrumbs. Add the egg and stir until it just begins to come together. Press half of the dough evenly into the prepared pan. Spread half of the lingonberry preserves on the dough. Crumble the remaining dough evenly over the filling. Bake for 30 minutes or until the top is golden. Serve warm with whipped cream or vanilla ice cream.
Cut pickles into small slices and place in a medium bowl. Add sugar and Tabasco Sauce and stir to combine. Refrigerate for at least an hour and serve.

peel potatoes and cut into small pieces. Place potatoes in a heavy sauce pan and cover with water. Boil until potatoes are soft and mushy and water is clear. Drain potatoes and place in a large mixing bowl. Add cream and mash potatoes. Add flour and butter and mix well. Add salt and mix well again. Dough will be very sticky. Knead dough until it is smooth and soft and roll out on a lightly floured surface to desired thickness (about 1/4 inch). Cut into desired shape and bake on a greased cookie sheet at 425 for about 12-15 minutes or until golden brown and crispy on the edges. Remove from cookie sheet and place in a warm place until ready for use. Serve with butter and jam or whatever you like!
Mix pumpkin, milk, brown sugar, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg in large bowl. Beat eggs and egg white in medium bowl. Stir in pumpkin mixture. Microwave uncovered on high 5 to 7 minutes or until set.

Sprinkle chicken breasts with seasoned salt and pepper. In a shallow dish combine flour and paprika. Dip chicken in flour mixture. In a skillet, saute chicken in butter about 5 minutes per side or until no longer pink in center and juices run clear. Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, combine soup, sour cream and white wineheat through. Remove chicken from skilletkeep warm. In the same skillet, combine browner, soup mixture and green onionheat through. Spoon over chicken and serve.

Heat oven to 375 degrees f. Place zucchini in a large bowl with oil, zucchini, onion, garlic, salt and pepper until tender. Add tomatoes and roasted red pepper. Spoon fish into skillet with vegetable mixture. Cover with foil. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes. Serve with fresh parsley sprinkled over top. Serve with cooked rice or whole grain pasta.

Mix together the egg, sugar, and cocoa in a mixing bowl. Heat together the milk and heavy cream until hot. Whisk into the cocoa mixture. Add vanilla and honey. Add heavy whipping cream. Cool the mixture. Freeze in an ice cream maker according to manufacturer's instructions. About half way through freezing, take out and add the crushed graham crackers and the chopped up Hershey bar. Mix to incorporate. Add in the miniature marshmallows. Continue freezing until done. Serve in a bowl with crushed graham crackers or on top of another dessert.

In a large pot of boiling salted water over high heat, cook potato until tender, 20 minutes. Drain, place potato in a food processor and process until smoothtransfer to a bowl. Whisk milk into potato mixture until blendedset aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook oysters and butter until heated through, about 2 minutesseason with salt. Stir in Worcestershire sauce and peppercook 1 minute longer. Stir oysters into potato mixtureseason with nutmeg and more salt if desired. Reheat over low heat until hot. Divide among 4 bowlssprinkle with chives or green onions before serving.

Heat olive oil and add garlic and saute until fragrant. Add squash and water and bring to boil over high heat. Cover and reduce heat to medium high and cook until squash is tender. Stir in basil and cook for another 1-2 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot

Cut beans in half. In a medium bowl combine the remaining ingredients. Add the beans and toss well. Cover and refrigerate until serving. Serve on a bed of lettuce. Garnish with additional mushrooms if desired.

Place family-size tea bags in a large pitcher and pour over boiling water. Let steep for 30 minutes. Remove tea bags. Add 2 teaspoons baking soda and stir. Add sugar until mixture is sweet enough for your taste. Chill and serve over ice. Makes 5-6 cups tea.

Peel and slice apples and saute in a small amount of butter until soft. In a large mixing bowl combine the cooked apples and cabbage. In a separate bowl combine the butter, brown sugar and cinnamon. Add this mixture to the cabbage and apples and mix well. Spray a small casserole dish with canola oil cooking spray and spread a layer of the cabbage mixture in the dish. Sprinkle with breadcrumbs and repeat the layering twice more. Bake in a preheated oven at 350 for 40 minutes or until the top is brown and bubbly. Makes 6 servings.

Break the eggs into a medium bowl and whisk with a fork until yolks and whites are thoroughly combined. Add the light cream and mix thoroughly. Season with salt and pepper to taste and add the Worcestershire sauce. Transfer the egg mixture to a saucepan over medium heat and stir gently with a wooden spoon until the eggs are scrambled and cooked through. Serve immediately.

Heat the wine and water in a saucepan over high heat. Add the halibut and cook for 5 minutes. Turn and cook for a further 3 minutes. Drain the fish, reserving the liquid. Whisk together the mayonnaise and sour cream. Season with paprika and salt. Stir in the halibut. Spoon the halibut mixture onto the breadcrumbs and toss lightly to coat. Shape the fish cakes and roll in the reserved liquid. Heat the oil in a nonstick skillet over high heat. Cook the fish cakes for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Serve hot with the sauce.

Blend together garlic, chilies, parsley and cilantro in blender. With the blender running add the cheese and pine nuts. Add olive oil gradually until desired thickness. Put into refrigerator. Cook shrimp in butter. Mix in pesto and serve.

Combine the soy sauce, vinegar and chili sauce in a small bowl. Heat 2 teaspoons of the toasted sesame oil in a wok or skillet over medium-high heat until the oil is hot. Add the ginger and stir-fry for 30 seconds. Add the snow peas and radishes and stir-fry for 1 minute. Add the remaining 2 teaspoons of the toasted sesame oil and the scallions. Stir-fry for 1 minute. Stir the soy sauce mixture and pour it over the vegetables. Add the cashews and stir-fry for 1 minute longer. Serve warm.

Combine panko and cranberries in a shallow bowl. In a separate bowl combine the green onion and thyme with the lemon peel and melted butter. Brush the salmon fillets with butter mixture and sprinkle with the panko mixture. Bake for about 10 minutes.
Combine first six ingredients. Fold in remaining ingredients.

Combine the poppy seeds and the currant jam in a small bowl. Combine the marzipan, flour, sugar, egg and salt in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachmentmix on medium speed until well combined, about 2 minutes. Add the butter and mix until smooth, about 2 minutes more. Form the dough into a ball, wrap in plastic wrap, and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. Scoop the dough with a teaspoon, roll it into a ball, then flatten it slightly between your palms so that it's about 1/2-inch thick. Place one teaspoon of the currant-poppy seed mixture in the center of each cookiewrap the dough around the filling so that it forms a pocket, then pinch the top to seal it closed. Place the cookies about 1 1/2 inches apart onto the prepared baking sheets. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until the cookies are puffy and set

Combine all of the ingredients except for butter and sweet potato. Mash sweet potato. Add to batter. Heat 3 inches of vegetable oil in a large deep pot to 375F (190C). Pour batter into hot oil with an ice cream scoop. Fry for 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Fry in batches. Drain on paper towel. Season with salt. Serve hot with sour cream.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add the pasta and cook until al dente. Meanwhile, in a large saute pan over medium heat, add olive oil and heat for about 30 seconds. Add garlic and cook until soft and golden, about 1 minute. Add fennel and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the pasta and cook until coated with the olive oil and fennel for about 1 minute. Season with black pepper and sea salt. Remove from heat and add the wild fennel and anchovies. Stir to combine and serve with the red pepper flakes sprinkled over the top.

Grate the cheeses together in a large bowl. Add the garlic and all other ingredients except the crackers and pimento stuffed olive and stir well until all is combined. Chill for at least 4 hours to allow flavors to meld together. Cut the stuffed olive in half and place 1/2 in each cracker. Serve as a sandwich or as an appetizer.

Combine all mayonnaise ingredients in a bowl. Cover and refrigerate until ready to use. Combine 3 tablespoons of mayonnaise with 1/2 cup of lettuce in a bowl. Layer tortillas with lettuce mixture. Top with turkey breast. Top with remaining lettuce mixture. Roll up tortilla and serve.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cold water. Combine tuna with pasta and remaining ingredients in a large bowl. Toss to mix. Garnish with parsley. Serve.

Heat canola oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and sauté until onion is translucent and golden brown. Add green beans and cook for about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and toss in fresh parsley before serving. Serve hot.
Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowlrefrigerate 2 hours. Stir in remaining ingredients. Yield: 6 servings.

In a heavy stock pot over medium high heat add celery ribs, onion and garlic. Saute until onion is translucent. Add lentils, brown sugar, pork hocks and enough cold water to cover. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer covered until lentils are tender about 30 minutes. Remove hocks, cool them and remove meat. Discard bones. Add back to lentil soup. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Simmer another 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Sprinkle the potatoes and onions with the herbs and place them into the bottom of a shallow baking dish. Pour over the margarine and season with the salt and pepper. Mix together the milk and flour and pour over the potato and onion mixture. Place the cheese over the top and bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven until golden. Serve hot.

Boil water and sugar together until syrupy. Dip fruit into syrup to coat. Cool. Beat egg whites until stiff. Gradually add hot syrup and vanilla. Beat until stiff. Fold in mayonnaise. Chill until serving. Just before serving, stir in orange rind and salt. Dip fruit into sauce to coat. Serve immediately. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.
In food processor, process cream cheese and next 3 ingredients until well blended. Add olives. Stir until combined. Serve with crackers or vegetables. Makes 3 cups.
Preheat oven to 375. Mix together bisquick mix, water and orange marmalade. Melt butter in large cast iron pan. Spoon batter into pan and bake 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown. Serves 4.

Combine flour, baking soda and salt in small bowl. Cut in butter with pastry blender or fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add oatstoss until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Press into 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Remove from oven. Mix together brown sugar, flour, cinnamon and nutmeg. Sprinkle over crust. Mix together butter, milk and vanilla. Pour over filling. Bake 25 to 30 minutes longer or until knife inserted into center comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes before cutting.

Place chicken in bottom of slow cooker. Add marmalade, lime juice, pineapple and soy saucestir well. Add remaining ingredientsmix well. Cover and cook on low for 7-8 hours or until chicken is tender. Remove chicken and set aside. Pour liquid through a strainer into a small saucepanbring to a boil. Combine cornstarch and water until smoothstir into pan. Bring to a boilcook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened. Add chicken and pour sauce over all. Refrigerate leftovers. Serve with white rice or hot cooked noodles.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. In a bowl, combine apples and sugar. Let stand for 15 minutes. In a medium skillet, combine the wine and bread crumbs over medium heat. Cook until liquid evaporates. Stir in apples. In a large bowl, combine apples, bread mixture, eggs, milk and orange zest. Pour mixture into a 9 x 13 baking dish. Bake until set in the middle, about 1 hour. Cool slightly. In a medium bowl, whisk together cream, sugar, orange zest and vanilla. Pour over bread pudding. Chill before serving. Serve with whipped cream if desired.

Brown ground beef and drain off fat. Add salt and worcestershire sauce. Crumble biscuit mix in the bottom of baking dish, then spread beef over biscuit mix and sprinkle onion gravy mix over top. Add milk and brown gravy mix and stir until combined. Bake at 400 degrees until hot and bubbling and biscuits are browned (approximately 40 minutes). Serve with a salad or green beans and corn on the cob.

In a saucepan combine all the above ingredients. Bring to a boil and let it boil for 5 minutes. Cool and store in an air tight jar. Use 2-4 tablespoons depending on what you are using it on. Great for shrimp, fish or even chicken.

In a large bowl or the bowl of a stand mixer, whisk together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and salt. Set aside. In a small bowl or glass measuring cup, whisk together the egg and canola oil. Add the egg mixture to the dry ingredients and stir until the mixture resembles a coarse meal. Add the water and stir just until the mixture comes together. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and knead for 1 minute. Divide the dough into 10 equal portions and shape each into a ball. Place the balls on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. Reduce the temperature of the oven to 300 degrees F (150 degrees C), and continue to bake until the loaves are golden brown and sound hollow when tapped, about another 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and allow to cool on the pan for about 10 minutes. Serve warm with butter. Makes 10 loaves.

Topping: Mix together sugar, flour and cinnamon. Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Reserve 1/4 cup of the mixture for the top of the pie. Press remaining mixture over bottom of pie. In a medium bowl, combine blueberries, orange juice, sugar and flour. Spoon into the pie shell. Sprinkle with the reserved crumb mixture. Bake at 425 for 45 minutes or until the juices are bubbling and the crumb topping is golden brown. Cool completely. Serves 6 to 8.

Spray a large skillet or griddle with nonstick spray. Break eggs into skillet. Cook over medium-low heat. When edges begin to set and eggs are still very moist, sprinkle with cinnamon and nutmeg. Cover and cook until eggs are firm and cooked through. Remove from heat. Sprinkle ricotta cheese and heavy cream over eggs. Top with a sprinkling of Splenda.

Preheat oven to 375. Line cookie sheet with parchment paper. In bowl mix together rolled oats, flour, sugar, cocoa and salt. In another bowl mix together baking powder and egg whites. Add vanilla and corn syrup. Pour over flour mixture. Stir until blended. Add rice krispies. Drop by heaping teaspoon on cookie sheet. Bake for about 10 minutes. Cool for about 5 minutes before removing from pan. Makes about 3 dozen.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add garlic and cook until tender. Add bell peppers and onions. Cook until peppers and onions are tender. Season with cumin and oregano. Add chicken, turning to coat in sauce. Cook 2 to 3 minutes on each side. Stir in hot chili peppers and lemon juice. Serve over cooked rice.

Bring water to a boil and add the rice and lentils and cook till done (about 50 minutes), adding more water if necessary to get the rice to cook properly. While the rice and lentils are cooking, sauté the onions in the olive oil and the season with the salt and pepper and cumin. When the rice and lentils are done, mix them together and then add the sautéed onions and mix well. Serve with a side salad and/or some fruit.

In a medium bowl combine onion and oil. Saute for about 5 minutes. Add tomatoes and green chilies and cook for an additional 5 minutes. Add spinach and cook until just wilted. Remove from heat. In a food processor combine cream cheese and half-and-half until smooth. Add spinach mixture to food processor and pulse until blended. Add cheese and pulse until blended. Add vinegar and pulse until blended. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cook breakfast sausage in large skillet until cooked through. Add egg to skillet, mixing well with sausage. Stir in salt and pepper to taste. Stir in garlic powder and set aside to cool. Unroll crescent rolls. Press perforations to seal. Fill with egg mixture. Cut each roll into three pieces. Arrange in 13x9-inch baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Whisk milk with egg until blended. Pour evenly over crescent rolls. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 to 40 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with parsley before serving.

Cook rice as directed on package. Combine milk and coconut milk in a saucepan over medium heat. Add rice and stir until heated through. Add sugar and salt. Stir in coconut extract. Pour into a greased 1 1/2 qt baking dish. Sprinkle with coconut flakes. Bake at 350 degrees F for 20-30 minutes. Serve warm.

Prepare crust by combining crumbs and margarine and pressing into 9 inch springform pan. Bake 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool. Prepare filling by blending soy cream cheese and pumpkin puree until smooth. Add remaining filling ingredients. Blend until smooth. Pour into crust and spread evenly. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Remove from oven and let cool completely. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Enjoy.
In a small mixing bowl beat eggs. Add water, biscuit mix and onions. Mix well. Add cheese and cayenne. Spoon into a well greased 9x13-inch pan. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes.

In a small saucepan combine maple syrup, mustard, molasses, and vinegar. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer. Toss in the cumin, stirring to blend. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Season the chops with the salt and pepper. Spray a cookie sheet with nonstick cooking spray. Lay the chops on the prepared sheet. Drizzle the sauce over the chops. Cover the pan with foil and roast for 40 minutes or until done. Serves 4.

Peel potatoes and cut into chunks. Put potatoes and water into medium saucepan and cover tightly. Simmer until potatoes are soft when pierced with fork, about 20 minutes. Drain potatoes well. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease an 8×8 inch baking pan. In large mixing bowl, combine potatoes, coconut, almonds, vanilla extract, powdered sugar, and melted dark chocolate. Press mixture evenly into prepared pan with hands or spoon. Bake in preheated oven until top is golden brown, about 20 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Unroll doughseparate into triangles. Place 1 tablespoon cream of chicken soup in each triangle. Sprinkle 1 tablespoon of cheese over top. Fold dough in half to make a crescent shape. Place on a cookie sheet. Brush each crescent with milk. Bake for 15 minutes in the preheated oven. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a large frying pan over medium heat. Add onion & cook until soft. Add courgettes. Cook for 5 minutes. Add pasta & sauce. Stir for 5 minutes. Add walnuts. Cook for 2 minutes. Serve with parsley & grated parmesan cheese.

Brew coffee. Remove from heat. Pour into a container with a lid. Add brown sugar, vanilla bean. Let it sit for 5 minutes. In another blender add banana. Blend until smooth. Add coffee mixture and blend until smooth. Add ice cubes and blend again. Pour into glasses. Sprinkle with almonds.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl, mix the ground turkey, cream of mushroom soup, eggs, oats, onion, and garlic. Stir until combined. Spread into prepared loaf pan. Bake in the preheated oven until no longer pink in the center, about 55 minutes. Serve on bun, if desired. Serves 6 to 8.

Cook Mexican rice and black beans separately. In a 9x13 pan, layer 1/3 Mexican rice and 1/2 mexicorn with 1/3 of the ground turkey. Repeat the layering process. Top the final layer of ground turkey with the remaining Mexican rice and black beans. Cover and bake at 350F for 1 hour or until the rice is cooked through. Sprinkle with cheese and serve.
Place ham shank in a 6 quart pressure cooker. Add water to come 1/2 inch from the top. Add potatoes, onions, carrots and cabbage. Seal cooker. Cook 22 minutes. Serve with brown gravy.

Wash and stem spinach. Blanch in boiling water until just wilted. Drain and press out excess water. Fold spinach into a large bowl. Add egg yolks and 1/2 cup of cheese and mix well. Add potato and mix until just blended. Sprinkle with remaining cheese and flour and mix well. Divide into two or four portions. On a floured surface roll each portion into a log about 1/2 inch thick. Cut into 1 inch lengths. Bring a large saucepan of water to a boil. Add gnocchi and cook until tender. Remove with a slotted spoon and place in a well buttered baking dish. Melt remaining butter in a small saucepan and pour over gnocchi. Serve.

In a bowl mix together the sugar and the rice flour. Pour in the boiling water and stir until the mixture comes together to form a dough. Knead the dough until it is smooth and elastic. The dough should not stick to your fingers when you touch it. Divide the dough in 4 equal pieces. Roll the dough into long sausage shapes. Place the dough onto a cutting board and cut into 1/8 inch strips. Stretch the dough as thin as possible. Dust the dough with a thin layer of powdered sugar. Cut the dough into 1 1/2 inch pieces and place the candy onto a wax paper lined platter. Dust with powdered sugar. Makes approximately 36 pieces.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine the all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In another bowl, beat butter with an electric mixer until creamy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then add the milk and vanilla extract. Add the flour mixture alternately with the buttermilk, starting and ending with the flour mixture and beating until smooth after each addition. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, then reduce the heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Continue baking until puffed and golden brown, about 20 minutes longer. Makes 12 popovers

In a large skillet cook beef over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain and set aside. In the same skillet saute onions and peppers until crisp-tender. Combine beans, tomatoes, beef and vegetables in a large saucepan. Add butter and season with salt and pepper. Simmer uncovered for 5 minutes. Spoon half into the bottom of a 2-1/2 quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Pour remaining mixture over top. Combine flour and paprikasprinkle over top. Bake, uncovered, at 350 for 20-25 minutes or until bubbly.

In a skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add ground turkey, onion and cook until turkey is no longer pink. Add chili beans, thick & chunky salsa, refried beans and beef broth. Bring to a boil and cook for a few minutes. Add chili powder and ground cumin and cook a few minutes longer. Serve with shredded cheese and low fat sour cream.

Cook pasta in large pot of boiling water until tender but firm to bite. Drain. Set aside. Meanwhile heat 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pine nuts and cook until browned. Remove pine nuts with slotted spoon and set aside. Add 2 tablespoons olive oil to pan. Add garlic. Cook until fragrant. Add chard leaves. Cook until wilted. Add broth and simmer for 2 minutes. Add penne to pan. Add sun dried tomato packed in oil. Cook for 1 minute. Add balsamic vinegar. Season to taste. Divide pasta among 4 plates. Top each serving with 1/4 cup pine nuts. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese.

Combine soy sauce and sugar in a small bowl, stirring until sugar dissolves completely. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Season chicken with salt and pepper, and add to skillet in a single layer. Sear for 2 minutes per side or until browned. Stir together remaining ingredients in a small bowl and stir into skillet. Cover and cook over medium heat for 20 minutes or until the meat is no longer pink and the sauce is thick and syrupy. Transfer meat to a platter and pour off excess sauce. Serve sauce with the chicken.

Toss the sprouts with a little olive oil, a couple tablespoons of water and some salt and pepper. Put in a baking dish and roast for 30 minutes or until tender. Melt butter in a small saucepan and whisk in the lemon juice and water. Simmer until thickened. Toss with brussels sprouts and sprinkle with a little fresh ground pepper.

In a saucepan over medium heat, stir together buttermilk, dijon mustard, salt and sugar until sugar is dissolved. Bring to a boil and let simmer for 5 minutes. Remove shrimp and cucumber from shells and peels and add to soup. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add green onions and serve.

1. In a sauce pan, combine the water, apple pie filling, orange juice and zest, cinnamon and salt. Bring to a boil over high heatstir well and reduce heat to medium low. Cook uncovered for about 10 minutes or until mixture is thick and bubblystir occasionally. Cool. 2. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). 3.
