Unroll one pie crust and press into bottom and up sides of a greased 9 inch deep dish pie panfold under edges to crimp. Pour the filling into the pie crustsprinkle the top evenly with the sugar. Cut slits in the top of the pie crust for venting. Bake at 400 degrees F for 10 minutesreduce heat to 375 degrees F and bake an additional 40 minutes or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool before serving.
In a bowl, whisk together sesame oil, sugar, vinegar, soy sauce and mustard. Add the spinach. Toss to coat. Top with the toasted sesame seeds. Serves 4.

Make pie crust as directed on box. Pour 1 1/2 cups of sweetened condensed milk into a bowl. Add 1 tablespoon lime juice and 2 packets of unflavored gelatin dissolved in 1/4 cup of cold water. Stir well. Set aside until cool. Beat 1 cup whipping cream until thick. Gradually beat in remaining condensed milk. Stir in gelatin mixture. Fold in 1/2 cup heavy whipping cream. Spread into crust. Refrigerate until firm. Garnish as desired.

Melt butter in a heavy saucepan. Add sugar and stir until well blended. Add eggs one at a time. Stir in well. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla. Sift together flour and baking powder. Add to melted mixture and blend well. Pour into a 9 x 13 inch greased baking dish. Sprinkle with walnuts. Bake at 350 degrees for about 30 minutes. Cool. Cut into squares.

To make hot tea, pour boiling water over the lavender and lemon slices. Allow to steep for 5 minutes. Strain and add sugar and fresh lemon juice. To make iced tea, pour boiling water over the lavender and lemon slices and allow to steep for 5 minutes. Strain and allow to cool. Add sugar and fresh lemon juice. Serve over ice.

Melt margarine in heavy 2 quart saucepan over low heat. Stir in brown sugar until well blended and smooth. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and nuts. Press into bottom of 13x9-inch baking pan. Bake at 375f for 12 minutes. While crust is baking combine cream cheese and milk until well blendedstir in powdered sugar until smooth and creamy. Spread over baked crust and bake for 5 additional minutes. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Wash carrots and cut off the ends. Cut carrots into 1/2 inch slices. Coat carrot slices with cooking spray. Place carrots in a bowl with onions. Add salt and pepper to taste. Mix well. Bake carrots for 30 minutes.

Season chicken breasts with pepper and salt. In a shallow dish, beat together the egg whites and cornstarch until combined. Place breadcrumbs in a separate shallow dish. Dip each breast in the egg mixture, then in the breadcrumbs. Heat 2 tablespoons of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Working in batches, add the chicken to the pan and cook until browned and cooked through, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer the chicken to a platter. Heat the remaining oil in the pan over medium-high heat. Add the lemon juice and cook until reduced and syrupy. Add the parsley and pour over the chicken breasts. Serve with green salad.

Bring one cup of water to a boil in a medium bowl. Stir in one package of lemon gelatin, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and stir in one cup of frozen lemonade concentrate. Set aside to cool to room temperature. In a large bowl, beat two packages of cream cheese with a mixer until creamy. Beat in two 8-ounce containers of frozen whipped topping, one at a time, beating on medium speed until light and fluffy. Beat in the lemon gelatin mixture on low speed just until combined. Pour into an unbaked 9-inch pie crust. Refrigerate for several hours or overnight to set. Decorate with whipped cream and lemon slice just before serving. If desired, add a drop or two of yellow food coloring to the whipped cream to tint it yellow.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Toss together potatoes and olive oil in a large bowl until potatoes are completely coated with olive oil. Spread potatoes out on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and roast for 1 hour until tender and golden brown. While the potatoes are roasting, mince the garlic cloves and combine with the fresh lemon juice in a small bowl. When the potatoes are done roasting, remove them from the oven and add the garlic and lemon juice mixture to the potatoes. Toss well and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a large bowl, beat butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in molasses and egg. In a medium bowl, whisk flour, spices and soda. Stir into butter mixture. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Yield: About 4 dozen.

Cook pasta in a medium pot with 3 cups of water. Bring to a boil. Cook for 8 minutes. Stir in chopped spinach and cook for 1 minute. Drain and set aside. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of water to the pot. Add garlic, lemon peel and zest. Cook for 1 minute. Add the spinach mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Cook for 5 minutes or until pasta is tender. Serve sprinkled with parmesan cheese and chopped fresh parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Melt 1 tablespoon butter in skillet over medium heat and saute onion for about 3 minutes. Add bacon and cook until crisp. Drain and mix with onion and bacon. Set aside. In a large bowl combine sour cream and oreganomix well. In a small bowl mix together tomatoes, Italian bread crumbs and 3 tablespoons Parmesan cheeseset aside. In a greased 9 x 13 inch dish layer onions and bacon mixture, sour cream mixture, tomato bread crumb mixture and three noodlesrepeat layering with remaining noodles and cheese. Bake uncovered for 30-35 minutes until hot and bubbly. Cut into squares to serve.
Mix together first 4 ingredients. Add rum and ice cubespour into glasses. Garnish each glass with pineapple chunk and melon ball.

Saute onion and bok choy in oil. Remove from pan, add egg and soy sauce and cook over medium heat until cooked through. Remove from heat. Stir bamboo shoot into eggs, add shrimp and mix well. Serve over rice and enjoy!

Cut chicken into 1/2" strips. Combine sesame seeds and pecans in a shallow dish. Dip each chicken strip into egg whites then the sesame seed/pecan mixture. Place each strip in hot oil and fry until golden brown. Serve with hoisin sauce for dipping. For the sauce, combine 2 tablespoons hoisin sauce with 1/2 tablespoon Dijon mustard, 1/4 cup apricot preserves and 1 tablespoon water.

In a large pot, melt butter over low heat. Stir in green onion and garlic until fragrant but not brown, about 2 minutes. Add broth, avocado, yogurt, crabmeat, and lemon juice. Cover and simmer on low heat until heated through, about 5 minutes. Ladle into bowls and garnish with avocado slices. Serve hot.

Combine gelatin with boiling water in a small bowl. Stir 1 minute or until gelatin is completely dissolved. Refrigerate 10 minutes or until slightly thickened. Gently stir in frozen raspberries. Pour mixture into an 8-inch square pan coated with cooking spray. Refrigerate 1 hour or until firm. Meanwhile, in a small saucepan, combine sugar and butter. Cook over medium heat 4-5 minutes or until butter is melted and sugar is dissolved. Brush pretzels with butter mixture. Place pretzels in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Bake at 350 for 5-7 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely. Spread cream cheese over bottom of pretzels. Top with raspberry mixture and cool whip. Refrigerate 1 hour or until ready to serve.

1. Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.2. Coat a 9 x 13 inch baking dish with cooking spray.3. Add potatoes and 2 cups water to a microwave-safe bowlmicrowave on high 8 minutes.4. Drain and transfer potatoes to a large bowladd beef, black beans and salsa.5. Spoon potato mixture into dishtop with cheese soup.6. Bake 10 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease a 9x9x2-inch baking dish. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the celery and cook for 5 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in the chicken and breadcrumbs. Add the eggs, milk, parsley, and seasonings. Cook for 1 minute more. Spoon the mixture into the baking dish. Pour the chicken broth over the top. Bake uncovered for 15-20 minutes, until the top is golden brown.

Melt 1 tablespoon butter in a 4-quart Dutch oven or saucepan. Saute garlic cloves and shallots for 30 seconds. Add dried tarragon and thyme. Sauté for 1 minute. Stir in ale and mussels. Bring to a boil. Cover and cook over medium-low heat for 5 minutes. Remove lid and cook until mussels open. Stir in parsley and chives. Sprinkle with remaining 2 tablespoons butter. Serve with toasted French bread.

Brown chicken breasts on both sides in butter. In a crock pot add chicken breasts and sprinkle with italian salad dressing mix and white wine. Cover with cream of mushroom soup. Stir in cream cheese with chives until it is mixed through out. Cook on low for 3-4 hours. Serve with angel hair pasta and extra parmesan cheese.
Combine sour cream, lemon juice and sugar. Beat until smooth and thick. Stir in cherry and banana. Chill for at least 4 hours. Fold in pineapple and nuts just before serving. Makes about 6 servings.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Lightly coat two 9-inch round cake pans with cooking spray. Sift together the flour, salt and baking soda into a large bowl and set aside. Beat the butter and sugar together in the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment until light and fluffy. Add the vanilla and eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Add the bananas and mix until just combined. Add the flour mixture in thirds alternating with the milk beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Divide the batter evenly between the two cake pans. Bake the cakes for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool the cakes in their pans on a wire rack for 10 minutes then turn out onto the rack and cool completely. To make the glaze, beat the butter and confectioners' sugar together in a medium bowl. Add the vanilla extract and enough milk to make the glaze drizzling consistency. Drizzle the glaze over the

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour 2 9×13 inch pans.In a large bowl, combine cocoa powder, flour, baking soda, and salt. In a medium bowl, combine the sugar, eggs, and buttermilk. In a small bowl, mix the Wesson oil and vanilla extract together.Add the Wesson oil mixture into the cocoa powder mixture alternately with the buttermilk mixture, beginning and ending with the cocoa powder mixture. Pour batter into prepared pans. Bake in the preheated oven for 30 to 35 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the middle of the cake comes out clean.Cool in pans for 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

In a large pot cook broccoli with butter until just tender. Drain and place in a greased casserole dish. Combine broccoli and rice with onion and seasonings. Add sour cream and cheese whiz and mix well. Bake for about an hour. Sprinkle with extra cheese when finished cooking.
Combine cream cheese, lemon juice and mustard. Spread on bread. Sprinkle with seasoning. Add turkey and cheese. Top with peppers and spinach leaves.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Peel and slice apples. Place in a 9-inch pie plate. In a large bowl, combine the sugar, salt, and spices. Add flour and mix well. Cut in butter with a pastry blender or fork until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over the apples. Bake for 45 to 50 minutes or until apples are tender. Cool 20 minutes. Serve with whipped topping if desired.
Mix all together except for almonds. Place in an ungreased pan and bake at 400 for 45 minutes. Sprinkle almonds over the top and return to the oven for 5 minutes until the almonds are toasted.

In a large Dutch oven, melt butter. Add onions and saut for about 5 minutes or until tender and slightly browned. Add garlic and saut for another minute. Add mushrooms and saut until tender. Stir in barley and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 20 minutes or until barley is tender. Stir in pepper and salt and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a bowl combine the apples, granulated sugar, cinnamon, and a drop of Mountain Dew soda. Unroll doughseparate each triangle in half, and place 1 tablespoon of apples in center of each triangle. Fold triangle over to form a crescent shapepinch edges together to seal. Place dumplings 1 inch apart on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped topping.

Preheat oven to 350. Mix pumpkin pie spice and salt. Combine evaporated milk and light brown sugar in medium saucepan and cook over medium heat. Add pumpkin pie spice mixture and Kahlua. Simmer about 5 minutes. Add canned pumpkin and stir until blended. Remove from heat. Cool until warm. Beat eggs in large bowl. Beat in pumpkin mixture. Pour into pie crust. Bake at 350 for 55 minutes. Cool completely. Serve with whipped topping.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Drizzle with oil and season with oregano and 1/2 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Cook until oregano is fragrant and flounder is browned, 4 to 5 minutes per side. Transfer flounder fillets to a plate. Add spaghetti sauce and 1/2 cup water to skilletboil until reduced by half and slightly thickened, about 10 minutes. Top with mozzarella and parsley. Serve with lemon wedges. Serves 4.

Heat olive oil in large pot and add leek. Cook until softened and add cauliflower and stir well to coat. Add chicken stock and nutmeg and bring to a boil. Simmer until cauliflower is tender and pur?e in blender or with food processor in small batches until smooth. Adjust seasoning with salt and pepper. Serve immediately or cool and refrigerate for up to three days.

Cut chicken breasts into bite-size pieces. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Saute the onion and chicken until browned. Stir in the broth and water. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes. Drain the mixture and place in the crockpot. Add the cream of chicken soup and the uncooked egg noodles. Stir well. Cook on low for 4 hours. Stir well. Cook for an additional 1-2 hours or until the egg noodles are tender. Garnish with shredded cheese, if desired. Serve with crackers.
Mix the eggs with the milk, salt, and pepper. Add the bagels and butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes. Top with shredded cheddar. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350f. Spray a 9 inch square pan. Peel and slice the apples and place them in the bottom of the pan. In a bowl combine the remaining ingredients and pour over the apples. Place in the oven and bake for 45 minutes or until the apples are tender and the top is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a small bowl combine relish, oil, salt & pepper. Brush the mixture onto chicken breasts and place in a shallow baking pan (i like to use a glass pyrex pie plate) that has been sprayed with a non-stick cooking spray. Bake for about 30 minutes or until the juices run clear when a knife is inserted near the bone. While chicken is cooking, squeeze the juice of one lemon into the pan and garnish with fresh parsley or cilantro. Serve over rice or pasta with some fresh fruit for dessert. Yum.

In a large skillet over medium heat add the olive oil, onion, garlic, and dried chili pepper flakes. Sauté until the onion is translucent. Add the tomatoes and sauté until the tomatoes begin to break down. Add the balsamic vinegar and sugar and allow the sauce to simmer. Cook for about 5 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat and allow to cool. Place the sauce in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth. Serve over pasta and garnish with fresh basil leaves.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the rice and stir to coat the grains evenly. Stir in the onion, garlic, carrots, peas, corn, salt, pepper, basil, oregano and water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, cover and simmer until rice is tender about 35 minutes. Stir in the parsley or cilantro and serve immediately. Serves 8.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Cook pasta shells according to the directions on the package. Drain the pasta shells, then return to the pot. Add the ground beef, spaghetti sauce, light sour cream, whipping cream, parmesan cheese, and mozzarella cheese. Cook over low heat, stirring occasionally, for 10 minutes or until heated through and the sauce has thickened. Serve hot.

Pre heat the oven to 350 degrees f. Cook and drain the macaroni as directed on the package. Set aside. In a bowl, mix together the macaroni and the cheese, tuna fish and potato chips. Place the mixture in an ungreased 9 x 13-inch baking dish. In a small bowl, combine the breadcrumbs and the milk and mix well. Pour over the macaroni mixture and bake for 20 minutes, or until the mixture is bubbly and golden brown.

Press tofu to remove excess water. Cut tofu in cubes and place in a food processor with vegan mayo and mustard. Pulse until smooth. Chill 1 hour or overnight. Cut celery and onion in cubes and place in a bowl. Add tofu mixture and toss until evenly mixed. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Makes 6 servings.

Heat oil in medium skillet over medium heat. Add crushed pepper flakes and garlic and saute for 1 minute until garlic is lightly golden brown. Add shrimp and salt and cook, stirring frequently until they turn pink, about 3 minutes. Add sherry, parsley, and old bay seasoning and cook until sherry evaporates and shrimp curl slightly, about 2 minutes more. Remove shrimp with slotted spoon to a serving plate. Keep warm while making sauce. Stir cornstarch into cold water until smooth, then stir into pan juices. Cook until mixture comes to a boil and thickens slightly, stirring constantly. Pour sauce over shrimp and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.

Tear the dry white bread into 1-inch chunks. Melt half of the sweet butter in a medium saucepan over medium-low heat. Add half of the golden raisins, nutmeg, and half of the bread chunks to the pan. Cook for 5 minutes. Add the remaining golden raisins and remaining bread chunks. Add the eggs, heavy cream, milk, and vanilla. Increase heat to medium-high. Cook 2 minutes. Reduce heat to medium-low. Cook for 5 minutes. Pour into an 8-inch-square or 9-inch-round pan. Cover with foil. Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes. Increase heat to 400 degrees. Cook for 15 minutes more. Uncover. Cook for 10 minutes more. Serve warm with sugar.

Peel and slice sweet potatoes 1/4-inch thick. Put in large pot of cold water. Bring water to a boil, cook until potatoes are just tender about 20-30 minutes. Drain and set aside. Butter two 15-inches by 10-inches baking pans or jelly-roll pans. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Melt butter over low heat in heavy saucepan. Add potatoes, milk, salt and brown sugarcook over medium heat until mixture boils, stirring occasionally. Add pumpkin pie spiceboil 1 minute. Remove from heatcool 10 minutes. Beat mixture with electric mixer until smooth. Spoon potatoes evenly into baking pans. Bake until potatoes are light brown and edges are set 20-25 minutes. Remove from ovencool 10 minutes. Cut into 1-inch squares and sprinkle with blanched slivered almonds before serving.

Chop the leeks into thin slices, keeping the white parts and discarding the green parts. Heat the olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and carrots to the oil. Saute the garlic carrots for about 5 minutes or until the carrots are just barely tender. Add the leeks and saute for another 5 minutes. Add the water to the saucepan and bring to a boil. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.

Bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the broccoli florets until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain and let cool. In a large bowl, combine the bacon, broccoli florets, pineapple tidbits, onions, raisins and the mayonnaise. In a small bowl, combine the vinegar and sugar and stir until the sugar is dissolved. Stir in the vinegar mixture and add the cheese and toss well. Chill before serving.

Melt white chocolate. Stir in coffee liqueur. Dip sides of wafers into chocolate. Place on wax paper. Refrigerate 15 minutes. Melt dark chocolate. Drizzle over almonds. Press into chocolate to coat. Dip other sides of wafers into dark chocolate. Place on wax paper. Refrigerate 15 minutes. Melt butter. Stir in sugar. Add cinnamon. Combine remaining ingredients. Spoon over chocolate wafers. Refrigerate. Unmold and store in airtight container.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Grease or spray a 12 cup bundt pan. Cut each biscuit into 4 pieces.In a large bowl, combine the sugar, butter and cinnamon. Add biscuits and toss until well coated.Transfer into the prepared pan and bake in the preheated oven until lightly golden brown, about 1 hour. Cool in the pan for about 10 minutes. Turn the bread out onto a wire rack and allow to cool completely before cutting into slices.

Peel kohlrabi and cut into large chunks. Boil in water until tender. Remove from heat and drain. In a small bowl, combine butter with sugar and salt. Mash kohlrabi. Add broth and mashed kohlrabi. Mash until mixture is smooth. Place in a small oven-proof baking dish. In a small bowl, combine flour and parsley. Sprinkle over kohlrabi. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and icing sugar until light and fluffy. Add the flour and cornstarch and stir until well combined. Divide the dough in halfwrap each half in plastic wrap, flattening it into a disc as you work. Refrigerate for 30 minutes before rolling out on a lightly floured surface to a 1/4 inch thickness. Cut with a 2 inch round cutter or a 1 1/2 inch square cutter. Bake for 10-12 minutes, until lightly browned. Let cool on a cooling rack before serving.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees. Bring to boil the apple cider in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. Meanwhile trim the ends off the carrots and then slice lengthwise into quarters. Melt the butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring often, until the carrots are tender. Add the tarragon and the cider. Bring to a boil and cook until the liquid has reduced by half, about 5 minutes. Remove from the heat. Stir in the brown sugar. Place carrots in a shallow baking pan. Bake until the sauce has thickened enough to coat the carrots, about 20 minutes. Serve hot.

Cut broccoli into florets and slice french beans on an angle. Heat olive oil in a saute pan over medium heat. Add broccoli and french beans and saute for about 4 minutes or until broccoli is tender and french beans are crisp tender. Remove from heat and stir in cashews and almonds. Add sea salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately.

In a bowl combine egg yolks and condensed milk. Stir until smooth and creamy. Cook over medium heat until thick and coats the back of a spoon about 6 to 10 minutes. Stir continuously with a whisk during cooking process. Remove from heat and add in the vanilla and heavy cream. Stir to combine. Pour into a plastic container and refrigerate until ready to serve. Top with chocolate sandwich cookies and serve immediately.

In large mixing bowl combine butter, 2 cups of sugar and cocoa. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in vanilla and salt. Pour into greased 9" pie plate. Bake at 350 for 50 minutes. Let cool completely before refrigerating 1-2 hours. When ready to serve, spread with whipped cream and top with nuts and chocolate curls.

In large bowl, whisk together coconut milk, orange juice, orange zest, fish sauce, chili sauce, garlic, ginger, mint, and cilantro stems until smooth. Arrange salmon fillets in baking dish. Pour sauce over salmon and sprinkle with pepper to taste. Cover with foil and bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes. Uncover and continue baking until salmon is flaky and easily pierced with fork 5-10 minutes longer. Serve with steamed rice.

Combine all the ingredients in a small saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook, stirring constantly until the butter is melted. Continue cooking until the mixture reaches 236 to 238 degrees F (113 to 114 degrees C) on a sugar thermometer. Serve over ice cream.

Preheat oven to 350. Spray 13x9 inch pan with cooking spray. In medium bowl, break up bread. Add milk, salt and pepper. Beat with fork until well combined. Press into pan. Bake for 10 minutes. In another bowl, beat together eggs and sausage. Pour over bread. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting into squares.
Remove the seeds and stems from jalapeno peppers. Stuff each one with a slice of cream cheese. Wrap each one in a strip of bacon. Secure the bacon with a toothpick. Bake at 350 until bacon is cooked.

In a small bowl combine the flour and baking powder. In another bowl combine the sugar, salt and egg. Mix together the sugar/egg mixture and the dry ingredients until just combined, then add the orange juice and water and mix well until smooth and blended. Heat the oil in a large frying pan or griddle over medium-high heat. Drop the batter by heaping tablespoons onto the hot oil and cook until bubbles appear on top of the pancakes and the edges begin to brown, 2-3 minutes per side. Serve immediately or place the cooked pancakes in the oven at 200 degrees while you finish cooking the rest of the pancakes. Serve the pancakes hot.

Heat a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat. Add mushrooms and cook until mushrooms are lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Add wine and stir until most of the liquid has evaporated, about 3 minutes. Add butter and garlic and cook until mushrooms are soft and liquid is reduced to a glaze, about 3 minutes. Serve hot.

Beat egg yolks and milk in a small bowl until well blended. Beat egg whites in a large bowl until stiff peaks form. Gently fold egg yolk mixture into beaten egg whites. Pour egg mixture into a large skillet coated with cooking spray over medium heatsprinkle with salt & pepper. Cook without stirring until large curds form, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in butter & half of the cheddar cheesecook until butter is melted & cheese is thoroughly mixed into egg mixture. Turn egg mixture into a 1-1/2-quart casserole dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining cheddar cheesebake at 375° for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted & top is golden brown. Cut into 4 wedgesserve with bread.
First, brown hotdogs. In a bowl combine egg and milk and add bread crumbs. Roll hot dogs in egg and bread crumb mix. Melt butter and add cheese. Fry hot dog in butter until crumbs are brown.

Roll out one of your pie crusts on a lightly floured surface into a 10 inch circle. Transfer to a 9 inch pie pan. Flute the edges. Place in refrigerator to chill for 30 minutes. Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Sprinkle the bottom crust with 1/2 cup of the sugar. Combine the flour, zest and 1 tablespoon of the sugar in a small bowl. Cut the rhubarb into 1/2 inch pieces. In a large bowl, combine rhubarb, raspberries and red currant jelly with the flour mixture. Spoon the rhubarb mixture into the crust. Dot with the butter. Roll out the remaining pie crust on a lightly floured surface into a 10 inch circle. Cut the circle into 1/2 inch strips. Place 10 strips in a lattice pattern on top of the rhubarb mixture. Fold the strips over the side of the pie to form a decorative border. Brush the lattice strips with the
Place all in a large bowl. Add boiling water to cover. Let stand 5 minutes. Strain through a colander. Pour into mugs. Serve warm. Garnish with a sage leaf.

Preheat broiler. Combine first 4 ingredients in a large bowl. Add cheese. Toss to coat. Divide mixture among 4 broiler-safe glass or ceramic baking dishes. Broil 3 minutes or until browned. Serve warm.

In a skillet over medium-high heat, saute potatoes and onion in butter until tender. Add garlic and cook until tender, 1 to 2 minutes. Add creole seasoning and stir. Add beans and cook 5 minutes. Serve.
Combine the coriander seeds, cumin seeds, caraway seeds, hot red pepper flakes and coarse salt in a small bowl. Mix thoroughly.

Heat the oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the onion and saute for 3 minutes or until soft. Add the curry powder and cook for 30 seconds. Add the tomatoes, beans and water. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes or until the beans are tender. If desired, add the oxtail soup mix. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 12 cup muffin pan with baking spray and set aside. Combine quinoa, baking powder and baking soda in a bowl. In a separate bowl combine the quinoa, bananas, eggs, honey and vanilla. Add the wet to the dry and mix until just combined. Fill the muffin cups 2/3 of the way full. Bake 20-25 minutes. Let cool in pan 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely. Store in an airtight container. Makes 12 muffins.

Cream sugar and eggs and add vanilla. Mix. Add flour salt and baking powder. Stir well. Roll out the dough. Cut out circles. Fill with raspberry preserves. Fold over like a crescent moon. Bake in 375 oven until golden brown.

Combine crushed vanilla wafers and powdered sugar in large bowl. Melt butter and add to wafers and powdered sugar mixture, then stir in nuts. Add frozen orange juice and stir well until blended. Shape into balls and roll in coconut. Refrigerate until firm and serve.

Place fish in a large pot of water, cover and bring to a boil. Cook for about 20 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Remove fish from water and let cool a few minutes, then flake fish into the pot of water, reserving a little of the cooking liquid. Add potatoes, carrots and corn niblets. Add more water if needed. Bring back to a boil. Stir in the pork. Lower heat and simmer for about 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Add milk and bring just to a boil, stirring constantly. Add the fish, stirring gently but thoroughly, until fish is heated through. Salt to taste. Serve with a sprinkling of parsley, if desired.

Beat egg yolks and sugar in a large bowl until thick. Set aside. In a heavy bottomed saucepan, heat heavy cream until it comes to a boil. Remove from heat, add egg yolk mixture and stir well. Return to heat and cook over low heat until thick enough to coat a spoon. Stir in Kahlua and Grand Marnier. Remove from heat and strain into a bowl. Chill in refrigerator until well chilled. Pour into individual glasses or one large bowl. Top with whipped cream and chocolate chips.

Place coconut flakes in small food processor and pulse until fine. Melt butter in medium skillet over medium heat until bubbling. Add coconut flakes and stir until coated with butter. Sprinkle with nuts. Place bread in same skillet over medium heat until browned on both sides. Turn bread over and sprinkle with macadamia nuts. Combine eggs, milk and coconut flakes in a shallow dishdip each slice of bread into mixture and place in skillet. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Top with whipped cream if desired. Serve with maple syrup.

Heat butter in heavy large pot over medium heat. Add noodlescook until just tender, stirring occasionally. Drain noodlestransfer to serving bowlkeep warm. Melt pot cheese over medium-high heatstir until cheese is melted and smooth. Stir in sour creamkeep warm. Serve noodles with pot cheese mixturegarnish with chives if desired. Serves 4

Brown bacon in large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add flour and seasonings. Slowly pour in the tomatoes, add sugar. Bring to boil and simmer 1 hour. Remove bay leaf. Serve over biscuits.

In a shallow bowl combine buttermilk and breadcrumbs. Stir in mustard powder, salt, and pepper. Place 1 tablespoon of butter in small saucepan. Heat over medium until melted. Add almonds and saute until golden. Place trout fillets in buttermilk mixture. Turn to coat both sides. Place fillets into melted butter. Top each fillet with about 1 tablespoon of almonds. Bake about 15 minutes.

In a small saucepan heat milk over medium heat until almost boiling. Remove from heat add sugar cinnamon and nutmeg and whisk until dissolved. Let cool to room temperature then add spiced rum and mix well.

In a medium bowl combine the broccoli with the red pepper. Mix together the onion powder, thyme and pepper. Add the broccoli and red pepper mixture and stir. Add the cheese. In a small bowl combine the butter with the flour and stir until smooth. Add the egg and stir until well mixed. Add the cheese mixture and stir until smooth. Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray and place the wonton skins on the sheet. Brush each wonton skin with the butter mixture and top each with a small spoonful of the cheese mixture. Bake in a 350 preheated oven until golden brown. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine the oil and onion. Cook and stir until the onion is soft and translucent. Stir in the butter and flour and cook until browned. Stir in the milk and broth, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for a few minutes. Stir in the hash browns and mix well. Place in a 9x13 baking pan. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes.

Cut russet potatoes into 1/2" cubes. In a large skillet melt olive oil over medium heat. Add onions, potatoes, salt and pepper. Stir occasionally and cook about 30 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Cook more to make them crispy

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drain wellset aside. In large bowl, combine macaroni, tomatoes and 1/2 cup butter. Mix well. Spoon into 2-quart casserole dish coated with cooking spraysprinkle with 2 cups cheese. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until bubblysprinkle with remaining cheese. Melt remaining butter in microwavedrizzle over top. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve hot. Makes 6 servings (serving size: about 1/3 of recipe).

Combine stir fry sauce, soy sauce, and honey in a bowl. Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add broccoli florets, mushrooms and carrot. Cook for 1 minute. Add onions. Stir in sauce mixture. Cook until vegetables are tender crisp. Stir in peanuts. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Place fish in 12x8 baking dish. Sprinkle fish with lemon juice, sea salt and pepper. Drizzle with olive oil. Roast until fish flakes easily with fork 10-12 minutes. Combine lemon juice and capers in small bowl and pour over fish. Serve immediately. Serves 2

Cook pasta according to directions on box. Add 1 can of cream of mushroom soup and 2/3 cup velveeta cheese to pasta water while pasta is cooking. Drain pasta and add pasta to soup mixture in large bowl. Stir in 1 can of tuna fish (drained) and 1/2 cup mayonnaise. Pour into a casserole dish and top with 2/3 cup grated parmesan cheese and 1/2 cup grated velveeta cheese. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes.

Heat olive oil in medium-size pot over medium-low heat. Add garlic and saute until golden. Add spinach and saute for 2-3 minutes. Add beans and broth. Bring to boil. Add pasta. Cook until pasta is tender but not quite al dente. Stir in parmesan cheese. Serve hot.

Prepare pie shell according to package directions. Bake 10 minutes or until lightly browned. Set aside to cool. Sprinkle cheddar cheese over bottom of cooled shell to cover completely. Bake 10 minutes more. Remove from oven and add mushrooms, asparagus spears, cooked bacon, onion, garlic, italian seasoning, milk, eggs and salt and pepper to taste. Bake 20 minutes or until set in middle. Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

In a small bowl combine 1/4 cup molasses, red wine vinegar, ketchup and worcestershire sauce. In a large bowl combine sea salt, black pepper and remaining molasses. Place turkey legs in bowl and toss. Add coconut oil and toss to coat. Place turkey on a baking sheet and bake for about 1 hour or until golden brown and cooked through. Remove from heat and toss in red onion mixture.
Toss together the mixed salad green with the radishes, strawberries, spring onions, red pepper and coriander. Mix the vinaigrette in a small bowl, then pour over the salad. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Line bottom of 9-inch round pan with parchment paper. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, egg whites, Sprite, and gelatin until well mixed. Pour into pan. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown and set in center. Cool completely. Frost with cool whip. Sprinkle with coconut. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place chicken breast between 2 sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a rolling pin to 1/4-inch thickness. Place on a large plate. In a medium bowl combine breadcrumbs and ranch dressing mix. In a small bowl mix together sour cream and chicken broth. Dip the chicken breast in the mixture then coat with the bread crumbs. Place on a baking sheet and bake 15 minutes. Turn and bake an additional 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Season egg whites with garlic powder and fresh parsley. Add eggs and cook until set but not dry. Add ranch salad dressing and mustard and blend in well. Cook for another minute or so until heated through. Top with part-skim mozzarella cheese.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease a 9x13x2-inch baking pan. Combine carrots and ginger in a small saucepan and cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15-20 minutes until carrots are tender. Drain carrots and ginger and reserve ginger. Puree carrots in a blender. Beat together eggs and honey. Add carrot puree and beat until smooth. Stir in lemon zest and ginger. In a small bowl, stir together breadcrumbs and hazelnuts. Add to carrot mixture and stir until combined. Pour into prepared baking pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until light golden brown. Cool. In a bowl, beat together cream cheese and powdered sugar until smooth. Spread over cooled cake and refrigerate for 2 hours before cutting. Yields about 8 servings.

Place all the ingredients except for the lime juice in a food processor or blender and blend until smooth. Add lime juice and process briefly until smooth. Season to taste with more salt or pepper. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut chicken breasts into strips. Heat oil in wok over high heat. Add chicken strips in a single layer. Cook until no longer pink in the center. Remove chicken strips with a slotted spoon. Add onion to wok and saute until onion begins to brown. Add orange juice, rice, ginger, herbs. Stir to combine. Cook until rice is heated through. Return chicken strips to wok. Stir until well combined. Remove from heat. Serve garnished with parsley.

Dredge pork chops with flour and season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in saute pan over medium heat and add chops. Brown on both sides and cook until desired doneness. Add wine and deglaze pan with a spoon or fork. Add honey and mustard and bring to a boil. Simmer until sauce thickens and coats the chops.

Season tilapia filets with salt and pepper. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Saute fish for 2 minutes per side or until done. Pour honey-mustard mixture over fish and bake at 450 for 5 minutes. Sprinkle with pecans, parsley and parmesan.

Combine the juice and the peel in a blender. Add the garlic and ginger. Cover and process until smooth. In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, warm the oil. Dip the tilapia in the flour, then into the orange mixture. Fry 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove the tilapia to a plate and keep warm. Pour off most of the oil in the pan. Add the green onion and cook until just tender. Stir in the juice mixture and bring to a boil. Simmer 2 to 3 minutes. Divide the tilapia among four plates and pour the sauce over.

Mix the condensed milk and espresso powder in a small saucepan over medium-low heat until smooth. Let cool slightly. Pour milk mixture into a large bowl and stir in yogurt. Stir in the heavy cream until smooth. Cover the mixture with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight. Freeze in your ice cream maker according to the manufacturers instructions. Once frozen, mix in the cinnamon. Scoop into a container and place back in freezer until serving time. 1 hour before serving, remove from freezer to soften slightly. Serve with fresh figs, if desired.
Mix all the ingredients together. Put in the refrigerator for 30 minutes.
Dissolve gelatin in boiling water in a small bowl. Cool. Add the cool whip and combine well. Chill for several hours or overnight.

Melt butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add franks. Cook until heated through. Add onions. Cook 2-3 minutes or until crisp tender. Stir in basil. Combine soup and milk until blended. Add to skillet and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer 1 minute. Stir in noodles. Cook 2 minutes or until noodles are heated through. Stir in tomato. Cook 1 minute or until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.
Combine mayonnaise, cream cheese, salsa, mustard & bacon until smooth. Spread on bottom half of tortillas. Top with tomatoes & lettuce. Roll & slice.
Cook pasta as directed on package. Drain pasta. Toss pasta with cooked beans, sausage and sauce. Sprinkle with cheese.

In a large bowl combine the lemon juice, mustard and olive oil. Add kosher salt and pepper to taste. Toss asparagus with the dressing and transfer to a serving plate. Garnish with shallots and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine garlic cloves, rosemary, lemon juice and zest, olive oil, wine, and McCormick Grill Seasoning together in a bowlset aside. Rub both sides of each chicken breast with mixture. Bake for 10 minutesremove from oven. Flip chicken breasts overbake for 10 minutes longer, or until cooked through.

Wash and clean beans and sprouts and cut into small pieces. Cook in boiling water about a minute and a half. In a skillet melt butter over medium heat and add garlic. When garlic starts to brown add beans and sprouts and saute until all the liquid is gone. Add salt and pepper and balsamic vinegar and stir.

Combine breadcrumbs, parmesan cheese and paprika in a small bowl. Combine the thyme, salt and peppers in another small bowl. Lightly beat the buttermilk in another small bowl. Place the flour in a third small bowl. Dip the chicken breasts into the flour and shake off the excess. Dip into the buttermilk and then into the crumb mixture to coat well. Place the breasts in the refrigerator and let stand for 1 hour. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Coat two baking sheets with cooking spray. Heat the margarine in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the chicken breasts and cook for about 4 minutes per side. Transfer the breasts to the prepared baking sheets and bake for 15 minutes. Turn the breasts and bake for another 15 minutes. Remove from the oven and serve immediately.

In a large saucepan saute shallots and mushrooms. Add butter and cook until lightly brown. Add wine and cook until mixture thickens. Add artichoke hearts, pimiento and lemon juice. Stir until heated through. Add shrimp. Stir until heated through. Top with parsley. Serve over rice or noodles.

In a small bowl combine water and yeast. Let stand for 5 minutes or until foamy. Add sugar, egg and 1 tablespoon milk. Mix well. Combine 4 cups flour and salt. Stir into yeast mixture. Add butter and remaining milk. Beat on low for 30 seconds, scraping bowl occasionally. Beat on medium for 2 minutes. By hand or with dough hook beat for 5 minutes. Stir in enough remaining flour to make dough easy to handle. Knead on lightly floured surface until smooth and elastic about 8 minutes. Place dough in a lightly greased bowl. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled about 1 hour. Punch down. Divide into 12 equal pieces. On a lightly floured surface roll each piece into a 6-inch circle. Place 1 inch apart on greased baking sheets. Cover and let rise until doubled about 45 minutes. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes or until golden brown. Brush with butter. Makes 12 rolls.
Mix all ingredients together. Refrigerate for a few hours before serving. Can be served in a salad, in a lettuce wrap or as a sandwich.
Mix all ingredients in a saucepan and simmer 5 minutes. Pour over pulled pork and cook for 1-2 hours.

Preheat oven to 375. In a large bowl mix flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Stir milk and egg until well blended. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened. Fold in plums and almond extract. Spoon batter into 12 muffin cups coated with cooking spray. Bake until a wooden pick inserted into center comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool muffins in pan on a wire rack 5 minutes. Remove muffins from pan and place top side up on rack. Cool completely before serving. Makes 12 muffins.
Wash and dry kale. Cook potatoes in salted water until soft. Drain potatoes and mash with butter. Add kale and broth. Add salt and garlic powder to taste. Heat until warm. Top with Parmesan.

Mix together beef, sausage, onions and garlic in skillet. Add green pepper and cook until tender. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Add beans and broth. Heat through. Season with salt and pepper. Add basil and serve over hot cooked rice.

Place chicken breasts in a 400 deg. F. oven. Cook for 15 minutes. Remove chicken and allow to cool. Cut in 1/2 inch thick slices. Toss green beans and asparagus together and cut into small pieces. Place in a bowl. Toss together pine nuts and basil. Add to bowl and toss. Add chicken and tomatoes and toss. Drizzle with olive oil and vinegar. Toss and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease 6 ramekins. Crack one egg in each ramekin. Pour enough milk in each ramekin so that the egg is covered. Sprinkle with ham. Sprinkle with cheese. Sprinkle with Ortega chiles. Sprinkle with chives. Bake for 10 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Bring grits to a boil, stirring occasionally. Reduce heat to low and cover. Cook grits for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. While grits are cooking, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from pan and drain on paper towels. Pour off all but 2 tablespoons bacon fat. Add onion and tomatoes. Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 5 minutes. Add bacon and stir until combined. Stir bacon mixture into grits and cook 5 more minutes, stirring often. Salt to taste. Serves 2.

Combine all ingredients in a small saucepan and bring to a boil over medium heat. Simmer for 2 minutes or until thickened. Store in a sealed container in the refrigerator for up to one week. Use as a dipping sauce or spoon over cooked vegetables and meats.

Preheat oven to 220 C/gas 7 and line a 20cm loose-bottomed tart tin with shortcrust pastry. Mix the dried fruit, sugar and walnuts together in a large bowl and spread over the base of the tart case. Beat the egg and lemon juice together in a jug and brush over the fruit. Bake for 30 minutes until the pastry is golden brown and the filling is set. Remove from the oven and sprinkle over the glace cherries and icing sugar, then return to the oven for a further 3 minutes until the cherries have plumped up and the icing sugar has melted. Cool slightly in the tin before serving warm or cold.

Peel potato slices to 1/4-inch thickness using a vegetable peeler. Dip into flourshake off excess. Dip into egg, turning to coat both sides. Dip into breadcrumbs to coat both sides. Place breaded potato slices in single layer on baking sheet sprayed with cooking sprayspray potato slices lightly with cooking spray. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until golden brown and potatoes are tender when pierced with fork. Serve immediately.

Brown ground beef, add onion, taco seasoning mix and water. Cook until beef is done. Drain and put back in pot. Add tomato paste and stir until blended. Simmer until hot. Serve over taco chips and top with cheese.

Heat 2 tablespoons vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the flour and stir constantly until bubbly. Add the water slowly while stirring. Add the tomatoes and other seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until thickened. Add more water if desired. Serve over chicken or pork.

Wash and trim rhubarb stalks. Cut into small pieces. Combine with water in large saucepan and simmer until rhubarb is tender, about 15 minutes. Stir in sugar and cook until syrup has thickened and rhubarb is glazed. Cool completely, about 1 hour. Stir in gelatin mixture until dissolved. Divide between serving dishes. Chill until ready to serve. To serve, pour 1/4 cup milk over each serving of rhubarb mixture. Serve cold.

Cook macaroni as directed on package. Drain and add butter and eggs. Mix well. In 9 x 13 baking dish, layer 1/2 of the macaroni mixture. In a saucepan, bring milk to boil. Add soup, and stir well. Add milk and soup mixture to macaroni. Stir well. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with remaining macaroni. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Sprinkle with paprika.
Combine all ingredients in a bowl. Chill at least 2 hours. Makes 4 servings.

In large skillet cook chicken in oil until browned on both sides. Stir in water, milk, mustard and soup mix. Cook until heated through. Stir in broccoli and rice. Cook until heated through. Sprinkle cheddar cheese on top. Bake uncovered in 350f oven for 15 minutes. Sprinkle with roasted red peppers. Serve over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees fahrenheit. In small bowl combine shallot, cherry tomatoes, black olives, capers, oregano and salt & pepper to taste. Gently mix with hands to break up olives & tomatoes. Toss with just enough balsamic vinegar to moisten - do not over do it. Pat fish dry with paper towel. Drizzle both sides of fish with olive oil and season with salt & pepper. Place on cookie sheet skin side down. Bake 12 - 15 minutes or until fish is opaque & flakes easily with fork. Serve with tapenade on top.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Season chicken breasts with yogurt, mustard, garlic and ginger. Dip in flour. Brown chicken on both sides. Bake uncovered about 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Increase oven to 450 degrees. Combine sour cream and mustard. Drizzle over chicken and bake an additional 5 minutes.

In a large Dutch oven over medium-high heat, warm 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and add the onion and thyme. Saute the onion and thyme until the onions are soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the sweet potatoes and saute the potatoes for 5 minutes. Add the remaining 3 tablespoons of olive oil and the butter and saute for 1 minute longer. Season with salt and fresh pepper to taste and add the sour cream and mix to coat well. Serve immediately.

Combine cream cheese and mayonnaise in a small bowl. Stir in green onion, horseradish, red pepper sauce, Worcestershire sauce, tuna and paprika. Stir until well blended. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with crackers or celery sticks. Makes approximately 1 cup.
Mix all together. Bake in a 9x13 dish at 350 for 45 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream.

Toast the English muffins. Split the top of each. Place bacon and cheese on bottom half and close. Poach 1 egg in boiling water for 2 minutes. Top each half of English muffin with egg. Mix together milk and eggs. Stir in black pepper and cayenne pepper. Cook over low heat until thickened. Spoon hollandaise over eggs.

Heat oil and butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add sage leaves and garlic. Cook until fragrant and sage is crisp. Add chicken breast halves and cook for 5 minutes per side. Add potato and chicken broth. Cover and cook until chicken is cooked through and potato is tender, about 20 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat and stir in parsley. Serve over pasta or rice.

Boil potatoes till tenderdrainmash potatoes and add melted butterflour, milk, salt and peppermix well. In a saucepan heat chicken bouillon granules in water till bouillon cubes are dissolved. Add paprikapour over potatoes in shallow baking dishsprinkle Velveeta cheese over potatoes and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees.

Melt butter in heavy sauce pan. Add flour and cook until light brown. Gradually add broth and water and bring to a boil. Stir in onions and string beans. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until string beans are tender. Stir in sour cream. Sprinkle with cheese. Top with corn flake crumbs. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20 minutes.

Dip each slice of bread into the milk, egg, butter mixture, then place on the skillet. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side. Spread with hot pepper jelly, then layer with ham, turkey and cheese. Cook another 2-3 minutes on each side or until golden brown. Serve with hot sauce on the side.

Heat chicken breasts until completely cooked through. Cool and dice into small cubes. In a large bowl, mix together celery, red bell peppers, and diced chicken breasts. Add the dried dill weed and mix until evenly blended. In another bowl, combine the ranch dressing mix and mayonnaise. Add the mixture to the chicken mixture and stir until well blended. Refrigerate at least an hour before serving. Serve on a bed of lettuce or with crackers.

Clean mushrooms. Soak mushroom caps in water for about 30 minutes. Drain caps. In skillet cook sausage until done. Remove sausage from skillet. Cut sausage into small pieces. Combine sausage, scallion, egg and breadcrumbs. Set aside. Combine soy sauce with water. Set aside. Remove mushroom stems. Mix mushrooms with soy sauce mixture. Stuff mushroom caps with sausage mixture. Arrange on baking sheet. Bake at 350f for 25 to 30 minutes or until done. Serve hot.
Boil sugar, water, creamy peanut butter and vanilla to thick syrup. Pour over ice cream. Top with chocolate sauce or grated chocolate. Garnish with toasted nuts.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 13x9-inch baking dish. Mix together the mashed sweet potatoes, sugar, eggs, milk and vanilla. Stir in the butter and coconut. Spread into the prepared baking dish. In a medium bowl, stir together the flour and brown sugar. Cut in the butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the nuts. Sprinkle over the top of the potatoes. Bake for 30 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool before serving.

In a large bowl, mix the dry fruit and nuts and set aside. In a small saucepan, combine the milk, honey and vanilla extractheat over medium heat until hot but not boiling, stirring frequently. Pour milk mixture over the dry fruit mixturetoss well and cover. Let stand for 1 hour or refrigerate for up to 24 hours before serving. To serve, place in a serving bowl and top with heavy cream and sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Serves 4.

In a saucepan, bring the milk to a simmer. Add pastina. Cook until pastina is tender. Meanwhile beat eggs in a bowl with a wire whisk. When pastina is tender, add eggs. Cook until the eggs are just set, about 2 minutes. Remove from heat. Add parmesan cheese and pepper. Stir until the cheese melts. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 350f. Toss sweet potato cubes with oil and season with pepper. Bake for 45 minutes or until tender. Cut steak into thin strips and marinate with ginger and olive oil in a bowl. Heat a skillet over high heat. Add steak strips and stir fry for 2-3 minutes. Add sweet chili sauce and lemon juice and stir fry for a few more seconds. Serve with baked sweet potatoes.

To make the spread, combine the cream cheese and butter in a small bowl. Mix well. Add the onion flakes and mix well. Cover and refrigerate until serving time. To assemble the sandwiches, spread the inside of the rolls with the chive and onion cream cheese spread. Top each roll with a slice of ham and a slice of cheese. Broil until the cheese is melted and golden brown. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Cut biscuits in half and place in ungreased 9-in. pie plate. Bake 12-14 minutes or until lightly browned. Meanwhile, in skillet, cook peppers and onions in butter until tenderstir in olives, sliced mushrooms, pasta sauce and remaining ingredients except cheese. Pour over biscuitssprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes more or until heated through.

Cut the tops off the peppers. Remove the seeds and membrane. In a large skillet brown the ground round with the onions. Drain. Add the tomato sauce and cook 5 minutes. Stir in the garlic salt. Add the cooked rice to the meat mixture and heat through. Spoon into the peppers and top with a little shredded cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Makes 6 servings.

Drain cocoa into a small bowl. Add remaining dry cake mix ingredients and stir well. Make 3/4 cup coffee. Beat cake mix and coffee together until well blended. Beat in eggs. Stir in vegetable oil and liqueur. Pour into a greased and floured 10 cup bundt pan. Bake at 350 for 55-65 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes in pan on a wire rack. Invert onto a serving plate and cool completely. Drizzle with liqueur and frost with chocolate frosting. To make frosting, beat together powdered sugar and pudding mix until smooth. Add 1/3 cup coffee and vanilla extract. Beat until smooth. Frost and drizzle with remaining coffee. Sprinkle with chocolate curls or chocolate chips.

In a dutch oven heat bacon drippings. Add onion and garlic and cook until onions are transparent. Add beans, water, ham hock, bay leaf, and ham bone. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 hours. Add seasoning. Serve with cornbread.

Wash avocados thoroughly then peel, remove pit and dice into small pieces. In a large mixing bowl, combine diced avocado, tomatillos, onion, roma tomatoes and lime juice. Mash with fork or masher. Add red pepper flakes and hot pepper sauce. Season with salt and black pepper. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a bowl mix together the flour, baking soda and salt. In another bowl mix together the nutmeg and bananas. In a third bowl mix together the butter, eggs and sugar. Add the banana mixture to the egg mixture and mix together. Add the flour mixture to the banana mixture and mix together. Spread the batter in an ungreased 10 x 15 inch baking pan. Bake in a 350 degree f oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Sprinkle with the chocolate chips and bake for an additional 2 to 3 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.

In large bowl combine crescent rolls, miracle whip, lemon juice and pepper. Gently fold in crabmeat. Divide into 24 equal portions. Form each portion into a 2-inch square. Top each square with a pinch of green onion and a sprinkle of parsley. Bake at 375 degrees for 12-15 minutes until golden brown. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 400f. Combine the panko crumbs, parmesan cheese, melted butter and seasonings. Dip the flounder fillets in melted butter then roll them in the bread crumb mixture. Place on parchment paper lined baking sheet. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes, until the tops of the fillets are lightly golden brown. Serve immediately.
In a saucepan, mix together brown sugar and flour. Add eggs and beat until smooth. Add milk and vanilla. Cook and stir over medium heat until thickened. Cool in refrigerator.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the garlic, crushed red pepper, and parsley. Cook, stirring frequently until garlic is lightly browned. Remove from heat. Add pasta to sauce. Toss to combine. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Coat a shallow baking dish with the oil. Season the breasts with salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine the rosemary, marmalade and vinegar. Rub the mixture over the breasts. Place the breasts in the prepared baking dish. Roast for 30 minutes. Reduce the heat to 350 degrees. Baste the breasts with the marmalade mixture. Continue to roast for about 20 minutes or until cooked through. Remove from the oven and let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Wash the potatoes. In a large pot boil the potatoes until tender but not mushy. Drain the potatoes. Add the butter. Stir until melted. Add the watercress, peas and corn. Season with salt and pepper. Serve warm.

Prepare simple potatoes traditional mashed potatoes with fat-free chicken broth according to package directions. Add garlic powder and pepper jack cheese during last minute of cooking. Drain spinach and stir into mashed potatoes.

Preheat oven to 350. Combine mix, mayonnaise, eggs and sugar until well blended. Spray or grease an 8x8 pan. Spread half of mixture evenly in pan. Bake 10 minutes. Spread remaining mixture evenly over first. Bake until light brown, about 15 minutes. Serve warm with butter.

In a large pot saute the olive oil, onion and carrot until onion is transluscent. Add the garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Add the dried split peas and cook for about 1 minute. Add 6 cups water. Stir in the dried marjoram and seasonings. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for about 1 hour. Add the turkey ham and cook for another 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Form 4 patties of the ground beef seasoned with salt and pepper. Lightly brush both sides of the buns with melted butter. Place a patty on each bun bottom, then top with a slice of mozzarella cheese. Place bun tops on each patty. Grill burgers over medium heat to desired doneness, about 6 to 8 minutes per side. Remove burgers from heat and place on a plate. Place french fries in a bowl. Toss with the chicken gravy. Divide french fries between each of 2 plates. Place burger on top of each serving of french fries. Serve immediately.

In a slow cooker, combine the water with the sugar, lemon juice, ginger and cloves. Toss in the peaches. Cover and cook for about 6 hours or overnight. Use the back of a large wooden spoon to smash the peaches as much as possible while still leaving some whole. Pour into jars and store in the refrigerator.

Sift together cake flour, 1/2 cup sugar and baking soda. Beat together the remaining 1 cup sugar and Crisco with an electric mixer until light. Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in milk and vanilla. Beat the flour mixture into the Crisco mixture at low speed just until combined. Pour batter into a greased 9 inch springform pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Remove sides of springform pan. Cool thoroughly. Makes 16 servings.

Cut the spinach leaves and arrange on serving plate. Add strawberries and kiwi. Sprinkle on slivered almonds and feta cheese. Place red onion rings on top. Place grilled chicken breast on top of salad. Dust with poppy seeds.

Dry each tenderloin on both sides with paper towel. Rub each tenderloin on all sides with the brown sugar mixture. Place tenderloins in a ziploc bag and refrigerate for 24 hours. Heat oil in a heavy skillet over medium high heat. Remove the tenderloins from the bag and place in the hot skillet. Cook for 20 minutes per side, turning the tenderloin only once. Serve and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 350. In 10-inch skillet, brown brats in oil over medium heat until browned and no longer pink in center. Add bell peppers and onions. Cook and stir until vegetables are crisp-tender. Spread brats and vegetables in shallow baking dish. Mix next 5 ingredients. Spread over brats and vegetables. Bake uncovered for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with parsley.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions. Cook for 4 minutes. Add chicken breasts. Cook for about 8 minutes on each side or until done. Remove from skillet and slice into small pieces. Set aside. In skillet over medium heat, saute carrots and cauliflower for about 5-6 minutes or until tender-crisp. Stir in broth and dried herbs and bring to boil. Cook for about 5 minutes or until reduced by half. Add pasta and chickencook for about 8 minutes or until pasta is tender. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese before serving.

Heat oil in a small pan and add cumin seeds. When it crackles add garlic and onions and saute till they are golden and then add lentils and stir and continue cooking for 5-8 minutes. Add 2 cups water and cook until lentils are soft and mushy. Salt and pepper to taste and serve hot with cayenne sprinkled on top. Serves 3.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Cool slightly. In a medium bowl, combine ham and macaroni. Stir in celery and onion. In another bowl combine mayonnaise, lime juice, honey, and cilantro. Add to macaroni mixture. Toss gently. Fold in honeydew. Transfer to a serving bowl. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving. Garnish with cilantro. Serve with lettuce leaves.

In a small bowl, combine mustard and breadcrumbs. Season with pepper. In a large skillet over medium heat, add oil and cook ham for 3 minutes. Add spinach and cook until wilted, about 2 minutes. Remove ham and spinach mixture and set aside. Arrange the chicken over the ham and spinach mixture. Top with cheese. Roll up and wrap each breast with a slice of ham. Place rollatini into an aluminum foil lined pan. Bake at 375 for 35 minutes. Uncover and bake for an additional 5 minutes.

Season the chicken with salt and pepper. Dip it in flour and shake off the excess. Heat the olive oil in a skillet and saute the chicken until browned on both sides. Add the thyme and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the sherry and the olives and boil until the liquid is reduced by half. Serve the chicken hot with the sherry sauce.

Cook gnocchi according to package directions. Drain and place in large bowl. Add garlic and basil and toss to combine. In a large skillet cook prosciutto over medium high heat until crisp, about 3 minutesdrain and set aside. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heatadd fontina and parmesan cheese and cook until cheese is lightly browned and melted, about 2 minutes. Add pasta and toss until heated through. Remove from heat and stir in prosciutto and parsleyseason with salt and pepper to taste. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

In a medium size bowl, combine margarine, sugar and cinnamon. Mix well and spread in 9x13 inch baking dish. Arrange pork chops over top and bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until a thermometer inserted in thickest part registers 160 degrees F. Serve hot over rice or noodles, if desired. Serves 4-6.

Heat oil in wok or skillet over medium-high heat until hot but not smoking. Add garlicstir-fry for 10 seconds or until fragrant. Stir in rice and snow peas. Cook and stir until heated through. Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve immediately.

Combine sugar, water and cocoa in a small saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and cook 3 minutes, stirring constantly. Remove from heat and add milk, butter, flour and vanilla. Return to heat and stir until thickened and smooth. Serve hot over hot biscuits or toast. Serve at once. Makes 2 cups.

In a small saucepan bring water and sugar to a boil over medium heat. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla extract and ground cinnamon. Refrigerate until cool and granita consistency forms, about 2 hours. Place granita in a blender and pulse until smooth. Pour granita into a bowl and garnish with slivered almonds and mint sprig. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat 12 x 8-inch baking pan with cooking spray. In medium bowl combine cornmeal, baking powder, salt, baking soda, eggs, and creamed corn. In another bowl combine canola oil and yogurt. Add to cornmeal mixturestir just until combined. Pour into prepared pan. Bake 25-30 minutes. Cool 10 minutes before cutting into squares.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease and flour a 9-by 5-inch loaf pan. Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add egg whites and beat until smooth and well blended. Stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda and cinnamon. Mix into creamed mixture until just combined. Fold in applesauce and bananas. Spoon mixture into prepared pan and bake for 1 hour and 10 minutes or until toothpick inserted into center of loaf comes out clean. Cool 10 minutes on wire rackremove from pan and cool completely on wire rack.

Grease an 8-inch square pan and set aside. Melt the baking chocolate over a double boiler (or in the microwave). Mix in the sugar and eggs until smooth and creamy. Stir in the vanilla and the dry ingredients just until smooth. Pour the batter into the pan. Bake at 325f for 40 minutes or until done. Cut the squares while still warm and sprinkle with nuts if desired. Let cool and store in an airtight container. Makes 24 squares.

Place the dried seasonings on a cutting board and, using a knife, grind the seasonings to a fine powder. Combine with the salt and pepper. Place the potatoes in a crock pot. Add the seasonings to the potatoes and mix well. Arrange the pork chops on top and sprinkle with seasoning. Add the remaining ingredients. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Remove the pork chops and place on a serving dish. Serve with the sauerkraut and potatoes.

Beat cream cheese and powdered sugar together until blended. Shape into a ball and wrap in plastic wrap. Chill in refrigerator at least 2 hours or overnight. Just before serving sprinkle with mini chocolate chips. Serve with graham cracker sticks.

Peel sweet potatoes and cut into wedges. Place in a large bowl. In a saucepan, combine butter, apple pie filling, raisins, apple pie spice and 1/3 cup water. Bring to a boil. Pour over potatoes. Stir until coated. Transfer potatoes to a 9x13 inch baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Sprinkle pecans on top. Serve.

To make this cilantro salsa, you will need about 1 cup of fresh cilantro leaves. In a blender, add cilantro leaves, 1 clove garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, 1/8 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, 1/2 teaspoon olive oil, 1/2 teaspoon sherry wine vinegar, 1/2 teaspoon water (to thin) and 1/8 teaspoon of chopped fresh green onions. Process until smooth or to desired consistency. Transfer to a serving bowl or individual bowls and serve with chicken or fish.

Bring water to a boil in a small saucepan. Add corn and cook until tender. Drain corn. Beat together egg and cornflour. Add corn and mix well. Heat oil in a non stick frying pan over medium-high heat. Drop corn mixture by heaping teaspoonfuls into pan. Cook for about 2 minutes on each side or until golden. Transfer to paper towel-lined plate to drain. Repeat with remaining mixture. Serve with your favourite dipping sauce.

Heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Brown meat with onion until no longer pink. Stir in garlic, spaghetti sauce, and corn. Bring mixture to boil. Reduce heat. Simmer for 15 minutes or until sauce is thickened. Stir in macaroni and cheese. Heat thoroughly. Serves 6.

Pour tea into a large saucepan. Add boiling water. Steep for 10-12 minutes. Stir in apple cider and unsweetened cranberry juice. Stir in brown sugar. Stir in cinnamon stick, ginger, and cloves. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 30 minutes. Remove from heat and discard the cinnamon stick. Stir in cinnamon sticks and orange slices. Let steep for 10 minutes. Serve hot. Garnish with orange slices and maraschino cherries if desired.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Toss sweet potatoes with oil and spread in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast 20-30 minutes or until tender. Cool slightly. Toss with remaining ingredients. Serve immediately.

In a large pot over medium heat, warm the chicken broth. Add the rice. As the rice is cooking, prepare the chicken. In a medium bowl, stir together the chicken, the carrots, the celery, the scallions, the cilantro or mint, the garlic, the ginger, the soy sauce and 1 tbsp. of the lime juice. Season with the salt and the pepper. When the rice is done, add the chicken mixture. Add the lime juice to taste. Stir to combine. Serve right away.

Place pork chops between sheets of heavy-duty foil. In a small bowl combine the honey, low sodium soy sauce, rice vinegar, gingerroot, and garlic. Pour over the top of the pork chops. Wrap well with heavy duty foil. Cook on barbecue grill over medium heat for 20 to 25 minutes. Turn once halfway through the cooking time. Remove from heat. Serve with rice.

Prepare jello according to package directions. Let cool slightly then add sour cream and mix well. Fold in the pineapple ring and carrot and celery. Spoon into a small glass dish or cup and refrigerate until set. Just before serving sprinkle with chopped pecans and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease the bottom and sides of an 8-inch square pan with melted butter, and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon of the flour.In a large bowl, combine the remaining flour with the salt and baking powder. Add the chiles and garlic to the flour mixture, and stir until evenly mixed. Add the whipping cream and mix until just combined, then sprinkle with the cayenne pepper and mix well.Place the mixture into the pan, and sprinkle with the remaining tablespoon of flour. Bake in the preheated oven until lightly browned and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 15 minutes.Remove the scones from the oven and cut into eight triangles. Serve immediately.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, combine beets and water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until beets are tender when pierced with a knife, 25 to 30 minutes. Drain and cool. In a medium bowl, combine beets, onions and butter. Add sugar and vinegar. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm.

Cook lentils as directed on box or bagdrain and set aside. Meanwhile, saute onion and bell peppers over medium heat until they start to get soft. Add broth and bring to a boiladd lentils and simmer for a couple minutes, until heated through. Season with salt and red pepper flakes to taste. Pour into a baking dish or casserolesprinkle with cheese and bake until hot and bubbly (about 5 minutes). Serve with pita bread or crackers. Makes about 6 servings.

Melt butter in heavy-bottomed saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the onion, garlic, bay leaf, black peppercorns, whole cloves and sea salt. Cover and cook over low heat for about 40 minutes, until the onions are very soft and have darkened in color. Uncover and cook for another hour, stirring occasionally until they are deep brown and caramelized. Turn off heat and discard bay leaf and cloves. Let the onion mixture cool completely before using it in the pie. Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Roll out pastry to a little bigger than a 9-inch pie plate. Fill the center of the pastry with the onion mixture and sprinkle cheese on top. Fold over the edges of the pastry and pinch to seal the top. Brush the crust with egg wash and sprinkle thyme on top. Bake in the middle of the oven until the crust is golden brown, about 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Melt butter in large skillet or pan. Add onions. Saute until tender. Add stuffing mix, soup and sour cream. Stir. Place in 9 x 13 inch pan. Arrange chicken breasts on top. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in peas and carrots. Serve.

Combine soy sauce, molasses, sesame oil, and tahini in a small bowl and whisk until smooth. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine the noodles and dressing. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Just before serving, add green onion and stir well. Add balsamic vinegar and more soy sauce to taste. Sprinkle on sesame seeds and serve.
Mix together in a bowl. Chill for at least one hour. Serve with crackers.

In the bowl of an electric stand mixer, beat the butter and sugar at medium speed until creamy and light. Add the bananas and beat well. Add the eggs one at a time. Beat until well blended. Add the applesauce and vanilla and beat at medium-high speed until incorporated. Combine the flour, baking soda and saltadd to the banana mixture and mix until just combined. Stir in the oats and chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake one sheet at a time until the edges are lightly browned and the centers are set but still slightly soft when gently pressed with a fingertip, 15 to 18 minutes. Cool on the baking sheets for 5 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 375f. Combine oil and onions in large skillet over medium heat and cook until onions are soft and golden. Transfer to small bowl. In same skillet, saute garlic in oil for 1 minute, stir in tomato sauce and bring to a simmer. Sprinkle halibut steaks with parsley and season with salt and pepper. Place steaks in single layer on baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Cover with sauce mixture. Bake in 375f oven for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with fork. Spoon sauce on halibut steaks. Sprinkle with parsley. Garnish with lemon slices if desired.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Rinse with cold water. Drain pasta. In large skillet, add broccoli. Heat until tender. Drain off excess moisture. In a small bowl combine flour with salt and pepper to taste. Gradually stir in milk. Heat to boiling. Add mustard. Stir until smooth. Remove from heat. Add cheese. Stir until melted. Add pasta and broccoli. Toss until well blended. Serve immediately. Makes 3 servings.

Cook jasmine rice according to package directions. Heat oil in large skillet or wok over medium-high heatadd onion and garlicsauté 2 minutes or until onion is tender. Add shrimp and sauté until pink and just cooked through (about 1 minute per side). Remove shrimp and onions from skilletset aside. Add rice and stir-fry until rice is heated through (about 2 minutes). Add fish sauce and sugarstir well. Stir in shrimp and onionsheat through. Stir in pineapple and green onions. Serve immediately.

Place wings in a zip-lock plastic bag. Combine hot pepper sauce and vinegar and pour into bag. Seal bag and place in refrigerator overnight or at least 8 hours to marinate the chicken wings. Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with foil and place the marinated chicken wings on the foil. Bake for 30 to 40 minutes or until the meat is tender and browned. In a small bowl mix together ranch dressing mix and paprika. Sprinkle the chicken wings with the dressing mixture and serve warm or at room temperature.

In a medium saucepan add the pretzels and sugarstirring until the sugar is dissolved and the pretzels are well coated. Remove from heat and stir in margarine until melted and incorporated with the pretzels. Cool and pour into a large serving bowl or plate. In a large bowl using an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese until fluffyadd the sugar and continue beating until blended. Add the Cool Whip and mix until well blended. Add the raspberry jello and mix well until all is incorporated. Spread the raspberry jello mixture on top of the pretzels and refrigerate until ready to serve. Before serving crumble the frozen raspberries over the salad and enjoy!
Empty jello into bowl. Add boiling water and stir until dissolved. Add cranberry sauce and lemon juice. Mix well. Fold in raspberries. Refrigerate.

Cook ravioli according to package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet brown ground beef. Drain grease. Add spaghetti sauce and frozen spinach. Heat through and stir well. Add ravioli and mozzarella cheese. Toss to coat. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

Mix tuna and cream cheese together. Place on pita bread and top with cheddar cheese and assorted fresh vegetables. Bake at 350 until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serve with favorite side dish or salad.
Wash spinach well. Drain well. Toss with sesame seeds and dressing. Serve warm. Dashi is a stock made from dried bonito flakes and kelp.

Combine the ground turkey with the carrots, egg, italian seasoned breadcrumbs, worcestershire sauce and garlic powder. Mix thoroughly and form into patties.
