Fry patties in butter until cooked through. Remove patties from pan. Pour butter out of pan and place frozen hash browns into pan and press down to cover bottom of pan with hash browns. Sprinkle cheese over hash browns. Top with patties. Cover with lid and bake for 30 minutes at 350 degrees. Serve with tomato sauce for dipping.

Beat the egg yolks in a medium size bowl until light in color. Add the sugar and continue to beat until it's thick like a pound cake batter. Add the vanilla extract and the lemon rind. Stir in the walnuts. Drop by the teaspoon on a greased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool for 10 minutes. Roll in powdered sugar.

Remove any fat from the ground turkey. Combine bread crumbs and butter in small bowl. In another small bowl, whisk together half-and-half and egg. In another small bowl, combine bread crumbs, dill weed, and pepper. In large skillet, heat 1/2 inch of vegetable oil to 375 degrees f. Prepare turkey cutlets by pounding each cutlet out to 1/4 inch thickness. Dip each cutlet into half-and-half mixture and then into bread crumb mixture. Fry cutlets in hot oil until golden brown on both sides. Remove to paper towels to drain. Serve with melted butter or tartar sauce.

Mix all dressing ingredients together. Place in refrigerator. Cool the cooked chicken and cut into cubes. Mix chicken, dried cranberries, and chopped apples together. Add the dressing and mix well. Put on sandwiches and top with lettuce and tomato.

In a mixing bowl beat butter until creamy. Add sugar and beat until light. Add flour and vanilla. Beat until well blended. Stir in nuts. Shape into 1 1/2 inch balls. Place on a cookie sheet lined with wax paper. Refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Dust with powdered sugar.

Slice 3 onions and 2 garlic cloves into very thin slices. Melt 2 tablespoons of butter in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onions and cook 5 minutes until transparent. Add brown sugar and stir 1 minute. Add 2 cups beef broth, 1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 2 teaspoons Worcestershire sauce, 1 teaspoon dried thyme, 1 teaspoon dried basil and 1 teaspoon dried rosemary. Bring to a simmer. Cover and cook 10-15 minutes until onions are soft. Meanwhile, sprinkle both sides of 1 pound boneless top sirloin steaks with 1 teaspoon each of salt and pepper. Sear both sides on a hot grill. Reduce heat to low. Place onions around steaks. Cover and cook 6-10 minutes until steaks are medium. Remove from heat. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Combine first 7 ingredients in a bowl. Mix well with your hands. Divide into 36 even balls. Combine tomato paste and sauce in another bowl. Mix well with your hands. Roll each meatball in tomato paste/sauce mixture. Arrange in a single layer in a 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Bake in 375 degree oven for 30 to 45 minutes. Serve with hot cooked pasta.

Lightly butter a 9-inch square glass dish. In a medium bowl, combine cranberries with 1/2 cup honey. Add to dish. Place bread in dish. In a small bowl, beat eggs with milk and vanilla. Pour over bread. Bake for 35 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes. Melt brie cheese. Spread on toast. Broil until cheese is golden and bubbly. Cut into squares. Garnish with cranberries.

Melt butter in 9 inch pie pan. Sprinkle the diced mushrooms over the bottom. Layer the sliced jarlsberg cheese over the mushrooms. Then layer the spinach souffle over the cheese. Bake in 350 degree oven for about 45 minutes. Serve with salad or green beans.

Bring brown mustard seeds and rice vinegar to a boil in a medium saucepan over high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes, stirring frequently until thick and syrupy, and the mustard seeds have turned gray. Add mustard powder and salt and stir well to combine. Let cool completely and then pour into a storage container or jar with a tight-fitting lid. Cover and refrigerate for 24 hours before using.

Mix brownie mix and water according to package directions. Divide batter evenly between 24 cupcake liners. Bake at 350 for about 18 minutes. Cool completely. Place 1 tablespoon of whipped topping in bottom of each cupcake liner. Add 1/2 teaspoon applesauce. Top with 1/4 teaspoon candy corn. Top with 1 teaspoon of whipped topping. Store in an air-tight container for up to 2 days.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease a 8-inch square or round cake pan with margarine. In a large mixing bowl, beat the eggs. Beat in the sugar. Stir in the baking powder and salt. Add the flour. Stir to make a batter. Pour the batter into the cake pan and bake for 30-35 minutes. Cool in the pan on a wire rack.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Grease bottom of a 9x13 inch (23x33 cm) pan. Beat eggs, sugar, and self rising flour together in a large bowl for 4 minutes or until very thick. Stir in orange juice and rind until well blended. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 50 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool cake in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pan, and cool completely on wire rack. Dust with confectioners sugar just before serving.

Saute onions until soft in oil in large pot, add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add potatoes and cauliflower, cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Add broth, water, salt and pepper to taste and bring to boil. Reduce heat to simmer, cover pot and cook for 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Remove from heat and add chives. Puree vegetables until smooth. Return to pot over low heat and keep warm until ready to serve. Serves 4 to 6.
In large kettle, combine broth and chicken. Heat throughly. Stir in celery, carrot, onion and corn. Cook until vegetables are tender. Stir in tomato. Heat throughly. Salt to taste. Serve hot.

Combine soy sauce, rice wine, brown sugar and cornstarch in a bowl. Set aside. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add gingerroot and garlic and stir-fry for 3 minutes or until aromatic. Add beef and continue stir-frying for 4 minutes or until browned. Add snow peas and cook for another minute or until bright green and crisp-tender. Add reserved sauce and continue stir-frying for about 1 minute or until sauce is thickened and the beef is cooked through.

Heat oil in large Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion and saute until tender, stirring often. Add curry powder and stir for 1 minute. Add chicken broth and stir until smooth. Add chicken, rice and seasoningstir well and heat to boiling over medium heat. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 15 minutes or until rice is tender. Stir in corn flake crumbslet stand for 1 to 2 minutes or until crumbs are golden brown and rice is creamy. Serve immediately or cool slightly. Refrigerate leftovers or freeze for later use.

Brown ground beef with onion until cooked through. Drain fat from meat mixture. Mix pasta sauce into meat mixture, add macaroni and pepperoni. Spoon into a greased casserole dish. Top with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until heated through.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat olive oil until it is hot but not smoking. Add chicken breastseason with salt and pepper. Cook until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 8 minutes. Transfer chicken to a plate and set aside to cool. In the same saucepan, add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add eggplant and cook until slightly softened, about 3 minutes. Add the tomatoes, tomato paste and salt. Simmer for 15 minutes. Remove the sauce from the heatstir in the chicken, mozzarella cheese and romano cheese. Transfer the sauce into a baking dish. Lay the rigatoni pasta on top of the saucesprinkle with parmesan cheese and bake until browned, about 30 minutes. Top with basil and parsleyserve immediately.
Mix margarine, sugar, vanilla. Add flour gradually, stirring well after each addition. Press dough into balls about 2 inches apart. Roll balls in nuts. Store tightly covered in refrigerator.

Heat barbecue sauce in a small sauce pan until warm. Remove from heat and set aside. Cut sausage links into 1/2 inch slices. Heat the rolls according to package directions. Place a slice of sausage in the center of each roll and top with barbecue sauce.

Melt butter over medium high heat in a small saucepan, add orange juice concentrate and reduce by half, about 5 minutes. Stir in chipotle and reduce heat to low, cook for about 1 minute. Remove from heat and add molasses. Add more molasses until glaze reaches desired thickness. In a bowl, mix together chipotle and molasses glaze and cilantro. Serve alongside corn on the cob for grilled corn on the cob with chipotle and molasses glaze.
In a large bowl, sift together flour, lard, sugar and salt. Cut in egg and vinegar. Add enough water to form a soft dough. Roll out and use in pie recipes.

Combine pineapple, eggs, sugar and butter. Set aside. Cut bread into cubes. Layer bottom of casserole with 1/2 of cubes. Pour half of pineapple mixture over cubes. Repeat with remaining cubes and pineapple. Bake 45 minutes. Let cool slightly before serving.

In a large skillet, heat oil over medium high heat. Add shallots and garlicstir fry 1 minute. Add shrimp, scallops and mussels. Stir fry 1 to 2 minutes or until shrimp change color. Add tomatoes and basil. Cook and stir 1 minute. Add mushrooms and pepper. Stir until mushrooms are cooked. Add white wine and lemon wedge. Cover and simmer 5 to 8 minutes or until shellfish are done. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Preheat grill to high heat. Clean tomatoes. Mix pesto sauce with green onions. Spread on each tomato half. Top each half with mozzarella cheese. Grill 3 to 4 minutes or until cheese is melted. Garnish with parsley.

Mix salsa and miracle whip. Sprinkle with chili powder. Cook chicken in skillet in medium heat until browned on both sides. Add salsa mixture and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes. Place 2 tortillas on a cutting board. Spread with about 1/4 cup salsa mixture. Top with 1/2 cup shredded cheese. Top with another tortilla. Repeat. Place quesadillas in a lightly greased 13x9 inch baking pan. Bake in a 350 oven for 15 minutes. Cut into wedges.

In a medium sized saucepan combine the apples, cranberries, sugar, oats, flour, cinnamon, and salt. Cook over medium heat until the juice is thickened. Stir in butter until melted. Spoon mixture into greased 2-quart baking dish. In a medium sized bowl combine flour, brown sugar, pecans, and butter. Crumble mixture over the top of the fruit. Bake at 350 degrees f. For 40 minutes or until the topping is crisp. Serve warm.
Slice tomatoes. Stack tomatoes alternating with halloumi. Drizzle with pesto sauce. Squeeze lemon juice over salad. Drizzle with olive oil.
Heat sausage in skillet until cooked through. Add hash browns. Cook until hot and browned. Beat eggs. Add milk. Pour over browned potatoes. Sprinkle cheese over top. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes.

Place cube steaks between 2 sheets of waxed paper or plastic wrap and pound to 1/4 inch thickness. Mix soup, milk, onion soup mix and liquid smoke in a medium bowl until well blended. Cut potatoes and vegetables in half and place in foil packets as shown in photo. Place 2 cubes in each packet and top with vegetables. Pour soup mixture over all. Bring 1/2 inch of water to boil in a large saucepan and place packets in water. Reduce heat to medium and simmer 20 min or until meat and vegetables are tender. Drain packets and serve.
Cut the cantaloupe into chunks. Combine the strawberries, sugar, rose water and mint leaves. Pour over the cantaloupe. Cover and refrigerate for several hours. Garnish with mint leaves.

In a medium saucepan, bring stock to a boil. Add broccoli, celery and onion. Reduce heat to simmer for 10 minutes. Add potatoes. Simmer 20 minutes until potatoes are tender. In a medium bowl, combine thyme, half-and-half, mustard, salt and pepper. Add to potatoes. Cook 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir until well combined. Serve hot. garnish with shredded cheddar.

Brown beef with onion in a skillet. Drain off fat. Mix beef with biscuit mix, water, soup and onion soup mix. Pour into 13 x 9 inch baking pan. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Serves 6-8.

Mix together cream cheese, sugar and cocoa until well blended. Beat in the milk and vanilla. Fold in the whipped topping and spoon into a 9-inch pie plate. Chill for at least 1 hour until firm. If desired, serve with garnish of mint leaves and strawberries.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and let cool. While potatoes cool make dressing. Mix together lime juice, picante sauce, olive oil and salt and pepper. Cut potatoes into 1/2" cubes and add to dressing. Refrigerate overnight. Cut tomato into 1/2" cubes and add. Add black olives and green onions cut into 1" pieces. Add cilantro. Serve chilled.
Drain and rinse chickpeas. Place in blender or food processor and puree until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and blend until creamy. Refrigerate. Serve with pita chips. Makes 4 servings.

Heat ghee in a pan and add rava. Roast the rava for 10 to 15 minutes till it turns golden brown. Cool this mixture. Take it in a plate and add sugar. Mix well. Add milk and cardamom powder. Mix well and make ladoos. Add green cardamom and saffron strands. Roll it in desiccated coconut. Serve.

Heat the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the shallot and cook until golden brown, about 2 minutes. Stir in the chicken breast halves and cook until the chicken is lightly browned on one side. Pour in the broth, wine and tarragonbring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Cover the skillet and reduce the heat to mediumsimmer for 12 minutes. Remove the covercook until the chicken is opaque throughout when cut in the center with a knife, 12 to 14 minutes longer. Meanwhile, combine the potatoes with the water in a small saucepanbring the water to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat to mediumcover the pan and cook the potatoes until they are tender when pierced with a knife, 12 to 14 minutes. Drain the potatoesmash them with the butter and parsley in a large bowlseason the potatoes with the salt and pepper. Stir the potatoes into the chicken broth mixturecook until heated through, about 1 minute. Ser

Brown sausage and drain. Saute onion and garlic powder until softened. Combine all ingredients and cook covered for 15 minutes stirring occasionally. Add water if needed. Serve as a main dish or side dish with a salad.

Prepare the pears. Cut 1/2-inch off the bottom and the top of each pear. Slice each pear in half lengthwise and remove core. Cut each half into 6 wedges. Combine lemon juice and oils in a large bowl and whisk until emulsified. Add pears and arugula to vinaigrette and toss to coat. Divide arugula mixture among 4 salad plates. Sprinkle with parmesan and blue cheese and serve with walnuts.

Wash apricots. Remove the pit. Cut the apricots in half. Pour sugar in a pan, add water. Add apricots. Cook for 45 minutes. Stir occasionally. Add the almond extract. Cook for another 15 minutes. Serve warm. Sprinkle almonds on top.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 9x5x3 inch loaf pan. Beat together cake mix and eggs until well blendedstir in oil. Mix together pudding and 1/4 cup water until smooth. Stir pudding mixture into cake batter. Stir together poppy seed and 3 tablespoons of watermix into batter just until combined. Spoon batter into prepared pansmooth top. Bake in preheated oven for 60 to 70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Cool in pan 10 minutesremove from pan to cool completely on a wire rack. Store in an air tight container.

Combine butter and flour in small skillet. Stir until browned and smooth. Add chicken stock and bring to boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and stir in dill and vinegar. Stir until thickened and smooth. Add salt and sugar to taste. Beat in egg yolk and cool slightly. Stir in dill until well blended. Serve warm or cold over fish or chicken.

Combine beef, stuffing mix and eggs in a large bowl. Add onion and next 5 ingredients. Mix lightly but thoroughly. Form into balls, about 1-inch in diameter. Place in a single layer in a shallow baking dish. Combine ketchup and next 3 ingredients in a small bowlspoon over meatballs. Bake, uncovered, at 375 for 25-30 minutes or until done (165 degrees F).

Fry bacon until crisp. Cut into 1-inch strips. Place croissants on a baking sheet. Heat oven to 350 degrees. Place butter lettuce leaves on half of each croissant. Top with a strip of bacon and a slice of tomato. Drizzle with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with garlic and parsley. Bake 5 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine cream cheese with ranch dressing. Spread in bottom of 9x13 casserole. Top with seafood cocktail sauce. Layer with cheddar cheese, imitation crabmeat, shrimp and seafood. Add green pepper, green onions and tomatoes. Refrigerate at least 2 hours before serving. Serve with tortilla chips.
In a medium bowl combine cucumber and red onion. In another bowl whisk together vinegar, sugar and red pepper. Add to cucumber mixture and toss to coat. Serve chilled. Makes 4 servings.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic in hot oil until tender. Add carrot and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add green beans and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add stock, cover and simmer for 10 minutes or until beans are tender. Stir in almond milk. Cook over low heat for 2-3 minutes or until heated through. Season with salt, pepper and herbs. Sprinkle with parsley to serve.

Combine potatoes, onions and apple in slow cooker. Place brisket on top of potato mixture. In a saucepan combine cider, brown sugar, mustard and cloves. Cook until boiling, stirring occasionally. Pour over brisket. Cover and cook on low setting for 7 hours. Remove brisket and shred. Return to slow cooker and stir. Add cabbage and stir. Cover and cook on high setting for 30 minutes or until cabbage is tender. Serve brisket on rolls. Top with cabbage mixture. Serves 6 to 8.
Peel the onion and thinly slice it. Dip the slices in the batter and deep fry in oil. Drain on kitchen paper and sprinkle with fresh mint. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375F. Beat together cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth. Stir in 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese. Spread evenly in a 13 x 9 inch baking pan coated with cooking spray. Top with bacon. Arrange tomato slices on top. Bake 15 minutes or until heated through. Top with bell peppers. Bake 5 to 10 minutes longer or until cheese is melted. Let stand 5 minutes before serving. Serve with remaining mozzarella cheese. Makes 10 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350f/180c/gas mark 4. Butter a small pudding basin. Beat the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. Add the eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. Stir in the flour and spices. Put in the pudding basin and level the surface with the back of a spoon. Sprinkle over the cranberries. Bake for about 35 minutes or until the pudding has risen and is golden brown on top. Serve with orange sauce.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine chicken, tomatoes, onion, green pepper, red pepper and 2 teaspoons canola oil. Transfer to an 8-inch square baking dish. Mix remaining 1 teaspoon canola oil with cumin, salt and pepper. Sprinkle over top. Bake 15 minutes. Serve with tortillas.

Rinse beans in cold water. Combine the beans with 3 quarts of cold water. Place in large stock pot. Heat to boiling. Remove from heat. Cover pot. Allow beans to soak overnight. Drain beans. Combine beans, chicken stock, garlic, onions, thyme and bay leaf. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered for 1 hour or until beans are tender. Season with salt and pepper. Discard bay leaf before serving.

Mix dried apricots and cranberries in a bowl. Combine chocolate chips and orange zest in a microwave safe bowl. Microwave in 30 second increments, stirring in between until chips are completely melted. Pour melted chocolate over fruit mixture. Stir until all fruit is coated. Place on parchment paper. Refrigerate 2 hours to allow to harden. Scoop mixture into balls. Roll each ball in a small bowl of powdered sugar. Store in the refrigerator.

Heat the olive oil over medium heat in a medium pot, add the onions and garlic and cook until tender but not browned about 5 minutes. Add the chicken, peanut butter and coriander and cook until lightly browned about 2 minutes. Stir in the tomato sauce and cook until the chicken is cooked through about 8 minutes more. Season with red pepper flakes and salt and pepper, if desired. Serve over rice with sliced avocado.

Preheat oven to 350F. Melt the butter in a heavy-based saucepan over medium heat. Add the leeks and sweat gently for 5 minutes until softened. Stir in the parsley, salt and pepper, then cook for 1 minute more. Add the potatoes, stock and thyme sprig. Bring to boil then reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes until the vegetables are tender. Remove the thyme sprig. Whisk the cream with the flour until smooth. Gradually add the hot soup, whisking well, until smooth. Add the chives. Heat until the soup is hot, then serve.

Brown lean ground beef. Add onion and jalapenos. Drain. Stir in tomatoes and paste. Add beef broth. Bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 30 minutes. Add rice and simmer 5 minutes longer. Stuff bell peppers and sprinkle with onion soup mix. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

In saucepan over low heat, combine water and gelatinstir until gelatin is dissolved. Remove from heat and add orange juice and orange zeststir until well-combined. Add sugar and stir until completely dissolved. Stir in lemon juice. Spoon into freezer container and chill until set, about 1 hour. Remove sherbet from the freezer and beat whipping cream until it forms stiff peaks. Fold whipped cream into orange sherbet. Return to freezer container and chill until ready to serve.
Place the popcorn in a large bowl and set aside. In a small bowl mix together the butter and the seasonings and pour over the popcorn and toss well to coat. Serve immediately.

Mix peanut butter and egg and vanilla until well blended. Roll into 1 inch balls. Place on wax paper. Place in refrigerator 30 minutes. Melt chocolate in microwave. Place in a plastic bag and snip off end. Drizzle over peanut butter balls. Refrigerate until chocolate is set.

Mix brown sugar, cornstarch and apple juice until smooth. Stir in orange zest. Heat cider vinegar until boilingstir into sugar mixture. Cook until thickened and bubbly. Cool slightly. Cut kielbasa on the diagonal into slices about 1-inch thick. Thread kielbasa, pepper, onion and pineapple on skewers. Baste with mixture and grill for about 5 minutes per side, or until kielbasa is cooked through and vegetables are tender.

Prepare pudding mix according to package directions using 1/2 cup milk. Add protein powder and beat to combine. Spread in a 9-inch pie shell. Refrigerate at least 3 hours or overnight. Top with Cool Whip and sliced bananas. Sprinkle with toasted coconut or pecans.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). Wash potatoes and boil until cooked through but firm, about 15 minutes. Drain and place on baking sheet and smash with flat side of a heavy skillet until flattened about 1/3 of an inch thick. Whisk together the cream, salt and pepper. Brush potatoes with the mixture and top with garlic and parsley. Bake 20 minutes or until golden brown on top.

Slice mushrooms lengthwise. In 10 inch nonstick frying pan, saute garlic in butter over medium heat. When garlic is golden add mushrooms. Cook about 3 minutes. Add wine. Cook about 5 minutes until mushrooms are tender. Sprinkle with cheese and saute until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with cracker crumbs.

Cut jalapenos in half lengthwise. Place 1/2 slice of turkey bacon on bottom half of jalapeno and top with 1/2 teaspoon cream cheese and 1/2 teaspoon cheddar cheese. Replace top half of jalapeno and secure with a toothpick. Grill jalapenos on medium heat for 3 minutes on each side or until jalapeno is tender and bacon is crisp.

Cut squash lengthwise and scoop out seeds. Bring 2 quarts water to a boil. Add 1 tbsp salt and the squash. Cook 15 to 20 minutes or until squash is tender. Remove squash and set aside. Heat 2 tbsp olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper, onion and garlic. Cook 4 to 5 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add 1 tbsp hot pepper sauce and 1 tbsp salt. Stir in rice and cook for 1 minute. Add squash and 3 cups water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered for 20 minutes. Stir in black-eyed peas and hot pepper sauce. Continue cooking 20 to 30 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Stir in 1 tbsp hot pepper sauce. Makes 6 servings. Serve with a tossed green salad.

In a saucepan whisk together broth and cornstarch. Cook over medium heat until thickened and clear. Stir in vinegar. Remove from heat. Stir in roasted garlic cloves and mustard. Cool slightly. In a small bowl whisk together honey and peanut oil until blended well. Pour mixture into broth mixture and stir well to blend. Season with pepper to taste. Serve with vegetables or use as a salad dressing. Makes about 1 1/2 cups.

Heat butter in a saucepan. Add the chicken. Season with salt and pepper. Sauté over medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side or until the meat is cooked through. Remove the chicken from the pan. Add the sherry wine to the pan. Cook over low heat for 2-3 minutes or until the sauce thickens. Add the lemon rind. Add lemon juice to taste. Mix well. Stir in the heavy cream. Return the chicken to the pan. Sprinkle with the parmesan cheese.

Boil water. Mash raspberries with a fork or put into blender. Remove from heat and add to raspberries 1/4 cup sugar for every 1/4 cup berries mashed up or put into blender. Mix well. Pour into a clean container and add lemon juice to taste. Let set for a day before drinking. This makes a great drink for parties or family get togethers.

Drain can of beans and place in a large pot with enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 30 min. Drain beans reserving liquid. Chop tofu into 1/2 inch rounds. Soak in ketchup for 15 minutes. Heat oil in a skillet and fry tofu. Drain on paper towels. Saute onion and garlic in same oil until soft. Add molasses and mustard and brown for 1 min. Add bean liquid. Simmer for 15 to 20 minutes. Add beans and tofu. Season to taste with more ketchup, mustard and molasses if needed. Serve with mustard and pickle relish.

In a medium saucepan over low heat combine walnuts, sugar and butter. Cook and stir until sugar is dissolved and mixture comes to a boil. Cook 2 minutes and then remove from heat. Stir in nuts and let cool to room temperature. Line a 9x13 baking pan with wax or parchment paper. Spread toffee mixture onto paper. Refrigerate 2 hours. Melt chocolate chips and spread evenly over toffee layer. Refrigerate until firm. Break into pieces and store in an air-tight container.

Heat the chicken stock in a large stock pot until it comes to a simmer. In a small skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the onions and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and cook until golden, about 3 minutes. Add the onions and garlic to the stock. Add the crushed tomatoes, celery ribs, and bay leaf to the pot. Bring the stock mixture to a simmer over medium-low heat. Reduce the heat to low and add the smoked paprika and cayenne. Simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in the rosemary and marjoram and cook for 5 minutes more. Add the sour cream and stir well before serving. Serve hot with freshly ground black pepper.

Cook tortellini according to package directions. Heat sweet butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add ham, cream and parmesan cheese. Heat until warmed through. Remove from heat. Add cooked tortellini and peas to sauce. Sprinkle with chives. Serve immediately.

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees. Take one puff pastry sheet and roll it out with a rolling pin until it is about 1/8 inch thick.2. Cut it into triangles using a pizza cutter (or if you are really handy you can use a knife and cut it by hand). Cut each triangle so that it is about 2 inches wide at one end and about one inch wide at the other end. 3. Bake for 6-8 minutes until they are lightly browned on the edges.4. While the pastry is baking take out your apples and peel and core them. Cut them into small pieces and place them in a bowl with the brown sugar and salt and toss them so that they are coated with the brown sugar and salt mixture. When the pastry is done cooking remove them from the oven and place them on a cookie sheet lined with a piece of aluminum foil or wax paper. Spread half of them out on a plate so that they are in a single layer (I like to make it a bit messy by using my hands so that it looks like a p

Spread mayonnaise on one slice of bread. Arrange lettuce leaves on top and tomato slices next to lettuce. Place bacon strips over lettuce and tomatoes. Arrange chicken breasts over bacon and top with remaining slice of bread. Wrap sandwich together and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 350. Grease an 8x4 loaf pan. In a large bowl, beat together eggs, sugar, eggnog, rum extract, vanilla extract, nutmeg. Beat in the flour, baking powder and salt until just blended. Pour into pan. Bake until a toothpick comes out clean, about 1 hour. Cool 10 minutes then remove from pan to wire rack to cool completely. Drizzle with powdered sugar before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. In large bowl, combine coconut milk and curry paste. Add sugar and fish sauce. Heat in small saucepan over medium heat for 4 minutes or until sauce thickens. Add bell pepper, mushrooms and basil. Cook 3 minutes or until bell pepper is crisp-tender. Remove from heat and stir in lime juice. Divide rice between 4 bowls. Top each serving of rice with one-fourth of the salmon mixture. Sprinkle each serving with basil.

Heat butter in small skillet over medium-high heat on stovetop until butter melts. Stir dill into butter and cook for 1 minute or until dill is wilted. Set aside. Crack eggs into small bowl, beat with fork or whisk. Heat large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat on stovetop. Cook salmon for about 4 minutes on each side or until salmon is browned on the outside and no longer pink on the inside. Remove from heat. Melt remaining butter with dill over medium-low heat on stovetop. Spread dill butter onto each of four rounds. Place about half cup salmon on each round, then sprinkle with about one-fourth of eggs. Place remaining rounds on top of each sandwich. Wrap sandwiches in plastic wrap or place between two sheets of wax paper. Refrigerate at least 2 hours or up to one day before serving. Serve immediately after removing from refrigerator. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing if desired.

In a large bowl combine graham cracker crumbs, sugar and melted butter until well blended. Press mixture into the bottom of a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Bake for 10 minutes or until crust is set. Combine sweetened condensed milk and jamspread over crust. Bake 15 to 20 minutes longer or until center is set. Sprinkle coconut over bars and then cashews and white chocolate chips. Cool completely. Cut into bars. Store in an airtight container in refrigerator for up to a week.

Mix margarine, milk and brown sugar in a large bowl. Combine flour and sugar. Add to margarine mixture and mix. Stir in crackers. Press into the bottom of a 13x9-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. In a small saucepan combine the sugar and corn syrup. Bring to a boil. Boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and vanilla. Spread over the cooled base. Bake for 10 more minutes. Sprinkle the top with the chocolate chips and press into the peanut butter layer. Cool completely before cutting into bars.

In a slow cooker, combine the meat, carrot and potatoes. Stir in the soup and stout. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 9 hours or high for 4 to 5 hours. Add the pearl onions to the pot and continue cooking until the meat is tender. Stir before serving. Serve with a side of boiled potatoes.
Combine the spinach leaves and the cantaloupe pieces in a salad bowl. Add the pistachios and toss to blend well. Serve with raspberry vinaigrette dressing or your favorite dressing.

Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash. Stir in cream cheese until smooth. Add sour cream and eggs, blending well. Add cream and butter. Stir in seasonings to taste. Pour into 2 quart greased baking dish. Bake uncovered at 375 for 30-35 minutes or until firm. Let stand for 10 minutes before cutting into squares to serve.

In a large bowl mix together the oats, milk, flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, ground cinnamon and vanilla extract until well blended. Beat the egg whites until stiff and fold into oat mixture. Heat the oil in a heavy skillet over medium heat. Drop batter by large spoonfuls into the skillet. Fry until golden on each side, 1-2 minutes per side. Serve immediately with fruit or maple syrup.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a 10-inch skillet over medium heat, heat oil. In a shallow pan or pie plate, combine breadcrumbs and ranch dressing. Dip chicken into ranch mixture. Place in skilletbrown on each side. In a 2-quart casserole dish, layer half the chicken with half the bacon. Top with half the dressing mixture. Repeat layers. Bake 30 minutes. Top with remaining chicken. Bake 15 minutes longer. Serve on toasted rolls. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 400. Bake potatoes for 1 hour. Cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out the insides. Set aside. Melt 3 tbsp butter in skillet over medium-high heat. Saute chives for 1 minute. Add 1/4 cup sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Spoon into potato shells. Sprinkle with bacon and cheddar cheese. Bake 5 minutes.

Place the pomegranates in a bowl and add water until they are covered. Cover and let them soak for 1 hour. Drain and put the pomegranates in a blender or food processor and add the sugar and grenadine. Blend until smooth. In a small saucepan bring the tapioca and water to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 minutes or until the tapioca is tender. Cool slightly and add to the pomegranate mixture. Whisk the mixture until smooth. Pour into 4 serving cups and chill for 2 hours. Garnish each serving with a dollop of whipped cream and a pomegranate seed.

Cut the beef into cubes. Heat the oil in a frying pan. When the oil is hot, add the beef, bell peppers and onions. Stir fry until the beef is browned. Add the seasonings. Add the water. Add the hoisin sauce. Toss well. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Coat a large baking sheet with cooking spray. In a medium bowl combine honey, mustard and water. Whisk until well blended. Place 1/2 of chicken breasts in honey mixture and turn to coat both sides. Place in a single layer on prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle with corn flakes. Bake 12 minutes. Flip and bake an additional 12 minutes. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel potatoes and cut into quarters or eighths depending on size of potatoes. In a large bowl, combine potatoes with butter and add enough water to cover them. Microwave on high for 10 to 13 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Drain potatoes, but reserve water. Put potatoes back in bowl and mash. Add enough of the reserved liquid to make mashed potatoes creamy but not runny. Add salt, pepper and cheese to potatoes and mix well. Grease a baking dish or casserole dish and spread potatoes evenly in it. Sprinkle onion over potatoes. Bake potatoes uncovered about one hour or until top is golden brown and potatoes are bubbly. Sprinkle parsley over potatoes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Season the chicken pieces with salt and freshly ground black pepper. In a large frying pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic cloves and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chili powder, ground allspice, ground cinnamon, lime juice and sugar. Mix well. Add the chicken pieces to the sauce and stir to coat them. Transfer the chicken to a shallow baking pan. Bake for 45 minutes, or until the chicken is done.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. In medium bowl, mix molasses and sugar until smooth. Beat in egg and shortening. In another bowl, mix flour, cinnamon, ginger and salt. Stir into molasses mixture. Shape into 1-inch balls. Roll in granulated sugar. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Cool 1 minute. Remove from sheet. Makes about 3 dozen.

Cook bacon in large saucepan over medium heat until crisp. Remove and crumble baconset aside. Add onions and garlic to bacon drippings in saucepansaute until tender. Add clams and beercover and cook over medium heat 3 minutesstir once. Add bacon and season with pepperheat through. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a medium bowl, combine crabmeat, cream cheese, cheese spread, pepper sauce and garlic. Blend well. Add shrimp, parsley, onion powder, seasonings, and egg. Spoon mixture into a 1 qt. casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

In a medium sized bowl, combine the boiling water and gelatin. Stir until dissolved. Stir in the vodka. Chill for 30 minutes or until set. Place in 2-ounce paper cups. Serve in cups or in shooter glasses. Makes 20 shots.

Combine the flour, butter, milk and seasoning in a blender and process until smooth. Let stand for 10 minutes. Heat a lightly oiled 8-inch nonstick skillet or crepe pan over medium-high heat. Ladle 1/4 cup batter into the pan, tilting to coat the bottom of the pan. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the bottom is lightly browned, then flip and cook for an additional minute or until the other side is browned. Repeat with the remaining batter to make 8 crepes. In a small skillet heat 1 tablespoon butter over medium-high heat. Add the spinach and onion and cook for 3 minutes or until tender. Sprinkle with salt and set aside. In a small skillet heat the remaining 1 tablespoon butter over medium heat. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the butter begins to brown lightly. Stir in the spinach mixture and cook for an additional minute or until warmed through. Spread about 1/3 cup spinach mixture over each crepe. Top with 1 tablespoon mozzarella che

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly grease baking sheets. In large bowl with mixer beat butter until creamy. Beat in vanilla. Add powdered sugar 1/2 cup at a time, beating after each addition. Gradually beat in cake mix. Divide dough into 4 parts. On wax paper roll each part into 10" long log. Wrap each log tightly in plastic wrap. Refrigerate at least 30 minutes or up to 1 day. On work surface sprinkle powdered sugar. Remove dough from refrigerator. Unwrap 1 log. Place on dusted surface. With sharp knife cut log into 1/4" thick slices. Place 1" apart on baking sheet. Bake 12-15 minutes or until edges are just beginning to brown. Cool 1 minute. Transfer cookies to wire racks. Cool completely. Store in tightly covered container.

Heat oil in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, parsley, pimiento, salt and pepper. Sauté for 8 minutes or until softened. Add potatoescook for 4 minutes or until lightly browned. Add brothbring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 12-15 minutes or until potatoes are tender. Remove from heat and sprinkle with parsley. Serve immediately.
Dip bread into the milk then dip into the egg mixture and fry in the bacon grease. Sprinkle with cheese and serve hot.

Place graham crackers in plastic bag. Crush with rolling pin or use food processor to make fine crumbs. In medium bowl combine pudding mix and milkstir 2 minutes until smooth. Fold in graham cracker crumbs. Pour into 9 x 13 panrefrigerate for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until firm. Heat oven to 350 degrees F. In medium bowl combine 3 cups chocolate frosting and 2 cups milkstir until smooth. Spread evenly over bottom of graham cracker crustspread remaining 2 cups chocolate frosting over top. Chill 1 hour or until set. Slice into 1 1/2 x 3 inch strips. Place on waxed paper. Sprinkle with nuts if desired. Store in refrigerator. Serves 15 to 20.
Beat eggs, milk, sugar, cinnamon, ginger, and allspice. Dip bread into egg mixture. Heat butter and brown bread to serve.

Cut breasts into bite-size pieces. Combine onion, bell pepper, teriyaki, garlic powder & pepper in bowl. Add breasts. Cover & refrigerate 8 hours or overnight. Thread pieces of dove & vegetables on skewers. Grill until chicken is no longer pink & vegetables are tender. Serve over rice & garnish with cherry tomatoes.

Pound the chops to a uniform thickness of 1/2 inch. Sprinkle with the flour mixture and coat evenly. Place the coated chops into a shallow pan and refrigerate for 1 to 2 hours. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Carefully add the chops and fry for 3 to 4 minutes on each side or until browned. Place the skillet into the oven and continue to cook for 40 minutes. Add 1/2 cup of the soup and cover the skillet. Cook 15 minutes more or until the juices run clear. Serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in heavy skillet over med-high heat until simmering. Add onions and cook until softened and golden brown, about 15 minutes, stirring often. Meanwhile, season steaks all over with steak seasoning, salt and pepper. Heat an ovenproof skillet over med heat. Add steakscook until browned on both sides, about 4 minutes per side, then transfer skillet to oven and bake until steaks are cooked through, about 10 minutes more. Meanwhile, stir garlic salt and black pepper into softened onions, then spread on top of steaks. Transfer steaks from oven to cutting boardslice thinly against grain of meat. Spread hoagie rolls with butter or mayolayer onions, steak slices, provolone slices, and any remaining onion mixture on bottom halves of rollsreplace top halves of rolls. Cut sandwiches in halfserve immediately.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add onion, bell pepper, garlic, and mushrooms, cooking until tender. Add rice and Cajun seasoning to skilletsaute 1 minute more, stirring constantly. Add chicken broth and bring to a boilcook until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heatstir in pecans and serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan. Add the garlic, courgettes, lemon zest, lemon juice and basil. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the pasta. Drain. Add the basil to the pasta mixture. Season. Sprinkle with the Parmesan. Serve.

Heat oil to 350 degrees. Make small balls out of pancake mix and drop into oil 3-4 at a time. Fry 3 minutes or until golden brown. Drain on paper towel lined plate. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar mixture or cinnamon sugar mixture or just cinnamon while still hot.

Cook potatoes until tender. Cut into quarters or cubes. Cook onions until tender and golden brown. Combine potatoes, onions, eggs, parsley, sour cream, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, pepper and olive oil in large bowl. Toss until well blended. Chill, covered, up to 3 days. Garnish with parsley if desired. Makes 10 servings
Toast two slices of bread. Spread one slice with cream cheese. Spread mayonnaise on other slice. Spread cheese slice with mayonnaise. Place on other slice.

Combine all ingredients in a saucepan over medium-low heat. Stir gently until all of the caramels are melted and the mixture is smooth. Pour into a greased 9x13 pan. Let cool. Crumble toasted rice cereal into a small bowl. Sprinkle evenly over caramel layer. Chill for 2 hours. Remove from pan and cut into squares. Store leftovers covered at room temperature.
Mix sauce ingredients together. Toss chicken with sauce. Form into patties. Dip into corn flakes crumbs. Coat with parmesan cheese. Broil for 3-4 minutes per side. Serve with mozzarella cheese.

Brown ground round and drain. Add pizza sauce and seasonings and simmer until done. Remove from heat and add cooked elbow macaroni and reduced fat cheddar cheese and mix well. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serve and enjoy!

Melt the butter in a 3-quart saucepan over low heat. Add the garlic and saute until golden. Remove the garlic with a slotted spoon and add the cream cheese. Stir over low heat until the cheese is melted and smooth. Add the milk and the parmesan cheese. Cook until the mixture is thick and smooth. Stir in the cayenne pepper. Serve over pasta.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In a large bowl combine the sugar, butter, and buttermilkbeat until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. Stir in the vanilla. In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking soda, and saltstir well. Add to the batter alternately with the bananas, beginning and ending with the flour mixture. Fold in the blueberries. Spoon the batter into the muffin cups. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely.

Boil potatoes until just tender. Drain and let cool. In a small bowl, whisk together red wine vinegar and oil. Add potatoes, and stir well. Add dill, and season with salt and pepper. Stir in peppers and green onions. Garnish with feta cheese. Serve chilled.

Season the pork loin with the salt. In a skillet over medium high heat add the oil and the garlic. Saut for about a minute. Add the herbs and cook for a few minutes. Remove the garlic and the herbs. Rub the pork loin with the oil mixture. Place the pork on a baking sheet and roast for about 1 hour. Serve with a side of roasted potatoes and your favorite veggie.

Slice leek and fry in olive oil. Add butternut squash, salt and pepper. Cook until squash is tender. Add beans and water. Cook until tender. Add rotel tomatoes and herbes de provence. Add cheese and bacon. Cook until cheese is melted. Serve over rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Whisk together the flour, sugar, custard powder, vanilla and salt in a medium bowl. In a separate bowl, cream together the butter and milk until smooth. Stir the milk mixture into the flour mixture until just combinedmix in the chocolate chips.Drop the batter by teaspoons onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes in the preheated oven. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 2 minutes on the baking sheet. Move to wire racks to cool completely before serving.

Combine the first five ingredients. Stir until smooth. Pour into pie shell. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle topping over the pie. Return to oven for 2 minutes. Remove from oven and cool.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large bowl, combine strawberries and white sugar. Toss with 1/2 cup water. Drain off excess water before serving. In a small bowl combine vinegar and 1 teaspoon of water. Blend in the olive oil, and the poppy seeds. Add the dressing to the spinach. Toss well. Top with feta cheese, strawberries, onions and nuts. Serve at room temperature.

Slice hot dog buns in half lengthwise. Spread each half with 1 tsp butter. Sprinkle with 1/4 tsp parmesan cheese and 1/8 tsp sesame seeds. Bake in a 400 f oven 8-10 minutes or until golden. Cool slightly. Serve.

In a 5-quart slow cooker, combine onion, garlic, water, barbecue sauce, salt, and pepper. Place pork roast on top of onion mixture. Cover and cook on low until pork is fork tender, 8 to 10 hours. Remove pork from slow cookercool slightly. Shred pork with 2 forks, discarding any fat, then return pork to slow cooker. Cover and cook on high until pork is heated through, about 1 hour. Serve pork on buns with coleslaw or other toppings as desired.

Preheat the oven to 325 degrees F. Grease a 10-inch tube pan or bundt pan. Cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Add the flour and beat just until combined. Add the vanilla. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour and 20 minutes, or until a cake tester comes out clean. Cool in the pan 10 minutes on a wire rack. Remove from the pan and cool completely on a wire rack. Dust lightly with confectioners' sugar.

Combine sugar cornstarch & water in saucepan & stir over heat until boiling, then boil for 1 minute stirring constantly. Remove from heat & add butter & lemon rind lemon juice & stir until mixture thickens & becomes smooth. Serve warm over shortbread cookies cake or meringue & top with fruit.

Cut cabbage into thin strips. Bring apple juice to a boil in a large skillet. Add cabbage and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Drain cabbage in a colander. Toss cabbage with apples, raisins, vinegar, honey, and oil in large salad bowl.

Peel and trim the turnips and cut into one inch pieces. Place in a medium saucepan with the butter and just enough water to cover the vegetables by about one inch. Bring to a boil and cook for about 10 minutes until the turnips are tender. Drain the vegetables and add the milk. Cook for about two minutes and then puree the mixture using an immersion blender or a food processor. Season with salt and pepper and add more milk if you want a smoother texture. The cream will thicken as it cools. You can make the turnip cream a day in advance and refrigerate it until you are ready to serve it.
Mix all ingredients together except pretzels. Chill overnight and shape into a pumpkin form. Serve with pretzel sticks or crackers.

Wash & trim off any tough outer stalks from bulb. Cut bulb into thin strips. Heat butter in a large frying pan. Add fennel & saute over med heat until tender. Add garlic & cook until aromatic. Add thyme & season well. Cook until fragrant. Add wine & cook until alcohol has evaporated. Add chicken stock & simmer until tender. Season to taste. Drizzle with a little extra butter just before serving. Serve immediately.

Boil the potatoes in the salted water for about 20 minutes or until tender. Drain the potatoes and allow them to cool slightly. Peel the potatoes and cut them into bite-size pieces. Set the potatoes aside. Peel and dice the eggs into cubes and add to the potatoes along with the onions and sweet gherkins. Add the dressing and toss well. Season to taste with salt and pepper and refrigerate until ready to serve.

In large bowl mix eggs and milk. Add salt and pepper to taste. Heat butter in large skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture and swirl pan to coat bottom of skillet. Continue to cook and stir until eggs are set. Fold in half and slide onto plate.

Combine soy sauce, garlic, sugar and white wine in a large nonreactive bowl, mixing well. Add the pork chops and stir until well coated. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat. Add pork chops and cook until browned on both sides, about 4 minutes per side. Add cornstarch mixture to the liquid from the marinade and bring to a boil in a small saucepan over medium-high heat. Stir constantly until sauce thickens and clears slightly, about 2 minutes. Pour sauce over the pork chops and stir gently until well combined. Serve hot with rice or noodles.

Cut parsnips into 1/4-inch slices. Place oil and salt in a shallow bowl. Add parsnips and toss to coat. Arrange slices in a single layer on baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes or until browned and tender. Cool slices on a baking sheet for 10 minutes. Place slices on a baking sheet and sprinkle with herbs. Return to oven until crisp, about 10 minutes. Transfer to paper towels to cool. Yield 4 servings.

Process the cottage cheese in a food processor until smooth. Add the eggs, one at a time, processing well between each addition. Add the remaining ingredients and process until smooth and well combined. Pour into a 15x10x2 inch pan. Bake for approximately 1 hour or until the centre is firm when lightly pressed with a finger. Cool on a wire rack to room temperature. Serve with fruit or on its own.

Combine ricotta cheese and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Add cream and beat until well blended. Stir in chopped cherries and chopped nuts. Spoon into individual cannoli shells and refrigerate until firm. Top with a dollop of whipped cream and a cherry garnish.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine sugar, cranberries, water and port. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Simmer until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Pour sauce into a serving bowl. Garnish with cranberries and a cinnamon stick. Serve warm. Makes about 3 cups.

Sift flour, cornmeal and baking soda together in large bowl. Set aside. In medium bowl combine eggs, milk, margarine and vanilla. Beat well with mixer. Combine dry and wet ingredients together just until moistened. Fold in 1 cup jam. Spoon into greased muffin cups, filling each half full. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-25 minutes or until done. Makes 12 muffins.

Combine cereal and butterscotch chips in an ungreased 8x8x2-inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until golden brown, stirring twice. Spread chocolate chips on top. Bake at 350 degrees for an additional 2 to 3 minutes or until chips are melted and golden brown. Cool completely before cutting into squares. Store in an air-tight container at room temperature for up to three weeks.

Pierce each chicken breast with a fork, put them in the crock pot. Add sauerkraut and top with Swiss cheese slices. Cover and cook on low for 5-6 hours or on high for about 3 hours or until chicken is cooked through and fork pierces easily. Serve on pumpernickel bread with thousand island dressing on each sandwich.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, heat oil and saute onion until tender, about 5 minutes. Add kielbasa and cook until browned, about 5 minutes more. Add beans and rice and cook 2 minutes more, stirring often. Add broth and stir in garlic powder and cayenne. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer 20 minutes or until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Season with thyme and serve immediately. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 425. In small bowl, combine filling ingredients. Pour into pastry shells. Bake for 15 minutes. Reduce oven to 350. Bake 1 hour longer or until filling is set. Cool slightly. Makes 8 servings.

In a large saucepan cook the rotini according to package directions until al dente. In a skillet heat the oil over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and cook 30 seconds until lightly browned. Add the red onion and cook 2 minutes. Add the zucchini and cook 3 minutes until softened. Add the tomatoes with their juices and bring to a boil. Add the pasta cooked in the saucepan and the juice from the lemon. Stir in the basil and the parmesan cheese. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

In a large saucepan saute onion in butter until tender. Add macaroni, tomatoes, water, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil then cover and simmer for about 10 minutes or until tender. Uncover and add breadcrumbs. Cover and cook for about 5 minutes. Serve in warm bowls. Top with fresh parsley if desired. Enjoy and serve it with love.

Mix flour and salt in a bowl. Add oil and water slowly until dough forms a ball. Use a rolling pin to roll out the dough to about 1/8 thickness. Cut the dough into 1 inch rounds and use a drinking glass to punch out 2 or 3 round holes in the center of each round of dough. Fill each hole with 1-2 teaspoons filling and pinch dough over the top to close the hole. Place on a plate and cover with a damp paper towel or plastic wrap to prevent drying. Continue with remaining dough and filling until all the dough has been used. Boil for about 3 minutes or until pierogies float to the top of the water. Drain and serve with butter.

Beat eggs in bowl. Stir in milk. Add cream cheese and chives. Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add egg mixture. Cook until eggs are set. Flip and cook an additional minute or two. Remove from skillet and serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400. Grease 4-6 individual ramekins or muffin tins. Cut the apples in half and remove cores. Put apples in ramekins and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Bake apples in the preheated oven for 30 minutes. In a medium bowl combine the flour, sugar, butter, vanilla, nutmeg and milk. Cook over medium heat until smooth, stirring constantly. Remove apples from the oven and pour over the topping. Bake for an additional 10-20 minutes until apples are tender. Serve hot.

Place all but soymilk in a small pot and bring to a boil. Remove from heat and add soymilk. Return to heat and cook until thick and bubbly, about 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add butter and zest. Cool slightly before using. Serve over pancakes or waffles, or use in your favourite dessert recipe.

In a food processor, combine all the salsa ingredients. Process to make smooth. Salt and pepper to taste. Chill until ready to serve. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Season scallops with the salt and pepper. Cook scallops for 3-5 minutes each side until done. Transfer to serving plates. Spoon the salsa over the scallops.

Grease 9x9x2 inch pan. Mix cocoa and sugar together. Add eggs, 1 at a time. Beat well after each addition. Add vanilla and mix well. Combine flour and salt. Add to mixture and stir until blended. Spread in pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25-30 minutes. Cool in pan. Cut in squares.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle steaks with salt and paprika. Add sage and garlic to hot oil. Cook steaks 2 minutes. Turn steaks over and cook 2 minutes more. Brush with pan drippings. Cook 1 minute longer. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

In a large saucepan, bring 4 quarts water to a boil. Add onion, celery, green bell pepper, ramen noodles, soy sauce, and egg drop mixture. Cook for 10 minutes, or until noodles are tender. Makes 8 servings (1 cup).

Heat oil in a nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add chilies and onioncook and stir until tender. Remove from heat. Lightly spray a 9x13-inch baking pan with cooking sprayspread half of the corn muffin mix in the bottom of the pan. Top with half of the enchilada sauce, half of the green onion and chilies mixture and half of the cheesesprinkle with half of the eggs and half of the cilantro. Repeat layers twice. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until firm. Serve with refried beans.

Cut the top off the heads of garlic so that the tops can be discarded and the garlic can be removed easily. Remove the paper around the top of the garlic. Put the garlic in a large pot with water to cover by 1 inch. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat so that the water is just simmering. Simmer until the garlic is very tender when pierced with a knife, 20 to 40 minutes depending on the size of the head of garlic. Remove the garlic and let cool. Squeeze the garlic out of its skin. Blend the garlic puree with the water to make a smooth sauce. The puree can be refrigerated overnight. The roasted garlic can be stored in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week. To make the roasted garlic oil, heat the canola and extra virgin olive oils in a small pot over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the roasted garlic and cook until the garlic turns brown. Strain the garlic out of the oil with a fine-mesh strainer
Mix together slaw mix, mayonnaise, salt and pepper. Cut up cooked chicken into small pieces. Layer coleslaw mix onto tortilla. Top with chicken. Fold tortilla and serve.

Bring water to boil in a large pot over high heat. Add pasta and cook for the time indicated on package instructions. While the pasta cooks, in a small bowl combine the tahini, soy sauce and toasted sesame oil. Mix well. Add garlic, gingerroot and onion and cook until fragrant and well combined, about 1 minute. Drain the pasta and place in a large bowl. Add the garlic mixture and toss until well coated. Add the cilantro and toss gently until combined. Serve at once or refrigerate until ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Cut the cod into small bite size pieces and put into a small dish. Add the lemon juice and pepper and toss to coat. Place the fish mixture onto a baking sheet lined with aluminum foil and bake 10 minutes. Meanwhile, cut the tomato into bite size pieces. Place the tomatoes, green peppers and onion into a small dish and toss to coat. Remove the fish from the oven and top each piece of fish with a small spoonful of the tomato mixture. Sprinkle each piece of fish with breadcrumbs and drizzle each piece of fish with a small amount of oil. Return the fish to the oven and continue baking 10 minutes or until the fish is cooked through. Remove from oven and sprinkle basil over each piece of fish. Serve immediately.

Put 150ml of water and 150g of sugar in a saucepan and bring to the boil. Stir until the sugar has dissolved, then add the lemon juice. Allow to cool and add the lemonade. Chill for a few hours in the fridge. Just before serving pour over ice cubes and add the mint leaves.

Bring chicken stock to a boil and add ravioli to it. Cook about 5 minutes or until ravioli is tender. Add spinach to stock and cover. Cook for about 3 minutes or until spinach is wilted. Drain. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Drain spinach and place in a serving dish with ravioli. Top with parmesan cheese. Serve with italian bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Sauté onion and green bell pepper in oil until tender. Add italian sausage and cook until browned. Drain fat from pan. Stir in diced tomatoes and stewed italian tomatoescook 2 minutes. Add ketchupcook and stir until heated through. Arrange pasta in a 13 x 9 inch baking dishtop with tomato mixture and mozzarella cheese. Bake uncovered for 25 minutes or until heated through. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve immediately. Serves 10.

In large skillet over medium high heat add oil and sausage. Cook until browned about 10 minutes. Pour in tomato sauce. Stir in oregano. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and cook for 35 minutes. Add chablis. Stir gently. Cook 10 minutes. Stir in mushrooms. Cook 5 more minutes. Serve over pasta.
Marinate steaks in sauce at least 1 hour or overnight. Remove steaks from marinade. Discard marinade. Cook steaks on grill or pan-fry. Baste frequently with remaining marinade. Serve with steaks.

In a large skillet, saute onion, carrot and celery in oil until tender. Add salmon and cook until lightly browned. In a large pot over medium heat, combine barley and water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low and cook 50 minutes. Add rice and cook 15 minutes more. Add salmon mixture to rice and barley. Add cilantro and pepper. Cover and cook 10 minutes more. Remove from heat and let stand 10 minutes. Serve.

Place a medium saucepan over low heat. Add the raspberries and sugar. Stir to combine. Cook and stir the mixture until the sugar has dissolved. Increase heat to medium high and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat to medium and cook until the mixture thickens. Stir in the port and chile. Serve warm.

Combine sugar, corn syrup and 1/2 cup water in saucepan. Bring to boiling. Add cereal. Stir to coat. Remove from heat. Stir in peanut butter. Press into waxed paper lined jellyroll pan. Chill. Melt chocolate as directed on package. Drizzle chocolate over top of cereal mixture. Chill. Cut into 1-inch squares.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add onion and saute until golden brown. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute more. Whisk in milk. Cook over medium heat, stirring until thickened and bubbly. Whisk in cream and paprika. Stir in sherry and lobster meat. Sprinkle with chives and serve at once. Makes 8 servings.

In a 3 quart saucepan combine the rice, celery, onions and butter. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat. Simmer, covered, for 20 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Stir in the orange rind. Let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in the orange juice, water and parsley. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 20-30 minutes or until the rice is golden brown. Garnish with slivered almonds. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add sugar and water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Add cooking apples and sauerkraut. Cook and stir until mixture is thickened. Add frankfurter and cooked parsley. Serve on hot buns.

Mix balsamic vinegar, honey, soy sauce, brown sugar, rosemary and garlic in a small bowl. Add drumsticks and coat evenly on all sides. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight. Preheat oven to 450°F. Arrange drumsticks on a rimmed baking sheet. Bake for 20 minutes or until drumsticks are cooked through. Remove from oven and let rest for at least 15 minutes before serving. Serve with sesame seeds and parsley garnish if desired.

Place the ham flat on a cookie sheet and bake for 1 hour at 375 degrees or until the ham is heated through. Mix the orange juice, brown sugar and ground mustard together and pour over the ham and bake for an additional hour.

In a small bowl whisk together vinegar and mustard. Gradually whisk in the olive oil. Season to taste with thyme. Add the greens to a large bowl and toss together. Add the cranberries, pecans, and red onion. Top with cheese. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar and salt. In a small bowl, combine milk, buttermilk and lemon juice. Add to dry mixture and stir with a wooden spoon just until dough forms. Turn dough onto a lightly floured surface. Knead lightly 4 to 6 times. Form into a round loaf about 8 inches in diameter. Place in a greased 8-inch square pan. In a small bowl, combine sugar and cinnamon. Cut a shallow cross in the top of the loaf. Sprinkle with cinnamon-sugar mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in pan for 10 minutes before removing to wire rack to cool completely. Slice before serving.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. Peel potatoes and cut into chunks. Add potatoes to a large saucepan with water to cover. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to low and cook until tender, about 20 minutes. Drain the potatoes and mash them. In a small saucepan melt 4 tablespoons butter with 1 chopped onion over medium heat until onions are softened, 5 to 10 minutes. Whisk into the mashed potatoes along with 1 cup sour cream. Add 2 cups orange juice, 1/4 teaspoon salt and the zest of 1 orange. Fold to combine. Place potatoes into a large casserole dish. Place the remaining 3 tablespoons of butter into a small saucepan with the remaining 1/4 cup sour cream. Heat until melted, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir into the mashed potatoes along with 1/4 cup orange zest. Spoon over the potatoes. Bake until warmed through and bubbly, 15 to

Sift dry ingredients together in a bowl. In another bowl, cream together margarine and brown sugar until well blended. Beat in the applesauce and the eggs one at a time. Stir in the dry ingredients. Refrigerate the dough for at least 3 hours or overnight. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Roll the dough out on a lightly floured surface about 1/2 inch thick. Cut out with cookie cutters, then place on a baking sheet. Bake for about 8 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden brown.

Cut pork into 1 inch chunks. Place in a roasting dish. Combine brown sugar, tequila, molasses, garlic cloves. Pour over the pork. Cover with foil and place in a 350 degree F oven for 3 hours. After 2 hours stir in the salt and the black pepper. After 3 hours add enough water to make a sauce. Stir. Baste the pork in the sauce. Cook for another hour. Remove the pork from the sauce. Pull the pork apart with two forks. Stir the sauce into the pork. Add the sliced green onions. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Grease 15x10x1 inch jelly roll pan with shortening. In large bowl with mixer beat sugar, eggs, vanilla and cinnamon. In small bowl with fork combine flour, baking powder and salt. In large bowl with electric mixer beat shortening into sugar mixture. Beat in flour mixture until well blended. Spread in pan. In small bowl combine milk and vanilla. Brush over top. Bake 20-25 minutes. Cool completely. Cut into 2 inch squares. Store in airtight container. Makes about 36 squares.

Cook pasta according to package directions and set aside. In a bowl add mayonnaise and beef bouillon powder and blend well. Add the seasoning and blend well. Add the shrimp and mix well. Add the pasta and mix well. Add the pickles and the pickle juice and mix well. Add the sweet onion and mix well. Refrigerate for 3 hours before serving.

In a shallow dish combine mayonnaise with onions. In a separate shallow dish combine lipton onion soup mix with parmesan cheese. Dip pork chops into mayonnaise mixture and then into soup mix mixture. Place pork chops in a baking dish. Spray with pam and bake for 45 minutes. Cook until meat thermometer reaches 160 degrees.

In a large bowl cream the butter, sugars and vanilla until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolk and mix well. Stir in the flour until the dough is fully combined. Fold in the chocolate chips. Divide the dough equally between 3 microwave safe mugs. Microwave on high for 60 seconds. Let stand for 1 minute. Serve immediately.

Slice cucumbers 1/4-inch thick. In small saucepan, combine cider vinegar, sugar, mustard seeds, garlic and chilies. Bring to boil over medium heat. Boil 1 minute. Remove from heat. Let cool slightly. Arrange cucumbers on a serving platter or shallow bowl. Pour vinegar mixture over cucumbers, sprinkle with salt to taste. Garnish with onions and tomatoes. Makes 4 servings.

Cut the chicken breasts or pieces into thin strips. Place the chicken in a bowl with the other ingredients (except for the scallions) and toss to coat. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to 24 hours. Thread the chicken onto skewers or place on a tray (no skewers) and broil for 2 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Arrange the chicken on a platter, sprinkle with the scallions and serve with rice or noodles and dipping sauce.
Place all ingredients in a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Chill. Serve with seafood.

Heat peanut oil and onions over medium heat in heavy pot until onions are lightly browned and just beginning to soften. Add the peanut butter, cardamom, and soy sauce and continue cooking until mixture thickens and becomes smooth, stirring constantly. Add lemon juice and seasoning and mix well. Simmer for about 2 minutes. Serve warm or refrigerate and serve cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Line 18 muffin cups with paper baking cups.Combine cake mix, water, pumpkin, and vanilla extractbeat 1 minute at low speed of mixer scraping sides of bowl constantly. Beat 1 minute at high speed. Divide batter evenly into prepared muffin cups filling each about three-fourths full.Bake 18 to 20 minutes or until wooden pick inserted near center of cupcakes comes out clean.Cool 10 minutes.Remove from panscool completely on wire racks.Frost with Buttercream Frosting.

In a large bowl or mixer bowl, stir together flour, salt, honey and vegetable oil. In a small bowl, beat together egg yolk and milkadd to dry mixture. Stir in enough of the milk mixture to form a soft dough that holds together. Knead on a lightly floured board for 5-8 minutes. Cover with a damp cloth and let rest for 10 minutes. Divide dough into 8 equal portions. On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 6-in. circle. Place on a greased baking sheet. Bake in a 350° oven for 15-20 minutes or until lightly browned. Yields one loaf.

Rub chicken breasts with olive oil and rosemary. In a small bowl, combine vinegar with 1/4 teaspoon salt and 1/8 teaspoon black pepper. Add garlic. Rub mixture over chicken. Broil chicken 4 to 5 inches from heat until chicken is browned. Turn chicken over and broil until done.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Mix together potato flakes and buttermilk in a shallow dish. Mix salt and pepper to taste. Dip each fillet into the potato mixture then coat with butter. Bake in oven for 10 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serve with lemon wedges.
Cut lamb into cubes and brown in oil in a large sauce pan. Add the split peas, broth, onion, apricots, prunes, almonds, salt and pepper. Simmer until the meat is tender, about one hour.
Heat the oil in a skillet. Add the garlic and cook it until golden. Add the green beans and the rosemary. Sprinkle with salt. Toss everything together well. Serve warm.

Wash and dry the okra. Cut off the ends of the okra and slice into 1 inch lengths. Heat the oil in a large skillet and add the okra and onions. Cook over medium heat for about 15 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 3 minutes. Add the garlic and ginger and cook for about 10 minutes. Add the cardamom. Add the jalapenos and cook for 5 more minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

Combine wheat and yogurt in a bowl. Let stand for 10 minutes. Beat egg in a small bowl and stir into wheat mixture. Add water and salt. Add onion and parsley. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter and cook until melted. Add wheat mixture and cook until heated through. Serve hot.

Soak the dried beans overnight in cold water to cover by 3 inches in a large saucepan. Drain the soaked beans and rinse. Add them to a fresh pot of cold water to cover by 3 inches along with the onion, garlic, bay leaves and 1 teaspoon of salt. Bring to a boil over high heat, then reduce the heat to medium low and simmer until the beans are tender but not mushy, about 2 hours, skimming off any foam as it rises to the top. When the beans are tender, discard the bay leaves, then transfer the beans to a blender in batches and puree until smooth. Return the bean puree to the pot, add the chile guajillo strips and the remaining 1 teaspoon of salt and cook over low heat for about 10 minutes more, stirring occasionally until the chile strips have broken down into the soup, then remove from the heat. Taste and season with additional salt if needed. Serve warm in bowls, topped with avocado and crumbled white cheese, garnished with chopped cil

Preheat oven to 375f. Roll out pastry for bottom crust and fit into a 9-inch pie plateflute edges. Roll out top crustplace on rolling pin, then place over bottom crust. Trim to 1/2-inch overhangflute edges. Press edges together to sealtrim to 1/2-inch overhangseal and flute edges. In a small saucepan over medium heat, bring cranberries, sugar, tapioca, water, orange zest and salt to a boilreduce heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes, or until thickened. Remove from heatstir in cinnamon and butter. Pour into pastry-lined pie platespread evenly. Place baking apples on topsprinkle with cinnamon and nutmegdot with butter. Roll out top crustplace over applesseal and flute edges. Cut several slits in top to allow steam to escape. Bake for 1 hour or until top crust is goldencool completely before cutting.

Flour chicken breasts. Season with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Brown the chicken breasts on both sides in the hot oil. Remove the chicken from the skillet. Add wine to the skillet. Bring to a boil, scraping up the brown bits from the bottom of the pan. Add sage leaves and chicken broth. Return chicken to the skillet. Cover and simmer for about 5 minutes. Remove chicken to a serving dish. Add mustard and butter to the pan juices and heat through. Pour over the chicken.

Peel and slice sweet potatoes into 1/4 inch thick rounds. Place in a large bowl and add orange juice and zest. Let stand until tender, about 10 minutes. Mash potatoes with a potato masher. Add brown sugar, nutmeg, coconut and cinnamon. Mix until well blended. Roll into 1 inch balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. Bake in a 350 degree F oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven. In a small bowl, combine marshmallows and 2 tsp. of granulated sugar. Spoon over top of potato balls. Return to oven and continue to bake for 3-4 minutes or until marshmallows are browned and toasted. Remove and let cool for 10 minutes. Store in the refrigerator. May be frozen.
Mix all ingredients except broccoli and noodles and bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. Add noodles and broccoli and bake another 25 minutes.

Cut pears into bite-sized pieces. Mix together cheese, walnuts, lettuce and sugar. In separate container, mix vinegar, Tabasco Sauce and salt and pepper to taste. Add oil slowly while whisking rapidly. Toss lettuce mixture with vinaigrette. Arrange pears on top of salad. Serve at once or refrigerate for up to two hours.

Heat a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat for 3 minutes. Add onion. Cook and stir 4 to 5 minutes or until onion is lightly browned. Stir in tomatoes and olives. Cook for 1 minute. Add spinach and parsley and cook for 2 to 3 minutes or until spinach is wilted and mixture is hot. Stir in penne and serve immediately.

Heat a skillet over medium heat. Melt butter. Add garlic and saute for 30 seconds. Add mushrooms and saute for 3 minutes. Season with salt, pepper, nutmeg and lemon juice. Add cream and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool. Butter bread slices on one side. Spread a thin layer of mushroom mixture onto the slices. Sprinkle with parsley and serve.

Cut chicken in parts as desired. Rinse in cold water and pat dry with paper towels. Mix flour, salt, pepper and paprika together in a bowl. Dip chicken pieces in the flour mixture, shaking off excess. Combine milk and egg in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken in milk mixture and shake off excess. Place floured chicken in frying pan or electric skillet and fry in hot oil over medium heat until well browned. Drain on paper towels or brown paper bag. Season to taste.

Roast apricots in a 325f oven until softened and juices are beginning to run. Puree apricots along with 2 tbsp of water. Stir sugar into the puree, dissolving it. Add water to bring mixture to 1 cup. Add lemon juice and almond extract. Stir in 1/4 cup of the apricot puree along with 2 tbsp of water to the sorbet mixture. Freeze mixture in a food processor according to manufacturer s instructions until firm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a cookie sheet with cooking spray. Mix all ingredients in a large bowl. Mix well. Shape into 20 small cookies on the prepared cookie sheet. Bake 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Allow to cool 10 minutes on cookie sheet before removing. Makes 20 cookies.

Combine the first 4 ingredients in a small saucepan and cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens. Combine the remaining 7 ingredients in a slow cooker. Add the beef and mix well. Cover and cook 12 to 18 hours. Remove brisket from the sauce and cut into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Toss the brisket with the sauce and serve.

Melt butter in medium saucepan over low heat. Stir flour and gradually stirring constantly with a whisk. Cook and stir for 5 minutes or until flour mixture turns golden. Remove from heat. Slowly pour in beaten eggs and stir constantly with a whisk. Return to low heat and stir constantly for about 3 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in cheese and butter. Fill each dumpling wrapper with about 1 heaping tablespoon of the cheese mixture. Fold over one side and twist to seal. Place the sealed side down in a large pot. Add the broth to the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for 40 minutes. Remove from heat and allow to sit for at least 15 minutes before serving.

Peel and cut potatoes into 1-inch cubes. Place in a large pot of boiling salted water. Cook until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Drain potatoes and transfer to a large bowl. Let cool slightly. In a small bowl, combine vinegar, celery and onions. Set aside. In another small bowl, whisk mayonnaise and yogurt. Add to potatoes and stir to combine.
