Stir in celery mixture and season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon and sausage until browned. Drain the meat and set aside. In a large bowl combine the sausage, bacon and eggs. Add the parsley and stir. Mix in the sour cream. Spread mixture evenly over the bottom of the pie shell. Sprinkle the cheese over the top. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool 5 minutes before serving.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lay out 10 pie crusts. Spread 1/2 cup spaghetti sauce on each one. Sprinkle 1/3 cup shredded mozzarella cheese on top. Sprinkle with mushrooms. Top with slices of chicken. Place on baking sheet. Bake for 10 minutes or until crusts are golden. Serve with extra sauce.

Melt butter. Add sugar and beat until creamy. Add lemon juice and zest and beat until well blended. Add egg and mix well. Add flour and baking soda and beat until well blended. Chill until dough is easy to handle. Roll dough into 1" balls and place 1" apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 12 minutes at 350 degrees. Cool. Dust with powdered sugar.

Drain tuna from can and combine with celery, onion and mayonnaise. Toast buns. Spread tuna mixture evenly on buns. Top buns with mozzarella cheese and tomato slices. Add lettuce leaves as desired. Makes 2 servings.

To make coffee, fill pot halfway with water and bring water to boil. Add coffee and bring back up to boil. Reduce heat and allow coffee to simmer for 5 minutes. Strain coffee, return liquid to pot, and bring back up to boil. Reduce heat and allow coffee to simmer for 5 more minutes. Strain coffee again, return liquid to pot, and bring back up to boil. Reduce heat again and allow coffee to simmer for another 5 minutes. Strain coffee once more, return liquid back to pot and let cool for 5 minutes. Add 1 teaspoon of ground cardamom, 1 pinch of saffron, and 1 pinch of rose water. Stir well and serve.
Prepare mac and cheese according to package. Add broccoli cheese soup to it. Add a can of meat. Serve.

Combine tomato paste and hot sauce and set aside. In a large bowl, combine parsley, shrimp, olive oil, oregano and lemon juicetoss to coat. Thread shrimp onto skewers and set aside. Preheat grill to medium. Grill shrimp for 2-3 minutes on each side or until shrimp are opaque. Place the shrimp on a serving platter and brush with tomato paste mixture. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Bring whole milk to simmer in large heavy-bottomed saucepan. Add rice and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until rice is tender and milk has been absorbed, about 30 minutes. Add sugar and cook over moderate heat, stirring occasionally, until sugar has dissolved and rice mixture is light golden brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in butter until melted. Off heat, add vanilla and salt. Scrape rice into large bowl. Beat egg and egg yolk in small bowl. Beat eggs into rice mixture. Pour mixture into large baking dish and let cool for 2 hours. Beat heavy cream and 1/2 cup sugar in large bowl until stiff peaks form. Fold whipped cream into rice mixture. Spoon rice mixture into 6 small individual ramekins or 1 large one. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Refrigerate for at least 4 hours. Serve with whipped cream.

In a large sauce pan heat the oil and saute the celery and carrot. Add the chicken and saute until browned. Add the remaining ingredients and bring to a boil. Turn down the heat and let simmer for 30 minutes. Serve with rice and a green vegetable.

Cut tomatoes in halves. In a large bowl combine tomatoes with lemon juice, sugar, extra virgin olive oil and savory. Season with salt to taste. Cover with plastic wrap and marinate for 10 minutes. Add the garlic. Serve at room temperature.

Place apricots in a bowl and cover with boiling water for 15 minutes. Drain, chop and reserve for use in the spread. In a medium saucepan combine remaining ingredients and simmer, stirring occasionally until smooth and thickened about 10 minutes. Cool completely and spread on crackers or toast.
Mix all ingredients together and pour into a greased casserole dish. Bake at 400 for 30 minutes.

In large bowl combine broccoli florets and red onion. In medium bowl combine cider vinegar and sweetener until dissolved. Gradually add mayonnaise and mix thoroughly. Toss with broccoli mixture. Sprinkle with sunflower seeds and raisins. Serve immediately or chill before serving. May be made 4 hours ahead.

In a large bowl, combine the warm water and the honey. Add the oil and mix well. Stir in the salt and cinnamon. Set aside. In a small bowl, combine the oatmeal and yeast. Add the warm water mixture and stir. Let stand for 5 minutes or until foamy. Add the bread flour and stir. Cover and set aside for 30 minutes. Stir in the raisins. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic, about 8 minutes. Place in an oiled bowl, turning to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled. Punch down the dough. Divide into 2 loaves. Shape into round loaves and place in two 9×5 greased loaf pans. Cover and let rise until doubled. Bake at 375 for 40 to 45 minutes. Cool in the pans on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove from pans and cool completely on the wire rack.

Saut the italian sausage until browned. Add the zucchini and summer squash. Cook until tender. In a separate pan, add the water and pasta sauce. Add the pasta and cook for 1 minute. Add the sausage mixture to the pasta sauce mixture along with the garbanzo beans. Add the beef bouillon cube. Let simmer for 10 minutes. Serve with grated parmesan cheese on top.

1) Melt margarine in saucepan and add gluten. Stir and let sit until the gluten is softened, about 5 minutes.2) Add all the remaining ingredients and stir well until you get a smooth mixture.3) Pour into an ovenproof dish and bake for 1 hour at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).

Saute garlic cloves and oil over low heat for about a minute or until garlic is golden and has developed a fragrance. Stir in chicken broth and seasonings to taste. Heat through. Serve topped with croutons or bread cubes and a poached egg. Sprinkle with cheese if desired.

Cook potatoes in boiling water until tender. Drain potatoes. Mash potatoes with sour cream. Add cream. Stir in cheeses. Spoon into a baking dish. Sprinkle with chives. Bake at 400 for 20 minutes until bubbly. 928. 3 grams.

Chop chicken in a bowl. Add celery, onion, salt, lemon juice, mayonnaise and mix well. Add grapes and mandarin oranges and mix well. Place lettuce in 4 individual plates and place salad on top of lettuce. Garnish with almonds and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream butter and brown sugar. Add eggs and vanilla essence. Sift dry ingredients. Add to creamed mixture and stir. Drop by teaspoonful on to greased tray. Bake for 10-12 minutes. Cool on trays.
Blend all ingredients in a blender until smooth. Makes 2 servings.

Cream margarine and vanilla together. Add caramel and mix well. Add marshmallow cream. In a separate bowl mix together pecans and powdered sugar. Add to the caramel mixture. Roll into 18 inch long log. Wrap in wax paper. Refrigerate.

Thaw frozen spinach in microwave until liquid is gone and spinach is pliable. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter and saute onion and garlic until tender and onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the spinach and cook until liquid has evaporated and the spinach has wilted and is completely cooked, about 5 more minutes. Cool mixture completely. In a large bowl, whisk the eggs and add the spinach mixture and cottage cheese and blend well. In a separate bowl combine the flour and cheese and stir until well blended. Add the flour mixture and the eggs to the spinach mixture and stir just until blended. Spray an 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray and pour the mixture into the dish. Cover tightly with plastic wrap and place in refrigerator for at least 2 hours before baking. Remove from refrigerator and place dish on a baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Serve

Heat oil and garlic over medium heat until soft. Add spinach and cook for 3-4 minutes until wilted. Add beans and cook until heated through. Season with lemon juice, vinegar and salt and pepper. Serve with crackers or bread.

In a large skillet heat 1 tbsp olive oil over medium heat until hot but not smoking. Add the cod and fry until the fish is browned and the oil is no longer bubbling around the fish. Pour in the water and cover the skillet tightly. Cook for 20 minutes until the fish is very tender and flaking apart. Meanwhile, make the scrambled eggs by putting the eggs in a bowl and whisking until well blended. Add the black pepper and set aside. When the cod is ready, remove the cover from the skillet and add the bacon and green pepper. Stir until the bacon is cooked and the green pepper is soft. Add the tomatoes and the scrambled eggs to the skillet and stir gently until the eggs are cooked but not dry. Serve immediately. Serves 6 to 8.

Preheat oven to 400 deg f. Peel eggplant and cut lengthwise into 1/4 inch thick slices. Arrange eggplant slices on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with salt. Bake for 20 minutes or until eggplant is very tender. Remove eggplant from oven. Place eggplant in a bowl. In a small bowl combine soy sauce, palm sugar, lime juice, chili paste and cilantro. Pour over eggplant and toss. Serve with green onions for garnish.

Cut off asparagus stems 2 inches above the bottoms. Toss asparagus stems with 1 tablespoon olive oil and place on baking sheetbake until golden brown and slightly tender, about 30 minutes. Toss shiitake mushrooms with remaining tablespoon olive oil and place on baking sheetbake until tender, about 20 minutes. Toss asparagus with balsamic vinegar to coat and add salt & pepper to taste. Sprinkle with shiitake mushrooms just before serving.

In a small bowl, combine the oats and water and let stand for 3 minutes. In a separate bowl, combine the salt, condensed milk and coconut extract. Add to the oats and stir until creamy. Spoon into 2 bowls and top with flaked coconut. Makes 2 servings.

Place stock, arborio rice and chicken in large pot over high heat. Cook until liquid has reduced by half and rice is just tender. Stir in leek and saffron. Continue cooking until liquid has reduced by half again. Stir in peas and lemon juice. Season and serve immediately. Serves 2.

In a large bowl combine rice, soup and cheesemix well. Divide rice mixture among chicken breast halvesarrange chicken breasts on a baking sheet. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight. Preheat oven to 325F. Bake chicken for 1 hour or until rice is golden brown on top. Yield: 4 servings. Serve with a green salad or steamed vegetables.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line two 9 inch round cake pans with parchment paper. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition. In a small bowl combine the flour, baking powder and saltstir well. Add the flour mixture to the butter mixture alternately with the milk. Mix until smooth. Divide the batter evenly between the two pans. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the middle of the cake comes out clean. Allow the cake to cool for 10 minutes before removing from the pans. While the cake is baking, prepare the icing by combining the butter, confectioners' sugar, lemon juice and rind in a small bowl. When the cake is cool, ice the bottom layer. Place the top layer on the cake. Spread the icing over the top and sides of the cake. Refr

Saute ground beef, onion, and green pepper in a skillet until the meat is brown and the vegetables are tender. Add garlic and continue cooking one minute longer. Stir in the canned tomatoes and tomato paste and cook 30 minutes over low heat. Add seasonings and cook an additional minute or two. Stir in the noodles and cheese and cook until the cheese is melted. Makes enough for four servings.
Cook noodles. Drain. Add butter. Toss. Sprinkle noodles with herbs. Toss. Serves 4 to 6.

Combine ingredients into a ball. Roll dough to 1/4-inch thickness and cut into squares or triangles with a pizza cutter. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes. Remove and allow to cool on a wire rack. Makes 2 dozen crackers.

In a small bowl combine honey, ginger, garlic and soy sauce. Remove skin from chicken and rub all over chicken thighs. Place chicken thighs on a broiling pan and bake 20 minutes at 400 degrees. Turn chicken over and bake another 20 minutes or until juices run clear when chicken is pierced with a fork.

Cut chicken into 1/2 inch cubes. In 10 x 12 baking dish, combine chicken and broccoli. In 2 quart saucepan, combine water and instant rice. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until water is absorbed. Stir in soup and milk. Add garlic salt and pepper. Spoon over chicken and broccoli. Top with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.

Peel and dice potatoes. Place in a medium bowl and cover with watercover and refrigerate for 24 hours or until potatoes are crisp-tender. Drain and pat dry. In another bowl, stir together mayonnaise, sour cream, dill and celery. Toss potatoes with dressing mixturecover and refrigerate for 12 hours or until thoroughly chilled. Sprinkle with onion and garlic before serving.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butterswirl pan to coat. Add shallotscook 30 seconds or until softened. Add garliccook 30 seconds. Add beansstir to coat with butter mixture. Cook 3 minutes or until beans are hot. Add parsleystir. Place beans in a large bowl. Combine vinegar and mustard in a small bowlwhisk. Gradually add oil, whisking constantly until mixture is thick and emulsified. Season with salt and pepper. Drizzle over beans. Toss to coat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve at room temperature.

Heat the olive oil in a saute pan and saute the shiitake mushrooms and ginger until softened. Add the garlic and saute for another minute or so until the garlic turns golden brown. Pour the stock into a medium size pot and add the ginger and mushroom mixture along with the soy sauce and lime juice. Bring the mixture to a boil and then simmer for about 20 minutes until the mixture is thickened. Serve the soup with the noodles and spinach. Garnish with green onions and serve.

I used a sweet sausage but you can use any kind you like. Saute the squash and garlic cloves in a little water and butter until tender. Then add the sausage and cook until done. Drain any excess liquid off of the squash and sausage and return it to the pan on med-low heat. Add the dressing and stir until the dressing thickens and covers the squash and sausage. Top it off with some parmesan and oregano leaves and serve it on some italian bread.

Heat the butter over medium heat. When butter is foaming add the onions. Cook until soft and translucent. Add rice and stir until well coated. Add the bay leaf and 1 teaspoon of the hot pepper sauce. Add the boiling water. Bring to a boil and then cover and turn down to a simmer. Cook for 12-15 minutes or until the liquid is absorbed. Remove the bay leaf. Season to taste. Fold in the frozen peas and the rest of the hot pepper sauce. Garnish the rice with the parsley.

Preheat the oven to 400. Lightly spray the squash halves with cooking spray and place the halves on a baking sheet. Roast for 45 minutes or until squash is tender. When cool enough to handle, remove the seeds and pulp with a spoon. In a large stockpot over medium heat, heat the stock. Add the onion and cook 5 minutes or until softened. Add the garlic and cook 1 minute. Add the rice and cook 1 minute. Add the squash and cook for 2 minutes. Add the rosemary and cook for 1 minute. Add the wine and cook until liquid is evaporated. Add 1 1/2 cups stock and cook until almost completely evaporated. Add 1 cup stock and cook 1 minute or until almost completely evaporated. Add the remaining stock 1/2 cup at a time and cook 1 minute or until liquid is absorbed. Add the cream cheese and cook until melted and well combined. Stir in the squash pulp. Season with salt and pepper. Ladle into bowls and top with balsamic vin

Pour the sweetened condensed milk into a large bowl. Add the milk and beat with an electric mixer on low speed until the milk is completely blended. Add the egg yolks and beat on medium speed until the mixture is thick and smooth. Add the butter and vanilla and beat until smooth and fluffy. Pour the mixture into a 9-inch pie pan and bake in a preheated 350 degree F (175 degree C) oven for 10 minutes. Remove the crust from the oven and sprinkle the chocolate chips evenly on the surface. Spread the pecans over the top of the chocolate. Return the crust to the oven and bake for 5 minutes. Remove from the oven and let cool on a wire rack. Serve with vanilla ice cream and caramel topping.
Cook lentils as directed. Drain. Mix all remaining ingredients with lentils. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes. Serve with crackers. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Pierce potatoes with a fork and microwave on high for 8 to 12 minutes or until tender. Cut into cubes. Mix soup, sour cream, 2 cups of the cheese, butter and onions in a large bowl. Add potato cubes to mixturetoss to coat evenly. Spoon into a buttered casserole dish. Sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup of cheese. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes or until heated through and top is lightly browned.
Grill tuna steaks to your liking. Slice into bite size pieces. Combine lime juice and oil. Add the jerk spice. Toss the tuna in this mixture. Garnish with diced fresh mangoes if desired.

Soak beans overnight in cold water. Drain, cover with fresh water, and bring to boil. Reduce heat and simmer, partially covered for 1 hour, or until tender. Drain beans reserving 1/3 cup cooking liquid. In a large heavy skillet, saute bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels reserving 1/2 cup fat. In the same skillet over medium-high heat, combine the remaining ingredients except the beans. Bring to boil and cook 3 minutes. Stir in beans and cook over medium heat for 5 minutes. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve hot over rice or in a loaf of hot bread. Makes 6 servings.
Cut oranges into 1/2 inch slices. Dice avocado. Place red leaf lettuce on platter. Arrange orange slices and avocado on top of lettuce. Drizzle white balsamic vinegar over salad. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Lightly grease an 8x8 inch baking dish. Pound each chicken breast to about 1/2 inch thick. Place a slice of swiss cheese and a piece of ham on each breast. Starting at the wide end of the breast, roll the chicken up to enclose the ham and cheese. Place the chicken in the baking dish. Mix together the cream of chicken soup and milk in a bowl. Combine the breadcrumbs and the seasonings in a second bowl. Dip the chicken into the soup mixture and then coat with the breadcrumb mixture. Repeat with the remaining chicken breasts. Bake at 350 degrees f for 45 minutes or until done.

Steam broccoli florets in a steamer basket in a pot over boiling water 5-7 minutes or until tender. Remove and place in a bowl. Add the almonds. In a small bowl combine the mandarin orange sections and orange juice and zest. Let stand for 20 minutes. Drain and add to the broccoli. Add the green onions and toss. Add the dressing and toss again. Chill before serving.

Preheat oven to 180 C/gas 4. Grease and line two 20 cm/8" round cake tins with baking parchment. Beat butter and chocolate together until creamy and combined. Add brown sugar, golden syrup and milk, beating together until smooth. Beat in eggs one by one until combined, then fold in flour, baking powder and ground almonds until just combined. Divide the mixture between the two cake tins and bake for 30 minutes, or until a skewer comes out clean when inserted into the cake. Leave the cakes to cool on wire racks for 10 minutes, then turn out onto racks and leave until completely cool. To make the buttercream icing, beat together butter and icing sugar with an electric hand whisk until creamy and well combined. Stir through thickened cream until smooth and then beat until thick enough to spread over the cakes. Spread buttercream icing over each cake. Melt white chocolate in a heatproof bowl set over a pan of simmering water, or in a heatproof

Drain and rinse chick-peas, then place in food processor bowl. Process until chick-peas are coarsely ground but not pureed. Transfer to bowl and stir in garlic and spices. Add chives and mix well. Form mixture into oval croquettes about 1-inch thick and 2 inches long. Heat oil in heavy skillet and fry croquettes until golden brown and heated through, about 2 minutes on each side. Drain on paper towels and sprinkle with pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature with Tzatziki Sauce or Yogurt Sauce.

Peel apples, cut in quarters. Fill pan with butter and brown sugar, bring to boil. Add cinnamon and cardamom, peel of apples and raisins. Simmer 10 minutes, add more butter if needed. Serve with icecream or whipped cream.
Butter 2 slices of bread. Top one slice with ham, cheddar cheese and pickled onion. Top with other slice of bread. Grill in a sandwich maker until melted.

Cook asparagus by wrapping asparagus stalks individually in foil. Grill asparagus over medium-high heat for 10 minutes. When asparagus is cooked through remove from grill. Cut asparagus in half lengthwise. Arrange asparagus on a serving plate. Top asparagus with ham. Break eggs into a small bowl and whisk until well blended. Heat a small skillet or saute pan over medium heat. Add butter. When butter is melted add eggs. Cook until eggs are cooked through. Spoon over ham. Serve immediately.

Place dry active yeast in a large bowl and sprinkle with warm water and sugar. Stir until yeast dissolves and is creamy looking. Add salt and eggs and beat until smooth and creamy. Add flour and beat until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl and cover tightly with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Punch down and shape into desired loaf(s). Let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour. Bake at 375-degrees for about 25 minutes or until golden brown and done in center. Makes one loafcan be divided and made into 2 or 3 loaves
Slice tomatoes and arrange on a serving plate. In a small bowl, combine mayonnaise and yogurt. Mix in capers and lemon juice. Season with lemon zest. Spread sauce over tomatoes. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350f. Butter a 13x9x2-inch baking pan. Beat butter and sugar with a mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Stir in flour. Spread into pan. Bake 10 minutes. Beat cocoa, amaretto, ground almonds, and 1/4 cup of the powdered sugar with a mixer. Spread over hot cake. Bake 20 minutes longer or until set. Cool on a wire rack. Dust with remaining powdered sugar. Cut into bars.

Combine ground beef with onions. Cook until no longer pink. Add zucchini and cook until tender. Stir in salt and pepper. Remove from heat and let cool for 20 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray a 9-inch pie pan with cooking spray. Unroll the bisquick baking mix. Cut in half. Place one half in the pie pan. Add ground beef mixture and spread. Place the other half of the bisquick baking mix over the ground beef. Bake for 40 minutes. Let cool for 5 minutes before serving.

Boil potatoes in skillet until tender. Drain. Cut into cubes. Cook bacon until crisp and crumble into the pan. Add potatoes and onion. Slice or dice bacon and stir into potatoes. Add butter and cook until crispy and potatoes are brown. Combine milk and eggs in a small cup or glass. Add to potatoes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir well. Add flour and parmesan cheese. Mix well. Shape mixture into balls or patties. Roll in bread crumbs. Deep fry in hot oil until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve immediately with tartar sauce. Serves 3 to 4.

In a large mixing bowl combine buttermilk and mustard and mix well. Add garlic and pepper and mix well. Place chicken breasts into buttermilk mixture and turn to coat both sides. Refrigerate 3 hours. Drain chicken and coat with crumbs and cheese mix and refrigerate again until ready to cook. Heat oil to 375 degrees f. Place chicken on a rack set over a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes or until done to your liking. Serve with your favorite sides.

Place biscuits in a single layer on a cookie sheet. Mix 3 tablespoons sugar and 2 tablespoons cinnamon together. Cut each biscuit into quarters. Roll quarters in the sugar mixture. Place on the cookie sheet. Bake in a 350 degree oven until golden brown. Sprinkle with nuts. Makes 12 servings.

In a food processor combine sour cream, brown sugar, cocoa, vanilla extract, instant coffee granules, egg white and process until smooth. Place in refrigerator for at least 3 hours to set before serving. Serve chilled with sliced strawberries or raspberries on top.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Cut figs crosswise into 1/4-inch slices. Arrange in a single layer in a baking dish. Bake until figs are tender and jammy, about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, whisk together orange juice, orange zest and honey in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the orange blossom water and simmer until reduced by half and thick, 15 to 20 minutes. Let cool. In a medium bowl, whisk together the creme fraiche and mint leaves. Drizzle the reduced orange sauce over the figs and serve with the creme fraiche mixture.
Wash and rinse rice. Combine water, soup mix, and margarine in saucepan. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, covered, 15 minutes. Remove from heat. Fluff rice with fork and serve.

In large bowl, mix filling and cherries. In another bowl combine Bisquick and nuts and brown sugar. Cut in butter until crumbly. Add filling mixture and stir with a fork. Spread in an ungreased 9 x13 inch dish. Bake at 400 for 40 minutes. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream or whipped cream if desired.

Melt 6 tablespoons butter in a large saucepan over low heat. Stir in flour until smooth. Add 2 cups chicken stock and blend until smooth. Add remaining chicken stock one cup at a time. Heat to boiling. Reduce heat to low. Add jalapeno pepper. Stir in remaining 8 tablespoons butter. Stir in sour cream. Add jalapeno juice. Add white pepper. Ladle over hot cooked rice. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 for 5 minutes. Serve immediately.

In a large bowl with electric mixer beat the butter and the sugar until light. Add the egg white and beat until blended. Combine the almonds and the baking powderbeat into the butter mixture. Stir in the flour. Shape into a roll about 1-1/2 inches in diameter. Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 2 hours. Divide the dough into 16 equal pieces and shape each into a 3-inch long log. Place the logs side by side on a parchment paper lined baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 400f oven for 12 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes. Meanwhile in a small bowl beat the eggs with a fork. Dip the logs into the egg and then into the topping mixture. Place the logs back on the baking sheet. Bake in a preheated 375f oven for 10 to 15 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool for 5 minutes. Break into 1-inch pieces.

Crumble the tempeh into small pieces and place into a bowl. Add the celery, red bell peppers and dill pickle and mix to combine. Add the scallions and parsley and toss to combine. Make the dressing by combining the soy mayonnaise, yellow mustard and lemon juice in a small bowl. Pour the dressing over the salad and mix to combine. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste and serve. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 325. Grease two 9-inch round pans. Sift together first six ingredients. Beat in eggs. Sift over mixture. Mix well. Drop by teaspoon onto greased pans. Bake 15 minutes. Cool completely. Roll in powdered sugar.

Soak sausages for 5 minutes in water. In a large pan over medium heat, add sausages and onion. Cook until brown all over. Add vegetables and cook until they start to soften. Mix flour with curry powder, add to pan and stir until gravy thickens.

Boil macaroni in salted water until al dente. Melt butter on the stove and add flour and mustard and cook until the mixture is the color of peanut butter. Add the milk and hot sauce and whisk until smooth and thickened. Add the cheese and stir until the cheese has melted and the sauce is smooth and creamy. Add the eggs one at a time and stir until smooth and combined after each addition. Add the macaroni and stir until all the pasta is coated and well mixed. Serve immediately.
Melt butter in a large skillet over low heat. Add peas, season with chives and pepper. Cover and simmer until peas are crisp-tender, about 3 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Butter an 8 x 8 baking pan. Line with parchment paper, leaving an overhang on 2 opposite sides to use for lifting out of pan. In a medium bowl, whisk butter and brown sugar until fluffy. Add egg and vanilla and whisk to combine. Sift flour, baking powder and salt into another bowlwhisk to combine. Add to butter mixture and whisk to combine. Stir in chocolate chips. Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth top with the back of a spoon. Bake until toothpick inserted into center comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Using overhang of parchment paper, lift brownies from pan and cut into 4 rows by 4 rows.

Cream butter and sugar. Add vanilla and eggsmix well. Sift together dry ingredients and add to creamed mixture. Stir in oatmeal and nuts. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes or until done. Cool completely on wire rack.

Dissolve jello in boiling water as per directions on package. Fold in cream cheese until smooth and pour into mold and chill until firm. In small bowl combine cherry juice and cola. Pour over jello mold and garnish with nuts and cherries.

Bring broth to a boil in a saucepan over high heat. Stir in mushroom soup, chicken soup, and broccoli soupheat through. Pour half-and-half into a large bowl. Add soup mixture and butter, stirring with a whisk until smooth. Add garlic and parmesan cheesestir well. Cook noodles in boiling water for 10 minutesdrain. Stir noodles into soup mixturetop with broccoli. Serve immediately.

In skillet heat olive oil over medium-high heat. Add orange roughy fillets and cook 3 minutes on each side. Add garlic, parsley, cherry tomatoes, kalamata olives and capers. Add wine. Cook 1 minute, stirring occasionally, until wine is reduced to half. Garnish with parsley. Serve with pasta or rice.

Heat a heavy bottomed pan over medium high heat. Melt the butter. Add the shrimp and saute until they turn pink. Add the garlic and saute 1 minute. Add the oil and continue sauteing until shrimp are opaque. Stir in the horseradish and mustard. Stir in the figs and serve immediately. Serves 4-6.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet and reserve fat. In the same skillet, cook onion until softened. Add black-eyed peas and stewed tomatoes. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in rice. Stir in bacon pieces and hot sauce and let stand for 10 minutes to heat rice through. Stir in salsa and season to taste with garlic powder, black pepper and salt. Serve hot.

Boil new potatoes until tender-crisp. Drain and cool in cold water for about five minutes. In a large bowl, whisk together italian dressing, sour cream, mayonnaise, dry mustard, horseradish and celery. Peel the eggs and add them to the dressing mixture. Drain the cooled potatoes and add them to the dressing mixture. Add in onion, salt and pepper to taste. Chill for at least one hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 375. Scrub potatoes. Pierce potatoes several times with a fork. Bake in oven for about 1 hour. Remove potatoes from oven and cut in half lengthwise. Add lowfat yogurt to potatoes and mix thoroughly. Sprinkle potatoes with sun-dried tomato and olives. Sprinkle with dried italian herb seasoning and black pepper. Serve immediately. Makes 6 servings.

Place a slice of bread on a plate. Place a thin layer of butter on the bread. Sprinkle a thin layer of cheese on the bread. Layer on a slice of peppers. Add a sprinkling of basil leaves. Layer on another slice of cheese. Add another slice of bread. Press the sandwich together with your hands. Place on a skillet or grill pan over medium heat. Cook for 3 to 5 minutes on each side or until the bread is toasted.

Boil water for green beans. Cook bacon and onions until crisp and lightly browned. Add beans to the onions and bacon and cook another minute or until beans are tender crisp. Drain beans and set aside. Melt butter and bacon fat in a saucepan over medium heat. Add beans and saute until beans are coated with fat and crispy. Add broth and seasonings. Simmer until beans are heated through. Drain and serve.

Boil potato wedges in water until tender. Drain. In a large skillet, saute onions in butter until tender. Add garlic salt. Sprinkle with parsley flakes. Add diced pimentos. Stir in potatoes, stuffing mix, and cheddar cheese. Heat through.

Fry bacon until crisp. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add pierogies and turn until they are golden brown. Add cabbage and stir. Add water and cover. Simmer until cabbage is tender. Add salt and dill and stir. Serve hot.

Season the fillets with lemon juice and butter and leave them at room temperature for about an hour. After marinating, coat each fillet with some flour and saut in hot oil for two minutes on each side. After removing from pan, deglaze with a little sherry and soy sauce. Serve with egg yolk sauce made by whisking egg yolks with a little hot water until smooth, and adding a little of the soy sauce mixture and a dash of lemon juice. Serve with steamed rice and green vegetables.

In a large mixing bowl, cream together the butter and sugar. Add in the vanilla and mix. Add the flour and baking soda and mix until combined. Chill in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). On a lightly floured surface, roll out the dough until it is about 1/4 inch thick. Using a baby ruth candy bar as a guide, cut out the cookies. Bake in the preheated oven for 12 minutes. Cool on wire racks.

Grate rind and juice oranges. Cream sugar and butter. Add egg and milk. Add rind and juice. Sift together flour, salt and baking powder. Add to creamed mixture and blend well. Pour into greased loaf pan and bake at 350 for 1 hour. Cool for 10 minutes then remove from pan. Cut in 1/2 inch thickness. Place nuts on top and sprinkle with powdered sugar. Yields 1 loaf.

Preheat oven to 350. In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except spaghetti. Place chicken breasts on baking sheet. Spoon curry mixture over chicken breasts and bake for 30 minutes or until done. Meanwhile, cook spaghetti in large pot of boiling salted water until tender. Drain and toss with 1/2 of curry mixture. Sprinkle with remaining curry mixture and serve. Garnish with basil leaves and chile slices, if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Wash potatoes. Remove any eyes or bruises with a small paring knife or potato peeler. Place in a large baking dish and cover with water. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cover, reduce heat to medium-high, and cook until tender when pierced with a fork, about 12-15 minutes. Drain potatoes and place on a baking sheet to cool slightly. In a small bowl, combine butter spread, milk and nonfat sour cream. Mash potatoes with a potato masher or a fork until smooth. Add in butter mix and mix thoroughly. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with bacon bits and chives before serving. Serve hot or warm.
Brown hamburger with mushrooms and onion. Add other spices. Add chicken broth, tomato paste, and water. Heat to boiling. Add spaghetti noodles and simmer until tender. Garnish with parsley flakes.

Sift together flour and baking powder. Add sugar. Add salt. Add milk and egg. Beat well. Fold in stuffed green olive and chopped pimiento. Pour into greased 9 x 5 x 3 loaf pan. Bake in 350 degrees fahrenheit for 40 minutes. Cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire rack.

Soften cream cheese. Mix with powdered sugar and milk. Blend in vanilla. Fold in whipped topping, folding in oreos. Pour into a 9x13 glass dish. Cover with plastic wrap and chill overnight or at least 6 hours before serving. Serve with oreos on the side.

Melt the butter in a large saucepan. Crumb the bread in the butter then add the rest of the ingredients, stirring to combine. Pour the mixture into an 8 inch square baking dish and bake in a preheated 175C (350F) oven for 1 hour or until set. Serve with custard or vanilla ice cream.
Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and return to pot. Add Alfredo sauce and stir to combine. Add remaining ingredients and toss well to combine. Serve immediately.

Line two baking trays with baking paper.In a large saucepan over low heat melt the margarine and golden syrup.Add the desiccated coconut, coconut essence and cherries.Spread the mixture onto the baking paper and bake in a 170 C oven for 10 minutes.Remove and allow to cool.Place the crackles in a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.Pour the crushed crackles into a large mixing bowl.Add the rice bubbles and glace cherries and mix well.Place the mixture in a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.Place the mixture into a large bowl.Melt the chocolate over low heat in the saucepan.Pour over the crackle mixture and stir until evenly coated.Place the mixture in a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.Pour the crushed crackles into a large mixing bowl.Add the rice bubbles and glace cherries and mix well.Place the mixture in a plastic bag and crush with a rolling pin.Place the mixture into a large bowl.M

Sift flour onto a large plate. In a separate bowl beat ricotta until smooth. Add the eggs one at a time. Fold in flour. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Place a spoonful of dough in the water. The dough is ready to be removed when it floats to the top. Transfer to a bowl and toss with a little bit of the tomato sauce. Repeat until all dough is used. Toss gnocchi with the remaining tomato sauce. Sprinkle with parmigiano-reggiano. Serve warm.

In a saucepan over medium heat, combine the first four ingredients and stir until smooth. Add half-and-half and stir constantly until mixture boils. Remove from heat and add butter and vanilla extract. Stir in cinnamon and pour into prepared pie crust. Refrigerate until set. In a bowl, combine the brown sugar and cinnamon for a sprinkle top. Spread over the pie. Chill before serving. Serves 8-12.
Puree peaches with brown sugar and salt. Stir in ice cream. Freeze in a 9-inch pie plate. Serve in individual servings.

Soften the cheese by placing the container of cheese in a small bowl filled with hot water from the tap. Mix well with the braunschweiger, the milk and the green onions. Add the worcestershire sauce to taste and the garlic powder if desired. Serve with crackers or raw vegetables.

In a large skillet heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and saute until soft. Add bacon and cook until bacon is browned. Remove bacon from skillet with slotted spoon. Heat skillet over medium heat. Add garlic powder, potato, water and paprika. Cook for about 15 minutes until potato is soft but not mushy. Remove from skillet with slotted spoon. Mash with potato masher or fork until potato is well broken up. Mix potato mixture with cream and egg yolks. Pour back into skillet. Cook over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Remove from skillet with slotted spoon. Place back into skillet and top with bacon. Place bacon on top to serve.
Mix Bisquick and sugar until crumbly. Add egg and milk and mix until smooth. Pour into 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle with walnuts and bake at 350 degrees fahrenheit for 40 minutes.

Heat oil in a large saucepot over medium heat. Add onion and carrot. Cook for 2 minutes. Add oregano. Cook for 2 minutes. Stir in quinoa and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cover. Cook for 15 to 20 minutes or until quinoa is tender. Stir in the frozen peas. Cook for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in lemon juice and pepper. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 350f. In a bowl combine the breadcrumbs, garlic powder, egg and cheese. In another bowl combine the mushroom soup, sour cream and soup. In a third bowl combine the ground beef, mushrooms and the soup mixture. Make into 4 equal patties. Dip each patty into the bread crumb mixture and place on a cookie sheet. Bake for 20 minutes. In a small bowl combine the ketchup and soup. Serve the sauce over the burgers.

Soak pigeon peas overnight. In a pot bring water to boil and add meat. Cook until meat is tender. Drain and return meat to pot. Add pigeon peas, seasoning, fresh thyme and fresh marjoram. Stir and add 1 1/2 cups of water. Simmer until tender. In another pot melt butter. Stir in flour and cook for 3-4 minutes. Stirring constantly. Add in water, salt and pepper to taste. Continue stirring until thick. Add to meat mixture. Simmer until thick. Serve over white rice.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add onions and saute until softened. Add curry powder, cake flour, salt, pepper and sugar. Stir well. Slowly add water while stirring to make a thin sauce. Once the mixture thickens, remove from heat. Stir in vinegar. Remove hard-boiled eggs from shells. Cut each egg into quarters. Place eggs into the curry sauce. Reheat slowly. Serve over rice.

Lightly coat a 10-inch ovenproof skillet with a small amount of olive oil. In a medium bowl, combine egg whites and skim milk. Lightly beat until blended. Add shrimp, scallions, salt and pepper. Heat skillet over medium-low heat. Add egg mixture. Cook for 1-2 minutes until lightly browned. Add swiss cheese. Place in a preheated 375 degree oven for 2 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Garnish with scallions.

Peel squash and cut in half lengthwise. Scoop out seeds. Cut into 2 inch cubes. Place squash in a large saucepan filled with water to cover. Boil squash until tender 15-20 minutes. Drain. Heat broth in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, carrots and baking soda. Cook 3 minutes. Add squash and broth mixture to a blender or food processor in batches. Blend until smooth. In a small bowl, combine cinnamon and pepper. Sprinkle over soup. Heat in microwave for 30 seconds or until thoroughly heated. Stir in half-and-half. Serve in a bowl or mug. Makes 16 cups soup.

Season the sea bass fillet with the orange juice, tomato paste and vegetable oil. Place the fillet in a baking dish and bake at 375 F for about 20 minutes. Meanwhile combine the vinegar and brown sugar in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Add the garlic cloves and orange zest and simmer for about 10 minutes. Stir in the ginger and the hot red pepper flakes. Add the liquid mixture to the sea bass fillet. Serve immediately.

Wash and pat dry the potatoes. Place on a hot grill (or in a grill pan). Grill over medium heat for 25 minutes, turning occasionally. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Cut into 1/2 inch slices and drizzle with the olive oil and the crushed garlic. Season with salt to taste. Serve warm.

In heavy skillet over medium-high heat, melt 2 tablespoons of butter. Add garlic cloves and cook until fragrant. Add tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes are broken down. Season with hot sauce. Stir in bay leaf. Cook 1 to 2 minutes. Add lemon juice. Remove from heat. Season with salt and pepper. Lay salmon fillets in skillet. Cover skillet. Cook 5 minutes. Turn salmon over. Cook 5 minutes. Turn salmon over. Cover skillet. Cook 5 minutes. Garnish with basil leaves. Serve over pasta.

Mix together first 4 ingredients in large bowl until well blended. Stir in pecans and mix well. Shape mixture into 1-inch balls. Place in single layer on ungreased baking sheet and bake at 250 degrees for 10 minutes or until set and lightly browned. Remove from oven and cool completely. Store in airtight container for up to two weeks.

In large saucepan combine sugar and cream over medium heat. Cook until sugar dissolves. Bring to boil. Boil 5 minutes or until mixture turns amber. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and almonds. Pour into wax paper lined pan. Chill until firm. Cut into squares.

Heat oil in Dutch oven over med-high heat. Add mushrooms, onion, garlic, herbes de provence, and cook for 5 minutes. Add broth and cook until mushrooms are tender, about 15 minutes. Add tomatoes with liquid from can, wine and beans. Simmer 15 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve over hot pasta, if desired.

Place spinach in a colander and run under hot water for about a minute or until the spinach has thawed and has begun to wilt. Place the spinach in a strainer and squeeze out the excess water. In a medium skillet cook bacon until crisp. Drain bacon fat from skillet and set aside. In the same skillet saut the spinach until wilted. Drain off any excess water from the spinach and add to the bacon. Set aside. In a bowl combine the spinach/bacon mixture, cheese, black pepper and olive oil. Spread the mixture evenly onto the pizza crust. Place crust on a baking sheet. Sprinkle parmesan cheese evenly over the top of the crust. Bake at 400 degrees for 15 to 20 minutes or until crust is crisp and topping is bubbly. Cut into wedges.

Prepare cake mix according to package instructions, pour into a 10x15 pan and bake for about 20 minutes or until done. Prepare the pudding according to instructions. Cut the cooled cake into cubes and mix with the pudding. Put half of the mixture back into the pan and top with the walnuts and sprinkles. Cover with the remaining mixture and refrigerate for an hour or more.

Bring 2 cups water to a boil in a saucepan. Add spinach, onion and ginger. Cover and cook for 10 minutes. Remove from heat and drain spinach mixture. Blend the spinach with the onion and ginger. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add the ginger paste and cayenne pepper. When the mixture begins to smoke add the spinach mixture and curry powder. Continue cooking until mixture is thickened. Add the garam masala and cook for 1 minute. Add the yogurt and cook for 1 minute. Season with salt.

Combine potato, flour and cheese in a large bowl. Add beaten egg and salt. Mix well. Divide into 12 balls about the size of a walnut. Place on a greased baking sheet or baking sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for 15-20 minutes or until light brown. Makes 12 cakes

Season veal with salt and pepper. Heat 2 tablespoons of the butter in a Dutch oven over medium heat. Add veal and brown on all sides. Transfer veal to a plate and add scallions to pan. Cook and stir scallions in the pan until tender. Stir in mushrooms and cook 2 minutes or until mushrooms are tender. Return veal to pan. Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute. Stir in wine and paprika. Bring to a simmer. Cover and simmer on low heat for about an hour or until veal is tender. Stir in whipping cream and cook for a few minutes longer. Spoon veal mixture over cooked rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour a 8 or 9 inch square baking pan. Combine eggs and brown sugar in a large mixing bowl. Beat until fluffy. Stir in syrup, cinnamon and vanilla. In a seperate bowl, mix the flour with the salt. Add the flour mixture to the egg mixture and stir until combined. Pour into the prepared baking pan. Sprinkle pecans over batter. Bake 30 minutes or until the cake springs back when lightly touched in the center. Cool for 10 minutes in pan. Remove from pan to a cooling rack. Cool completely before cutting. Dust lightly with confectioners sugar. Serve in squares or triangles.

Preheat the oven to 350°F. Cut the potatoes into 1/4″ slices and toss with 2 tbsp of olive oil, 1 tbsp of lemon juice and 1/8 tsp of salt. Roast for 20 minutes or until just tender. In the meantime cook the broccoli, beans and dill in boiling water for 2 minutes or until just tender. Drain and rinse under cold water. In a large serving bowl combine the potatoes, broccoli, beans, dill and goat cheese. Toss gently. Garnish with pine nuts and more dill if desired. Serve immediately.

In a large skillet over medium heat, cook sausage until browned, about 6 minutes. Add onion, pepper, poblano chile, tomatillos, wine, salt and garlic powdercook for 1 minute longer, stirring occasionally. Add ricestir until heated through, about 1 minute more.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In shallow dish, combine egg whites and breadcrumbsdip squash into egg mixture, then roll in breadcrumb mixture to coat. In large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, heat butter and oil until butter melts. Add squash mixturesaute 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Turn squash overadd sugar, salt, onion and pepper to tastesaute 3 minutes more or until squash is tender. Place squash mixture in 8-inch square baking dishsprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered 5 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve immediately with salad or fresh fruit. Yield: 4 servings (serving size: about 3/4 cup squash mixture)

Combine zucchini and onion in a 12-inch skillet coated with cooking spraycook over medium heat until zucchini is crisp-tender. Stir in garlic and halibutcook for 2 minutes longer. Stir in tomatoes, parsley, lemon juice and the next 4 ingredients (through pepper)cook 1 minute longer or until thoroughly heated. Sprinkle with cheesecook 1 minute longer or until cheese is melted. Makes 4 servings (serving size: about 1/2 cup halibut mixture and about 2/3 cup zucchini mixture). Per serving: 227 calories, 9 g fat (1 g saturated fat), 41 mg cholesterol, 48 mg sodium, 28 g carbohydrate, 21 g protein, 2 g fiber.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 24 muffin cups with paper liners. Melt butter in a saucepan. Stir in sugar. Cook over low heat until sugar dissolves. Remove from heat. Add egg yolks one at a time, stirring until incorporated. Pour into a large bowl. Add flourstir until well blended. Divide batter evenly among liners. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until slightly brown around edges. Cool in pan on wire rack for 5 minutes. Remove from pancool completely on wire rack. Combine corn syrup, powdered sugar, vanilla, almond extract and enough water to make a glaze that drips from a spoon but will not run. Dip tops of tartlets in glaze. Garnish with pecans. Refrigerate for at least one hour before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Cut the garlic heads into quarters. Rub duck breasts with lemon pepper. Place each piece of duck breast skin side down in a single layer. Place one quarter of a head of garlic next to each piece of duck breast. Drizzle with olive oil and fresh lemon juice. Roast for 45 minutes or until cooked through. Remove duck and place on serving platter. Increase heat to broil and cook garlic for 5-7 minutes or until browned and crispy. Serve as garnish with duck.

In a large saute pan over medium heat, add in the oil. When the oil is hot add in the onions and garlic. Saute until the onions are translucent. Add in the flour and mix well to combine. Add in the anaheim chilies, and continue stirring until the mixture starts to thicken. Add in the stock and mix until smooth. Add in the salt to taste. This makes enough for two enchiladas.
In a frying pan over medium heat, melt margarine. Add apples. Cook until soft. Add brown sugar. Add white bread. Cook until toasted.

In a saucepan, combine the milk, sugar, cornstarch and salt. Stir in 2 cups ice cubes. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Stir in vanilla. Remove from heat. Stir in cinnamon. Cool slightly. In a large bowl, combine eggs and 3 cups ice cubes. Add milk mixture. Fold in bread cubes. Pour into 13x9 baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F. for 35 minutes. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Serve immediately. You can make your own crepes. Beat 1/2 cup milk with 1 egg. Add 1/4 cup all-purpose flour. Stir until smooth. Heat skillet over medium heat. Add 1 tablespoon butter. When butter stops foaming, pour 1/4 cup batter into center. Tilt pan to spread batter. When edges are dry, turn crepe over. Cook 1 minute. Remove from pan. Repeat with remaining batter. Serve with fruit, whipped cream, ice cream or sauce. Makes 6 crepes.

In a blender, beat the eggs and milk together until smooth. Add the flour and beat until smooth. Heat butter in skillet over medium heat. Pour in batter and spread out to form 6-inch circle. Bake for 3-5 minutes until lightly browned. Top with slices of brie cheese and cook for 3 more minutes until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with chopped chives and serve warm with toasted bread cubes and/or crackers.

Heat oven to 375 degrees F. Put potatoes in a 9x13 pan with enough water to cover them by one inch. Cook until done (10-15 minutes). Drain them and put them back into the pan, add dried dill weed and mash them up with a fork. While potatoes are cooking prepare pork chops with water or milk (to cover bottom of pan). Cook in oven until done (20-30 minutes). Remove from oven and cover with cream of mushroom soup. Let sit for 10-20 minutes. Blend half of can of soup into a gravy with a little water (2 tsp). Blend other half with a little milk or water (2 tsp) and a little sour cream. Spoon a little bit of each gravy on top of pork chops and serve with mashed potatoes (with dill weed) and parsley for garnish.

Heat 2 tbs oil in a large saucepan. Add onion and garlic and cook until onion is softened. Add red pepper flakes and anchovy fillet and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and capers and cook for 2 minutes. Add tuna in oil and stir well. Season with salt and pepper. Cook pasta in a large pan of boiling water until al dente. Drain and add to sauce. Cook for 2 minutes. Season with salt and pepper and garnish with fresh parsley.

In a medium skillet, over medium high heat, add ground beef and onion salt. Cook until browned and then add potatoes and cook for 5 minutes or until potatoes are golden. Drain and return to skillet. Add salt and pepper and set aside. In another skillet over medium heat add heavy cream and cook until bubbles form on top of cream. Remove from heat and add to beef/potato mix and mix well. Add eggs and mix well. Spoon into pie shells and sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake for 45 minutes or until golden.

Mix cake mix, margarine and eggs. Spread half of the batter into greased 8x8 inch pan. Sprinkle with half of the cherry pie filling. Spoon remaining cake batter over filling. Sprinkle with remaining pie filling. Bake 40 minutes at 350 degrees. Drizzle with chocolate frosting. Sprinkle with coconut. Let cool 15 minutes. Dump out into plate. Serve.

Bring soup and water to a boil in a 3-qt. ovenproof dish. Stir in rice and cook for 5 minutes or until donestirring occasionally. Stir in onion powderheat through. Add chicken and stir to mix well. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

Sieve the flour and cocoa into a large bowl. Add the butter and rub in until the mixture resembles fine breadcrumbs. Add the sugar and egg and bring together to form a soft dough. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and roll out to about 1 cm thick. Use a sharp knife to cut the dough into 4 long strips. Sprinkle the coconut onto a clean work surface and roll the dough into a log shape. Wrap in cling film and refrigerate for 20 minutes. Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/gas mark 4. Cut the log into 1/2 cm thick slices. Arrange the slices in a shallow, lightly greased ovenproof dish. Beat the egg in a small bowl. Brush the top of each slice with the egg and sprinkle with the icing sugar. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the cake is well risen and golden brown. Leave to cool in the tin for 5 minutes before turning out onto a wire rack to cool completely

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 8 by 8-inch baking pan. In a large bowl, combine the brown sugar, flour, eggs, oil, vanilla and chocolate morselsmix well. Spread evenly into prepared baking pan. Bake for 25 minutes or until slightly puffed and a toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool completely on a wire rack. Melt the chocolate chips, butterscotch chips and butter in the microwave on high for 30 secondsstir until smooth. Drizzle over cooled brownies. Sprinkle with pecans. Cut into 16 squares.

Bring 2 cups of water to the boil in a large saucepan over high heat. Stir in the rice and boil for 10 minutes or until the water is completely absorbed. Combine the butter and margarine in a frying pan over low heat and add the onion and garlic. Cook gently for 2 minutes or until the onion is translucent but not coloured. Stir in the chopped capsicum and the parsley and cook for a further minute or until the capsicum is just tender. Drain the rice and stir in the onion mixture and the chopped parsley. Season with pepper and serve with the lemon wedges.

Cut avocado in half. Scoop out pulp and place in bowl. Add lime juice, cilantro, red onion, red bell pepper, corn kernels, jalapeno jack cheese, hot sauce. Mash together. Add salt, to taste. Serve with tortilla chips. Serves 4.

In 2 1/2-quart casserole combine cream cheese, milk and eggsblend well. Add cornmix well. Combine muffin mix and milkstir just until moistened. Spoon over cream cheese mixturetop with cheddar cheese. Bake at 375f for 25 to 30 minutes or until lightly browned. Let stand for 5 minutes before serving.

Line a 9x13x2 inch baking pan with foil (with ends of foil extending over sides of pan for easy removal later). Combine puffed kashi, wheat germ, oatmeal, raisins, mini chocolate chips, cinnamon, natural style peanut butter, honey and milk in a large bowl until well blended. Transfer the mixture into the prepared baking pan. Spread evenly into pan. Bake 20 minutes. Let cool completely in pan on a wire rack. Cut into 16 squares. Store in an airtight container for up to 3 days or freeze for up to 3 months.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, combine oil, onion, and garlic and saute for about 5 minutes until onion is softened. Add curry powder, zucchini, potato, and broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer about 10 minutes until potato is tender. Use an immersion blender to puree until soup is smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Makes about 4 servings. Serve hot with crusty bread or rice.

In a small bowl whisk the horseradish, lemon juice and garlic together. Season to taste with fennel seeds and pepper. Spread the Dijon mixture evenly over the cod fillets. Sprinkle the breadcrumbs over the top. Bake until the breadcrumbs are golden brown and the fish is cooked through and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Garnish with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

Bring the water to a boil in a pot. Add carrots and cook until tender. Add the sugar and butter. Cook for about 10 more minutes. Add the brown sugar and cook for 2 minutes. Stir in the white wine vinegar and salt. Cool and serve.

In a medium mixing bowl, combine mushrooms, oil, water and vinegar. Add mustard and lemon juiceseason with salt and pepper and toss lightly. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Serve over hot rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cream peanut butter and margarine together in large bowl. Beat in banana and egg until smooth. Stir in flour, Splenda and baking soda until blended. Drop by level tablespoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from cookie sheets to wire racks. Cool completely and store in airtight container.
In a mortar and pestle or in a small food processor combine tomatoes, garlic, olive oil, cayenne pepper, and dried mint. Pound or pulse until well mixed. Serve with warm pita bread.

In a large bowl beat the sugar, eggs, kahlua, and vanilla until well blended. In another bowl combine the flour, butter, and pecan pieces. Add to the egg mixture and mix well. Spread in the unbaked pie shell. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Let cool. Sprinkle the top with chocolate chips. Refrigerate until serving time. Makes one deep dish pie.

In a medium bowl combine the flour, sugar, oil and milk. Add the eggs, vanilla and baking powder. Stir until smooth. Fold in the apples. Spoon into a greased 8-inch square pan. In a small bowl combine the brown sugar and cinnamon. Crumble over the top of the cake. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped topping.

In a bowl combine first 4 ingredients. Place in a greased 9x13-inch baking dish. Add apples and sprinkle with pecans. Drizzle with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until apples are tender.

In a large ovenproof casserole dish or pan, heat the oil. Fry the sausages in it until lightly browned on all sides. Add the onion and cook until softened. Add the oregano and garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add the chopped tomatoes and beef stock. Bring to the boil and simmer for 10 minutes. Remove the sausages and slice them into rounds. Add the black olives and the mushrooms. Simmer for 3-4 minutes. Add the sausages to the dish. Dot the sausages with the butter and bake for 15-20 minutes. Serve hot. The 30-minute vegetarian.

Dredge each chop in flour, dip in egg and then dredge in the bread crumbs. In a large skillet over med heat, heat oil until hot. Brown the chops in the oil for about 3 to 4 minutes per side. Remove to a plate. Pour in wine and stir to deglaze pan. Stir in cornstarch. Return the chops to the pan. Cover and simmer for about 3 to 5 minutes or until cooked through. Pour the sauce over the chops and sprinkle with freshly grated parmesan cheese. Serve over rice.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and celery and cook for about 5 minutes or until soft. Add the vegetables, garlic cloves, salt and pepper to taste. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the cumin and cook for 2 minutes. Add the tomatoes and cook for another 2 minutes. Pour mixture into pie crust. Sprinkle shredded cheese over top. Bake at 375 for 25 minutes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place sliced almonds in a shallow baking pan. Toss with vermouth. Bake about 10 minutes or until lightly toasted. Remove from oven. Clean fish fillets. Mash sliced garlic cloves with salt. Add white wine. Heat over medium high heat until wine is reduced to 1/2 cup. Add vermouth. Stir in fish fillets. Cover and cook for 8-10 minutes. Turn fish over. Remove cover. Add butter. Cook 2 minutes longer or until fish is opaque throughout. Season with salt and fresh ground pepper. Place fish on a serving platter. Garnish with parsley. Serve with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 400f. Wash and trim the beets. Place in a baking dish. Cover tightly with foil. Bake for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. In a small bowl combine margarine and maple syrup. Place back in oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven. Pour maple syrup glaze over beets. Serve warm.

In a large bowl, combine the ground lean pork, onion, apple, egg and bread crumbs until just combined. Add the parsley and garlic and mix well. Divide the meat mixture into six portions and form each portion into a log shape about 4 inches long and 3 inches in diameter. In a small bowl combine the barbecue sauce with the mustard and brush each mini meat loaf with this mixture. Bake the mini meat loaves for 40 minutes or until cooked through. Let the meat loaves rest for five minutes before serving.

Place curry powder in blender containeradd orange juice concentrate and lime juiceblend until smooth. Place tofu in a shallow baking dishpour curry mixture over tofu. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour. Stir every half hour. Serves four.
In a large fry pan over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the sprouts, cut side down, and cook until browned. Season to taste with nutmeg, salt and pepper. Serves 2.

Bring water to boil in large pot for cooking the green beans. Boil the green beans in water for 3-5 minutes or until crisp tender. In a frying pan over high heat, cook bacon until crisp. Drain bacon on paper towels and crumble. Cook green beans in bacon fat until crisp tender and set aside. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, sugar and garlic powder. Pour over green beans and toss to combine. Sprinkle with bacon bits and serve.

In a large bowl combine the bread crumbs and parmesan cheese. In another bowl mix egg with shallot and a few drops of oil. Dip chicken into egg mixture and then coat with bread crumb mixture. In a large skillet heat oil. Saute chicken over medium heat for about 12 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from skillet and set aside. Add mushrooms to skillet and saute for a couple of minutes. Add a little water if they need it, then add chicken back into skillet and toss with mushrooms and parsley. Top with a sprinkling of cheese and serve over noodles or rice.

In a small saucepan, combine cranberries and heavy cream. Bring to boil. Cook until cranberries pop and sauce thickens to syrup consistency, about 15-20 minutes. Remove from heat and cool to room temperature. Chill sauce in the refrigerator until ready to use. In a small bowl, combine the walnut halves with the powdered sugarstir until coated. Set aside. Remove core and seeds from apple, leaving the stem intact. Cut the apple into wedges or thin slices. Arrange the apple slices on a platter. Drizzle the cranberry sauce over the apple wedges and sprinkle with the walnuts. Serve immediately or refrigerate covered until ready to serve.

Heat oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, garlic and green pepper and cook 2-3 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add hash browns and cook 5-6 minutes. Stir in ham and cook 3 minutes. Stir in the cheese. Cook 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with eggs and your favorite hot sauce. Makes 6 servings.
Combine all ingredients and mix well. Spread on white bread. Serve.

Cut celery and apples in quarters. Melt butter in frying pan and saute celery and onion. When they are tender, add the celery and apple pieces and saute about five minutes until the celery is just tender. In a small bowl mix together the flour and curry powder. Sprinkle this mixture over the vegetables and stir. Add salt and pepper and continue cooking for two or three more minutes until the mixture is a creamy consistency. Remove from heat and serve.

Preheat oven to 180C (350F) butter a 20cm square cake tin line with greaseproof paper and butter the paper. Melt the chocolate gently over a low heat or in a bowl over hot water then mix with the butter and caster sugar until combined. Beat the eggs with the espresso then mix this into the melted chocolate. Sift the flour and salt together then add to the mixture, mix until combined. Spread the mixture evenly into the cake tin then bake in the oven for 15 minutes or until a skewer inserted comes out clean. Cool the brownies in the tin for 10 minutes then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute onion, carrot and celery in oil until tender. Add garlic and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in apple and wine. Bring to a boil. Stir in broth and port. Cook until reduced by half. Stir in 1/4 cup of the parsley. Pour into bowls and sprinkle with remaining 1 tablespoon parsley. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease two 9-inch-diameter round cake pans. Line the bottom of each pan with parchment paper. In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and eggs until pale. Add the flour mixture and beat until combined. Stir in the cinnamon and carrots. Divide batter evenly between pans. Bake cake layers until a tester inserted in centers comes out clean, about 25-35 minutes. Transfer layers to racks to cool. Frost cake when cool. Melt the butter and stir in the powdered sugar and milk until smooth. Frost cake. Sprinkle with walnuts.

In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the eggs and vanilla extract and mix until blended. In another bowl combine the flour, cocoa, baking soda and saltstir with a whisk. Add to the creamed mixture and mix until combined. Stir in the white chocolate chips. Cover and refrigerate the dough for at least 2 hours or overnight. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto parchment paper-lined baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the edges are set but the centers are still soft. Let cool for 2 minutes before removing from the baking sheets to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an airtight container. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

In a food processor combine salsa and eggs and puree until smooth. With the motor running slowly add mayonnaise and mustard. Process until mixture is smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Cover and chill for 1 hour.

Wash tomatoes well. Cut off ends. With a sharp knife, cut out core and discard. Cut tomatoes into thick slices. Combine tomatoes, herbs, scallions, cheese and yogurt in a bowl. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Serve chilled or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 400 F. Beat butter and sugar together in a large bowl until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla and eggs one at a time. Sift together flour, baking soda and baking powder. Stir into butter mixture until combined. Stir in hazelnuts. Drop by teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake in preheated oven until very light golden brown, about 8-10 minutes. Cool on baking sheets for 1 minute before removing to wire racks to cool completely. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

Heat the oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the Swiss chard, scallions and garlic and cook until wilted, 3 to 4 minutes. Add the chickpeas, salt and pepper and cook until the liquid is almost evaporated from the skillet and the mixture is dry. Remove from the heat. Stir in the feta and dill and serve warm or at room temperature.
Combine all ingredients except cornstarch, eggs and green onions. Cook until pork is no longer pink. Remove from heat. Stir in cornstarch and eggs. Stir in green onions. Serve over rice.

Preheat crock pot to low. Season chicken with flour salt and pepper. In a large skillet brown chicken on both sides. Place chicken into crock pot. Mix soup, milk and garlic powder. Pour over chicken. Cook on low for 4-6 hours or high for 2-3 hours. Serve over mashed potatoes or white or brown rice.

Place roast in a 2 gallon zip lock bag. Place the water, salt, sugar, bay leaves, garlic, shallots and allspice berry in a pot and bring to a boil. Add the hot pepper sauce and pour over the roast. Seal the bag and place in a pan. Place the pan in the refrigerator and allow the roast to brine for 24 hours. Remove the roast from the bag and place in the oven. Cook for approximately 30 minutes per pound or until a meat thermometer reads 145 degrees. Remove from oven and let sit for 10 minutes before carving.

Take your roast out of the package. Place it into your crock pot. Add water to the bottom of your pot. Season roast with all spices. Pour over top of roast. Set on low for 6 hours or high for 3 hours. After cooking take roast out. Allow to rest for 10 minutes. Slice. Serve with au jus.
Heat a cast iron skillet on medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons of butter and sage. When it is melted add brussels sprouts and stir until brown on both sides. Season to taste and serve.

Combine 2 teaspoons curry powder, 1 teaspoon ground coriander, 1 tablespoon orange zest, 1 teaspoon worcestershire sauce, 1 tablespoon dijon mustard, 1 tablespoon ketchup, 1/4 cup pure maple syrup, and 1/2 cup reduced sodium soy sauce in a large zip-top bag. Add tenderloin. Seal bag. Marinate in refrigerator for at least 2 hours. Remove pork from bag. Place in a greased 9×13 baking dish. Bake in preheated 325 degree oven for 40-50 minutes. Baste occasionally.

Melt butter in 12 inch skillet over moderate heat. Add onion and celery. Saute 3-4 minutes. Add baby peas and 2 cups cold water. Bring to boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Cook 3 minutes. Stir in pimiento. Add seasonings. Mix cornstarch with 1/4 cup water. Stir into skillet. Heat until thickened. Remove from heat. Serve over rice. Makes 4-6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat eggs together in large bowl. Add milk, salt, dry mustard and beat to blend well. Set aside. In another bowl, melt butter over low heat in saucepan. Add onion and saut until soft and translucent. Add white bread, sausage, and sharp cheddar cheese to mixture. Turn off heat. Dip bread into egg mixture until thoroughly soaked and place in greased 9 by 13 inch baking dish. Pour remaining egg mixture over bread. Bake 1 hour or until set. Sprinkle with additional cheese if desired. Cut into squares. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and rinse with cold water and drain again. Bring a medium pan of water to a boil. Blanch asparagus for 30 seconds. Remove with slotted spoon and plunge into ice water to stop the cooking process and preserve the bright green color of the spears. Drain and rinse with cold water and pat dry with paper towel. Cut into 1/2 inch pieces. In a large skillet cook the green beans in boiling water 2 minutes or until crisp tender and still bright green. Drain and rinse in cold water, then pat dry with paper towel. Cut into 1/2 inch pieces. In a large skillet cook the green peas in boiling water 2 minutes or until tender crisp. Drain and rinse in cold water and pat dry with paper towel. Cut into 1/4 inch pieces. In a medium skillet cook the green onions in boiling water 2 minutes or until crisp tender. Drain and rinse in cold water and pat dry with paper towel. Cut into 1/4 inch pieces.

Heat chicken broth and gingerroot to boiling. Add soy sauce. Stir. Add peanut butter and honey stirring to blend. Add chili paste stirring to blend. Add garlic cloves chopped and stir. Add spaghetti and cook until tender. Add green onion and stir. Add cooked and chopped or sliced peanuts to top.

Prepare the fish fillets by rinsing them with water and pat dry with paper towel. Use the flat side of a knife to gently press the garlic clove to release its flavors into the fish. Rub the fish with the garlic. In a bowl, combine the garam masala, chili powder and turmeric. Sprinkle the seasoning over both sides of the fish fillets. Drizzle with vegetable oil and let marinate for 15 minutes. Preheat the grill to medium high heat. Grill the fish fillets for 3-4 minutes on each side or until opaque. Serve with lemon wedges.

In a medium bowl stir together ketchup, italian dressing and black pepper. Place the chicken in a large plastic bag or shallow bowl with the dressing mixture and coat well. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Preheat grill. Remove chicken from marinadediscard marinade. Grill the chicken breasts over medium heat for 3-4 minutes per side or until no longer pink in the center. Cut into thin slices and arrange on a serving platter. Makes 10 servings.

Heat olive oil in pan over meduim heat. Add turkey sausage. Brown sausage until cooked through. Add cabbage and mushrooms. Cook cabbage until tender. Add garlic, italian seasoning and pepper. Cook until garlic is cooked through. Serve over spaghetti noodles. Top with pepper and grated cheese.

Heat oil over medium-high heat in a large skillet or wok. Add leek and mushroomssaute for 5 minutes. Add broth and cornstarchstir to combine well and bring to a boil. Cook until thickened, about 1 minute. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer for 15 minutes more. Stir in sour cream and tarragon. Stir over low heat until heated through and smoothly blended. Serve warm.

Line cookie sheet with wax paper. In a large pot over medium heat combine the sugar and water. Bring to a boil and boil for 5 minutes. Add the corn syrup. Continue boiling for 5 minutes. Add the peppermint oil. Remove from heat. Add the food coloring. Pour into the prepared pan. Let cool. Cut into squares. Store in an airtight container in a cool dry place.
Combine pork chops with tomato sauce, olive oil, apple cider, lime juice, chili powder, cumin, ground cayenne pepper and onion powder. Refrigerate overnight. Cook the chops on the grill.

Combine all the ingredients in a bowl. Mix together. Brush a baking sheet with oil. Pour the mixture onto the baking sheet and spread it evenly. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve with a salad.

Prepare tofu by pressing it between two plates for 30 minutes. Drain it in a colander and cut the tofu into cubes. In a small bowl, mix slivered almonds with dry bread crumbs. Combine almond mixture with tofu cubes, parmesan cheese, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Beat egg in a small bowl. Dip tofu cubes in egg and then into the almond mixture. Roll in almond mixture to coat. In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add tofu cubes. Cook until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with pasta or rice.

Boil the mustard seeds in the beer and wine vinegar for 30 minutes. Strain the seeds from the beer and wine vinegar. Grind the seeds in a blender or food processor. Add the mustard powder, sugar, spices and the liquid. Blend again. Store in a bottle. Refrigerate.

Combine water, rice and salt in a medium saucepan. Cook over medium heat until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed, about 20 minutes. Add milk, sugar and vanilla. Cook for 2 more minutes. Stir in 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon. Pour into a 2-cup serving dish. Cover with plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 3 hours or until set. Garnish with the remaining 1/2 teaspoon cinnamon.
In a medium bowl, combine tapioca, milk and sugar. Beat egg lightly and add to mixture. Stir in vanilla. Pour into rice cooker. Cook according to manufacturers instructions. Serve warm or cool.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Lightly spray an 11 x 7 x 2 inch glass casserole dish with nonstick cooking spray. Combine the ground beef, onion and parsley in a large skillet. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring to break up the meat. Drain any fat. Stir in the soup and tomato sauce. Heat through. Add the water and rice. Bring to a boil. Stir in green beans. Place in the 375 degree oven. Bake until heated through. Makes 6 servings. Nutrition per serving: 630 calories, 15 g fat (6 g saturated fat), 65 mg cholesterol, 79 g carbohydrates, 44 g protein, 12 g fiber, 950 mg sodium.

Remove any excess fat from ham and rub with brown sugar and mustard. Place ham in crock pot and add rest of ingredients. Cook on high for four hours or low for six hours. Remove ham from crock pot and shred with fork. Pour liquid into small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for ten minutes. Remove ham from crock pot and shred with fork. Pour liquid into small saucepan and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for ten minutes. Serve ham over rice with glaze. Makes four servings.
Process artichokes and olives in food processor until finely chopped. Stir in garlic. Add remaining ingredients and process until smooth. Serve with crackers or fresh vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Brown bratwurst in skillet. Add sauerkraut and saute for 1 minute. Place in baking dish. Combine Bisquick and milk. Mix well. Stir in egg. Pour over bratwurst mixture. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden. Cool for 10 minutes before cutting. Serve with mustard.

Cook small shell pasta in large pot of boiling water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain. Place in large mixing bowl. Combine ranch dressing mix and mayonnaise in small bowl. Stir in milk.
