Pour over pasta and toss. Add frozen baby peas. Stir in green onions, tomatoes and black olives. Serve immediately or refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Melt butter and chocolate together in a double boiler over simmering water. Remove from heat and stir in eggs and vanilla. In a separate bowl combine flour, cinnamon and salt. Stir into chocolate mixture. Fold in 1 ½ cups walnuts. Turn mixture into an ungreased 13×9-inch baking pan. Bake for 30 minutes. Cool completely in pan on wire rack. Spread brownie with chocolate glaze. Sprinkle with remaining walnuts. Makes 20 brownies.

Preheat oven to 350f. Toss zucchini with olive oil and garlic. Spread on a baking sheet and bake for about 25 minutes or until tender but still firm. Let cool. Cook pasta according to directions on package. Toss with red bell peppers, zucchini, olives and sunflower seeds. Serve with pesto sauce on top.

Wash sweet potatoes. Boil them in a large pot of water until they are tender. Drain them in a colander. Mash them in a large mixing bowl with a fork. Add melted unsalted butter and green onion to the sweet potatoes. Add salt and black pepper to taste. Serve with sour cream.

Cook polenta according to package directionspour into a greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Top with marinara sauce, sprinkle with pesto sauce, and then top with pine nuts and mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375 for about 25-30 minutes or until heated through.

Prepare gelatin according to directions on box, adding powdered drink mix to hot water before adding cold water. Let stand 5 minutes to dissolve gelatin. Stir in sugar until dissolved. Divide into molds or plastic cups. Refrigerate until set, 4 to 6 hours or overnight. Run warm water over popsicles to remove from mold or cups. Serves 6.

In a small bowl combine satay sauce, soy sauce, lime juice, and gingerrootset aside. Heat a heavy non-stick skillet over medium-high heat. Sprinkle lamb chops with salt and pepper and dredge in flour, shaking off excess flour. Add lamb to pan and cook until browned on both sides and medium rare inside (125 degrees Fahrenheit). Transfer lamb to a platter and serve with sauce spooned over the top and sprinkled with additional toasted sesame seeds if desired.

Chop up a small white onion and cook in olive oil. Add minced garlic. Add cream cheese. Stir until well mixed. Add seasonings and mix. Spoon a generous amount into each mushroom and sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Broil in oven until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Beat 2 cups of flour and salt. Cut 1 1/2 cups of butter into this mixture and work together with your fingers until the dough resembles course crumbs. Add 1/2 cup of cream cheese and 1/4 cup of water, mix together well and knead into a ball. Wrap the ball in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes. Roll out dough onto a floured surface to 1/8" thickness. Use a pastry cutter or knife to cut the dough into 2" circles. Use a fork or your fingernails to poke a hole into the middle of each circle, or leave the center plain. Bake on a lightly greased baking sheet at 375F for about 12 minutes or until lightly browned and puffed. Cool before storing in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Combine lemon pepper and flour in small bowl. Dip each breast into flour mixture. In large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, brown chicken in oil. Remove from skillet and set aside. In same skillet, stir together curry powder, lemon juice and dressing. Add scallions and cook until scallions are tender. Arrange chicken on plates and top with scallion mixture. Slice avocado and arrange over top. Garnish with tomatoes and olives.

Bring 1 cup water to a boil in a saucepan. Add asparagus and cook until crisp tender, about 3 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Transfer to a bowl and toss with vinegar. In a small bowl, whisk together oil and lemon juiceadd to asparagus and toss. Sprinkle with sesame seeds and lemon rind.

Slice the onion. Heat the oil in a wide pan and add the onions. Stir for about 10 minutes until they have turned golden. Add the flour and stir for 1 minute. Add the stock and stir again. Simmer for 10 minutes. Peel the zucchini and cut into 1-inch cubes. Add to the pan and simmer for 20 minutes. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Divide the soup between serving bowls. Crumble in the Roquefort and stir. Serve immediately.

Boil the potatoes until they are just tender. Drain and allow to cool slightly. Add the red onion, sour cream, mayonnaise, vinegar, dill, salt and pepper. Mix well to combine and refrigerate at least an hour before serving.

In a large saucepan combine vinegar, sugar, apples and ginger. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Add garlic and red pepper flakes. Reduce heat and simmer 15 minutes. Add raisins and continue to simmer 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Transfer to a food processor or blender. Puree. Add vinegar. Add salt and cayenne to taste. Chill. Can be served as a spread or chutney. Will keep 1 to 2 weeks in refrigerator. Makes 4 cups.

Heat cooking spray in an electric rice cooker. Stir in the chinese sausage. Add the green onion. Stir until chinese sausage is broken up. Stir in the water, cover with the lid. Cook until the white rice is tender. Stir in the cilantro leaf. Sprinkle on the black sesame seeds. Makes 2 servings.

Melt butter and brown sugar together. Combine graham cracker crumbs, sliced almonds and melted butter mixture in a large bowl. Pat mixture into 13x9x2 inch pan. Chill for at least 1 hour or up to 3 days. Break into pieces and serve.
Melt margarine and sugar together. Combine with graham cracker crumbs and nuts. Spread mixture into greased 8-inch square pan and press down evenly. Chill until set. Makes about 1 1/2 dozen.

In a large resealable plastic bag, combine the first eight ingredients. Add chickenturn to coat. Marinate in refrigerator for at least 2 hours or up to 8 hours. Remove from bag, discarding marinade, and grill over medium heat or broil 4 inches from heat 10-12 minutes on each side or until no longer pink (170 degrees f) in center. Let stand 5 minutes before cutting.

Dissolve sugar and salt in the water. Beat eggs and add to the sugar and salt mixture. Slowly add the matzo meal to the egg mixture. Stir with wooden spoon until mixture is smooth. Heat oil in frying pan over medium heat. When oil is hot enough to fry in (but not burn) dip 1/2 cup of the batter into the oil with your hand. Remove after 1 minute and place on paper towel to drain. Dip the doughnut in the cinnamon sugar mixture. Serve warm.

Combine water, sugar, lemon juice and ice in a large pitcher. Pour into glasses. Divide lychee pieces evenly between 8 glasses. Add Malibu to each glass and stir. Pour into glasses. Garnish with lychee pieces. Makes 8 servings.
Crack open oysters. Salt and pepper to taste. Dip each oyster in egg. Dip each in cracker crumbs. Fry in hot vegetable oil until golden brown. Serve with hot sauce.

Heat oil in heavy saucepan over medium heat. Add onion. Cook 5 minutes or until lightly browned. Add spinach. Cook 3 minutes or until spinach wilts. Remove from heat. Combine with rice in large bowl. Melt butter in small saucepan. Stir in tomatoes. Cook until tomatoes are soft. Stir in remaining spices. Pour tomato mixture into spinach mixture. Toss to mix well. Serve with optional topping.

In 6-quart slow cooker combine first 4 ingredients. Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours. Stir in tomato sauce. Spoon 1/2 of the soup into 6 bowls. Top each serving with 1/4 cup of the tortilla chips. Top each serving with 1/4 of the cheese. Top each serving with 1/4 of the avocado. Top each serving with 1/4 of the sour cream. Top each serving with 1/2 tablespoon of the green onions.

Combine the first four ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth. Strain into a cocktail shaker half filled with ice cubes and shake until the outside of the shaker feels cold, about 15 seconds. Strain into margarita glasses and serve immediately. Garnish with a slice of lime and a maraschino cherry.
Combine brown sugar, cream cheese, sour cream and vanilla extract in small bowlmix well. Refrigerate 1 hour. Serve dip with fruit of choice. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350f line baking sheet with aluminum foil and lightly coat with cooking spray. Cut each chicken breast in half crosswise. Place each half between 2 slices of bacon. Roll up bacon and secure with wooden pick. Place on baking sheet. In small bowl combine marmalade, soy sauce and oil. Brush over chicken. In same bowl combine ginger, garlic and oil. Mix well and sprinkle over chicken. Bake uncovered for 20-30 minutes until chicken is cooked through and bacon is crispy.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place the chicken breast halves in a large glass baking dish. Whisk together the oil, spices and seasonings in a small bowl. Pour the mixture over the chicken breasts, and turn them to coat. Cover the dish and bake for 25 minutes. Remove the cover and continue to bake until the juices run clear when the meat is pierced with a knife, about 10 minutes more. Transfer the chicken to a serving platter and sprinkle with chopped fresh spring onion. Makes 4 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 24 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a large mixing bowl. In a smaller mixing bowl, combine shortening, 1/3 cup of the milk, and the egg, beating until smooth. Add the wet ingredients to the flour mixturestir just until moistened (batter will be thick). Divide the batter into the prepared muffin cups. Top each muffin with 1/2 teaspoon of the jam and 1/2 teaspoon of the nuts. Bake 20 to 25 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes before removing from muffin cups to wire racks. Cool completely on wire racks.

In a large mixing bowl beat butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in peanut butter. Add eggs one at a time beating well after each addition. Mix well. Add flour and baking soda. Beat until combined. Add chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 8-10 minutes. Remove from cookie sheet. Sprinkle with peanuts. Cool before eating.
Mix meat with onion in skillet over med heat. When browned add soup and veggies. Cook until veggies are heated thru. Pour over tater tots. Bake at 350 until top is browned. Serve with salad.
In a medium bowl, beat cocoa and sugar with a mixer until blended. Beat in egg whites until dry. Add cornstarch and saltmix well. Stir in pecans. Drop by level teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper.

Combine the graham cracker crumbs and sweet biscuits and sprinkle over a baking tray. Press down with a spoon until flat and bake for 10 minutes at 170 degrees celsius until crisp. Cool on a wire rack. Meanwhile combine the cheesecake with the strawberries and syrup until smooth. Pour over the base and cool completely before rolling into balls using the back of a spoon. Roll balls in icing sugar and serve.
Mix snow, condensed milk and vanilla. Serve immediately with decorative candies.

Heat yellow rice mix according to directions on package. Place in serving bowl. Top with chicken. Melt cheez whiz over chicken. Add frozen broccoli to the chicken mixture. Salt and pepper to taste. Top with sour cream.

Place pita rounds on baking sheet. Bake until crisp 5-8 minutes. Meanwhile, brown ground beef in large skillet over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. In a large bowl, stir together soup mix and water, then stir in yogurt, mint leaves and tomatoes. Place 1/2 of the meat mixture down center of each pita round, then top with 1/2 of yogurt mixture.

Combine lemon juice and olive oil. Reserve 1/4 cup of lemon juice and set aside in a small dish. Rub lamb with olive oil mixture and place in refrigerator overnight to marinate. Remove lamb from marinade and pat dry with paper towels. Mix together dried rosemary, dry mustard and black pepper and rub into lamb. Sprinkle with lemon zest and reserved lemon juice mixture. Grill over medium heat for 20 minutes or until desired doneness. Remove from heat and serve with roasted potatoes and asparagus or carrots. Serves 4 to 6 people.
In a tall glass, combine ice cubes with orange juice. Add Southern Comfort and Amaretto. Stir well. Add grenadine.

Prepare linguine as directed on package. While pasta is cooking, heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add garlic and leeks and saute 2-3 minutes until lightly browned. Stir in the white wine. Add clams and juice. Stir until the liquid is reduced by half. Remove clams and discard the shells. Add the linguine to the sauce and toss. Sprinkle with white pepper and oregano.

Bring milk to a boil in a saucepan. Remove from heat and add cocoa, sugar and rum. Stir well to dissolve the cocoa. Add dark chocolate and stir until melted. Divide the mixture among six mugs and top each with a few pinches of peppercorns. Serve hot.

Cut cabbage into 1 inch strips. Heat oil in a heavy skillet. Add cabbage and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add garlic and ginger and cook for 1 minute. Add onion and cook for 5 minutes. Add chili and turmeric and cook for 1 minute. Add water and cook for 2 minutes. Season with salt and serve with coconut.
Mix together the artichoke hearts, lemon juice and salt. Add oil and tarragon and cilantro and let marinate overnight. Drain and add the red pepper and sumac and serve.

In a small saucepan combine all the ingredients except the ginger. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer and cook for 5 minutes or until the cranberries pop open. Stir in ginger. Let the mixture cool slightly, then puree in a blender or food processor until smooth. Cool the sauce completely before serving. Makes 1 1/2 cups.

Place the salmon fillets on the grill and grill for about four minutes on each side or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Place the salmon fillets on the grill and grill for about four minutes on each side or until the fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. When finished grilling, remove the fish from the grill and place on a plate. Add the crushed red pepper flakes and garlic cloves and saute until fragrant and garlic cloves are lightly browned and crisp, about 1 minute. Add the red wine vinegar and stir well to combine and dissolve the garlic cloves. Add the sun-dried tomatoes and basil and stir well. Taste and add more salt and red wine vinegar if desired. Divide the tomato sauce among the salmon fillets and serve immediately.

Place sugar and corn syrup in a heavy-bottomed pan and cook over medium heat. Cook until sugar melts and bubbles appear, continue cooking until amber colored. Remove from heat and pour in cream. Stir until smooth. Stir in vanilla and nuts. Pour into buttered pan. Cool. Dip in melted chocolate.

Cook pasta in boiling water according to package directions. Meanwhile, melt butter in saucepan. Add flour and cook 1 minute. Gradually add milk. Cook and stir until thickened. Add cheeses. Drain pastaadd to cheese mixture. Mix well. Spoon into 2-quart casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Combine melted margarine, bread crumbs, and seasonings. Sprinkle evenly over pasta mixture. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes. Cool slightlysprinkle with parsley. Serve.

Cube veal, sprinkle with salt and pepper, dredge in flour and shake off excess. Brown veal in a large nonstick pan with oil. Add the onions and cook until they are tender. Add the mushrooms and cook until tender. Stir in the lemon juice, wine and whipping cream. Bring to a boil. Cook until the liquid is reduced to half. Stir in the veal. Simmer until the veal is heated through. Serve over egg noodles.

Mix the apricot preserves with the lemon juice. Add a little water to thin. Place the apricot preserves mixture in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until the preserves have thickened. Meanwhile, melt the butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in the honey until melted. Stir the butter mixture into the apricot preserves mixture. Add the lime juice, lime zest, and salt. Mix well. Strain the mixture through a fine sieve to remove the seeds. Pour the glaze into a bowl. Refrigerate until ready to serve. To make the daiquiri sauce, mix together all the ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low. Simmer 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Strain the sauce through a fine sieve. In a large saucepan melt the vegetable oil over low heat. Add the sugar. Stir until the sugar dissolves. Add the cornstarch mixture to the saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens. Add the pine

Heat the olive oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add the carrots and onions, and cook until tender. Stir in the cauliflower florets and the water. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat to low. Simmer for 10 minutes. Add the spinach pasta and cook until the pasta is tender. Stir in the dried basil and season with the salt and pepper. Serve with the romano cheese.

Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. In a medium bowl, combine dressing and maple syrup and mix well. Place carrots in a single layer on a baking sheet and pour dressing mixture over carrotstoss well to coat evenly. Bake for about 12 minutes or until tender and golden brown. In a small saucepan combine butter and pecansstir until butter is melted and mixture is well blended. Remove from heat and pour over carrots.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a cookie sheet. Cream together the butter and peanut butter until smooth. Beat in the sugar and eggs until well combined. Beat in the vanilla. Combine the quick-cooking oats and baking sodastir into the creamed mixture. Stir in the morsels. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto prepared pan. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Cookies will be slightly soft when removed from the oven. Cool and store.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. In a large bowl beat the butter and sugar together until well blended. Add the eggs one at a time and beat well after each addition. Add the vanilla extract and salt. In a small bowl whisk together the baking soda and xanthan gum. Add the baking soda and flour mixture to the butter mixture and beat until well blended. Stir in the instant vanilla pudding until well combined. Stir in the pecans. Drop the batter by heaping teaspoons onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until the tops are lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes then remove to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an air-tight container. Makes about 2 dozen cookies.

Cream together margarine and sugars. Add eggs and flavorings. Add flour, baking soda and salt. Mix well. Stir in milk chocolate chips and almonds. Drop dough by rounded tsp onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes. Let cool. Makes about 4 dozen.

In a large pitcher, place all the ingredients except the lemon and orange slices and stir well. Add the vodka and stir again. Remove lemons and oranges from pitcher and set on a serving tray. Pour punch into glasses and garnish with a lemon or orange slice.

Sauté the green onions in the butter. Add the chicken stock and the chicken. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is cooked through. Add the peas, mushrooms, carrot, soya sauce, and salt. Simmer 5 minutes more. Add the egg white to the soup, stirring continuously. Stir in the green onions and serve immediately.

Place the beans in a medium-sized pot of boiling water with a pinch of salt and cook for 3-5 minutes until crisp-tender. Remove with a slotted spoon and drain well. Heat the oil in a large skillet or saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the onions and garlic and cook until soft, about 5 minutes. Add the beans and tomatoes and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve warm or cold.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups.In a bowl combine flour, baking soda and saltset aside. In a large bowl combine pecans, sugar and vanilla. In a small bowl combine the egg and sour cream. Beat at medium speed until smooth. Add the flour mixturebeat until just moistened. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Heat your wok over medium high heat. Add the oil and allow it to warm up for 30 seconds. Add the onion and sauté for 2-3 minutes until it starts to soften. Stir in the chickpeas, tofu, zucchini and kale. Continue sautéing for 3-4 minutes. Add the lemon juice and zest and toss together until everything is well combined and heated through. Remove from heat and serve immediately. Enjoy!

Beat cheese until smooth. Stir in powdered sugar and vanilla until well blended. Spread onto tortillas. Top with miniature chocolate chips and cherries. Sprinkle with cinnamon. Store in refrigerator. Serve with apple or orange slices or celery sticks for dipping. Makes about 24 servings (1 tablespoon each).

Cook the rice according to package directions, adding the wild rice with the long grain in the last ten minutes of cooking. Mix the mayonnaise and sour cream in a bowl and set aside. Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and cut the celery in half lengthwise and then in small pieces. Add the chicken and celery to the mayonnaise and sour cream mixture and mix well. Add the cooked rice and stir until well mixed and coated with dressing. Fold in the salted cashews and alfalfa sprout. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve on a lettuce leaf with the lettuce leaf wrapped around the salad.
Toss greens with red onion, dressing and black pepper. Add the cranberries, oranges and almonds. Top with blue cheese crumbles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. In a medium bowl, combine the butter, garlic, orange zest and salt. Place tomatoes in a shallow panstuff each tomato with butter mixture. Bake until tender but not falling apart (about 30 minutes). Serve warm or at room temperature.

Make waffles according to package directions. Heat apple pie filling to a boil. Place waffle on a plate and top with a scoop of ice cream. Pour warmed apple pie filling over ice cream and sprinkle with pecans and cinnamon.

Mix together coriander, chicken and oyster sauce until well combined. Divide mixture into eight portions and shape them into balls with your hands. Heat coconut milk in a saucepan until just boiling point. Add the chicken balls and cook until they float to the surface of the milk. Add fish sauce and garlic and stir until sauce has thickened slightly. Serve hot with fresh coriander leaves and lime wedges.
Mash avocadoes until smooth. Stir in goat cheese until combined and spread onto crostini or crackers of choice. Top with pistachios, cilantro and flakes of red pepper.

Follow jello instructions on box, but instead of adding pineapple, add crushed pineapple and use 2 cups of boiling water instead of 1 cup. Pour into mold and chill overnight. Once set, top with crushed pineapple and marshmallows. When ready to serve, fold in cool whip and cottage cheese and garnish with sliced green olives on top.

Cut tofu into 1-inch cubes. Combine cornflour, sherry, soy sauce & oil. Dip tofu cubes in mixture & deep fry until golden brown. Remove & drain. Pour pineapple juice into frying pan & bring to a boil. Add tofu. Cook over medium heat until pineapple is tender. Garnish with green onion & bean sprouts. Serve with cooked rice.

Beat eggs, milk and sugar. Add vanilla. Dip bread in mixture. Place in a buttered casserole. Dot with butter. Combine brown sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle over bread. Bake at 375 degrees for 20-30 minutes or until topping is golden brown.

Grease and flour a 12 cup bundt pan. Sift flour. Cream together the cream cheese and butter until smooth. Blend in the vanilla. Add the eggs one at a time, beating well after each. Gradually beat in the flour. Add the hot water and the coffee. Beat until smooth. Pour into the pan. Bake at 350 for 45 to 50 minutes or until a skewer comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes. Invert the pan on a wire rack. Remove the pan. Cool completely.

Put water in pan. Add salt and 1 tsp thyme and juniper berries. Place turkey in pan. Cover. Bake for 2 hours 40 minutes. Add 1/2 cup chicken stock every 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Rub turkey with 1 tbsp olive oil. Sprinkle with 1/2 tsp sage and 1/2 tsp peppercorns. Cover loosely and return to oven for 1 hour. Increase heat to 425 degrees. Baste turkey every 10 minutes. Remove from oven and let rest 10 minutes. Carve and serve with gravy.

Prepare graham cracker crust according to package directions. Prepare kool-aid according to package directions. Add orange juice and mix well. Let cool. Beat cream cheese until smoothstir in kool-aid mixture until well blended. In a large bowl beat heavy whipping cream until soft peaks formfold into cream cheese mixture. Spread over crustchill at least two hours. Top with whipped cream before servinggarnish with orange slices if desired.

In a small saucepan bring water to boil. Add corn and cook for 5 minutes. Remove from heat and add cream. Add chopped vegetables and bring to boil. Add salt and pepper to taste. Add parsley and cook for an additional minute. Stir in maple syrup. Serve hot in bowls and garnish with parsley.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a large mixing bowl combine flour, egg and cold water. Mix until smooth with no lumps. Divide the dough into two parts and roll out on a floured surface into two 6 to 8 inch round cakes about 1/4 inch thick. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden brown on the bottom and edges of the tart are dry to the touch. Cool on a wire rack. To assemble the tarts, cut out small circles of bacon and place on the bottom of each tart. Layer with zucchini slices, and sprinkle with basil and drizzle with a little oil.
Place everything in slow cooker. Cook on low for 8-9 hours. Remove ham bone.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine olive oil, pepper and garlic powder in a small bowl. Sprinkle each breast with about a teaspoon and a half of the mixture. Place in a baking dish. Sprinkle half the cheese over the top and bake for about 20 minutes. Remove from oven and top with salsa and remaining cheese. Return to oven for about 5 minutes until cheese is melted.

Peel the potatoes, cut them into thin slices and boil them in salted water. Drain well and dry on kitchen paper. Warm the mayonnaise and season with garlic and hot paprika. Place the potatoes in a shallow dish and add the garlic mayonnaise. Sprinkle with chopped parsley.

Heat 1 tablespoon of the olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook the mushrooms 5 to 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the remaining 1 tablespoon olive oil. Add the zucchini, squash, garlic, and seasoning. Cook 5 to 7 minutes or until the vegetables are crisp-tender. Add the mushrooms, stirring well. Cook 1 minute or until heated through. Makes 4 servings.

Beat the egg in a bowl. Add the egg white and beat again. Add a few drops of water and beat again. Heat in the microwave for 45 seconds& mix in a fork. Heat for another 30 seconds& mix again. Add the salt& pepper to taste& eat hot or cold.

Saute mushrooms, onion, bacon in oil until tender. Add evaporated milkcontinue sauteing until milk is reduced by half. Stir in sun-dried tomatoespour into bowlcoverkeep warm. Saute sour cream in pancontinue sauteing until mixture thickens and bubbles. Stir in pepperspoon over mushroomssprinkle with cheese. Serve over hot pastagarnish with parsley.

Thaw blueberries. Measure out 3/4 cups blueberries and set aside for decorating the top. In a large bowl, mix together the blueberries, 1/2 cup sugar and flour. In a saucepan, heat the margarine until melted. Pour it over the blueberry mixture and stir until well combined. In another bowl, combine the cream cheese and the remaining 1/2 cup sugar and beat until smooth and creamy. Fold in the pecans. Spoon the cream cheese mixture into the prepared pan and spread it evenly over the top. Drop the reserved blueberries over the top and spread them out evenly over the cream cheese layer. Bake in a preheated 325 degree F oven for 40 minutes. Serve warm or cold.

Combine first 3 ingredients in large bowl. Mix well and shape into 2-inch meatballs. Combine remaining ingredients in small bowlbrush over meatballs. Place meatballs on baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350f for 20-25 minutes or until meatballs are no longer pink in center. Makes 6 servings. Serve over cooked pasta or rice.

Slice baguette into 1/2 inch pieces. Cut each piece of bread into 1/2 inch pieces. Pour olive oil into a large bowl. Add tomatoes and bread. Toss with oil and seasoning. Place on a large platter and serve.

Heat a cast iron skillet over high heat. Add a thin coat of olive oil and the potato slices. Flip the potato when the bottoms have a crusty golden brown color. While the potatoes are cooking, beat the eggs in a bowl. When the potatoes are done and the eggs are beaten pour the eggs on top of the potatoes. Add the salt. Cook until the eggs are set. Cut into wedges and serve.

Heat oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add onion and saute until onion is soft. Add rice and saute for about 3 minutes. Add chicken stock. Add chicken and cover. Simmer until rice is cooked. Stir in chicken bouillon cube. Add salt. Serve hot.

In large skillet brown kielbasa. In large crockpot combine kielbasa, cabbage, potatoes, carrots, chicken broth, diced tomatoes, italian seasoning. Cook on high for 4 hours. Serve over rice or noodles. Makes 8 servings.
Peel and cut the potatoes in half. Fill each half with 2 teaspoons of butter, 2 teaspoons of milk, 1 teaspoon of cheese and 1 slice of bacon. Place in microwave for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine butter, sugar and condensed milk in a large bowl. Beat until smooth. Stir in the flour. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes until golden. Allow cookies to cool before removing from the pan.
Toast the french baguette. Spread each side with mayonnaise and dijon mustard. Layer ham and avocadoes onto bread. Sprinkle with sea salt and black pepper. Special.

Combine 1 cup water and 1 Tbsp cornstarch in saucepan over medium heat and stir until thick and smooth. Add 1/2 c cider vinegar, 1/4 c sugar, 1 tsp onion powder and 1/2 tsp Morton Lite Salt. Remove from heatstir until thick and smooth. Cover and refrigerate for up to 3 weeks. To serve, pour dressing over 1/2 head lettuce and top with 1/4 cup chopped celery and 1/4 cup chopped red bell pepper. Garnish with 2 Tbsp chopped fresh parsley and 1 tsp chopped fresh dill or 1/4 tsp celery seed. Makes about 1 cup dressing.
In a large bowl, combine arugula, pecans, peach, cheese. Add dressing. Toss to coat. Serve.

Cook the hamburgers until fully cooked. Drain off any fat and crumble into a large bowl. Add the celery and stir. Add the seasonings. Add the broth and stir. Let the mixture cool to room temperature. Crumble the bread into a large bowl. Add the dressing and stir. Mix the eggs in a bowl with the milk and stir into the dressing mixture. Add more broth if too dry. Melt the margarine in a skillet. Add the onions to the skillet and saute until softened. Pour the onions into the dressing mixture. Stir in the eggs. Spread into a greased baking dish. Bake for 30 minutes. Serve hot.

Combine cauliflower florets and 2 cups water in a saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Cook 5 minutes or until cauliflower is very tender. Strain through a colander. Set cauliflower aside. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook for 3 minutes. Stir in flour and cook 1 minute. Add cauliflower and cook 3 minutes or until well blended. Gradually add chicken stock and milk. Bring to a boil. Cook over medium heat until mixture thickens. Stir in cream cheese and garlic and herbs. Stir until smooth. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

Heat oil in a wok over medium heat. Add mushrooms and stir-fry until they are wilted and fragrant, about 1 minute. Add bok choy and stir-fry until wilted, about 2 minutes. Add water and bring to a boil over high heat. Add salt and simmer for 1 minute. Serve immediately with steamed rice.
Spread peanut butter on toast. Sprinkle with honey and dust with pumpkin pie spice. Serve with milk for a quick breakfast or snack.

In a small saucepan, combine caramel sauce, brown sugar cinnamon syrup and espresso. Cook over medium-low heat for about 1 minute or until warm. Stir in milk until warm and frothy. Pour into a coffee glass and top with whipped cream and sprinkle of cinnamon.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a large skillet or saute pan over medium heat, heat the oil. Add the onion and garlic. Saute for about 2 minutes or until the onion is soft. Add the turkey and mushrooms. Cook until the turkey is done. Stir in the tomato paste. Add the tomato sauce, water, and seasonings. Heat through. Stuff the bell peppers with the turkey and sauce. Place the stuffed bell peppers into a baking dish. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Serve garnished with parsley.

Place chops into a zip-lock bag with pork loin, 1/2 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp pepper. Marinate at room temperature for at least 30 minutes or for up to 2 hours. Heat vegetable oil in a skillet until it sizzles when you drop a little water into it. Add chops to pan. Add onion slices to skillet. Cook for about 5 minutes. Deglaze skillet with water and stir to dissolve any brown bits. Add ketchup, brown sugar, lemon juice and lemon zest to skillet. Bring to boil. Lower heat to medium-low. Simmer for 10 minutes. Turn chops over. Simmer another 5-10 minutes. Check for doneness. Serve with rice.

In a small bowl combine marmalade and mustardset aside. In a small bowl combine garlic powder, salt and pepperset aside. Place salmon in a shallow glass baking dishbrush with cooking spray. Sprinkle with the spice mixtureturn to coat. Place salmon in the oven and bake for approximately 12 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. During the last few minutes of baking brush the salmon with the marmalade mixture and continue baking until glazed. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Melt marshmallows in a large heavy-bottom pot over low heat. Remove from heat and stir in cream slowly. Stir until thick. Stir in ice cream. Spoon into a parfait glass or bowl. Drizzle with caramel. Garnish with chopped nuts and/or drizzled chocolate.

In a large saucepan melt margarine over low heat. Add marshmallows and stir until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in cereal and dried cranberries. Press into a greased 13x9 pan and cut into squares.

Melt butter in a sauce pan over medium-high heat. Add scallions and garlic and cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture is aromatic and the scallions are just lightly browned. Add the flour and cook, stirring constantly, for about 1 minute. Whisk in the broth and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes. Add the mushrooms and simmer for another 1 minute. Stir in the cream and cook for about 2 minutes longer. Add the tarragon and season with salt and pepper to taste. Pour into individual bowls and serve.

Put baking cocoa and sugar in a saucepan. Add water. Bring to a boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in milk. Add vanilla extract. Pour into mugs. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with ground cinnamon.
Thoroughly mix all ingredients together and chill 2 hours. Serve on lettuce leaves for a light meal.

Cut tofu into small cubes. Combine 1/4 cup flour with 1 teaspoon sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt in a small bowl. Toss tofu cubes in flour mixture. Heat 2 inches vegetable oil in a wok. Add tofu cubes in batches, and cook until golden brown. Remove from wok with slotted spoon, and place on paper towels to drain. In a bowl mix together 1/4 cup vinegar, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1/2 teaspoon garlic powder, 1/4 teaspoon sugar, 1/2 teaspoon sesame oil, 1/4 teaspoon red pepper flakes, 2 teaspoons chili paste, and 1 cup water. Toss tofu cubes in dressing. Serve with steamed white rice.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees f. Line a baking sheet with foil for easy clean up. Trim ends off brussels sprouts. Cut in half and place on prepared baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper, and toss well until evenly coated. Roast 25-30 minutes or until tender and browned. Remove from oven and toss with parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl or in a cup with a spout pour 1 cup of water. Add 1 tablespoon cocoa powder, 1 teaspoon cinnamon, 1 teaspoon vanilla extract, 2 packets of artificial sweetener and stir. Pour into bottle or jar with a tight fitting lid.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease and flour two 9×5-inch loaf pans. In a large bowl, combine the flour, baking powder, and matcha green tea powder. Set aside. In a large mixer bowl, cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time, then stir in the flour mixture just until combined. Spoon the batter into the prepared pans, and bake for 50 to 60 minutes in the preheated oven, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool the cakes in the pans for 10 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Combine the powdered sugar and 2 teaspoons waterstir until smooth. Drizzle over the cake.

Preheat oven to 350f. Mix almonds with olive oil in a bowl. Spread in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Sprinkle with paprika and sea salt. Bake about 15 minutes. Remove and sprinkle again. Return to oven to bake about 15 more minutes. Remove from oven. Store in an airtight container.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Clean mushrooms and dry them with paper towels. Cut each mushroom into 4 wedges. Heat olive oil in a small saucepan. Add breadcrumbs and saute until crumbs are golden brown. Add mushrooms to the pan. Turn the mushrooms over. Add artichokes, sun-dried tomatoes, capsicum, olives, feta cheese, thyme leaves and black pepper. Mix well. Transfer the mixture to a baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees F for about 10 minutes until golden brown.
Mix all ingredients together. Marinate steaks for 10-30 minutes in fridge. Grill or bake steaks about 3 minutes per side. Remove and let rest. Slice across the grain. Serve with rice or noodles.
Dust venison with salt and pepper and brown in hot butter. Add fresh mushrooms and sour cream. Add port wine and heat through. Add marjoram and heat until sauce has thickened. Serve over venison.
Combine mustard greens, vinegar, water, salt and pepper in crock pot. Lay chicken breast halves on top of greens and cover with lid. Cook 8 hours on high or 10 hours on low.
Juice the lemons and oranges. Add 1/2 cup sugar to the juice. Pour into a tall glass and add 2 scoops of ice cream. Add water to fill the glass. Garnish with the slices.

In a large skillet, saute green pepper and ham in butter until tender. Add tomatoes and tomato juice. Cook until mixture thickens. Stir in uncooked rice. Add water and peas. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Cook until rice is tender and liquid is absorbed. Serves 6.

Cook potatoes until they are just done. Drain and return potatoes to saucepan. Add flour and seasonings and stir over med-low heat until blended. Gradually add milk and continue stirring until smooth and thickened. Pour over potatoes and mix well. Place in crock pot and sprinkle with cheese. Cover and cook on high 1-1/2 hours or low 3-1/2 hours or until potatoes are tender and cheese is melted.
Preheat oven to 375f. Cut tomatoes in half. Rub cut sides with olive oil. Place on a large roasting pan. Season with sea salt and fresh thyme. Roast for 40 minutes. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray a 13x9-inch baking dish with olive oil spray. Place biscuits on a plate. Brush tops with olive oil. Sprinkle with garlic powder and salt. Bake for 15 minutes or until biscuits are firm. Remove from oven. Stir together garlic powder and dried herbs. Cut biscuits into 3-inch pieces. Arrange in prepared baking dish. Top each biscuit piece with bell peppers. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Stir together garlic powder and dried herbs. Cut biscuits into 3-inch pieces. Arrange in prepared baking dish. Top each biscuit piece with bell peppers. Sprinkle with cheeses. Bake for 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Remove from oven. Serve immediately.

Cook noodles in salted boiling water according to package directions. Drain. In a small saucepan melt butter. Blend in garlic salt. Stir in cream. Add dill weed. Toss noodles in mixture. Sprinkle with soft breadcrumbs. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 425f. Unroll pie crusts and place on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 425f for 6-8 minutes until crusts are browned. Remove from oven. Sprinkle the cheese evenly over crusts. Break bacon into small pieces and sprinkle over cheese. Dissolve horseradish with warm water to make a slurry. Mix egg yolks, flour and milk to form a thick batter. Mix in horseradish slurry. Beat egg whites until stiff and fold into cheese mixture. Pour mixture over cheese. Bake at 425f for 10-12 minutes until top is golden brown. Let cool on wire rack for 15 minutes before slicing.

In a large bowl, beat cream cheese & lemon zest until light & fluffy. Add 1 cup of powdered sugar & beat until combined. Add the Cool Whip & beat until combined. Fold in the raspberry filling. Spread the mixture evenly over the prepared cake. Refrigerate 2 hours. Sprinkle with raspberries before serving.

Prepare brownie mix according to directions. Spread into a well-greased jelly-roll pan or foil-lined pan. Bake 20-22 minutes. Cool. Crumble brownie into fine crumbs. In a large bowl combine the brownie crumbs, sweetened condensed milk, and heath bars. Refrigerate. Sprinkle with powdered sugar just before serving. Makes 24 truffles.

Beat butter until smooth. Add sugar and beat until fluffy. Beat in sour cream. Add flour, salt, baking soda, and baking powder. Beat until dough is smooth. Divide dough into 4 equal portions. Wrap each portion tightly in plastic wrap. Chill 2 hours. On lightly floured surface, roll each portion into 10-inch circle. Cut into 1/2-inch rounds with floured cutter. Place on ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 400 degrees for 8 minutes. Cool 1 minute. Remove from baking sheet. Place on cooling rack. Drizzle with lemon juice.

Heat some oil in a wok. Fry shanks on all sides until lightly browned. Remove shanks from wok, drain excess fat. In a saucepan, combine soy sauce, honey, cinnamon, and garlic. Stir well and bring to a gentle simmer. Add stock and simmer for 20 minutes. Return shanks to wok and cover with sauce. Simmer for another 20 minutes. Serve with jasmine rice and gai lan.

In a small bowl combine mustard and herbes de provence. Coat salmon fillets with the mustard mixture. Lay the salmon fillets on the baking sheet and bake for 8 minutes or until the salmon flakes easily with a fork. Serve with a fresh dill garnish.

Heat oven to 400. Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat. Add flour and whisk for 1 minute. Gradually add milk, stirring until smooth. Continue stirring over medium heat until mixture bubbles, 1-2 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in 1/2 cup white wine until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Set aside 1/2 cup mixture. Place 2 english muffins on a baking sheet. Top with cheese. Bake 2-3 minutes until golden brown. Transfer to a plate to cool slightly. Beat eggs, egg yolks, and remaining 1/2 cup mixture in a bowl until smooth. Place 1 muffin half on each of 4 plates. Top each with 1/3 cup egg mixture. Bake 10 minutes until puffed and golden brown. Top with bacon and remaining muffin half. Sprinkle with chives, if desired. Makes 4 servings.

Toss apples and pecans in a small bowl. Mix cheese and spices in another small bowl. Wrap apple mixture in each tortilla. Brush with butter and bake in dehydrator at 135f until done. Turn over once. To rehydrate, cover with a small amount of water.

Boil potatoes until done. Drain and place in large bowl to cool to room temperature. While potatoes are cooling, mix herbs and salt and pepper in a small bowl. Peel potatoes and cut in half or in fourths. Add potatoes and herbs to a large saute pan with 1/4 cup of butter or margarine. Toss well to coat potatoes with herbs and butter. Serve potatoes as a side dish or add to a green salad for a great lunch.

Mix flour, baking powder, salt and sugar in a large mixing bowl. Cut in shortening with pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add lemon rind and mix lightly. Beat egg lightly with milk in a measuring cupadd milk mixture to flour mixture just until dry ingredients are moistened. Stir in blueberries gently with a fork. Turn out onto a lightly floured surfaceknead gently 4 or 5 times to blend. Pat or roll to 1 inch thickness. Cut into wedges with a floured 2 inch biscuit cutter. Place scones on ungreased baking sheets. Bake at 400 degrees for 10 minutes or until golden brown. Makes 8 large scones or 16 small scones.

Heat oven to 375. In 1 1/2-quart casserole, mix noodles, soup, broth, sherry, chicken, 1 cup of the cheese, almonds, pimiento, mushrooms and salt and pepper. Spread in greased 1 1/2-quart casseroletop with remaining 1 cup cheese. Bake 30 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately with additional cheese if desired. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour two 9-inch round baking pans. Combine flour, cinnamon, baking soda and salt in large bowl. Set aside. Beat oil and sugar in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Beat in eggs, one at a time. Stir in flour mixture until well mixed. Fold in carrots. Spread batter evenly in pans. Bake for 35 to 45 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on wire racks for 10 minutes. Invert cakes onto wire racks. Cool completely, about 1 hour or longer. Beat cream cheese and butter in large bowl with mixer on medium speed until well mixed. Gradually add confectioners sugarbeat until well mixed. Fold in vanilla extract. Spread frosting between layers and over tops and sides of cakes. Garnish with walnuts if desired.

Beat egg whites with cream of tartar and sugar until stiff and glossy. Add coconut, pecans and vanilla. Mix well. Place in a 9 x 13 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Remove from oven. Dissolve gelatin in boiling water. Stir in strawberries and sugar. Let cool. Pour over hot crust. Cool. Top with whipped cream and decorate with strawberries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine egg whites and sugar in a large bowl. Beat until stiff peaks form. Combine flour, baking powder and salt in a medium bowl. Gradually add to egg whites, beating on low speed until smooth. Spoon onto a greased 9-inch square baking pan. Bake for about 15 minutes or until slightly browned and firm. Cool in pan on a wire rack for about 1 hour. Meanwhile prepare glaze. Combine sugar and cornstarch in a medium saucepan. Stir in water and vanilla until well blended. Cook and stir over medium heat until thick and bubbly. Cool for about 30 minutes until glaze is spreadable. Pour glaze over the cooled apple filling and spread evenly. Refrigerate for about 1 hour. Cut into squares. Garnish with apple slices.

Heat vegetable oil in a pressure cooker over medium heat. Sprinkle roast with dried Italian dressing mix. Add onion, mix well. Sprinkle roast with ranch dressing mix and beef broth. Cook 35 minutes. Cook on high pressure 20 minutes or until the beef reaches the desired tenderness. Let stand for 10 minutes. Remove meat from the cooker, and transfer to a platter or cutting boardcover with foil to keep warm while you make the gravy. Reserve the broth from the pressure cooker in a measuring cup or other container. Strain the broth to remove the onion pieces and discard onion pieces. Pour the broth back into the pressure cooker and add the gravy mixes. Heat over medium heat until gravy thickens to desired consistency. Serve the roast with the gravy over mashed potatoes.

Remove and discard the outer leaves of the brussels sprouts. Slice each sprout in half lengthwise. In a 12 inch skillet over medium heat, saute bacon until crisp and remove with a slotted spoon to a paper towel to drain. Add the sprouts to the bacon drippings in the skillet, sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Cook over medium heat for 15 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in the chopped bacon and sour cream. Serve warm.

Soak the lentils overnight. Drain the soaking water. Add water to a pot along with the lentils. Bring to a boil. Lower the heat to a simmer. Cover the pot. Simmer for about 30 minutes. Add ginger, turmeric, salt and cayenne. Cook for another five minutes. Add vegetable oil and stir. Add the dried onions and cumin. Cook for one minute. Remove from the heat. Serve hot. Serves about four.

Place 1/3 of cake in a trifle bowl. Top with 1/3 of the strawberries. Top with 1/3 of the whipped cream and 1/3 of the chocolate chips. Repeat with layers. Chill before serving. Sprinkle with more chocolate chips if desired.

Combine the dry ingredients in a bowl. Cut in butter until crumbly. Add milk and stir to form a dough. Add more ice water if needed to form a dough ball that does not stick to hands or bowl. Turn out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead until smooth. Roll out to 1/4 inch thickness. Cut with a 2-inch round cutter. Place on ungreased sheet. Brush with melted butter. Bake at 400 degrees F until lightly brown, 10-15 minutes. Serve hot with fried chicken or ham.

Mix milk and cocoa powder in a small bowl. Beat together butter and sugar in another bowl. Stir in egg whites. Stir in cocoa-milk mixture. Stir in peanut butter. Combine flour, oatmeal and baking soda. Stir into cocoa mixture. Chill for 30 minutes. Drop by rounded teaspoons 1 inch apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Flatten slightly. Bake in 350 degree F. oven 10 to 12 minutes or until edges are golden and tops are cracked. Cool 1 minute on baking sheet. Remove to wire racks. Makes about 3 dozen.

Brown ground beef in a large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion and green peppercook 5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp tender. Add beans and barbecue saucemix well. Heat through. Spoon beef mixture into a 2-quart baking dish. Mix corn muffin mix and water in a small bowlstir in corn. Spoon corn over beef mixturesprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near centre comes out clean. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a large microwave safe bowl combine all ingredients. Microwave uncovered for 4-6 minutes or until the mixture has thickened. Let cool for 15 minutes. If you want the butter to be more spreadable, refrigerate. The butter can be stored at room temperature or in the refrigerator.

In the bottom of the crock pot add the onion, celery ribs, cauliflower and chicken stock. Cover with a lid or place the lid on top of the crock pot. Cook on low for 6 hours. In a medium sauce pan melt the butter over medium heat. Add the flour and cook 1 minute. Whisk in the cream until smooth. Add the Worcestershire sauce. Stir until the soup mixture is smooth. Stir the cheese into the soup mixture until melted. Stir into the crock pot. Cook an additional 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Pour milk into a large mixing bowl. Add oil and sugar. Sprinkle yeast over top of mixture and let sit for 10 minutes. Add flour and cornmeal and stir until a soft dough forms. Cover bowl with plastic wrap and let stand for about 2 hours. Pre-heat oven to 400 degrees. Prepare pizza sauce and set aside. Roll out dough into 2 pizza pans and top with pizza sauce and toppings. Bake for about 10 minutes or until crust is golden brown.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. In a bowl combine the chicken breasts with the salt, pepper, lemon juice and butter. Place in a baking dish. Cover the dish with foil and bake for about 1 hour or until the chicken is no longer pink in the middle. In a small saucepan combine the metaxa brandy with the cream and bring to a low simmer over low heat. Take off the heat and stir in the fresh basil. Pour the sauce over the chicken breasts.

Heat oven to 375 degrees. Chop garlic finely and saute in a little olive oil. Add chopped tomatoes. Bring to the boil and cook for 5 minutes. Season with dried herbs, sugar and salt and pepper. Place rindless bacon on a baking sheet and place in oven for 15 minutes. Meanwhile cook pasta according to pack instructions. Add mascarpone cheese to bacon mixture and toss through pasta.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, saute the ground beef and onion together until browned. Stir in the kidney beans. In a large saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Stir in the rice and cook according to package directions. Drain the liquid. Mix the salsa into the cooked rice. Stir in the ground beef mixture. Transfer to a 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake uncovered at 350 F. for 30 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Serves 4.

Stir together the raspberries, water, sugar and lime juice. Cool the mixture in the freezer for about an hour or until it starts to thicken. Transfer the raspberry mixture to a blender. Blend until smooth. Transfer the raspberry puree to a shallow freezer-safe container. Freeze the raspberry puree until very slushy but not frozen solid. Take the raspberry puree out of the freezer to let it soften just a little. Then scrape the raspberry puree with a spoon to create larger granita flakes. Add the champagne, scrape to blend, return to the freezer for about an hour. Remove the raspberry champagne granita from the freezer. Allow the granita to soften at room temperature for about 15 minutes. Then scrape it with a fork to create a softer granita. Serve the raspberry champagne granita in glasses or bowls. Garnish with mint leaves.
Brown bacon in skillet. Remove bacon and add onion and green peppers. Add cabbage and carrots. Add roast pork. Add rice. Add soy sauce. Stir fry. Add frozen peas. Cook until hot.
In a large bowl combine the ramen noodles, cabbage mix, sunflower seeds, almonds, green onion, sugar and vinegar oil mix. Mix well and chill for at least 1 hour before serving.
Beat the eggs with the cream cheese, dill, garlic powder, salt & pepper in a large bowl until smooth. Pour into a greased 8x8 casserole pan and bake at 350 for 20-25 minutes.

Combine vodka, orange liqueur and lime juice in a cocktail shaker with ice. Shake vigorously for about 30 seconds. Strain into a martini glass and top with cranberry juice and simple syrup. Garnish with a raspberry and a rosemary sprig.

Cook the lentils according to package directions. Drain and rinse under cool water. Combine lentils with the remaining ingredients in a medium bowl. Toss gently until well combined. Garnish with tomatoes and serve at room temperature or chilled.

Mix together all dry ingredients, then add fat and mix with your hands. Place tablespoons of mixture onto a baking tray and flatten with your hands or a spatula. Bake at 180 c for 10 minutes or until they are a light golden brown. Serve hot with butter or cheese sauce.
Peel and cut carrot into thin slices. Boil carrot with sugar for 2 minutes. Add salt and spices. Let cool. Add vinegar and oil. Mix well.

Combine apples, strawberries and rhubarb in a large bowl. Toss with 1/2 cup sugar and 2 tsp cinnamon. Place in a greased casserole pan. Mix flour, brown sugar, nutmeg and 1/2 tsp cinnamon in a small bowl. Cut in 3/4 cup butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Sprinkle over fruit mixture. Dot with remaining butter. Bake at 375 degrees f until golden brown and bubbly, about 45 minutes. Serve warm with ice cream or whipped cream.

Preheat the oven to 180c. Grease a 20cm round cake pan. Cream the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Fold in the flour. Add the vanilla. Pour the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown and cooked through. Cool in the pan for 10 minutes. Turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Dust with icing sugar before serving.

Fill a teapot with boiling water and add tea bags. Let steep for 3 minutes. Remove tea bags and stir in frozen lemonade concentrate. Stir in sugar. Fill glasses with ice cubes. Pour tea mixture over ice cubes. Top with ginger ale. Garnish with fruit slices. Makes 4 servings.

Heat the oven to 375f. Butter a shallow baking dish, then put the asparagus into it and sprinkle with the tuna flakes and the salt. Dot with the butter and bake for 25 minutes. Meanwhile make the sauce. In a large saucepan or skillet over low heat melt the butter, stirring in the flour with a whisk until smooth and bubbly. Add the lemon juice and stir until thickened and smooth. Add the curry powder and hot pepper sauce and cook for 2 minutes, stirring often. Remove from the heat and stir in the sour cream. Spoon over the baked asparagus and tuna and serve at once.
Combine all ingredients in blender until smooth. Chill for 1 hour before serving.

In a large skillet over high heat, cook chicken in oil until cooked through. Meanwhile, combine all remaining ingredients in a saucepan. Bring to a boilreduce heat and simmer 5-7 minutes or until thickened. Serve over hot cooked pasta shells. Sprinkle with parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Lightly spray 12 muffin cups with cooking spray. Mix together the cornbread mix, milk and egg until smooth. Stir in ham and cheddar cheese. Fill each muffin cup half full. Bake until golden brown, about 15 to 18 minutes. Yield: 12 servings.

In a large clay pot, combine the carrot, potato, chicken broth, chicken, garlic, parsley, caraway seeds, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boilreduce heat to low. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Stir occasionally. Sprinkle with Italian dressing before serving. Serve with brown rice.

To prepare the garlic, put it in a small saucepan with 3 tablespoons of water and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until the garlic is very soft and golden brown. Drain and set aside. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a large pot over medium-high heat. Add the linguine and stir to coat. Add 2 cups of water. Bring to a boil and cook according to package directions. While pasta is cooking, heat 1 tablespoon of butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Add the garlic and stir until it turns golden. Add 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar and continue to stir until reduced by half. Remove from heat and stir in 2 tablespoons of brown sugar and set aside. Drain pasta and add to the balsamic sauce. Stir to coat and then add the parmesan cheese. Toss well and serve immediately.

Place lamb in a large resealable plastic bag set in a shallow dish. In a small bowl combine the barbecue sauce and sweet chili saucepour over the lamb. Seal and turn to coat. Refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight. In a large skillet heat oil over medium-high heatadd lamb, ginger and garlic. Cook for 4 minutes. Add honeycook until thickened and lamb is cooked through. Serve with white rice.

Heat broth in saucepan over low heat. Cut seitan into bite sized pieces. Cook soba noodles as directed. Add carrots and broccoli, cook for 5 minutes. Add seitan, cook until hot. Add tamari, teriyaki sauce, sesame oil and rice vinegar. Pour over noodles.

In a stockpot over medium-low heat, melt butter and cook onion until translucent. Add flourcook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Whisk in stocksimmer 5 minutes until thickened. Add broccolisimmer 5 minutes or until crisp-tender. Remove from heatstir in half the cheese until melted. Season with paprika and pepper. Ladle into serving bowlstop with remaining cheese.
Muddle mint leaves in lime juice and sugar, and top with ice cubes. Add white rum and pomegranate juice, and stir well to mix. Garnish with lime wheel and pomegranate seeds.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Peel potatoes and cut in half. Peel and cut squash in half lengthwise. Pour about 1 inch of oil in a frying pan. In a bowl mix potatoes, squash and onions with flour. Heat oil and fry potato mixture in hot oil until browned and crisp. Turn potatoes and fry other side until brown. Place in oven for 10 minutes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

In a large Dutch oven or pot over medium heat bring the water, potatoes, onion and bacon drippings to a boil. Reduce heat to medium low. Cover pot and simmer for 10 minutes. Add salt and sugar to taste. Add pepper to taste. Add clams. Cook 5 minutes. Remove from heat. Add cream. Stir thoroughly. Serve in large bowls.
Combine all ingredients in blender and blend until smooth. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Serve over iceberg lettuce.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Grease and flour 2 bread pans. With electric mixture, beat 2 eggs, 1/4 cup sugar and 1/4 cup water for 1 minute at medium speed. Beat in pumpkin, oil, and salt until combined. At low speed, beat 1 1/4 cups flour and 1 tsp baking soda into pumpkin mixture until just combined. Beat 1 1/4 cups flour and 1 tsp baking soda into pumpkin mixture until just combined. Pour into prepared pans and bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until bread tests done. Cool bread in pan on wire rack 5 minutes and then remove to rack to cool completely. Makes 2 loaves.

Peel the skin off the onions and cut them into quarters. Place them in a pot and add the vegetable oil. Sautee the onions until they are translucent and begin to caramelize. Add the lentils and the water. Bring it to a boil and add the salt and pepper. Simmer for 20-25 minutes or until the lentils are soft.

Cook egg noodles. In a skillet cook corned beef and sauerkraut with caraway seeds. Mix together noodles, corned beef mixture and thousand island dressing. Add swiss cheese and milk to mixture. Pour into a 9x13 casserole dish. Cut pumpernickel into thin strips. Melt butter. Sprinkle melted butter over pumpernickel strips and place on top of noodles. Broil until crispy.
Place chicken in 9x13 inch pan. Mix instant mashed potatoes and parmesan cheese and spread over chicken. Dot with butter. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Bake at 350 degrees about 1 hour.

Break cauliflower florets into pieces. Peel carrots and cut into small pieces. Finely chop red onion. Combine cauliflower, carrots and red onion. In a small bowl combine capers and fresh parsley. In another small bowl combine white wine vinegar and dijon mustard. In a third small bowl combine olive oil and mayonnaise. Add cauliflower mixture to the bowl with vinegar and dijon mustard and stir until well coated. Add the dressing and toss lightly.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Spray a baking dish with cooking spray. Place chicken breasts in baking dish. In a small bowl combine picante sauce and chipotle powder. Spoon over chicken breasts. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 15-18 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear. Sprinkle with green onions just before serving.
Wash and dry the spinach leaves. In a large mixing bowl, combine the spinach, pecans and sherry vinaigrette. Toss well. Add the gorgonzola and toss gently.

Remove strings from the beans, cut to desired length and steam or boil until crisp tender. In a large skillet melt butter over medium heat. Stir in flour. Add salt and pepper to taste. Cook until mixture is smooth and lightly browned. Stir in onion. Add sugar to taste. Stir in the beans. Cook until beans are coated well. Transfer to a casserole. Top with sour cream and sprinkle with cheese. Bake until heated through. Top with breadcrumbs before serving.

Place bread on baking sheet. Spread 1 side with mustard. Layer cheese on top and then ham. Whisk together eggs and skim milk. Pour over ham. Sprinkle cheese on top. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Serve with a side salad.

Mix sharp cheddar cheese with butter. Stir in flour and salt until well blended. Place in refrigerator until ready to bake. Heat oven to 400 degrees. Roll mixture into walnut-sized balls. Place about 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheet. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes or until golden. Serve warm. Yield 30 to 40 pieces.

Heat a large saucepan over medium high heat. Add butter, leeks and onion. Cook 4 to 5 minutes, or until soft. Add garlic cloves and cook for an additional minute. Add water and bring to a boil. Lower heat, cover and cook until potatoes are soft (about 10 minutes). Add chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for about 10 to 15 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir in tarragon. Pour into serving bowls. Garnish with a dollop of cream and a spoonful of yogurt. Serve immediately.

Combine the snap peas with the cream cheese. In a small bowl, combine the milk, curry powder and mango chutney. Pour this mixture over the cream cheese and snap peas and mix well. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving. Top with the peanuts. Serve with crackers.

Combine the beer with sugar, baking powder and 2 cups flour. Beat the egg and stir it into the mixture. Fold in the remaining flour 1/2 cup at a time to make a smooth batter. Heat oil for deep-frying to 375f. Dip the fish pieces into the batter. Deep-fry, a few at a time, for 5 minutes or until lightly golden. Drain on paper towels. Sprinkle with lemon pepper. Serve hot.

Cut asparagus in half lengthwise and toss with oil on a baking sheet. Broil on high for 5 to 7 minutes. Sprinkle asparagus with hazelnuts and toss. In a small bowl whisk together honeydew, orange juice, wine and mustard. Arrange asparagus in a platter and pour dressing over. Garnish with blue cheese.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Cook bacon in a pan over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from pan. Add onion slices to pan and cook until translucent. In a bowl mix meat, bacon, onion slices, garlic salt, black pepper, and lime juice. Spoon meat mixture onto tortillasprinkle with cheese. Roll up tortilla and place in a greased pan. Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes or until heated through. Serve with salsa. Garnish with avocado slices or onion rings, if desired.

Cut the tops off the sweet peppers and set aside. Remove seeds and membrane. Dice the reserved peppers tops. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook for 3-5 minutes. Add rice and cook for 1 minute. Add broth and bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Stir in corn and salsa. Heat through. Spoon rice mixture into the bottom of each pepper. Layer with beans and top with diced pepper tops and shredded cheese. Cover and bake at 375 for 30-45 minutes or until heated through. Top with sour cream and sprinkle with cilantro.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Mix egg, syrup, flour, baking powder and salt. Add milk gradually to make a batter. Turn into a greased muffin tin. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden. Serve warm.

Cook margarine and onions and garlic in large skillet over medium heat until onions are tender. Stir in rice and broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cover and simmer 20 minutes. Stir in peas and lemon juice. Cook 5 minutes longer. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Combine first four ingredients in a mixing bowl and beat well. Pour into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes or until edges are light brown. Cool completely. Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl and spread over cooled pie. Refrigerate for several hours or until firm. Cut into wedges and serve.

Place ham steaks in a shallow roasting pan. Add onion and brown sugar. Pour whiskey over ham steaks and onion. Combine the Dijon mustard and cider vinegaradd flour to the mixture and whisk until smooth. Gradually whisk in the water until the mixture is smooth and pour over ham steaks and onion. Cover with foil and cook for 45 minutes to 1 hour in a 325f oven. Remove foil and continue cooking for 10 more minutes until liquid is reduced and ham steaks are glazed. Cut the ham steaks into slices and serve.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Combine carrots, raisins, garlic, and 1/2 teaspoon of each of the spices in a large bowltoss to coat. Place carrots on baking sheet. Drizzle with olive oilsprinkle with brown sugar. Bake in preheated oven until carrots are tender, 35 to 40 minutes. Mash carrots until smooth. Mix in yogurt and remaining spice mixture. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375f. In a bowl, mix together the first five ingredients. Cut up the apples and put them in a 9 x 13 baking dish. Pour the flour mixture over the top. Bake for 30 minutes. In a small bowl mix together margarine and sugar. Drizzle over the top of the apple mixture. Bake another 15 minutes or until the crisp topping is golden brown. Serve warm with vanilla ice cream.

Boil 4 cups of water with 1 tsp. salt. Add 1/4 tsp. baking soda. Add ramen noodles and cook 1-2 minutes. Drain. Rinse with cold water. Toss with remaining ingredients. Store covered in fridge. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Grease 12 cup muffin pan or line with paper liners. In a large bowl, combine whole wheat flour, baking powder, cinnamon and salt. In a medium bowl combine eggs, oil, honey and orange zest. Beat well. Add orange juice. Stir in dry ingredients just until blended. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups. Bake for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 5 minutes. Makes 12 muffins.
Cream margarine, sugars and vanilla. Stir in flour, oats and salt. Stir in chocolate chips. Roll into balls and place on greased cookie sheet. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.

In a medium bowl combine sugar and flour. Stir in baking soda and baking powder. Add margarine. Using a pastry blender, cut in margarine until mixture is crumbly. Stir in pumpkin puree. Add ginger powder. Gently stir in orange juice until dough comes together. Turn dough out onto a floured surface. Using a rolling pin, roll out dough to about 1/2 inch thick. Using a pizza cutter or sharp knife, cut dough into 6 wedges. Place wedges on a greased baking sheet. Bake at 350 degrees f for 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from pan to a cooling rack. Serve warm.

Cook pasta according to package directions. Drain and combine with tuna. Add italian seasoning and cracker crumbs. Mix well. Spoon into a greased casserole dish. Melt butter and pour over top. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Serve hot.

In a medium saucepan bring 4 cups of water to a boil over high heat. Stirring often to avoid sticking add pasta. Boil for 10 minutes. Reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for 20 more minutes or until pasta is tender. Stirring constantly add milk, sugar, butter. Cook until heated through about 5 minutes.

Cook potatoes & onions until soft. Set aside to cool. Mix egg with milk & salt & pepper. Add potatoes & onions & bacon & roast beef. Add worcestershire sauce to taste and cheese. Put into pie shells & bake for about 20 mins or until puffy and lightly browned. Let cool a bit before eating.

Combine corn and chicken broth in a saucepan over medium heat. Cook until heated. Remove from heat. Add tomatoes, green chilies and tortilla chips. Stir. Add chicken breasts and cook for 5 minutes. Serve with lime wedges.

Cook sausage in skillet until no longer pink (drain). Add onion and cook until tender and golden. Add garlic and cook 1 minute more. In a separate pan bring broth to a boil and add the potatoes and cook for about 20 minutes or until fork tender. Drain and add to sausage and onion mixture. Stir in the spinach and cook until wilted. Pour the broth mixture into a 2 quart casserole dish and stir in the sausage mixture. Stir in the heavy cream. Cover and bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Uncover and sprinkle with freshly ground black pepper to taste. Serve immediately.
Mix Velveeta with sausage. Press into an unbaked 9 by 13 inch pan. Spread jelly over mixture. Sprinkle bread cubes on top. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Serve warm.

In large skillet saute bacon until crisp. Remove from skillet. In same skillet saute mushrooms and onion until tender. Add garlic and saute 1 minute more. Add green beans. Stir in parmesan cheese and cook for 5 minutes more. Add white wine and heat through. Toss with cooked bacon.

Peel and pit the avocadoes. Cut each avocado in half, remove the seed. Scoop the flesh into a large bowl. Mash with a fork or potato masher. Add the salt, lime juice, tomatoes, onion, and cilantro stems. Taste the guacamole. Add salt or lime juice to taste. Serve with tortilla chips. Serves 8.

In a medium bowl whisk together the olive oil, lemon juice, black pepper, and a pinch of salt. Add the shrimp, toss to coat. Add the avocado, celery rib, scallion, tomatoes, and parsley. Toss to combine. Taste for seasoning. Garnish with the red onion.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Season chicken with salt and pepper. Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in skillet over medium heat. Cook chicken until browned and juices run clear. Transfer to shallow baking dish. In same skillet whisk orange juice, mustard and cornstarch until well blended. Bring to a boil and stir until thickened. Pour sauce over chicken and bake for about 20 minutes, or until done. Remove from oven and sprinkle with sage and thyme before serving.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Peel and thinly slice the onions into rings about 1/2-inch thick and put into a large frying pan over medium heat with the oil and sugar and cook until the onions are caramelized and softened. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Put the pork tenderloin into a roasting tin and bake in the preheated oven for about 15 to 20 minutes or until cooked through and the internal temperature reaches 145 degrees (for medium rare) and then remove from the oven. Transfer the pork to a warm serving platter and top with the caramelized onions.

Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add garlic, onions and saute until tender. Add fish, tomatoes and green chilies, season to taste. Simmer for 10 minutes then add olives and wine. Cook for 5 minutes longer or until fish is tender and flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. In a small bowl combine orange juice, lemon juice, orange rind and nutmeg. Place fish in 9x13-inch baking dish. Pour marinade over fishturn to coat. Bake for 10 minutes. Turn fish overbake for 5 more minutes. Remove fish from baking dishtop with sliced onions. Bake until fish flakes easily with a fork. Serves 4.

Mix together flour and butter using a pastry blender or fork until the mixture resembles fine crumbs. Add the egg yolks and mix to a dough. Add milk slowly until the dough is soft enough to roll out. Roll out dough to about 1/4 inch thickness and cut into circles using a cookie cutter or glass (about 4 inches). Fill the dough circles with the filling (plums). Fold the edges over to form a semicircle and crimp together to seal the filling inside. Heat water to a boil, add the dumplings and cook for 5 minutes or until dumplings are done. Serve warm sprinkled with sugar and cinnamon.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Grease a 9×13 inch baking pan. In a medium bowl, combine yellow cornmeal, baking powder, baking soda, salt, eggs, cream-style corn, oil, and sour creamstir well. Pour batter into prepared baking pan. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutesremove from oven, and cool for 10 minutes. Cut into squares.
In 9x13 baking dish layer beans, ground beef, refried beans, colby-monterey jack cheese, cream cheese, sour cream, taco seasoning, jalapenos. Bake at 350 for 30 min. Serve with tortilla chips.

Microwave margarine and chocolate in microwave until just melted, stirring every minute. Stir in corn syrup and vanilla. Stir in Rice Krispies until well coated. Pour into a greased 9x13 inch pan and let set at room temperature until set. Cut into squares.

Cook the ham with the fatty part up, then set aside the bone and discard the meat. In a 2-quart casserole combine the potatoes, soup and milkadd the ham meat and bone. Sprinkle with the seasonings and bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

In a small saucepan over low heat, combine chocolate square, sugar, cinnamon and milk until smooth. Remove from heat. Add vanilla. Spoon into mugs or cups. Top with whipped cream and sprinkle with cinnamon.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 9x9 baking pan with cooking spray. Mix Bisquick and milk with wire whisk until dough forms. Press into baking pan with wet fingers and let set for five minutes. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Add chicken, corn and onion to dough layer. Mix together enchilada sauce and taco seasoning and pour over chicken mixture. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese and bake for an additional ten minutes or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Top with tortilla chips and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Pierce spaghetti squash with a sharp knife several times and bake in a 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) oven for 45 minutes or until squash is soft. Cool slightly and scrape out spaghetti-like strands of squash into a serving bowl. Cook bacon bits according to package directions until crispy. Drain on paper towels. In a small bowl, combine bacon bits, milk, nutmeg, salt and white pepper until smooth. Sprinkle over squash and toss gently to coat. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Muddle fresh mint leaves and lime juice in a large glass jar or pitcher. Add 2 cups of water, then stir in 1/2 cup of sugar. Add blueberries and gently stir until combined. Add lemonade and rum (or substitute club soda and rum) and stir until well combined. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour (or up to overnight) to let flavors blend. To serve, fill glasses with ice and pour over mojito mixture. Garnish with fresh mint sprig and a lime slice.

Mix all ingredients thoroughly and store in a tightly sealed container in refrigerator. Shake well before using. Use 1/4 cup of mix with 1/4 cup of mayo for dressing or use 1/2 cup of mix and 1 cup of sour cream or 1 cup of plain yogurt to make dip.

Boil eggs in water with a bit of vinegar added to the water. Take them out of the water when they are hard boiled. Cut in half with the bottom removed. Melt butter in a skillet. Slice the bread in half and butter the bread. Put the eggs in the bread like a sandwich. Broil until the bread is golden brown. Sprinkle with salt & pepper. Serve with a salad.

Heat cider over medium heat in a saucepan until boiling. Add raspberry concentrate and stir to combine. Cook and stir until the cider is reduced to desired consistency. Stir in the sugar and cinnamon stick. Remove from heat and serve warm.

Place all fruit in large bowl. Add pudding mix and milkstir with wire whisk until well blended. Add frozen orange concentratestir until well blended. Refrigerate 1 hour or until thickened. Stir in sour cream just before serving. Garnish with additional fruit if desired.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 2 tablespoons of olive oil and 1 chopped onion. Saute until softened but not brown. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons chili pepper flakes. Add 1/2 cup long grain rice. Add 2 cups chicken stock. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for about 20 minutes. Uncover. Add 1/2 cup frozen baby spinach. Cover and cook for 5 minutes. Add a little salt. Turn off heat. Cover with lid for about 10 minutes. Fluff rice with a fork. Garnish with fresh dill. Serve with yogurt.

Boil the egg noodles for 8-10 minutes in salted water. Drain and add a pat of margarine. Set aside. Heat 1 tbsp margarine in a frying pan and add flour.
