Stir constantly over medium heat until the flour is lightly browned. Add tuna and milk. Stir until well blended. Add mushrooms, peas and salt & pepper to taste. Pour over the egg noodles. Bake at 350f until cheese is melted and browned. Serve with crackers or garlic bread.

Preheat oven broiler to high heat. In a shallow bowl combine lime juice, tequila, soy sauce and garlic powder. Add chicken breasts to the bowl. Marinate for 30 minutes or until chicken is covered in the mixture. Remove chicken from marinade and discard marinade. Place chicken on a baking sheet and broil for 5 minutes on each side or until chicken is cooked through. Top each piece of chicken with tomato, onion and a sprig of cilantro. Serve on top of salad greens or over rice.
Wash and pat dry chicken livers. Dust with flour, salt, pepper and oregano. Heat oil and add livers. Fry about 4 minutes on each side. Add lemon juice when ready to serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with foilspray with cooking spray. In a large bowl toss chicken wings with 3/4 tsp salt and 1/4 tsp pepper. In a large Dutch oven or cast-iron skillet heat 3 in of vegetable oil over medium-high heat until shimmering. Fry wings in batches until golden brown and crispy, 6-8 minutes per batch. Transfer to paper towel-lined baking sheets to drain. In a small saucepan cook butter, hot sauce, white vinegar, and remaining 1/4 tsp each salt and pepper over medium-high heat until butter is melted and sauce is slightly thickened, about 3 minutes. Toss wings with sauce in a large bowl until coated. Bake wings until hot, about 3 minutes. Sprinkle with blue cheese crumbles and parsley if desired. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl combine milk and chocolate. Let stand 1 minute. Heat in microwave 1 to 2 minutes, stirring frequently. Stir in schnapps and marshmallows until marshmallows have melted. Serve hot. Yields 1 serving.

Melt butter in saucepan on low heat. Add sugar, eggs, lemon juice, zest of lemon, and salt. Stir well. Place in blender to combine thoroughly. Pour mixture into a buttered souffle dish, place in oven for one hour at 325. Bake until golden brown and cooked through.

In a large nonstick skillet over medium heat, cook sausage until browned. Remove from skillet and set aside. In skillet over medium heat, combine onion and beer. Bring to a boil and cook until almost evaporated. Stir in mustard, brown sugar, vinegar and cornstarch dissolved in water. Cook over medium heat until thickened. Return sausage to skillet. Serve over rice.

Saute the onion and ground beef until cooked through. Drain fat from beef. Add taco seasoning. Heat throughly. Mash the potatoes and season with salsa or taco seasoning to taste. Mix the potatoes with the ground beef. Spoon some of the mixture into the shells and top with sour cream and lettuce. Serves 4 to 6.

Heat butter in large pot. Add onion, celery and carrot and saute until tender. Add stock and bring to boil. Reduce heat and add cheddar cheese and flour. Stir until cheese is melted and mixture is thick. Remove from heat and stir in beer. Add tabasco sauce and worcestershire sauce. Season with mustard and pepper. Serve with toasted bread cubes.

Cook bacon and drain on paper towel. Crumble and set aside. Mix cheese, mayonnaise and onion. Add bacon and season with worcestershire sauce and pepper. Stir in diced pimento. Refrigerate at least two hours. Serve with crackers.

Melt bacon drippings in skillet and cook onions until lightly browned. Set aside. In another skillet fry breadcrumbs in butter until golden. Remove from heat. Add cooked onions, mild cheese and season to taste with salt and pepper. Mix well. Spread into an unbaked pie crust. Bake in preheated oven at 375 degrees for about 20 minutes or until golden. Serve hot.

Heat oil in large frying pan over medium heat. Add chickencook 6 minutes or until no longer pink. Drain excess fat. Stir in water and taco seasoning mix. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until mixture thickens and chicken is tender. Spoon chicken mixture into taco shells. Top with lettuce and shredded cheddar cheese. Roll up.

Cook linguine according to package directions. Heat oil in large skillet. Saute garlic, zucchini and broccoli florets until tender crisp. Add red pepper. Add chicken broth and simmer until thick. Add linguine to skillet and toss until thoroughly coated. Sprinkle with hot pepper flakes, salt and pepper. Serve sprinkled with fresh parmesan cheese.

In small saucepan combine 1 cup boiling water and 1/4 cup cocoa. Stir until smooth. Cool. Combine sugar, vanilla, eggs, shortening and buttermilk in large bowl. Stir in flour and baking soda. Stir in cocoa mixture. Pour into 13x9x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes or until toothpick inserted in center comes out clean. Cool completely. For glaze combine 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup sugar in small saucepan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until sugar dissolves. Bring to a boil. Boil 3 minutes or until syrup thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in vanilla and butter. Spread over cooled cake. Let stand until glaze is set. Cut into 2x3-inch bars. Store in tightly covered container.

Rub loin with garlic cloves. Sprinkle with rosemary and season with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil and wine in large skillet over high heat until boiling. Place loin into skillet and sear 1 minute per side. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until done. Remove from oven and cool slightly. Slice into 1/2" slices.

Cut ends off beans and trim to uniform length. Boil broth until reduced to 1/4 cup. Pour broth in a small bowl or measuring cup, add lemon juice. Place beans in a 9 x 13 inch roasting pan. Drizzle olive oil over beans and sprinkle with 1 tablespoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. Roast for 25 minutes, stirring once or twice. Sprinkle almonds on top of beans and roast for 5-7 minutes longer or until almonds are golden brown. Remove from oven and toss gently with broth mixture. Sprinkle with remaining 1 teaspoon salt and 1/4 teaspoon pepper and serve.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Lightly grease 13 x 9-inch baking dish with olive oil. Season the fish with salt and pepper. Lay the fish fillets in the bottom of the prepared baking dish in one layer. Scatter the chopped tomatoes evenly over the fish. Next add the diced red onion, zucchini, mushrooms and garlic cloves. Pour the white wine over the vegetables and fish, making sure that the fish is completely covered with wine. Sprinkle the herbs over the top. Dot the fish with the lemon juice and drizzle with olive oil. Bake uncovered in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Remove from oven and sprinkle with the feta cheese. Return to the oven and bake for another 3 minutes. Serve immediately with lemon wedges for squeezing over the fish.

Butter one side of each bread slice. Place one bread slice on a baking sheet and top with the brie cheese. Top with the ham and sprinkle with the dijon mustard. Add the roasted red peppers. Top with the other bread slice and press down firmly. Bake until golden and cheese is melted. Cut in half and serve warm.

Grease baking trays and line with paper. In a large bowl combine the corn flakes, oats and sultanas. Place in the oven for 10 minutes. Remove from oven and cool slightly. Beat butter and sugar until light and creamy. Add egg and beat until well combined. Fold in the dry ingredients. Spoon the mixture into a piping bag with a large nozzle and pipe onto the prepared trays. Bake at 170 degrees for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from oven and cool on trays. Store in an airtight container.

Heat a small skillet over medium heat. Break egg into skillet and cook until set, about 3 to 4 minutes. Slice kielbasa into 1/4 inch slices and fry in the same skillet until browned and crispy. Spread mayonnaise on the bottom half of the roll, spread pepper jack cheese over the mayonnaise. Arrange kielbasa over the bottom half of the roll, arrange egg over top of kielbasa. Place the top half of the roll on top. Serve with a glass of orange juice -- enjoy!

Combine the glutinous rice with the water in a large heavy saucepan over medium heat. Cook stirring constantly until the mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat to low. Cook until the water is absorbed and rice is tender. Remove from heat. Add the coconut milk. Stir in the sugar. Transfer to a serving dish. Pour the coconut cream over the rice. Cook for about 15 minutes or until the rice is cooked through. Sprinkle with the butter. Serve hot.

Season chicken with salt and pepper. Dip chicken in beaten egg, and coat with flour. Brown chicken in hot olive oil, and remove from pan. Saute onions and garlic in the same pan until tender but not browned. Add wine and deglaze pan scraping up brown bits from bottom of pan. Add chicken and cook until done, about 8 minutes per side. Remove chicken from pan and keep warm while you make sauce. Add mushrooms and cook in pan until they begin to release juices, about 2 minutes. Add Marsala and bring liquid to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until sauce thickens and mushrooms are tender, about 4 minutes. Season sauce with salt and pepper. Serve chicken over noodles and top with Marsala sauce. Serves four.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat corn syrup, milk, eggs and egg whites in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well blended. Beat in pumpkin. Add spicesmix well. Pour into pie crusts. Bake 1 hour or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Cool on wire rack. Topping: Mix powdered sugar and enough milk to reach desired consistency. Spread topping over cooled pie. Cool completely. Store in refrigerator. May be frozen.

Spread pesto on one side of bread and top with cheese and pepper. Sprinkle on some parmesan and cover with another slice of bread. Spread more pesto on the outside of the sandwich and grill in a panini press until crispy and browned.

Season prawns with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan. Add prawns and saute till lightly browned. Remove and keep aside. Add the garlic and chilies. Saute for 1 minute. Add the tomatoes and saute till they begin to soften. Add the white wine and bring to a boil. Return the prawns to the pan. Reduce the heat and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes. Sprinkle the chopped coriander on top and serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Spray 12 1/2 cup muffin cups or 1 1/2 cup ramekins or custard cups with Pam Cooking Spray. Peel potatoesslice thinly and arrange in muffin cups. Top each muffin cup evenly with Swiss cheese slices, green onions, and salt and pepper to taste. Pour heavy cream into each muffin cup until just above potatoesdo not overfill. Bake until potatoes are tender when pierced with a knife (about 25 minutes). Serve immediately.

In a large bowl combine the first five listed ingredients. Add tomatoes and onion. Toss to coat. Add the green pepper and toss again. Serve immediately or cover. Refrigerate up to 6 hours. Makes about 4 servings.
Place potatoes in a large pot and cover with chicken broth. Simmer until tender (approximately 20-30 minutes). Drain potatoes and return to pot. Add pesto sauce and salt. Mash until smooth.

Peel the stem off of the brussels sprouts and remove the outside layer of the cabbage (this is usually the part that is bitter) and cut in quarters. Melt the butter in a large pot over medium heat and add the brussels sprouts and cabbage. Saute until the cabbage becomes soft and the brussels sprouts are browned (about 20 minutes). Add the chicken stock and simmer until the flavors come together (about 30 minutes). Melt the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat and whisk in the flour until it becomes a paste. Whisk in the milk and whisk until the mixture thickens (about 2 minutes). Whisk in the heavy cream and nutmeg and whisk until the soup is smooth (about 1 minute). Ladle the soup into bowls and drizzle with tabasco sauce and sprinkle with salt and pepper.

Combine cream cheese, sugar and baking chocolate. Mix well. Spread evenly on the bottom of an 8 or 9 inch spring form pan or pie plate. Place about 1/3 cup whipped topping on top. Sprinkle with crushed oreo cookies. Put remaining whipped topping on top and spread evenly. Chill for 1 hour before serving. Can be stored 1 day in refrigerator or frozen for longer storage. Makes 2 servings.

In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in warm milk. Add salt, brown sugar and bacon drippings. Set aside. In a medium-sized bowl, combine 3 cups flour, 1 1/2 cups whole wheat flour. Set aside. In a large bowl, combine 3 eggs, 1 cup water and yeast mixture. Beat well. Add all-purpose flour and beat well. Stir in whole wheat flour. Turn onto a floured surface. Knead until smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl. Turn to coat. Cover and let rise in a warm place until double in bulk. Punch down. Divide into 2 pieces. Roll each into a 10 x 13 inch rectangle. Spread each rectangle with about 1/2 cup of the bacon drippings. Sprinkle each rectangle with 1 cup chopped bacon. Fold each rectangle into thirds lengthwise. Place in a greased 9 x 13 inch baking dish. Cover and let rise in a warm place until double in bulk. Bake in a 400 degree f o

Soak Fiber One cereal in boiling water for about 1 minute and drain. Mash the banana and stir in the yogurt and sugar substitute. Combine the flour and baking soda and stir into the banana mixture. Stir in the drained cereal and the egg substitute, mix well. Spoon into greased muffin cups and bake at 400f for 15-20 minutes or until golden brown and a tester comes out clean. Cool for at least 10 minutes before removing from pan.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat 2 teaspoons of the oil. Add steaks. Cook until golden brown on each side about 4 minute turn steaks and cook until browned 4 minute. Transfer steaks to a plate. Add garlic to pan. Cook 1 minute. Add wine. Cook for 1 minute or until wine has evaporated. Stir in broth. Bring to a boil. Cook for 1 minute or until liquid is reduced. Remove from heat. Stir in mustard. Whisk in remaining 2 teaspoons of the oil. Serve sauce over steaks.

Combine first five ingredients in a small bowl until well blended. Rub mixture onto both sides of salmon fillets. Grill over medium high heat for about five minutes on each side or until salmon is cooked through (to an internal temperature of 145 degrees F), depending on thickness of salmon fillets. Serve with lime wedges.

Rinse and pat dry chickens. Rub with olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Bake at 400 degrees for 1 hour. Remove from oven and pour orange juice mixture over chickens. Bake at 400 degrees for another hour. Remove chickens from oven and let them sit for 15 minutes. Carve chicken and arrange on platter. Garnish with cheese, olives, and tarragon.

Mix first three ingredients in a coffee cup. Fill the cup with ice cubes. Add sugar to taste. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Top with whipped cream, sprinkle with chocolate shavings, then add a sprig of mint. Enjoy!

Heat the olive oil in a frying pan and saute the onion and garlic until the onion is soft and the garlic is beginning to colour. Add the courgette and cook for a couple of minutes until the courgette is soft. Add the pasta and stir until it has been coated with the oil. Season and add the tomatoes and the pine nuts. Stir and heat through. Serve with a scattering of parmesan cheese.

Boil potatoes in salted water until tender. Drain and allow to cool. Slice potatoes and green peppers thinly. Mash avocados and combine with the other ingredients except potatoes and peppers. Add potatoes and peppers and stir well to combine. Garnish with scallions and serve chilled or at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 450f. Mix together the first 4 ingredients. Press into an 8 or 9 inch square pan. Bake for 5 minutes. Mix together the apples and raisins. Sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Pour over the cooked crust. Bake for 25 to 30 minutes until the apples are tender. Serve warm or cool.

Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add brussels sprouts and cook for 5 minutes or until crisp tender. Add wine to pan and stir until evaporated. Add mustard and stir until blended well. Add maple syrup and pepper to taste. Cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Serve immediately.
Heat ghee and add all the spices. Add the squash and cook until tender. Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot with chapattis or rice.

Season halibut with salt and pepper. Dip halibut fillets in flour and shake off excess. Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add fish and cook until browned on 1 side, about 2 minutes. Turn and cook until fish is just cooked through. Place fish in a small bowl. Add vinegar and toss. Transfer fish to plates. Add water to skilletbring to a boil. Cook until reduced to 1/2 cup, 1 to 2 minutes. Stir in garlic and rosemary and cook 1 minute. Spoon over halibut.

Peel potatoes and cut in half. Toss in a large bowl with the shallots and a splash of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Roast in the oven until golden and tender, about 40 minutes. Cook the brussels sprouts in a large pot of boiling salted water until just tender, about 3 minutes. Drain and rinse with cold water. Toss with butter and lemon juice and a pinch of salt. Remove the potatoes and sprouts from the oven. Turn the oven down to 350. In a large cast iron pan, cook the bacon over medium heat until browned and crisp. Drain on paper towels and reserve 2 tablespoons of the fat in the pan. Add the potatoes and sprouts to the fat in the pan and stir gently. Season with salt and pepper and roast until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy, about 15 minutes. Toss the potatoes and sprouts together and serve with the bacon.

Mix all the above ingredients together in a small bowl and coat the chicken pieces thoroughly, making sure all the pieces are well covered.Place the chicken pieces into an oven proof dish, and place into the oven to cook for 1 1/2 hours at 375 degrees.Turn the chicken pieces over every 45 minutes to ensure even cooking. Serve with rice and steamed vegetables.

Combine honey and peanut butter in a saucepan. Cook over low heat until smooth and well blended. Stir in coconut and sesame seeds. Remove from heat. Quickly drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper or aluminum foil. Cool. Break into pieces. Store in tightly covered container.

In a small bowl, combine the butter, flour and sugar until it is crumbly. Sprinkle the mixture with the nutmeg and cinnamon and mix well. Press 3/4 of the mixture into the bottom of an 8 or 9 inch springform pan. Sprinkle the lemon juice over the bottom of the crust and lay the sliced peaches evenly over the lemon juice. Sprinkle the remaining crumb mixture over the top. Bake at 375 degrees for 40 minutes or until lightly browned. Serve with vanilla ice cream and whipped cream.

In a large skillet, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium-high heat until shimmering hot. Sprinkle 1/4 of the pork chops with the soy sauce and hot pepper sauceadd to the skillet and cook until browned on both sides. Transfer to a plate and repeat with remaining pork chops and sauce, adding more oil as needed. Place the coconut milk in a saucepan and heat until it begins to bubble around the edges of the panadd the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and the garlic and cook until the garlic is lightly browned, about 2 minutes. Add the remaining sauce mixture from the skillet and the pineapple tidbits and bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 10 minutes, until the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper to taste and stir in the parsley. Pour the sauce over the pork chops and serve immediately.

Heat olive oil in large nonstick skillet over medium high heat. Add london broil beefcook and stir until brown on both sides. Add garlic and cook 30 seconds. Add scallionscook 2 minutes. Add seasoning mix and stir in roasted red peppers and tomatoes. Remove from heat and stir in spinachlet cool slightly. Place goat cheese in center of each steak. Top steak with spinach mixtureroll up tightly to enclose cheese. Tie steak at 2-inch intervals with kitchen string. Grill or broil steaks, turning once, 10 to 12 minutes or until desired degree of doneness (160 degrees F).

Preheat oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C). Beat eggs and white sugar together until light and fluffy. Stir in the milk and salt. Pour into each tart shell. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until the custard has set. Cool slightly before serving.

In the crock pot combine chicken broth, soup, onion powder. Slow cook on low for 6-8 hours. Add potatoes and cook for another hour. In a saucepan over medium heat mix together the cream cheese and green chilies. Stir until smooth. Stir in the cheese until melted. In a bowl combine the flour tortilla chips. Spoon the potato soup into bowls. Top each bowl with the cheese mixture and chips. Garnish with additional chilies if desired.

In a large bowl combine flour and seasoning. Dip chicken in flour mixture to coat. Heat oil in a large ovenproof skillet. Add chicken breasts and cook over medium heat for 2 minutes. Turn and cook until browned on other side. Transfer to a plate. Add pears and apples to pan with any juices. Turn heat to high and add lemon juice and water. Bring to a boil and cook until reduced by half. Stir in cider. Add chicken back to pan and stir to coat. Cover and bake at 350f for 45 minutes. Uncover and bake for 15 minutes longer.

Boil the pasta until al dente, adding the lemon zest and some salt and pepper during the cooking time. Drain the pasta and keep aside. Heat a large frying pan on a medium heat with the butter and garlic until the garlic has turned golden brown. Add the cherry tomatoes to the pan, the king prawns and the lemon zest, season with salt and pepper and fry until the prawns have turned pink and the tomatoes have collapsed. Stir through the parsley then mix with the pasta, adding some lemon juice if required. Sprinkle with some more parsley to serve.

1. Preheat the oven to 200°C.2. Peel the potatoes and cut into chunky slices. Place the slices in a large pan, cover with cold water and boil for 15 minutes. Drain the potatoes and mash thoroughly.3. Put the potatoes in a bowl. Beat the eggs in a jug and add to the potatoes, along with the milk and seasoning.4. Add the fish to the mixture and combine well.5. Put the mixture in the fridge to chill for 20 minutes.6. Sprinkle the cornflake crumbs onto a plate. Heat the oil in a frying pan on medium heat. When the oil is hot, take out 1 teaspoon of the mixture and shape it into an oval shape. Dip the fish into the cornflake crumbs and place into the pan. Repeat until all the fish is coated. Fry on each side for 1-2 minutes and cook for 5 minutes on each side. Serve with lemon wedges.

Prepare pudding according to package directions. Set aside to cool. Combine cake crumbs and toffee bits. Spoon pudding into dessert dishes. Top with toffee-candy bar mixture. Makes 8 servings. Each serving contains 150 calories. 15g carbs. 3g fat. 2g fiber. 4g protein.

Place the pork chops and onion in a slow cooker. Mix together the cream of mushroom soup and the cream of onion soup. Pour over the meat and onion. Cook on low for 5-6 hours or on high for 2-3 hours. Serve over rice.
Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add carrots, green onion, ginger and ponzu sauce. Cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Season with salt to taste. Serve with rice or pasta.

Cut the onion in half and cut each half into quarters. Cut the zucchini in half lengthwise. Put the chicken and vegetables in the crock pot. Sprinkle with garlic powder, seasoning salt and black pepper. In a large bowl combine the oil, spaghetti sauce mix, italian seasoning, white wine and water. Pour over chicken and vegetables. Cook on low for 6 to 7 hours. Stir in the zucchini during the last hour of cooking. Serve over pasta. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets or use parchment paper. In a large bowl mix together dry milk powder, baking soda, baking powder, salt, molasses, and egg beaters. In a smaller bowl combine light butter and vanilla with mixer. Add egg beaters mixture to butter and blend well. In a separate bowl combine whole wheat flour, raisins, and cinnamon with mixer. Slowly add flour mixture to butter mixture and blend well. Drop by spoonfuls onto cookie sheet. Bake for 8 minutes in preheated oven. Makes about 3 dozen cookies.

In a small saucepan over medium heat whisk together the maple syrup, balsamic vinegar, orange juice, garlic and olive oil until smooth and warmed through (about 1 minute). Season with salt and pepper to taste. Arrange the salmon steaks in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet. Pour the sauce over the fish, making sure to coat all sides evenly. Bake until the fish flakes easily with a fork (10 to 15 minutes). Serve with a wedge of orange and a drizzle of the glaze on top.

Combine buttermilk, coconut and cilantro. Add chicken legs and refrigerate 24 hours. Preheat oven to 350F. Drain liquid from chicken. Coat chicken legs with flour. Heat oil until hot. Brown chicken legs. Cook for 45 minutes. Add chopped cilantro. Serve over rice.

Boil carrots until tender-crisp and cool in ice water. Melt butter in heavy skillet over medium heat, stir in brown sugar and cook 2 minutes, stirring constantly. Stir in carrots, chives, creamcook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture is hot and carrots are evenly coated. Serve immediately. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Spray casserole dish with cooking spray. Spread hash brown potatoes evenly over bottom of dish. Sprinkle meat evenly over potatoes. Add taco seasoning mix. Pour water over meat mixture. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Remove from oven. Sprinkle cheese evenly over top. Bake for an additional 10 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve with lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream. Serve with rice or chips.

Slice the green zucchini in half lengthwise. Heat the extra virgin olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat until almost smoking. Sear the squash halves for about one minute on each side until golden brown and cooked through. Remove the squash from the skillet and place in a bowl and set aside. Whisk together the lemon juice, lemon zest and extra virgin olive oil and pour into the skillet. Return the squash halves to the skillet and sprinkle with sea salt and fresh basil and toss gently until coated with the lemon vinaigrette. Serve immediately with grilled chicken or fish.

Combine flour and salt in a large bowl. Combine egg and water in a small bowl. Dip vegetables into egg mixture and then coat with flour mixture. Heat oil in a deep frying pan until hot. Fry vegetables until golden brown on all sides. Drain on paper towels. Serve with a sweet chili dipping sauce.

Melt butter in heavy saucepan or microwave safe container. Stir in brown sugar, corn syrup and lightly beaten egg. Stir in rolled oats until well blended. Press into a greased 11x15 glass baking dish. Sprinkle with coconut and bake in preheated 325 oven for about 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and sprinkle with candied cherries (optional). Cool completely in dish before cutting into bars.
Place all ingredients in a small saucepan and heat over medium heat until bubbling and thickened, about 10-12 minutes. Cool and serve over fish or chicken. Makes about 1/2 cup sauce.

Crack the eggs into the food processor and add the ricotta cheese and salt. Blend well. Add the cream of tartar and blend for about 2 minutes or until the batter has the consistency of cookie dough. Preheat oven to 375F. Place the baking sheet in the oven and turn it off. When the oven is cool, remove the baking sheet and spray it with non-stick spray. Remove the batter from the food processor and place it in the center of the baking sheet. Spray the batter lightly with non-stick spray. Bake for 30 minutes or until the batter is crispy and golden brown.
In a large pot, combine all the ingredients except the pasta shells. Bring to a boil. Simmer for 30 minutes. Add pasta shells. Heat thoroughly. Serve hot.

Mix rice flour, water, sugar and salt in a saucepan. Cook over medium heat until the mixture thickens and starts to boil. Reduce heat and simmer for five minutes. Pour into molds and allow to cool completely. Remove from molds and store in an air-tight container. To serve, cut in half and garnish with a dollop of cream cheese and a slice of ripe mango or papaya.

Prepare a pot of hot oil. In a large bowl, combine the chicken, onion, bread crumbs, garlic salt, salt and pepper. Mix well. Add the eggs and mix until thoroughly blended. Form into patties about 2-1/2 inches in diameter. Fry the croquettes in batches. Fry each side until golden brown. Drain on paper towels. Serve with a mustard dip or ketchup.
Combine onion and seeds. Mix together mayonnaise and vinegar. Add to onion mixture. Add broccoli and other items. Chill.

In a 9x13 inch baking dish combine 1 pound of cooked salmon with the sliced mushrooms. Beat together 2 large eggs and 2 tablespoons of water. Stir into the salmon mixture. Then stir in 1 cup fresh breadcrumbs. Sprinkle with 1 cup of american cheese. Pour in 1/2 cup lemon juice. Add 1 1/2 teaspoons of instant minced onion. Spread the frozen peas over the top. Cover and refrigerate overnight. Bake for 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease and flour an 8x4 inch loaf pan. In a large bowl combine butter and sugar. Beat until creamy. Add the bananas and egg. Beat until well blended. Combine the flour, salt, baking soda and baking powder. Add to the banana mixture. Fold in the sour cream. Pour into loaf pan. Bake for about 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 15 minutes in the pan. Remove from pan. Cool completely on wire rack.

Slice grapes in half and place in a bowl. Toss grapes and walnuts together. In a separate bowl whisk together honey and vinegar. Add blue cheese and mix until blended. Pour dressing over grape mixture and toss to coat. Serve at room temperature.
In a large bowl, dissolve the cocoa and sugar in the hot water. Chill overnight. Add the vanilla and the heavy cream. Freeze as directed on the freeze dryer. Serve immediately.

Cook pasta to al dente. Add ricotta cheese to a medium bowl. Add parsley and 1 cup of the mozzarella cheese to the ricotta cheese mixture. Mix well. Add the cooked pasta and spaghetti sauce to the ricotta cheese mixture. Add the remaining mozzarella cheese to the top of the dish. Bake for 30-40 minutes until bubbly.

In a medium bowl combine the yogurt with the curry powder and coriander. Cut the chicken breasts in half lengthways and place in a resealable bag with the marinade. Leave for at least an hour, but preferably overnight, in a cool place. Heat the oil in a large pan or wok and cook the rice according to the instructions on the pack. Heat the stock cubes in the remaining oil until they dissolve. Add the carrot, red pepper and green chillies and saute until tender. Stir in the mint. Turn up the heat and add the chicken breast halves. Cook until just tender. Serve with the rice.

Mix yeast into warm water. Add sugar and let sit for 5 minutes. In a separate bowl mix egg, vanilla and cinnamon. Add the liquid mixture into the yeast mixture. Mix well. Add flour and butter. Mix well. Dough will be sticky. Place in a greased bowl. Cover and allow to rise until double in size. Roll out to a 1/2 inch thickness. Cut into desired shapes. Place into a greased pan. Cover and allow to rise until doubled. Bake at 400 degrees for 8-10 minutes. While they are baking, mix together sugar and cinnamon. After they have cooked for 8 minutes, remove from oven and roll in sugar and cinnamon mixture. Continue to bake for about 1-2 more minutes.
Split the cake into two halves and top one half with a scoop of strawberry ice cream. Top with the other half of the sponge cake. Top with whipped cream. Top with sliced fresh strawberries and enjoy!

Preheat oven to 375f. Spread dressing evenly on the bottom half of each hoagie roll. Layer evenly with meat and cheese. Top each with 2 to 3 slices tomato and 2 to 3 slices onion. Top each with a lettuce leaf. Bake until heated through and cheese is melted, about 10 minutes. Serve hot.

Place onion in bottom of slow cooker. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Lay turkey breast on top of onion. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Pour in broth. Cover and cook on low for 4 hours. Remove turkey to cutting board. Shred using two forks. Stir into broth in slow cooker. Return turkey to slow cooker. Cover and cook on high for 1 hour more. Serve on hamburger buns with cranberry sauce. Makes 4-6 sandwiches.

In a shallow bowl combine apple juice and lime juice. Sprinkle in cornstarch and stir well. Add chicken bouillon cube and stir well again. Add the chicken to the bowl and mix well to coat with the marinade. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour. Remove from refrigerator and let stand for 30 minutes. Meanwhile in a small bowl combine the oil and the paprika. Prepare the grill for direct cooking over medium-low heat. Thread the chicken onto the skewers and brush the tops and sides with the oil mixture. Grill the chicken 5 minutes on each side or until the juices run clear. Serve with lime wedges.

In a food processor combine onion, garlic, herbs, merlot, olive oil until smooth. Set aside 3 tablespoons of marinade for basting while cooking chops. Place chops in a shallow baking dish. Pour remaining marinade over chops. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour or overnight. Preheat a grill or broiler to high heat. Grill or broil chops for 4 to 5 minutes each side or until desired doneness. Brush chops with reserved marinade during cooking. Serve hot or cold.

Peel potatoes and cut in half lengthwise. Brush with butter. Place on a cookie sheet and sprinkle with seasoning. Roast for 15 to 20 minutes, turning once or twice. Season to taste with pepper and coarse salt. Serve hot or cold.

Place chicken in a pot and cover with 1 inch water. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer for about 10 minutes per pound. Cut chicken into bite-size pieces. Add remaining ingredients and stir to combine. Serve over white rice. Garnish with cucumber and scallions.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Cut croissants in half lengthwise. Place croissants cut-side-up in 13-by-9-inch baking dish. Whisk eggs, milk, half-and-half and vanilla in medium bowl to blend. Spoon about 2 tablespoons filling into bottom half of each croissant. Top with buttered side of top half of croissant. Bake until golden brown and toothpick inserted in center comes out clean, 15 to 20 minutes. Top toast with cream cheese mixture, berries and syrup. Sprinkle with almonds if desired.
Shred cabbage and red bell pepper. Toss together. Toss in cilantro, jalapeno, lime juice, and cumin. Taste for seasonings. Serve cold. Great for taco salad.

Melt chocolate and butter together over low heat. Remove from heat and add sugar and water. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Beat in cream and whisky until smooth. Set aside at room temp to cool and thicken slightly, about 1 hour. Serve with pound cake, strawberries and pineapple.

Preheat oven to 400. Lightly spray a baking sheet with cooking spray. In a small bowl, combine apricot preserves and soy sauce. Place asparagus spears on the baking sheet. Brush with the apricot mixture. Bake for 15 minutes. In a small bowl, combine the garlic and salt. Remove asparagus from oven. Brush with the garlic mixture. Return to the oven and bake for 5 minutes.

In a bowl mix together the flour, sourdough starter, and baking soda and baking powder. Cut butter into the flour mixture and make a soft dough. On a lightly floured surface knead the dough until smooth. Roll to 1/2 inch thick. Cut with a biscuit cutter and place on a lightly greased baking sheet. Bake at 450 for 10 minutes. Turn out onto a rack to cool.

Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add macaronicook 10 minutes or until tender but still firm to the bite. Drain. Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Stir in flourcook 2 minutes. Whisk in milk gradually until smooth. Cook 5 minutes, stirring constantly. Add salt and pepper. Stir in 1-1/2 cups cheesecook 3 minutes or until melted. Stir in macaroni. Pour mixture into a 2-quart baking dish coated with cooking spray. Sprinkle with remaining 1-1/2 cups cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes or until bubbly and golden. Serve immediately.

Melt butter in a large saute pan over medium high heat. Add red and yellow onions and saute until slightly softened but not browned. Add salt and pepper. Add steak to pan and saute until lightly browned on both sides. Top steak with blue cheese and serve on ciabatta roll with dijon mustard and onions.

Dip each stick into flour to coat well, then dip into egg mixture to coat well, then dip into breadcrumbs to coat well. Lay on paper towels until ready to cook. In a large skillet, heat olive oil to medium-high heat until hot. Fry the mozzarella sticks until golden brown, about 3-4 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels. Serve warm with marinara sauce for dipping.

In a medium bowl, mix together the hamburger and barbecue sauce until well combined. Transfer to a 9x13-inch baking dish. Cover with foil and bake for 20 minutes or until done. Remove from ovenstir the onion into the beef mixture until well combined. Remove the biscuits from the refrigerator and place them on a lightly floured surface. Roll them out to about 1/4 inch thick. Cut the biscuits with a floured 2 1/2-inch round cookie cutter to make 24 rounds. Arrange the rounds on top of the beef mixture. Sprinkle the top with cheddar cheesereturn to the oven for 5 minutes or until the biscuits are golden brown.

Bring 2 quarts of water to boil in a medium saucepan. Add couscous. Bring back to a boil. Turn heat off and let sit covered for 10 minutes. Fluff couscous with a fork. Stir in water and set aside. In a small bowl, combine 2 Tablespoons sriracha sauce and 2 Tablespoons water. Stir to combine. Toss couscous with 2 Tablespoons sriracha sauce mixture and 2 Tablespoons water. Toss until coated. Top with parmesan cheese.

Coat chicken parts in flour mixed with salt, fresh ground black pepper, paprika, garlic powder, onion powder. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken parts. Cook until golden brown on all sides. Remove chicken pieces from skillet and drain on paper towels. Serve hot.

Cut chicken breast in half lengthwise. Pound chicken breast with mallet or rolling pin until about 1/4 inch thick. Spread pesto mix on one side of each chicken breast half. Top with provolone cheese slices. Roll up chicken breast halvesplace in shallow pan or baking dish. Bake in 350 degree F oven 45 minutes or until chicken is thoroughly cooked (165 degrees F). Serve with sliced mushrooms on top and sour cream on the side, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350f. Season pork with salt & pepper. Heat oil in skillet over medium high heat. Sear pork on all sides. Add ginger to pan and cook until pork is brown. Place pork in baking dish. Add hoisin sauce, orange juice, broth, and sesame oil to pan. Scrape up any brown bits that have stuck to pan. Pour over pork. Cover with foil. Bake for about 2 hours or until pork is cooked through. Remove foil. Sprinkle with green onions. Serve with rice.
Mash avocados with a fork in a large bowl. Mix in salsa and season with garlic salt and pepper. Refrigerate. Serve with tortilla chips. Makes 4 cups.

Place meat into large saucepan or crockpot. Add water and bay leaf. Add spices. Bring to boiling. Reduce heat to low. Cover. Cook until meat is tender. Remove bay leaf. Add cabbage. Cook until tender. Serve with sour cream.

Combine peanuts and sunflower seeds in large bowl. Set aside. Combine wheat germ, raisins and oats in medium bowl. Set aside. Melt brown sugar, corn syrup and vanilla together in a saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly. Pour over peanuts and sunflower seeds. Stir until well coated. Stir in raisins, oats and wheat germ until evenly blended. Spread on greased baking sheet to cool to room temperature. Crumble crispy rice cereal into bowl with crunchy peanut butter. Stir until well blended. Stir cereal mixture into peanut mixture. Lightly press mixture into a greased 9x13 pan. Cool to room temperature. Cut into bars. Store in airtight container.
Muddle basil leaves with simple syrup in a glass. Add 2 ounces of rum, 1 ounce of lime juice, and 3 ounces of orange juice. Add crushed ice to fill. Top with soda water. Serve with mint sprig.

Wash and cut 3 lbs. Carrots into 2-inch chunks. Place in a saucepan with 4 cups of water. Cover and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 25 minutes or until the carrots are fork tender. Drain the carrots. In a saucepan, combine 1/4 cup of water and the remaining 1/2 cup of water. Bring to a boil and add the carrots. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in the mustard and parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper.

Brown ground beef in skillet with onion until no pink remains. Drain off fat. Add spaghetti sauce and spinach and heat thoroughly. Pour into a casserole dish. Spread ravioli on top of the sauce. Sprinkle cheese over ravioli. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes, or until cheese is melted and bubbly. Serves 6-8.

Cook quinoa according to package directions and let cool. In a large bowl combine quinoa with spinach, lemon juice, oil, lemon pepper and salt and pepper. Toss well. Serve in individual bowls and top with poppy seeds if desired. Serves 4.

Melt the butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the onion and cook until softened, about 3 minutes. Stir in the cabbage and apple. Cook until crisp-tender, 8 to 10 minutes. Add the vinegar and cook until the liquid is almost evaporated, 1 to 2 minutes. Add the sugar and flour and stir until the flour is dissolved. Add the wine and cook until the liquid is reduced by half. Season with the salt and pepper.

Halve the avocados, remove the pits and place them flesh-side-down in a large bowl. Add the lime juice and the oil and mash with a fork until the avocados are well mixed and the mixture is thick but still has some texture. Season with salt. To serve, arrange the avocado on slices of bread. Top with ham and cheese. Grill on both sides until the cheese melts and the bread is crisp and golden.

Soak the crumbs in the vinegar and water. Mix the rest of the ingredients until it sticks together. Roll into meatballs and cook in a skillet with a little water. Can also be made with just ground beef.

In a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, wasabi paste and lemon juice until smooth. Add the noodles and arugula and toss well. In a large skillet, heat 2 tbs. oil over medium-high heat. Add the tuna steaks and season with salt and pepper. Cook until the tuna is browned on the outside, about 2 minutes per side. Add the remaining oil to the skillet and pour the wasabi mixture over the tuna. Divide noodles among 4 plates and top each with 1 tuna steak and 1 scallion. Serve immediately.

Drain sardines, reserving oil. Process sardines, green onion, yogurt, lemon juice, dried dill and horseradish in a food processor until smoothseason with salt and white pepper. Chill until ready to use. Cut carrot into 1/4-inch-thick roundsspread each with sardine mixture. Cover with plastic wraprefrigerate until ready to use. Serve with crackers or toasted bread rounds.
Melt cheese in a double boiler over hot water. Add wine and lemon juice and blend well. Stir in cornstarch and nutmeg. Stir in cayenne pepper. Melt butter and add to cheese mixture.

In a small saucepan combine milk, sugar and cornstarch. Bring to boil and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and add egg whites. Beat with mixer until blended. Fold in vanilla and banana slices. Pour into baked pie shell. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool for 1 hour. Serve with whipped cream or ice cream.

Cut sausage into 1/2 inch pieces. Heat butter in a skillet. When the butter melts add the sausage and thyme bay leaf and marjoram. Brown sausage. Remove bay leaf and marjoram. Add flour and stir in white wine and cook until wine is reduced and sauce is thick. Add chives. Serves 4.

Cut meat into 4 serving pieces. Heat oil in large soup pot. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add short ribs, cover and cook for 1 to 1 1/2 hours or until meat is fork-tender. Add remaining vegetables except for dill. Cook 15 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Add dill and cook for 5 minutes longer. Makes 4 to 6 servings

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Line 2 large baking sheets with parchment paper. Cream together the butter and sugars in a large bowl using a mixer. Add the egg and vanilla and mix until well blended. Stir in the peanut butter until evenly incorporated. Add the flour and mix until smooth. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place on the prepared sheets, about 1 1/2 inches apart. Bake until the edges are light brown and the tops are cracked and set (about 12 minutes). Remove the cookies to a wire rack to cool. Place a mini peanut butter cup in the center of each cookie. Roll the cookies in a bowl with the melted chocolate until well coated. Place on a parchment-lined baking sheet to set.
Cut avocados in half and remove seeds. With a fork, mash avocado until smooth. Add lemon juice and salt. Gently stir in tomato, onion, jalapeno. Serve immediately.

In large bowl, combine cornmeal, water, salt and butter. Let stand 10 minutes. Stir in eggs and flour. Let stand 15 minutes. In another bowl, stir together milk and baking soda until well mixed. Stir milk into batter. Heat waffle iron or griddlespray with cooking spray if using griddle. Spoon batter onto ironcook 4 minutes or until waffles are golden brown. Serve immediately. Makes 4 waffles.

Put 3 cups of water in a saucepan. Stir in 1 cup sugar and 1/2 teaspoon salt. Cook over medium-high heat until sugar dissolves and mixture comes to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until a candy thermometer reaches 240 degrees. Remove from heat and quickly stir in 1-1/4 cups flour. Return mixture to the heat and stir until a soft ball forms when a small amount is dropped into cold water. Remove from heat and stir in 1 beaten egg, then 2 more eggs, 1/2 teaspoon lemon rind and 1 teaspoon fat. Cool to lukewarm. Line a baking sheet with wax paper. Using a pastry bag with a star tip or a plastic bag with a 1/2-inch opening cut from the corner, pipe 3-inch lengths of batter onto the sheet. Place in a 250 degree oven and bake 20 minutes. Turn and bake until golden brown. Remove from oven and roll in granulated sugar. Serve with cinnamon-sugar butter.

In a large bowl, combine cranberries, dried cranberries, sugar, ginger and cornstarchtoss well. Let stand 10 minutesstir well. Toss with lemon zestset aside. In a large skillet over medium heat, combine cranberry mixture, pear slices and watercook until tender, about 3-5 minutes. Transfer to a blender or food processorpuree until smooth. Set aside. In a medium bowl, beat milk and egg until smoothpour into pie shellsprinkle with cranberry pureebake for 12 minutes or until edges begin to brownremove from oven and top with remaining pie crustbake until golden browncool on a wire rackgarnish with fresh cranberries.

In a medium mixing bowl combine cereal and noodles. In a microwavable bowl combine margarine and chocolate chips. Heat on high for 1 minute or until chocolate is melted. Stir in raisins and banana chips. Pour over cereal mixture and mix well. Pour into a microwave safe casserole. Microwave on high for 3 minutes. Stir and continue to microwave in 1 minute intervals until chips are melted and cereal is well coated. Stir in nuts. Let cool and serve.

In a food processor or blender, blend pecans until very fine, about the texture of fine breadcrumbs. In a large bowl combine the pecans, mayonnaise, olives, chili sauce and worcestershire sauce. Fold in the cheese and mix well. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve on crackers or bread cubes.

Put chicken bones (with meat) in large stock pot with about 5 cups of cold water (reserve the rest of the water for the vegetables). Add fresh ginger, green onions, celery ribs, carrot, yellow onion, white peppercorns, Szechwan pepper (optional), bring to a boil, then lower the heat. Simmer for about 1 1/2 hours. Strain the broth (save the vegetables) through a fine strainer or cheese cloth into another stock pot or large bowl. Add the rest of the water (about 4 cups), strained vegetables (reserve the rest of the vegetables), chicken stock, and the chicken bones. Simmer for about 45 minutes more or until the chicken bones are falling apart (I also simmer the chicken bones separately in 2 cups of the reserved water for about 30 minutes before adding them into the stock). Remove the chicken bones (save the meat) and add the ginger. Add the rest of the vegetables (except for green onions). Simmer for 10 more minutes or until all veget
Mix cream cheese with heavy cream. Spread over pear halves. Cut grape leaves in half. Wrap pear halves in grape leaves. Drizzle with honey. Serve chilled.

Mix together yeast, water, sugar, milk, salt in a large bowl. Let stand 10 minutes. Add in 2 cups of the flour to the mixture, stirring. Add in the remaining 1 cup of flour, cornmeal and baking soda. Knead dough for 5 minutes. Place into a greased bowl. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour. Punch down dough. Divide dough into 2 parts. Press each part into a loaf shape. Place each loaf into a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan. Cover with plastic wrap and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45 to 50 minutes. Cool in pans 10 minutes then remove to wire racks to cool completely.

Heat 2 tbsp of margarine in pan. Add flour and cook for one minute stirring all the time. Stir in 1/4 cup of chicken bouillon (no water added) and 1/2 tsp of salt. Add one egg yolk and whisk until smooth. Serve over rice.

Preheat the oven to 200c. Wash tomatoes. Cut out the tops of each tomato and set them aside. Rub the inside of the tomato with salt and pepper. Sprinkle the tomatoes with the sugar, dried thyme, a drizzle of oil. Bake for about 2 hours or until the tomatoes are tender. Serve as a side dish or as a topping to a roast.

Mix together the cream cheese and instant pudding mixes. Add 1/2 of milk and beat until well blended. Stir in remaining milk and the cooled whip topping. Fold in 2 cups of the chocolate chips. Spoon into 9-inch square pan. Cut into 2-inch squares before serving.

In a large pot saute mushrooms in oil until lightly browned. Stir in water. Blend in dry milk and seasonings. Bring to boilingboil and stir 2 minutes. Reduce heatsimmer 10 minutes. Stir in flourcook until thickened. Remove from heat. Stir in 2 tablespoons sherry. Garnish with green onion.

1. Prepare skewers for the fish kebabs by soaking them in water for 30 minutes. 2. Mix the lime juice, coriander leaves, garlic ginger and red chili. Marinate the fish fillets in this for 30 minutes. 3. Prepare the red bell pepper strips by cutting them into strips. 4. Cut the fish fillets into 1 inch cubes. Thread them on the skewers alternating with red bell pepper. 5. Heat oil in a non stick pan. Place the skewers in the pan and cook for a few minutes. 6. Drizzle the fish with fish sauce and soya sauce. 7. Sprinkle with black pepper and serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place boneless skinless pieces in 9 x 13 pan. Sprinkle with garlic powder and fresh garlic. Drizzle with soy sauce. Sprinkle with paprika and parsley flakes. In a small bowl, combine yogurt with enough flour to make a thick paste. Spread over the top of the chicken. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese and bake for 30 minutes.
Brown bear steak with salt pork or butter in skillet. Add remaining ingredients, cover and simmer for 2 hours. Add water if necessary to cover meat.

Heat the soup in a medium saucepan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic powder and cook for 1 minute. Add the cooked chicken. Place the tortillas on top of the chicken and cheese and pour the remaining soup on top of the tortillas. Bake uncovered for 20 minutes or until bubbly. Let stand for 5 minutes. Garnish with lettuce and tomato if desired. Serve with a dollop of sour cream.

In a large saucepan over medium heat combine sugar, corn syrup, eggs, butter and salt. Stir until mixture comes to a boil. Remove from heat. Stir in pecans. Pour into prepared pie shell. Bake in a 350 degree oven about 1 hour or until top is golden brown. Cool on a wire rack. Serve at room temperature.

Cut ice cream sandwiches in half. Place cool whip in bowl. Spoon half of the whipped topping into a zip-top bag, cut off a tiny bit of one corner and use it to pipe out rosettes around the bowl. Spread one half of the ice cream sandwiches on top of the whipped topping. Spoon half of the marshmallow cream on top of the ice cream sandwiches. Spread the rest of the ice cream sandwiches on top of the marshmallow cream. Spread the rest of the whipped topping over the top of the ice cream and marshmallow cream. Spread ice cream bars over the top of the whipped topping. Top the whole thing with magic shell ice cream topping and sprinkle with nuts. Serve.

Boil the manicotti in a large pot of boiling water for 4 minutes. Remove from water and drain on paper towel. Meanwhile, heat the oil in a medium frying pan and saute the onions until golden. Set aside in a large bowl and keep warm in a covered bowl in the oven. Blend the cottage cheese, eggs and nutmeg together in a medium bowl and set aside. Cook the spinach in a medium frying pan over low heat and drain. Combine the spinach with the cottage cheese mixture and stir well. Fill the manicotti with the cottage cheese mixture and place on a baking tray. Bake at 350 degrees for about 20 minutes or until heated through and the cheese is lightly browned on top. Cover the top of the manicotti with the mozzarella cheese and spaghetti sauce and sprinkle with the parmesan cheese. Bake for another 10 -15 minutes or until the cheese is browned and bubbly on top.

First youll want to prepare the basil. Take the leaves off the basil stem, then chop it very finely in a food processor. Youll see a fine green dust forming in the processor bowl. This is what you want. Youll notice that as youre chopping it the leaves are still green, so youll want to add the lemon juice. This helps keep the color green. Next add the spinach, pine nuts, garlic and parmesan cheese and continue chopping till everything is mixed together. This is where the magic happens. Once everything is finely chopped together youll want to add the mineral water and salt. Continue chopping till it is completely mixed together into a paste like consistency. Add the black pepper for taste, then put it in the refrigerator overnight to let the flavors develop. Serve cold on pasta or warm as a pizza spread.

Prepare the cake mix as directed on the box. Add the pumpkin. Pour into a greased 13x9 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Cool. Meanwhile, prepare the filling. Mix the pudding with the milk. Fold in the pumpkin and vanilla extract. Spread over the cooled cake. Sprinkle with the pecans and English toffee bits. Refrigerate.

Preheat the oven to 180C/350F/Gas 4. Season the fish fillets with a little salt and black pepper. Squeeze the lemon juice over the fish and rub the fish in the lemon juice to coat the fish fillets in the juice. Coat the fish fillets in the cheese and mustard to coat well. Place the fish fillets onto a baking tray and bake for 15 minutes. Remove the fish fillets from the oven and allow the fish fillets to rest for 2 minutes. Garnish with chives, tomatoes and a dollop of cream. Serve with fresh vegetables and rice.

Combine all the ingredients except vodka in a heavy-bottomed saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heatthen reduce heat to low and simmer uncovered for 20 minutes. Remove from heatlet cool slightlystrain into a container. Coverrefrigerate overnight. Add vodkalet sit for a day. Strain againdiscard solids. Store in the refrigerator for up to 2 weeks. Serve over ice cream or with coffee or tea.
Mix all ingredients as directed in your bread machine instruction booklet. Bake 60 minutes at 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Remove from oven and serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Spray 9x13x2 inch glass baking dish with cooking spray. Cook lobster tails in boiling water for 2-3 minutes or until bright red. Drain and cool. In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add flour and cook for 3 minutes or until lightly browned. Whisk in chicken broth and heavy cream until smooth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Add lobster tails, cheese, chives and white pepper. Spoon into baking dish. In a small bowl combine egg yolks and wine. Whisk into sauce. Bake for 15 minutes or until heated through. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 400f. Beat eggs and water in a medium bowl. Dip mozzarella in egg mixture and then coat with breadcrumb mixture and spices. Place on greased baking sheet and bake for 8 mins or until lightly golden brown. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Fry bacon until crisp. In a large dutch oven or large pot, combine rice with 3 cups broth and 1 tsp. salt. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to lowcover and simmer until the liquid is absorbed and the rice is tender, about 20 minutes. Fluff with a forkstir in 2 Tbsp. of the bacon drippings and the orzo. Cover and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork. Stir in shallots and remaining 1/4 cup brothcover and let stand for 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork and stir in remaining 1 Tbsp. bacon drippings. Remove from heat and stir in the parsley and lemon juice. Transfer to a serving dish and serve at once.

Combine yogurt and cream cheese in large bowl. Beat with electric mixer until smooth. Stir in sugar, extract and strawberries. Refrigerate. Prepare graham cracker crust. Press into the bottom and side of 9-inch pie dish. Pour cheese mixture into crust. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour. Serve with whipped topping and more strawberries if youd like.

Peel potatoes, dice and boil until tender. Drain potatoes and mash with sour cream and mustard until smooth. Add flour and seasoning to taste. Stir in chopped chives. Form the potato mixture into small cakes and place on a baking tray. Heat the olive oil in a frying pan. Fry the potato cakes gently on each side until they are golden brown. Serve warm with a green salad or a green vegetable like asparagus.

Heat oven to 400 degrees. In a medium bowl, combine the butter and eggs. Add the flour, milk and salt. Beat well. Pour into a greased 9-inch pie plate. Sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon. Cut the apple into thin slices. Arrange slices over batter. Bake for 20 minutes. Melt butter in a small bowl. Drizzle over apple pancake. Let cool for a minute or two. Serve warm.

Soak the yeast in the water until dissolved. Mix sugar with hot water. Add molasses. Stir into yeast mixture. Add salt and shortening. Add 1/3 cup of the shredded wheat. Beat 2 minutes. Add 3 cups of the flour and the raisins. Beat 2 minutes. Add enough remaining flour to form a soft dough. Knead until smooth. Place in a greased bowl. Cover. Let rise in a warm place until double in bulk. Punch down. Roll into 2 loaves. Place in greased loaf pans. Let rise until double. Bake at 375 degrees for 30 minutes. Cool on racks. Makes 2 loaves.

Peel and dice potatoes into 1/4 inch cubes. Heat oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add potatoes, onion, green pepper, garlic clove, bacon and 3/4 teaspoon saltcook stirring occasionally until potatoes are tender and lightly browned about 10 minutes. Transfer to a large bowl and set aside. Melt butter in same skillet over medium heatadd eggscook stirring occasionally until just set 2 minutes. Stir in milkcook stirring occasionally until eggs are fully cooked 2 minutes longer. Stir in potato mixture, 3/4 teaspoon salt, pepper, 1/2 cup cheese and 1/2 cup green chilescook stirring occasionally until heated through about 5 minutes. Set aside to cool. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lay flour tortillas on a baking sheetbake about 10 minutes or until crisp. Fill tortillas with about 1 1/2 cups of potato mixturefold in half to enc

Season chicken breasts with ginger, nutmeg and pepper. Bake uncovered in 350 degree oven for about 35 minutes. Meanwhile, peel and slice sweet potatoes. Cover with apple juice and cook until tender. When chicken is cooked, slice into strips and place on top of sweet potatoes. Bake uncovered for a few minutes until the chicken is heated through. Serve immediately.

In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, dry sherry and cornstarch. Set aside. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, stir fry beef in 1 tablespoon oil until it is no longer pink. Stir in cornstarch mixture and cook for 2-3 minutes. Add broccoli and water chestnuts and continue cooking for 2-3 more minutes. Garnish with the green onions and the remaining oil. Serve over hot cooked rice.

Heat oil in large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garliccook and stir 3 minutes. Add carrots and celerycook and stir 5 minutes or until vegetables are crisp-tender. Add black beansmix well. Add stock and bring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 10 minutes. Add cumin and parsley. Makes 6 servings.

Peel and cube pumpkin. Melt butter in pan. Add dried herbs. Add pumpkin and cook for about 10 minutes. Add salt and fresh ground pepper and continue to cook. Add chicken stock and sugar and boil for another 10 minutes. Serve hot. Serves 4 - 6.

Peel the potatoes and zucchini into 1/4-inch strips. Grate the zucchini with a food processor or a box grater. Chop the potatoes into 1/4-inch pieces. In a large bowl combine the zucchini and potatoes with 1/4 cup of the oil. Add the garlic and onion and mix well. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. In a separate bowl combine the eggs, 1/2 cup flour and the remaining 1/4 cup oil. Stir into the zucchini mixture until just combined. Spray a 10-inch baking dish with cooking spray. Pour in the zucchini mixture, spreading to an even layer. Bake for 45 minutes or until golden brown and slightly puffed. Remove from the oven and let cool for 10 minutes. In a small bowl combine the sour cream with 1/2 teaspoon of the dill. Cut the kugel into 1-inch squares and serve topped with the dill cream. Serves 4-6.
In a medium bowl mix together the frozen spinach, sour cream, mayonnaise, vegetable soup mix & water chestnuts. Add the green onions & stir until just blended. Spread on toasted bread rounds & serve.

Marinade pork chops in beef broth overnight. Brown pork chops in skillet and pour remaining marinade over pork chops. Bake 25-35 minutes at 350f. In skillet saute green bell pepper and ketchup. Add water and vinegar and bring to boil. Add cornstarch and water mixture. Cook until thickened. Pour over pork chops. Serve over rice.

Cream butter & sugar until light & fluffy. Add eggs one at a time. Add buttermilk. Dissolve baking soda in buttermilk. Add it with dry ingredients. Mix well. Pour into greased 9x5x3 pan. Bake @ 350 for about one hour.
Drain tuna. Mix with onions and celery seeds. Add mayo and mustard and mix thoroughly. Add egg and mix well. Serve on bread.

Fill shells with soup mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes. In the meantime, melt butter & add garlic powder, onion powder, & salt & pepper to taste. After 25 minutes of baking, add cheese to top of shells & pour butter mixture on top of cheese. Bake for 5 minutes uncovered & serve.

Press out water from tofu by wrapping it in paper towels and placing a heavy dish on top. Slice tofu into 1/2-inch cubes. Combine all marinade ingredients in a bowl and stir well. Add tofu to marinade and toss to coat. Marinate in refrigerator for 30 minutes. Thread tofu cubes onto skewers. Grill over medium heat until golden brown. Serve with sesame oil. Serves 4.

Combine garlic powder, lemon juice, seasoned salt and Italian seasoning in small bowl. Combine oil and chicken in large ziploc bag. Add seasoning mixture and shake well. Refrigerate at least 1 hour or up to overnight. Grill chicken about 10 minutes per side or until juice runs clear when chicken is pierced with knife. Cut lemon in half and place on top of chicken during last few minutes of cooking. Garnish with lemon slices.

Heat olive oil on medium high heat. Add grenadier fillets and cook for 2-3 minutes on each side or until browned and flakes easily when tested with a fork. Set aside and keep warm. Combine dijon mustard and vinegar and stir well. Add salt and pepper to taste and paprika if desired. Serve immediately with grenadier fillets.

Peel and grate kumara. In a large pan of boiling salted water cook kumara for 15 minutes or until tender. Drain. Mash kumara with butter and milk. Preheat oven to 180 degrees. Heat oil in a frying pan. Add onion and cook, stirring often, for 5 minutes or until softened. Add zucchini and squash and cook for a further 3 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook for another minute. Add lamb and cook for 2 minutes on each side. Transfer to a baking dish. Pour over any juices from the pan. Top with kumara mash. Bake for 30 minutes or until lamb is cooked through. Serve.

Heat olive oil in skillet over medium high heat. Add chili powder and paprika. Stir. Add garlic salt and cumin. Stir. Add potatoes and cook until potatoes are fork tender. Turn potatoes out into a bowl. Add avocados and sour cream. Stir. Stir in cilantro and lime juice. Chill. Serve with chips or crackers.

Cook water and couscous in a small saucepan over high heat until water is absorbed. Place in a serving bowl. Top with plums, goat cheese, scallions, mint and drizzle with honey and vinegar. Toss lightly to combine. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve warm or at room temperature. Makes 4 servings.

In a large skillet, brown the pork chops on both sides in the cooking oil. Remove the chops from the skillet. In the skillet remaining in the pan is the cooking oil, add the green pepper, onion, and crushed tomatoes. Cook until the vegetables are soft. Add the vinegar, brown sugar, crushed pineapple, celery salt, and crushed red pepper. Cook until the mixture thickens. Add the pork chops and cook on low heat for an additional five minutes. Serve on a hot plate with steamed rice.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cream the butter and brown sugar in a large bowl. Beat in the egg and mix well. Stir together the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into the butter mixture. Stir in the oats. Stir in the raisins and peanuts. Drop the dough by heaping teaspoons onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until the cookies are lightly browned. Cool on wire racks.
Preheat oven to 450 degrees. Prick potatoes with a fork several times and place on a baking sheet. Drizzle with oil and rub with herbes de provence. Bake until tender and brown. Serve hot.

In a saute pan over medium heat add olive oil. When oil is hot and shimmering add flour and stir until combined and a nutty aroma is produced. Add mushrooms and cook until mushrooms release their juices and begin to brown. Add thyme and vegetable stock. Bring to a boil and then reduce to a simmer. Add soy sauce, vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Allow to simmer for 5 minutes. Remove from heat.

Heat oven to 375f. Brush tortilla with butter and sprinkle with sugar and cinnamon. Roll up and place seam side down on a greased baking sheet. Bake for 12 minutes or until lightly browned. Cut into slices. Top each serving with cool whip and sprinkle with chocolate chips and banana slices. Drizzle with honey.
Cook macaroni. Brown beef and onion soup mix. Drain fat. Add tomatoes. Simmer 10 minutes. Add macaroni. Cook 5 minutes.

Melt butter in a small saucepan over low heat. Stir in sugar until melted. Remove from heat. Whisk in eggs. Add flour, baking powder, cocoa, salt, baking soda and chili powder. Stir well. Divide the batter evenly into the muffin cups. Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes. Cool completely on a wire rack. Makes 20 bites.

Boil a large pot of salted water and cook pasta according to directions on the package. While pasta is cooking, heat 1 tbsp. olive oil over medium-high heat in a large saute pan. Add cauliflower and garlic and saute until cauliflower is cooked through and lightly browned, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in red pepper flakes. Drain pasta and add to the cauliflower and garlic. Stir to combine. Serve immediately.

Split muffins, spread mustard on bottom of one half of each muffin. Layer ham, egg slices and cheese on bottom half of each muffin. Top with top half of each muffin, then spread cream on top of each muffin and sprinkle with worcestershire sauce. Bake in a 350f oven for 5 minutes or until cheese melts. Makes two sandwiches.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, saute the onion in butter until tender. Stir in the barley. Gradually stir in the broth. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer for 20 minutes. Add the cranberries, almonds, sage, and seasoning. Cook 10 more minutes. Stuff the turkey breast with the barley mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 2 hours. Cool slightly before slicing. Serve with additional cranberries.

Cut baby bok choy in half lengthwise. Scoop out the stem, leaving the leaves intact. Set aside. Heat water in a large pot. Once it boils, add chicken stock and bok choy leaves. Simmer for a few minutes. Add wonton wrappers. Turn off heat and let the wontons float in the boiling water for about 3-5 minutes. Drain the wontons on a plate lined with paper towel and place in individual bowls. Pour in broth and sprinkle with white pepper and sesame oil before serving.
Brown potatoes in butter until potatoes are crispy. Add mild salsa. Mix potatoes. Add shredded american cheese. Serve hot.

Beat cream cheese and sugar until well blended. Add eggs one at a time. Beat until smooth. Add vanilla and Frangelico. Pour into pie shell. Bake 45 minutes at 350. Cool completely before refrigerating.

In a bowl combine ground chicken, egg, bread crumbs and lemon juice. Mix well. Divide evenly and form into 6 patties. Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook patties for 5 minutes on each side. Top each patty with feta cheese. Serve on toasted buns.

In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat together the eggs and butter. Add the corn syrup and brown sugar and beat until smooth. Add the rind and juice and beat until thoroughly blended. In another bowl combine the flour and salt and blend into the egg mixture. Stir in the pecans. Pour the filling into the pie crust. Bake until the center is set and the edges are golden brown, about 40 minutes. Let cool before serving. Serve with whipped cream.

Cook beef and sausage over medium-low heat in large skillet until browned. Drain. Stir in tomato soup and tomatoesheat through. Arrange 1/2 the beef and sausage mixture on bottom of 13 x 9 baking pan. Top with half the potatoes, half the onion, and 1/3 of each cheese. Repeat layers. Combine milk and melted butterdrizzle over top. Bake uncovered at 350 for 20-30 minutes or until bubbly. Garnish with parsley.

Mix margarine and sugar together until creamy. Add cream cheese and eggs. Beat until creamy. Add flour. Add baking powder and vanilla. Pour into bundt pan. Bake at 350 degrees for one hour or until a toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Remove from pan. Cool on rack. Dust with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper. In a large bowl, beat together butter, sugar, vanilla and salt until light and fluffy. Beat in flour until well combined. Stir in spices. Divide dough into 24 portions. Form each portion into a ball. Place 2 inches apart on prepared baking sheets. Bake until cookies are golden brown around edges, 10 to 12 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool. Combine powdered sugar and milk until smooth. Drizzle over cookies. Allow cookies to stand for at least 5 minutes so icing will set. Store in an air-tight container at room temperature for up to 1 week.

In a pan, combine 1 cup dark rum, 1/4 cup sugar syrup, 1 tsp nutmeg, and 1/4 tsp cinnamon stick, and heat over low heat until sugar is completely dissolved. Transfer into a large mug and add 1 Tbsp hot water. Then add 1 Tbsp of butter on top. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 300 degrees. Mix all ingredients in a large resealable bag. Add rib racks and coat. Let sit in fridge overnight or at least 2 hours. Place rib racks in a shallow dish or on a rack in a large pan. Bake in the oven for 2 hours. Remove from the oven and cover with aluminum foil. Continue to cook in the oven for 1 additional hour or until meat is very tender and falling off the bone. Serve with your favorite barbecue sauce.

Place the cucumber in a bowl and sprinkle with salt. Let them stand for about 15 minutes. Squeeze them dry and toss them with the chilies and the onions. In a small bowl mix together the rest of the ingredients. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss gently to combine. Place the salad in the refrigerator and let it marinate for about an hour. Before serving sprinkle with the roasted peanuts.

Combine the first four ingredients in the top of a double boiler. Cook until mixture reaches the soft-ball stage. Add vanilla. Remove from heat. Add egg yolks. Return mixture to the double boiler. Cook over medium-low heat until mixture thickens and forms softly when spoon is run through it. Pour into an 8x8x3-inch baking dish. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Let cool. Spread with topping. Cut into squares. Top with toasted coconut. Refrigerate.

Combine the ricotta, feta, eggs and seasonings. Roll out phyllo dough and cut into 2-inch squares. Place a spoonful of the cheese mixture on each square. Fold over one side to form a triangle. Drizzle with butter. Bake at 350 for 10 minutes.
Toss pineapple with celery and grapes. Sprinkle with walnut pieces. In a small bowl, combine yogurt, honey, and mayonnaisedrizzle over fruit mixture. Chill before serving. Makes 6 servings.

Mix egg and spinach together. Lay out one sheet of dough and brush with butter. Spread spinach mixture over the crust. Sprinkle with mozzarelae and oregano and bake at 375f for 15 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Sift together flour and salt. Add cracked wheat, cornmeal and soya flour and mix well. Add buttermilk, margarine and yeast. Knead into dough and cover with a damp cloth for 1 hour. Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness and cut into strips 1 inch wide and 6 inches long. Fry in bacon fat until golden and crisp. Serve immediately with butter or jam.

Mix together first 4 ingredients in a bowl until well blendedspoon half of mixture into each of two slow cookerstop with ribs in each slow cookercover and cook on high for 4 hours or until ribs are tender. Stir remaining mixture wellpour evenly over ribs in each slow cookercover and cook on high for 1 hour or until heated through. Serve with rice.

Prepare dates by cutting off the stems and removing pits. To stuff dates, combine ground almonds and powdered sugar in a small bowl. Add enough of the orange flower water and food coloring to form a paste. Stuff the dates and place the nuts in the center. If desired, roll dates in powdered sugar. Serve at room temperature.
Place all ingredients in a large pot or Dutch oven. Heat until mixture is simmering. Cook pasta according to package directions. Serve immediately with fresh parsley garnish.

In a large dutch oven over medium-high heat, heat olive oil. Add onion and garlic. Stir to cook 1 minute. Add carrots, broth, tomatoes and bay leaf. Stir to mix. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to simmer. Cover and cook 30 minutes. Stir in beans. Simmer 30 minutes longer or until vegetables are tender.

Chop tomatoes, cilantro, lime juice, and jalapeno together in a bowl. Add the garlic and onion powder. Add the lime juice, garlic powder, and onion powder to the chopped tomatoes, cilantro, lime juice, and jalapeno. Salt to taste and refrigerate until ready to serve.

Hollow out red peppers. Slice the tops off the tomatoes and scoop out the seeds. Season the peppers and tomatoes with salt and pepper. Heat the olive oil in a pan and add the garlic and basil. Saute until soft and add the tomatoes. Saute for a minute. Remove the tomatoes and set aside. In the same pan add the peppers and saute for a minute. Pour the tomatoes over the peppers. Top with basil leaves. Serve hot.
Cook ramen noodles as directed. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl combine cabbage, ramen noodles, almonds, onions and dressing. Toss to combine. Serve immediately or refrigerate for up to 2 days.

Crush the biscuits. Mix the crushed biscuits with the rice flour and cocoa. Press the mixture into a 22 x 33cm tray lined with baking paper. Bake for 10 minutes at 180 degrees C. Remove from the oven and cool for 2 minutes. Spread the nutella on top and press the hazelnuts into the nutella. Sprinkle with the crushed hazelnuts and almonds and melt the dark chocolate and frangelico together. Drizzle on top and refrigerate for 30 minutes to set before cutting into pieces. Serve and enjoy!

In a large saucepan, combine rice, water, margarine and soup mixbring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer uncovered 20 minutes. Remove from heat. Add cooked chopscover. Let stand 15 minutes. Serve from pot.

Prepare Spanish rice according to package directions. Add one can of diced tomato with green chilies and one can of enchilada sauce. Cook rice and sauce. Remove from heat. Chop chicken breast and bell peppers. In large skillet, saute bell peppers and chicken breast in oil and picante sauce. Cook until chicken and bell peppers are done. To assemble chimichangas, spread about one cup of Spanish rice mixture over each tortilla. Place bell peppers and chicken breast over rice mixture. Fold in the sides of the tortilla and roll up like a burrito. Place rolled tortillas in a baking dish. In a medium saucepan melt cheddar cheese over low heat. Pour melted cheese over chimichangas. Place in oven at 375 degrees for 10 minutes.

In a large bowl combine boiling water with cherry gelatin. Stir in milkcool to 100 degrees. Add pudding mixbeat 2 minutes. Fold in whipped topping. Spoon into 1-qt. molds coated with cooking spray. Refrigerate at least 3 hours or until firm. Unmold. Garnish with additional whipped topping. Makes 4 servings.

Combine vegetable oil, white wine vinegar, sesame oil, lemon juice and seasoned pepper in a small bowl. Whisk well to combine. Pour dressing into a plastic bottle with a screw on cap and store in refrigerator. Makes approximately 2 cups.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Sprinkle pork with salt and pepper. Add pork chops and cook until browned on both sides. Remove pork and set aside. Add onion and garlic to pan and cook until onion is softened. Add bacon and cook until browned. Stir in sauerkraut. Add pork and any accumulated juices and beer. Bring to a boil. Cover and reduce heat. Simmer until pork is cooked through.

Rinse the fish fillets well, drain, and pat dry. Season with the seasoning salt. Coat the fillets lightly with the flour. Melt the butter in a skillet. Add the flour. Cook over low heat until the mixture is golden brown. Remove from the heat. Add the mayonnaise. Stir until smooth. Add the egg yolks. Stir until thickened. Add the rind and parsley. Spread this mixture over the fillets. Bake in an oven preheated to 350 F. until the fillets are firm to the touch. Beat the egg whites stiff. Spoon over the fish. Bake 3-5 minutes longer. Garnish with freshly grated parmesan cheese.
