Cut cheese into 8 pieces. In a skillet add cheese and melt over low heat. Pour lemon juice over cheese and brown slightly on each side. Serve with French bread and enjoy.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. In a small bowl combine oil, garlic cloves, honey, balsamic vinegar, salt and black pepper. In a glass baking dish or roasting pan add the lamb chops. Pour over the honey mixture. Bake for about 15 minutes, turning once, until done to taste. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease an 11x15 inch baking dish. Combine sour cream, soup, butter, cheese, onion powder and salt in a large bowl. Beat until well blended. Unfold Rice Krispiescut into 1 inch squares. Press squares into the bottom and up the sides of the prepared dish. Spread the sour cream mixture evenly over the top. Bake in the preheated oven for 1 hour. Remove from oven to cool slightlytop with sour cream. Serve immediately.

Place 1 can of soup mix, water and 1/2 cup chopped onion in crock pot and cook 3 hours on low or 1 hour on high. Place pork chops into mixture and cook another 1 hour on high or 3 hours on low. Serve with rice or noodles and frozen vegetables.

Preheat oven to 375f. Cut each biscuit into 6 pieces. In small bowl, stir together garlic cloves, cheese, and butter. Spoon cheese mixture evenly onto biscuit pieces. Place biscuit pieces in single layer on greased cookie sheet. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until biscuits are golden brown. Serve with ketchup.
Combine yogurt and pepper. Spoon into individual serving bowls. Top with fresh figs. Drizzle with olive oil and honey. Top with toasted hazelnuts. Serve immediately.

In a medium bowl, combine peaches and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Combine the flour and 1/2 cup brown sugar. Cut butter into mixture until crumbly. Sprinkle over peaches. Bake for 40 minutes. Combine pecans and remaining brown sugar. Spoon over peaches and bake 10 minutes. Cool slightly. Serve warm or cold.

In a large saucepan of boiling water cook pasta for 8-10 minutes or until al dentedrain. Meanwhile in a saucepan combine butter, onion and cook until tender. Add heavy cream, ham and cook until warm. Add pasta. Mix in peas. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese. Makes about 4 servings.

Combine graham cracker crumbs, brown sugar, and margarinepress into a 9-inch pie plate. Refrigerate until filling is ready. Beat cream cheese, sugar, gelatin and milk until blended. Beat in whipped cream until smooth. Spoon filling into crust. Refrigerate for at least 8 hours or overnight. Drizzle with blueberry syrup. Garnish with blueberries.
Place 1 tsp maple syrup into a mug with hot milk and espresso coffee and cocoa powder stirring well until smooth. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 425. Cut peppers in half and remove seeds and ribs. Place peppers in a single layer in a baking pan. Toss with oil and sprinkle with garlic. Roast 20 minutes or until the pepper skins are charred on all sides and the pepper is soft and easy to scoop out. Remove from the oven and cool slightly. Put pepper mixture and remaining ingredients in a blender container. Cover and process until smooth. Serve with lettuce leaves or on a sandwich bun.

Butter one side of each slice of bread. In a small skillet over medium heat, crush garlic into butter until smooth. Spread half of the butter mixture on each slice of bread. Layer the bread with Swiss cheese, cheddar cheese, Monterey Jack cheese and mozzarella cheese. Top with remaining butter mixture. Cook on skillet over medium heat until the cheese is melted and the bread is golden brown. Cut the grilled cheese sandwich into quarters and serve with parsley.

Preheat oven to 325 degrees. Sift flour, sugar and cocoa together. Stir in remaining ingredients just until moistened. Pour into greased miniature muffin cups. Bake 15 minutes or until done. Makes 24 miniature cakes.

In a large saucepan, combine sugar, lemon juice, water and half-and-half. Cook over medium heat until sugar is dissolved. Cool to room temperature. Stir in pineapple. Chill well. Beat whipping cream until stiff. Fold into sherbet. Refrigerate until serving time. Serves 6.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter in a 13x9-inch (3-quart) glass or ceramic baking dish. Add the brown sugar, and stir until blended. Add the peaches, and spread in an even layer. Mix the cake mix, pudding mix, eggs, sour cream, oil, and extract in a large bowl. Spread over peaches. Bake for 45 minutes or until set. Cool on a wire rack for at least 30 minutes. Cut into squares. Serves 6 to 8.

Cut acorn squash in half lengthwise, remove seeds scoop out pulp from cavity with spoon. Mix sugar, spices & nuts in a small bowl. Fill squash with nut mixture & dot with butter. Bake in a pre-heated 450f. Oven for about an hour or until squash is tender & filling is golden brown.

Brown sausage and drain. In a large pot saute onion and pepper until onion is translucent. Add celery rib and cook for a few minutes. Sprinkle cajun seasoning over top and saute for 2 minutes. Add bay leaf and saute for 2 minutes more. Add turkey kielbasa and cook for 1 minute. Add stewed tomatoes and chicken broth. Bring to a boil and add rice. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 20 minutes. Remove bay leaf. Serve over rice.

Cook the pasta in boiling water. In the meantime, roast the poblanos. Prepare the olive oil mix. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and saute until softened. Add the poblanos and cook until the skin has charred. Add the zucchini and saute until tender. Remove the poblanos from the skillet and remove the seeds. Chop the poblano flesh into small pieces. Return the poblano flesh to the skillet. Add the oregano and the cooked pasta. Toss until the pasta is coated. Transfer the pasta mixture into a 9-inch square baking dish. Top with the tomatoes. Sprinkle with the cheese. Bake for 20 minutes. Serve immediately.

Boil red potatoes in lightly salted water until just tender. Drain and rinse in cold water. Mix together sour cream, mayonnaise and dill. Toss potatoes in dressing and arrange on a serving platter. Garnish with chives.

In small bowl, combine chicken breasts and neufchatel cheese. Place in blender or food processorprocess until smooth. Add onions and sherryprocess until onions are finely chopped. Transfer mixture to bowladd mayonnaise and lemon juicemix well. Cover and refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving. Spoon into bowlsprinkle with hot sauce and nutmegtop with paprika. Serve with crackers or toast points.

In a large skillet heat 2 tsp oil over medium-high heat. Add pine nuts and cook for 5 minutes or until golden brown. Remove from pan with a slotted spoon and set aside. In same skillet heat remaining oil. Add asparagus and cook for about 5 minutes or until crisp tender. Remove with slotted spoon. Set aside. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil over medium-high heat. Add pasta and cook for about 8 minutes or until al dente. Drain pasta in a colander. Toss pasta with asparagus and pine nuts. In a small bowl whisk lemon juice with lemon-pepper seasoning and olive oil. Toss pasta with dressing. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9x9 inch baking dish. Prepare the crust by combining the flour and butter in a bowl with a fork or pastry blender until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Stir in the chopped pecans. Press into the bottom of the prepared baking dish. Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes. Prepare the filling by combining the cream cheese and whipped topping in a bowl and spreading over the cooled crust. Bake for 20 more minutes. Prepare the topping by combining the pudding mixes, milk, butter, vanilla extract, and 3/4 cup pecans in a bowl and mix until smooth. Spread over the baked cheesecake layer and sprinkle with the remaining chopped pecans. Bake for 10 more minutes, or until the filling is set.

In a large bowl, mix together pork, eggs, skim milk, mustard and Worcestershire sauce until just combined. Add salt, pepper, breadcrumbs, parsley and mix again until combined but not over-mixed. Divide into 4 patties and wrap each with a slice of bacon. Arrange on a baking sheet. Bake for 20-25 minutes. Let rest for 10 minutes before cutting into 1-inch slices.

Heat 1 tablespoon oil in large skillet over medium heat. Add onionscook 10 to 12 minutes or until crisp-tender. Add 2 cups refried beanscook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Pour 1/4 cup beans into each tortillatop with 2 tablespoons cheese. Fold over each side of tortilla. Brown tortillas in remaining 1 tablespoon oil in skillet for 1 to 2 minutes on each side or until crisp. Serve with sour cream if desired.

Heat a nonstick grill pan over medium-high heat. Meanwhile combine the zucchini and squash with the breadcrumbs, cheese, onions, and egg until well blended. Form into four patties. Coat the pan with the butter. Place the cakes in the pan and cook for 3 to 4 minutes per side. Garnish with lemon wedges.

Preheat oven to 350f. Combine bell pepper, celery, oats, catsup and thyme in small bowl. Place turkey in shallow bowl or plate. Press pepper/celery mixture evenly into turkey with your fingertips or back of spoon. Shape into patties about 1/2-inch thick. Place on baking sheet coated with cooking spray. Bake uncovered 10 minutes or until thoroughly cooked through (160f). Cool slightly before serving. Makes about 50 minis.

In a 9x13 pan, layer hamburger, brown sugar, onion, garlic cloves, tomato soup, tomato sauce, cream of chicken soup and milk. Bake uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake 5 minutes more. Serve over egg noodles.

Preheat oven to 350F. In a small bowl combine the kosher salt, black pepper, onion powder, garlic powder, thyme, ginger and pineapple juice until well blended. Rinse pork tenderloin and pat dry. Rub spice mixture over tenderloin. Place in slow cooker. Add pineapple chunks and juice and cranberries. Cover and cook on low for 6-8 hours or on high for 3-4 hours. Remove pork tenderloin from slow cooker and allow to rest for 5 minutes. Slice thinly and serve.

Combine water and ramen noodles in a microwave safe bowl. Cook for 3 minutes. Place a layer of bread in a bowl. Sprinkle with ketchup and american cheese. Layer with the cooked ramen noodles. Serve with a fork and spoon for easy eating.

Heat the olive oil and sauté the garlic for 30 seconds. Add the stock and the smoked turkey and bring to a simmer. Add the collard greens and cook until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with crushed red pepper flakes. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease cookie sheets. In the bowl of an electric mixer, cream together the butter and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time until smooth. Sift together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. Blend into the sugar mixture. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by teaspoonsful onto prepared baking sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow to cool completely before removing from cookie sheets.

Combine beef with egg and mashed potatoes. Salt and pepper to taste. Shape into patties and cook in skillet or on grill until done. Meanwhile combine pickled beets with onions and capers. Serve on buns with beet mixture and lettuce and tomato.
Sprinkle pork chops with garlic powder. Place in pan and add soup and mushrooms. Cover and bake 1 hour at 350 degrees.

Slice the onions thinly and fry them in olive oil until soft. Break up the sausages with your hands into the pan and fry until browned. Break 6 eggs into a bowl and season with salt and pepper. Pour half-and-half into a shallow bowl and whisk in 1/2 cup of hot water. Beat eggs into this mixture until smooth. Pour egg mixture over the sausages and onions. Cook for a few minutes until the eggs are set on the bottom of the pan, then scatter over the dried oregano. Cover with a lid for a few minutes to finish cooking. Serve with salsa, tortillas or bread to sop up the juices from the pan.

In a large skillet, heat 2 teaspoons of olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and saute until tender but not brown. Add chicken breasts and cook on each side for 5-6 minutes or until done. Remove to a platter. In the same skillet, heat butter over medium high heat. Add lemon rind and capers to the skillet. Stir for 1 minute, then stir in lemon juice. Add cooked chicken back to the skillet with the caper-lemon sauce. Stir in the basil before serving.

Combine margarine and sugar in a mixing bowl until well mixed. Beat in egg and vanilla. Sift together flour and baking soda. Add to the creamed mixture, and mix well. Chill dough 1 hour. Shape into balls and flatten to 1/2-inch thickness. Place cookies 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake 8-10 minutes in a 350 degree F oven. Cool on wire racks.

Sear the beef fillets in a little olive oil in a heavy frying pan until they are cooked through. Add the wine and simmer until the liquid has reduced to a thick sauce consistency. Sprinkle with black pepper and set aside. Cook the asparagus in a little boiling water for 2 minutes or so until tender but still crisp. Place in a serving dish and dress with a little olive oil and salt and pepper. Peel and cut the avocado into 2cm/1 inch dice and blitz in a food processor with a little lemon juice and a little olive oil to make a creamy dip. Spread the lettuce leaves with the mayonnaise and lay on a serving plate. Arrange the asparagus on top of the lettuce and top with the beef and avocado dip. Garnish with nasturtium petals and serve.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream together butter and sugar. Beat egg and add to mixture. Stir together oats, flour, baking soda and powder and salt. Stir into creamed mixture. Add blueberries and mix thoroughly. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake 20-25 minutes until muffins are golden brown and toothpick inserted into center comes out clean. Cool muffins on a wire rack.
Mix coleslaw, green onions and 3 tablespoons canola oil in large bowl. Toss to coat. Serve immediately.

Cook the noodles in boiling salted water for about 4 minutes or until tender. Drain noodles and set aside. In a skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and garlic. Cook and stir until tender. Add the flour and cook and stir until a paste forms, about one minute. Add the beef broth and bouillon granules and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer, stirring often until the mixture is thickened. Stir in the cooked noodles, pepper and sour cream. Serve with the mushrooms.

Slice tomatoes in half. Rub the garlic clove over each tomato half. Place in a small glass baking dish. Drizzle with olive oil. Sprinkle with olives and season with salt and pepper. Broil until tomatoes are soft and the edges of olives are golden. Serve warm.

In a food processor, process cookies until fine crumbs form. Add peanutsprocess until nuts are finely chopped. Transfer to a 9-inch pie plate. Spread evenly over the bottom. Freeze while you prepare the ice cream topping. In a small saucepan over medium heat, whisk together the butter and fudge sauce until melted and smooth. Remove from heatadd coffee liqueur and stir until combined. Pour over ice creamsmooth with spatula or back of spoon. Freeze until set, about 2 hours or overnight. Top with peanut butter cups before serving, if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cream together sugar and butter. Add flour and salt. Mix well. Roll into 1 inch balls. Press each ball to flatten to 1/4 inch thickness. Bake on ungreased cookie sheet for 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Coat an 8 1/2 by 4 1/2 inch loaf pan with cooking spray. In a large bowl, stir together flour, cornmeal, baking soda and powder, and salt. Set aside. In another bowl, whisk together milk and eggs. Stir into dry mixture until just moistened. Stir in applesauce and butter. Spread batter evenly in prepared pan. Bake for 50 to 60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes 1 loaf (10 to 12 servings).

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute until fragrant, about 2 minutes. Add the pine nuts and basil and saute for 30 seconds. Add the pasta and cook until it is just tender. Turn the heat to high and add the tomatoes and stir until the tomatoes are wilted. Remove from the heat and stir in the parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper.

Place beef in a large pot and add water. Boil until tender. Drain and chop the meat. In a large skillet heat the oil and saute the onion until tender. Add the beef, green peppers and chili. Cook and stir until well mixed. Add the tomatoes and sultanas. Season with salt and pepper. Serve hot.

Carefully cut off the top 2 inches of each pear and discard. Remove the core. Slice each pear lengthwise into 1/2-inch slices. Combine the lemon juice and the sugar in a large pot and place over medium heat. Add the pears and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low, cover the pot and simmer gently for 20 minutes. Add the butter, cream, vanilla extract, whisky and salt. Bring the mixture back to a simmer. Cover again, remove the pot from the heat and let the pears sit for 5 minutes. Serve the pears warm or at room temperature. Makes 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Mix all dry ingredients. Add egg and water and knead to form dough. Dust with flour as needed. Divide into 4-6 equal pieces and roll into balls. Place on cookie sheet and bake for 15-20 minutes until browned on top and bottom. Turn over halfway through baking. These are best hot. Serve with butter or creamy topping or your choice of sauce.

In a large bowl or pitcher combine the milk, cocoa powder and vanilla. Whisk in the eggs. In a separate bowl combine the cocoa powder and the all-purpose flour. Add the oil. Stir the dry mixture into the liquid mixture until smooth. Heat a 6 inch (15 cm) crepe pan over medium high heat. Add a little oil to the pan and swirl to coat the bottom. Pour a small amount of the batter into the pan to form a pancake. Cook for 1 minute or until the top of the crepe is dry. Turn the pancake over and cook the other side for 1 minute. Stack the crepes as they are finished cooking. Place the crepes in a plastic bag and keep them in the refrigerator. Before serving, place the crepe on a warm plate. Top with powdered sugar and your favorite fruit.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Butter a 2 quart casserole dish. Mix together the cracker crumbs, eggs, salt and pepper. Add the Tabasco Sauce and the scallops. Pour into prepared dish. Bake in preheated oven for 25-30 minutes or until set. Serve hot.

Combine flour, granulated sugar, brown sugar, margarine, eggs and vanilla in mixing bowl. Beat at low speed until well mixed, scraping sides occasionally. Beat at medium speed 2 minutes until light and fluffy. Stir in salt and baking soda. Stir in white chocolate chips. Drop by tablespoons on ungreased baking sheet about 2 inches apart. Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes. Let cookies set on pan 5 minutes before transferring to wire rack to cool.

Preheat the oven to 400. Line a muffin pan with muffin liners. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking soda and salt. Set aside. In the bowl of an electric mixer fitted with the paddle attachment, cream the sugar and the butter together until well combined. Add the vanilla extract and the eggs. Mix to combine. With the mixer on low speed, gradually add the flour mixture. Mix until just combined. Fold in the semi-sweet chocolate chips. Divide the batter evenly into the prepared muffin cups. Bake for 15 to 18 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean. Let muffins cool in the pan for 5 minutes then remove to cool completely. Enjoy.

Beat cream cheese until smooth. Beat in sweetened condensed milk and orange juice until well blended. Stir in half of the Cool Whip Free and spread in prepared graham cracker pie crust. Top with remaining Cool Whip Free and garnish with orange peel strips, if desired. Chill until firm. Serve with garnish.
Combine all in a jar. Shake well. Makes about 1 cup. Makes 3 cups.
In a medium bowl toss together penne pasta, plum tomatoes, fresh mozzarella cheese, extra virgin olive oil, red wine vinegar, fresh basil. Season with salt and ground pepper to taste.

Saute onion in olive oil until softened and transparent. Add beef and cook until browned and crumbly. Stir in tomato sauce and water. Season with chili powder, salt and pepper. Add macaroni and cook for 8 to 10 minutes or until macaroni is tender and pasta water is absorbed. Remove from heat and add beans and cheese. Serve with additional cheese for topping if desired.

Combine cream cheese and ranch dressing mix in a small bowl with the back of a spoon until well blended. Spread evenly over tortilla. Layer with lettuce, onions and jalapenos. Roll up and cut in half. Makes two wraps.

In a small skillet over medium heat, melt the butter. Add the shallot and saute until golden brown, 5-6 minutes. Add the scallions and cook until soft, about 3 minutes. Transfer the vegetable mixture to a bowl, add the celery and stir to combine. Cover the vegetables and let cool for at least 30 minutes. Meanwhile, peel the potatoes and cut into 1/2-inch dice. In a medium pot over medium heat, warm the chicken broth until hot. Add the potato dice and simmer until tender, about 10 minutes. Season the potatoes with nutmeg and rosemary. Stir into the vegetable mixture along with the cream. Reheat the mixture over medium-low heat until hot. Season with salt and pepper. Serve the soup warm with the crackers.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. In a small bowl, combine the cornmeal, buttermilk and 1/4 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Heat a medium nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Melt the butter in the pan. Add the cornmeal mixture. Cook until it begins to set and the bottom is brown. Stir in the raisins. Transfer the mixture to a plate. In a small bowl combine the cream cheese and brown sugar until smooth. Add the remaining 1/4 teaspoon each pepper and the eggs. Beat until smooth. Stir in the pumpkin and spices. Spoon the mixture into the cornmeal crust. Bake until the filling is set in the center, about 30 minutes. Serve warm or at room temperature. Serve with cranberry chutney.

Remove the seeds and core from the apple. Slice the apple into thin pieces and place onto the skewer. In a large saucepan combine the sugar, corn syrup, water and cinnamon oil. Bring to a boil and boil for one minute. Remove from heat and stir in the red food coloring and pour over the skewers. Cool and enjoy!

In a skillet, brown the steak in oil until browned on all sides. In a small bowl combine the wine, soy and barbecue. Pour over the steak and brown on all sides. Serve on a plate with the rosemary sprig for garnish.

Heat a 12-inch skillet over medium heat and add the butter. When the butter melts, add the ginger and the ground turmeric and cardamom seeds. Stir for about 30 seconds, then add the onions and cook until the onions are golden. Add the ground nutmeg and cloves and cook for about 1 minute. Add the garlic and cook until the garlic is fragrant and golden. Add the chicken pieces and stir well. Cover the skillet and reduce the heat to low. Cook for 45 minutes until the meat is tender. Remove the cover and stir often to prevent sticking. Remove the cinnamon stick. Serve with rice or couscous and a salad.

Combine mayonnaise, italian seasoning and chicken breasts in a ziploc bag. Close and shake to coat chicken completely. Place the chicken on the doritos and melt the butter on top. Bake at 400f for 30 minutes or until chicken is done. Serve warm with tortilla chips.

In food processor, blend ricotta with yogurt. Add walnuts and butterprocess until smooth. Transfer mixture to small bowl. Add garlic, pepper, salt and Parmesan cheese. Stir until blended. Toss with pasta before serving. Garnish with fresh parsley and basil. Serves 4.

In a large bowl, combine the turkey, stuffing mix, eggs, milk, onion, celery, and cranberries. Mix well. Shape into a loaf, and place in a lightly greased loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve warm.

Ingredient: 1 cup fresh mint leaves 4 thin slices fresh ginger 1 teaspoon sugar 1/2 cup boiling water 1 cup strong black tea 1/4 cup fresh lemon juice (about 2 lemons) Directions: Bring 1 cup water to a boil. Add mint leaves and ginger slices. Cover and steep for 10 minutes. Strain tea mixture. In a large pitcher, combine mint tea with strong black tea, sugar, fresh lemon juice, and cold water. Serve over ice. Makes 4 cups.

crush oreos in a large food processor. combine crushed cookies and butter in a large bowl. Press crumbs evenly over bottom and up sides of a 9-inch pie plate. Freeze while making filling. In a large bowl, beat ice creams and cream until smooth and creamy. stir in the fudge topping and walnuts until combined well. Pour into pie shell and freeze until firm. Serve with a drizzle of fudge topping and a sprinkle of chopped nuts.

Combine yogurt, dill, vinegar, garlic, and mayonnaise. Spread half of this mixture on one side of each fillet. Grill or broil fillets until opaque in center, about 10 minutes. Turn overspread remaining mixture on top. Grill or broil 5 minutes more. Serve with lemon slices.

Combine romaine with apple, red onion, green onion, green peas and raisins in a large bowl. Divide among four serving plates. Top with cilantro leaf and cashews. Sprinkle with salt and pepper. Serve immediately.

Cook penne pasta according to the package directions. Drain and set aside. In a large bowl toss together chicken, dressing and broth until well coated. Add pasta and toss until pasta is coated. Transfer mixture to a greased 1-1/2 quart baking dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Sprinkle with croutons and serve with additional cheese and croutons on the side.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees f. Wash potatoes. Cut lengthwise into 1/4-inch slices. In a bowl toss potatoes with oil and seasonings. Arrange potatoes in a single layer in a baking sheet. Bake for 30 minutes. Turn potatoes over and bake for 30 minutes more.

Cut steaks to size desired. Put in plastic bag with steak sauce, pineapple juice, cornstarch and brown sugar. Shake to coat steaks. Marinate at least 2 hours. Preheat grill or broiler. Grill or broil 10-15 minutes per side or until desired doneness. Serve with baked potato.

Preheat oven to 350 F. Toss squash with oil and spices. Roast on a foil-lined baking sheet for 20 minutes. Add fennel and onion. Roast another 20-30 minutes or until squash and onion are tender and beginning to brown.

Combine barbecue sauce and orange zest and juice. Place chicken on grill or in a skillet. Cook 5 to 6 minutes per side. Brush chicken with sauce mixture during last 3 minutes of cooking. Cut vegetables into 1/2 inch pieces. Combine vegetables and dressing in a large bowl. Cook chicken. Cut into 1-inch pieces and place in bowl with vegetables. Toss to coat. Serves 4.

Preheat crock pot to low. In a large skillet saute the beef until browned. Stir in the cabbage leaves. Cook and stir until heated through. Drain excess liquid. Spoon beef mixture into center of each cabbage leaf. Roll up. Place in crock pot. In a small bowl combine the tomato paste and water. Stir well. Add to the beef mixture in the crock pot. Cover and cook on low for 6-7 hours or until beef is tender. Stir in the rice. Season with thyme and pepper. Cover and cook for 30 minutes longer. Serve hot.

Mix together flour and sugar in a large bowl then cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the ritz cracker crumbs then set aside. In a separate large bowl combine pineapple chunks with the juice and set aside. In a small bowl combine the cheese with the melted butter. Pour the pineapple chunks into the crumb mixture then pour the cheese mixture over the pineapple. Mix together then spread into a 9-inch square baking dish. Bake at 350 degrees for 45 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large bowl, stir together the jello and boiling water. Add the crushed pineapple. Stir in 1/2 cup of the sugar and the vanilla. Chill until the gelatin is set. In a saucepan, melt the butter. Add the remaining 1/2 cup of sugar and the walnuts. Cook and stir until the mixture is bubbly. Pour over the chilled pineapple mixture. Cover and chill for 4 hours or overnight. Crumble 5 graham crackers in a small bowl. Spoon the pineapple mixture into 6 dessert dishes. Top with the crumbled graham crackers. Serve immediately.

Hard-boil eggs, 12 minutes. Remove from pot and let cool. While eggs are still warm, place in large bowl and cover with vinegar. Add bay leaves, onion, and garlic. Cover and refrigerate at least 24 hours. Drain and rinse eggs well. To serve, slice in half. Add a pinch of salt to each egg.

In large mixing bowl combine all rice pudding ingredients. Cook in heavy-bottomed 2 quart saucepan over low heat, stirring constantly until mixture boils and thickens. Stir in pineapple and pecans. Pour into individual serving dishes and refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving. This dish can be prepared one day ahead and refrigerated until ready to serve.

Cut the ribs into individual bones. Mix soy sauce and plum jam together. Rub ribs with garlic. Put ribs in a baking pan and pour sauce over them. Add water to pan to cover the ribs. Add honey. Bake at 325 degrees for 3 hours. Turn ribs once during cooking. Baste with sauce when done. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit (175 degrees Celsius). Mix together flour, soda, and salt. In a separate bowl, stir together sugar, dried cranberries, orange zest, egg, and vanilla. Stir dry ingredient mixture into wet mixture just until combined. Fold in oil and sourdough starter. Fill muffin cups 3/4 full. Bake until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes. Serve muffins warm or at room temperature. Makes 10 to 12 muffins.

In a medium bowl whisk together vinegars, mustard, honey, 3 tablespoons olive oil, 1/8 teaspoon each salt and pepper. Add the tomatoes and toss to coat. Cover and chill for at least 1 hour before serving. Cut bread into 1 inch cubes and toss with 2 tablespoons olive oil. Arrange cubes in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake for about 15 minutes or until crisp. Remove from oven. Let cool slightly. Add the bread cubes to the tomato mixture. Toss to coat. Transfer to a serving bowl. Sprinkle with basil leaves. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Makes 4 servings.

Slice squash into 1-inch pieces. In a medium bowl combine squash with remaining ingredients. Form into 2-inch patties. In a skillet heat 1/2-inch of vegetable oil until 375 degrees. Add pattiescook about 3 minutes per side or until golden brown. Makes 6 servings.
Cut bread into cubes. Pour soup into 8x8 pan and add bread cubes. Toss to coat. Pour into 2-quart casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake at 350 degrees for about 45 minutes.

Slice steak against grain. Cut across grain into thin strips. Combine lime juice, fish sauce and peppers in a small bowl. Add garlic and let stand. Slice or shred red onion and cucumber. Combine with cilantro and scallions. Toss with dressing and spread on lettuce leaves. Top with steak strips and serve immediately.

Prepare a large baking pan by lining it with waxed paper. Melt chocolate in double boiler over low heat or in microwave. Stir in nuts and marshmallows. Pour mixture onto prepared baking pan and spread evenly. Let cool to room temperature or until firm. Break into pieces. Store in tightly sealed container. Makes about 30 pieces.

Preheat grill to medium heat. Lightly brush both sides of bread with olive oil and grill until toasty. Spread 1 side of toasted bread with mayonnaise and spread with turkey breast and roasted red peppers. Top with slices of taleggio cheese. Grill until cheese is melted. Sprinkle with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Serve with watercress leaves. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat butter and both sugars in a large bowl until creamy. Beat in vanilla. Add flourbeat well. Stir in cereal. Shape into 1 inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 10-12 minutes or just until set. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from cookie sheets to wire racks. Cool completely. Makes about 24 cookies.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Line two cookie sheets with parchment paper. In a food processor or blender combine almonds, egg whites and sugar. Process until mixture resembles wet sand and the almonds are ground to a fine meal. Add cardamom and cinnamon and pulse until combined. Sprinkle the mixture onto the prepared baking sheets and spread to form a thin even layer. Bake until the macaroons begin to color and are dry to the touch (about 25 minutes). Transfer to wire racks to cool completely. Store in an air-tight container.

In medium skillet over medium heat, cook beef with water until no longer pink. Drain. Stir in taco seasoning mix. Stir until well blended. Stir in chili and pepper. Simmer for about 10 minutes. Remove from heat. Stir in taco sauce. Stir until well blended. Spread about 1 tsp. cream cheese onto each taco shell. Top with meat mixture. Sprinkle with lettuce and tomato. Makes 4 servings.
Combine all ingredients in saucepan over medium heat. Cook until it is thick and syrupy. This sauce can be used on pancakes or waffles.

In a medium skillet over medium heat, melt butter and add garlic salt. Stir until the garlic salt is fully dissolved into the butter. Add the shrimp to the skillet. Cook the shrimp for 5 minutes or until pink. Remove the shrimp from the skillet. Add the linguine to the skillet. Cook the linguine until it is fully cooked. Drain the linguine and place it back into the skillet. Stir in the cream cheese until it melts into the linguine. Stir in the whole milk. Add the basil leaves and parmesan cheese. Stir until the cheese melts. Serve the seafood basil alfredo over the linguine.
Place all in a blender. Blend until smooth. Serve with gingerale.

Prepare a breading station with three bowlsfirst for flour, second for egg whites and third for crushed breadcrumbs. Wash and shake dry spinach leaves. Tear into small pieces. Lay on wax paper and let dry 10 minutes. Mix flour with salt and pepper. Beat egg whites until frothy. Dip spinach pieces in egg whites then flour. Place in breadcrumbs until coated completely. Deep fry until golden brown. Serve with melted butter and red chile flakes on top for garnish.

Place potato in large saucepan. Cover with water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover and simmer until tender. Mash potato and stir in corned beef. Add beaten eggs and bread crumbs. Stir in soup. Form into 1-inch meatballs and brown in a skillet.

Dry off lamb chops. Dust with flour and shake off excess. Heat oil in large frying pan. Brown chops on all sides over medium high heat. Remove chops and keep warm while you make sauce. Pour off all but about 1 tablespoon of fat from the pan. Add onion and cook over low heat until onion is soft and translucent. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Stir in tomato sauce and vinegar and cook until thickened and bubbly. Stir in ground ginger and curry powder and cook until fragrant. Add water and salt and pepper to taste. Return chops to pan and cover tightly with lid or foil and cook over low heat until chops are cooked through and sauce is thickened, about 15 minutes. Serve immediately over rice.

To make the dough, combine the flour, sugar, yeast and salt in the bowl of a stand mixer. Add the warm water and mix on low speed until combined and the dough begins to form. Add the butter and turn the mixer on medium-high speed until the dough comes away from the sides of the bowl and forms a ball. Continue to mix for 10 minutes, or until the dough is smooth and elastic. Place in a greased bowl and cover with plastic wrap. Let rise in a warm place for 1 hour. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured surface and punch down. Let rest 5 minutes and divide into 8 even pieces. Working with one piece at a time, roll the dough into a rope about 16 inches long. Shape the rope into a loop and place on a baking sheet. Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled in size, about 30 minutes. Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Remove from the oven and brush with melted butter. Serve

In a large saucepan over medium heat combine the sugar, butter, evaporated milk, butterscotch chips, and salt. Cook until the mixture boils. Remove from heat. Add oats and coconut. Mix well. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper. Let cool.
Peel cucumbers, cut into 1/4-inch slices, remove seeds. Toss with onion, green pepper, salt, sugar, celery seed, and vinegar. Refrigerate 1 hour before serving.

In a saucepan over low heat combine marshmallows, honey and butter until melted and smooth stirring frequently. Remove from heat and stir in vanilla and salt. Mix oats and cereal with coconut and nuts. Pour marshmallow mixture over cereal mixture and stir until completely coated. Pour onto wax paper and cool. Cut into bars when cool.

Preheat oven to 400f. Mix eggs with bread crumbs. Coat chicken fillets with mixture. Roll in parmesan cheese. Melt butter and garlic in pan. Add chicken. Brown both sides. Add parsley. Bake 15-20 minutes. Turn over and bake until done.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease a 12-cup muffin pan, or line with paper muffin cups. In a large bowl, combine the sugar, butter, egg, flour, baking powder, and salt. Stir until smooth. Stir in milk and vanilla extract. Gently fold in the strawberries. Spoon the batter into the prepared muffin cups. In a small bowl combine the flour, brown sugar, cinnamon, and buttercut the mixture in to small pieces. Sprinkle over the batter. Bake in the preheated oven for 20 minutes. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from the pan. Serve warm.

Prepare rice-a-roni according to package instructions. In large skillet over medium-high heat, cook mushrooms and bell pepper until tender. Remove and set aside. Cook and stir chicken until no longer pink and juices run clear. Add rice-a-roni and soup. Cook and stir until heated through. Stir in vegetables and cheese. Heat through. Serve on tortilla chips or in tortilla shells.

Preheat oven to 350f. In large bowl, beat butter and vegetable oil until creamy. Add sugar and beat until blended. Add egg and beat well. Combine dry ingredients. Gradually add to creamed mixture. Beat well. Shape into 1-inch balls. Place 2 inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove to wire racks to cool.

Preheat oven to 350°F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a medium bowl whisk together the butter and sugars. Beat in the vanilla. Add the eggs one at a time, beating until incorporated. Sift together the flour, baking soda and salt into the bowl. Beat until just combined. Fold the chocolate chips into the dough. Using a 1 1/4-inch round cutter or glass dipped in sugar, cut out 24 dough balls and place about 2 inches apart on the baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until the edges are lightly golden. Cool for 2 minutes before removing from baking sheets to cooling racks. Recipe from Martha Stewart Living.

Heat grill or broiler. In a large bowl, mix together the frozen concentrate, lemon juice, hoisin sauce, oil and ginger. Add in wings and coat well. Grill wings until cooked through and golden, about 10 minutes per side or broil on high until golden and cooked through, about 8 minutes per side. Serve with green onions for garnish and extra hot sauce on the side.

In a large saucepan, combine apple cider with apricot nectar and sugar. Add cinnamon sticks and spices. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat. Simmer 10 minutes. Stir in lemon juice. Remove from heat. Add orange juice. Let stand for 10 minutes. Discard cinnamon sticks and spices. Chill. Serve over ice cubes. Garnish with lemon rind if desired. Serve with cornbread.

Cut cauliflower into florets, then toss in 1/2 cup rice vinegar, 1 tsp curry powder, 1 tsp salt and 1/2 tsp of pepper until well coated. Spread florets on cookie sheet. Roast at 425F until browned. Stir in 1/2 cup rice vinegar with 1 TBSP each of butter and soy sauce and 1 tsp curry powder. Cook until bubbly. Stir in 1/3 cup chopped parsley. Serve with cauliflower.

Cut leek in half lengthways. Clean by rinsing thoroughly under running water. Dry well. Trim off root end. Cut leek lengthways into thin slices. Melt butter in saucepan. Add leek. Cook over medium heat about 5 minutes or until tender. Remove from heat. Stir in frozen spinach. Cook over low heat about 1 minute or until spinach is tender. Combine with sour cream. Season with salt and pepper. Beat eggs lightly. Add tasty cheese. Add spinach mixture. Spoon into pastry-lined tart pan. Bake at 180c for about 30 minutes or until tart is cooked. Cool. Serve.

Fill a pot with 2 cups of water. Add tea bags. Boil for about five minutes. Remove from heat. Strain into a large mug with a spoon. Add a splash of evaporated milk to the mug. Add a small slice of ginger to the mug as well. Stir well. Enjoy!

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees. Place the pistachios on a baking sheet and toast until golden brown. In a large bowl, combine the quinoa, lemon juice, and 1/2 cup of water. Cover and let stand for 10 minutes. Stir in the lemon zest and olive oil. Season the tabbouli with salt and pepper. In a medium bowl, toss the parsley and mint in a small amount of olive oil. Stir the parsley mixture into the quinoa and toss well. In a small bowl, combine the toasted pistachios and 2 tablespoons of olive oil. Toss well to coat. Season with salt and pepper. Divide the tabbouli among 4 bowls. Top each portion with the pistachios. Garnish with tomatoes and cucumber. Serve immediately.
Pour club soda into glass over ice cubes. Add sugar, stirring until dissolved. Pour in lime juice and top off glass with lime slices. Garnish with parsley sprig, and serve.

Dissolve the yeast in 1/3 cup of the warm milk. Mix all the dry ingredients together and add the yeast mixture, the eggs, raisins, rum and lemon rind. Let stand for 10 minutes. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease two 9 inch spring form pans. In a large bowl, beat together the cheese, sugar, butter and salt until light and fluffy. Add the sour cream and mix well. Fold the beaten eggs into the mixture one at a time. Divide the cheese batter evenly into the prepared spring form pans. Bake for 20 minutes or until the center is set. Meanwhile, combine the remaining milk and cornstarch. Cook over medium-high heat, stirring constantly until thickened. Remove from the heat and add the lemon juice. Pour the sauce over the cheesecakes while they are still hot. Let cool, then refrigerate overnight before serving.

Brown ground beef. Drain. Add spaghetti sauce. Cook over low heat until well heated. In a greased shallow baking dish, layer pasta, sauce mixture and parmesan cheese. Top with mozzarella cheese. Bake at 375 degrees for about 25 minutes. Sprinkle with chopped parsley before serving. Serves 6.

In a small bowl combine brown sugar, butter, ginger, caraway seed, orange peel, and juice. Microwave until butter is melted and mixture is smooth. Cook carrots in a large pot of boiling water for 2 minutes, or until crisp-tender. Drain and add carrots to glaze mixture. Toss well and transfer carrots to a baking pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 375 for 10 minutes or until glaze is bubbly. Sprinkle with fresh parsley before serving. Makes about 6 servings.

Place salmon in a glass dish. Squeeze the juice of the lemon over the fillets. Sprinkle dill over fish and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt and pepper. Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Cook in a preheated oven at 400 degrees for 10 minutes. Serve with rice.

Place 4 cups of chickpeas in a large bowl. Add 3 tablespoons of salt, cover with water and let stand overnight. The next day, drain the chickpeas. In a large saute pan heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil and 1 tablespoon of balsamic vinegar. Add 3 slices of onion, thinly sliced. Let cook 5 minutes on medium low heat. Add the rosemary. In a separate pan heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil. Saute the chickpeas 2 minutes. Add 1/2 teaspoon of salt and let cook another 3 minutes. Add the cooked onions and rosemary to the chickpeas. Mix well. Serve hot. Serves 2.

In a large bowl, cream together the butter and sugar. Beat in the almond extract. Combine the flour and saltadd to creamed mixture and mix well. Chill for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Place on ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool on wire racks. Roll cooled cookies in confectioners sugar. Store cookies in tightly covered containers.

peel avocados and cut in half around the pit. Scoop into a blender with the broth, lime juice, salt, and garlic cloves. Puree. Season with more salt if desired. Serve with a dollop of heavy cream and garnish with a lemon wedge on the side.

Heat oil in wok or skillet over med-high heat. Add chicken pieces and saute until chicken is lightly browned. Add water, soy sauce and wine and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is cooked through and juices run clear, about 10 minutes. Serve hot.
In a large bowl whisk together eggs, water and salt. Add flour gradually, stirring constantly until smooth. Let rest 20 minutes. Cook 4 minutes or until dumpling float. Makes 4 servings.

Beat together peanut butter, eggs and sugar until blended. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake at 350f for 10 minutes. Let cookies stand on sheet for 1 minute. Remove to wire racks to cool. Makes about 4 dozen.

In a large mixing bowl combine butter and prepared stuffing. Add cheese and meat. Beat eggs and milk and add to stuffing. Season with salt and pepper. Pour into a greased pie plate. Bake at 350 for about 30-35 minutes. Cut into wedges and serve.

Preheat oven to 350f. Place hash browns in a large mixing bowl. Add cheese. Set aside. In a small saucepan over medium heat, cook ham until heated through. Add green onion. Stir until heated through. Add eggs. Stir until blended. Add milk. Stir until blended. Pour mixture over hash browns and cheese. Add pepper and salt to taste. Spread mixture into a lightly greased baking dish. Bake for 45 minutes or until firm and golden. Makes 6 servings.

Cut bologna in half lengthwise. Place one half on each slice of bread. Spread cream cheese onto bologna. Top with black pepper and garlic. Add one baby dill pickle to the center of each sandwich. Top with cheddar cheese. Wrap sandwiches tightly and serve. Makes 12 appetizers.

Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and cook 10 minutes or until tender. Add garliccook 1 minute. Add winebring to a boil. Boil 3 minutes or until almost evaporated. Add broth, beans, thyme, greens, 1/2 teaspoon pepper and 1/4 teaspoon salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to medium. Cover and simmer 20 minutes or until greens are tender. Ladle into bowlssprinkle with Parmesan cheese.

Place all but the buttermilk in a bowl. Whisk well until smooth. Gradually whisk in buttermilk until thickened. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Serve chilled over mixed greens garnished with crumbled feta cheese.

Cut turkey into bite sized pieces. Cut up head lettuce. Add fruit to lettuce, and gently mix together with turkey. Chill until ready to serve. Drain juice from the frozen orange juice concentrate into a bowl or pitcher. Add cranberry sauce to juice and mix together well. Serve salad with cranberry dressing on side.
Beat cream cheese and apple juice until well blended. Add brown sugar and beat well. Stir in pie spice and apple. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Stir in pecans. Serve with crackers or vegetables.

Brown the bacon. When the bacon is ready, remove from the pan with a slotted spoon, leaving the fat behind. In a food processor, grind the speculaas into a coarse powder. Heat the fat in a frying pan and cook the meatballs until they are browned. Add the spice mixture, ketjap manis, sambal bajak, butter and bacon to the meatballs. Turn the heat down a bit and cook for 20 minutes, stirring regularly.

Heat broiler. Cut chicken into serving pieces. Combine remaining ingredients in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken pieces in mixture. Broil 5 inches from heat about 4 minutes per side or until done. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.

In a small frying pan over medium heat, combine the Szechuan peppercorns, 2 teaspoons of the peanut oil and the star anise. When the pan is very hot, add the garlic and cook for 30 seconds. Add the chicken pieces in one layer, sprinkle over the rest of the peanut oil, the sugar, the rice wine, the soy sauce and the ginger. Cover the pan tightly with a lid or foil. Cook for 20 minutes, uncover, turn the chicken pieces over and cook for a further 20 minutes. Remove the chicken pieces from the pan with a slotted spoon, keeping them warm. In the pan, bring the sauce to a simmer. When the sauce is syrupy, stir in the cornflour to thicken. Add the juice of a lime and the chicken pieces. Simmer for a further minute or two, just until the chicken is heated through. Serve immediately with rice or noodles.

Bring a pot of water to a boil. Add the fresh peas and boil until tender, about 1-2 minutes. Drain and run under cold water to stop the cooking process. In a large bowl, mash the butter until fluffy. Add the mint and green onion. Toss in the peas and toss until evenly distributed. Season with salt and serve.
Preheat oven to 400. Combine scallops with olive oil. Place in a pan on a baking sheet. Bake for 4 minutes or until the scallops are opaque. Sprinkle with chives. Serve immediately.

To make the crust: In a food processor, process the brown and granulated sugars and the flour until well combined. Add the butter and process until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the egg and process just until the dough begins to hold together. Pat the dough into a 9-inch pie plate. Bake until lightly browned, 10 minutes. To make the filling: In a large bowl, combine the eggs, milk and vanilla. In a small bowl, combine the brown and granulated sugars and the pecans. Add the pecan mixture and the flour to the egg mixturemix just until blended. Pour the filling over the crust and bake until the filling is set and slightly browned on top, about 30 minutes. Cool on a rack. Serve at room temperature.

Bake bacon until it crisps up. Drain the bacon on a paper towel. Put chestnuts in a large bowl. In a medium bowl mix together all other ingredients. Add bacon to chestnuts. Mix well. Spread bacon-chestnut mixture in a greased 9x13 pan. Bake at 350 degrees F for 15 minutes or until bacon-chestnuts are cooked. Let cool. Cut into small squares.

Cook rice according to package directions. Drain chicken from broth, shredding it into small pieces, and add it back into broth with peas and carrots. Set aside. Heat wok or large skillet over medium-high heat for about one minute. Add oil and swirl around wok until oil is hot and slightly smoking. Add chicken mixture and stir-fry until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are soft. Add rice and continue stir-frying until rice becomes crispy on edges and heated through. Add soy sauce and stir-fry until rice is heated through. Add egg and stir-fry until egg whites are cooked through. Serve warm with chopsticks.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Wash sweet potatoes. Cut in half lengthwise. Place on baking sheet. In small bowl combine chili powder, paprika, garlic powder, cumin, light brown sugar & salt. Rub spice mixture on each half. Drizzle with olive oil and bake for about 45 minutes. Flip the potatoes over and bake for another 15 minutes or until tender. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350f. Stuff each mushroom with about 1 teaspoon of goat cheese. Wrap each mushroom with 2 pieces of sweet pepper. Coat with 1/2 teaspoon of olive oil. Bake for 10 minutes or until mushrooms are tender.

Cook the sausage in a skillet over medium heat until no longer pink. Stir in the beef and cook until no longer pink. Drain the fat. Add the soup and stir until smooth. Stir in the salsa. Spread into an 8 inch square dish. Top with the shredded cheese. Bake in a 350 degree oven for 20 minutes. Serve with corn tortilla chips.

Place chicken in a single layer on a baking sheet. Spray with a nonstick spray coating. In a bowl, combine orange juice and ginger. Brush half of this mixture over chicken and sprinkle with half of the pepper and parsley. Brush remaining orange juice mixture over chicken and sprinkle with remaining pepper and parsley. In a plastic bag or bowl, combine cornflakes and butter. Place chicken in bag or bowl and turn to coat with cornflakes. Place in a single layer on a baking sheet. Bake at 350 for 1 hour or until done.

Slice buns in half horizontally. In small bowl, combine mayonnaise, mustard, Worcestershire sauce, chiles, olives and green onion. Spread bottoms of buns with mixture. Top with ham, cheese, tomatoes and top bun halves. Makes 2 sandwiches.

Combine cream cheese and miracle whip in a bowl. Mix in crabmeat and seafood cocktail sauce. Spoon into a 9x13x2 glass baking dish and bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until melted and bubbly. Top with green peppers and green onions. Serve with crackers and tomatoes.

In a large pot, heat canola oil over medium heat. Add onions, carrots, garlic clove, broccoli and potato. Cook until tender. Pour in chicken stock. Add in fat-free evaporated milk. Season with pepper and salt to taste. Bring to a boil then simmer over low heat for 10 minutes. Serve hot with toasted garlic bread.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Prepare a jelly roll pan or 10x15x1-inch pan with parchment paper. Line the bottom and two sides with parchment. Sift the flour, salt and baking soda into a bowl. Beat the eggs and sugar together in a mixer until pale and thick. Add the brandy. Beat until combined. Add the dry ingredients. Beat at low speed until combined. Beat at medium speed until smooth and thick. Add the cranberries. Beat at medium speed until the batter is smooth and thick. Scrape the batter into the prepared pan. Bake for 40 minutes. Cool completely. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours. To make the sauce, combine the water and sugar in a small saucepan and bring to a boil. Lower the heat and simmer until the sugar syrup is a deep ruby color. Add the cranberries and simmer until the cranberries begin to pop. Remove from heat. Strain into a small bowl. Add the whipping cream and whisk until combined. Spoon the sauce over the

Soak beans overnight in water. Place beans in 4 quarts of fresh water. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat. Simmer for 1 hour. Remove ham bone and bay leaf. Add potato and celery. Simmer until potato is tender. Stir in chopped onions and chopped carrots. Simmer until tender. Season with salt and pepper. Add more water if necessary. Makes 5 to 6 quarts.

Place marshmallows on a plate. Warm milk and vanilla together in a small saucepan over medium heat. In another small saucepan, heat marshmallows until just melted. Dip each marshmallow into melted milk mixture to coat. Lift out of milk and place on wax paper. Let stand until cool. Blend ice cream and yogurt together in blender. Top with toasted marshmallows.

Toss together chicken breasts with yogurt, lemon juice, ginger, garlic and Old Bay. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes or up to overnight. Place chicken breasts onto hot grill. Cook for about 5 minutes per side or until chicken is cooked through. Remove from grill and allow to cool for 5 minutes before slicing.

In a small bowl combine the first 5 ingredients and set aside. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle the snapper on both sides with the salt and pepper. Add the snapper fillets to the skillet and cook until lightly browned. Turn the fish over and add the onion and bell pepper. Cook until tender. Stir the remaining ingredients together in a small bowl. Add to the skillet and cook until the sauce thickens. Serve hot. Serve over rice if desired.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Brown ground beef in a 12-inch cast iron skillet. Stir in corn, beans, tomatoes, rice and taco seasoning until evenly distributed. In a small bowl, combine water and cornstarch until cornstarch is dissolvedstir into mixture. Pour into prepared skillet. Top with cheddar cheese. Bake until cheese is melted. Serve hot.

Peel and cut sweet potatoes into cubes. Place in a 1-quart casserole dish. Add butter and brown sugar. Cover with foil. Bake for 35 minutes at 350 degrees F. Meanwhile, cook and stir milk and cream in a small saucepan over medium heat. Heat until hot. Pour milk mixture over sweet potatoes. Stir in ground cayenne pepper. Bake 10 minutes more at 350 degrees F.

Place chicken breasts in a resealable plastic bag. In a medium bowl combine olive oil, garlic, diced tomatoes (including juices) apricots, golden raisins, 1/8 tsp. of the salt and 1/4 tsp. of the pepper. Pour over chicken. Marinate overnight. Grill or broil for 8-10 minutes per side. Serve with couscous or rice.
In a small saucepan, combine honey, wine, mustard, and cinnamon. Heat until mixture is bubbling. Brush glaze over ham before serving.

In a nonstick skillet over medium heat, heat the butter until melted and then add the pork tenderloin. Brown the pork all over. Transfer the pork to a plate and cover to keep warm. In the same skillet combine the whipping cream and the mango chutney. Simmer for 3 minutes stirring occasionally until thickened. Season with the salt and pepper to taste. Place the pork back into the sauce and simmer for about 2 minutes until heated through. Serve pork over steamed rice and top with green onions.

In the bowl of an electric mixer, beat together the butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Add the egg yolk and vanilla, and mix well. In another bowl combine the flour and baking powder. Beat flour mixture into the sugar mixture until just combined. Stir in the salt. Place the bowl in the fridge to chill while you prepare the candy canes. Break off the tip of each candy cane to make the point. Place the chocolate chips in a plastic baggie and microwave it at 50% power for 1 1/2 minutes. Stir well until the chocolate is melted. Remove the baggie from the microwave and knead the chocolate to combine well with the cane tip. Put the chocolate in the fridge to harden while you make the cookies. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Roll the dough into balls about 1 inch in diameter. Place the balls onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake until the edges are lightly browned, about 10 minutes. Allow

Heat cream cheese in microwave until softened (not melted). Stir in chilies and chicken. Unroll crescent roll dough. Divide evenly into two rectangles. Spread half of the cream cheese mixture on each rectangle. Roll each rectangle into a tight log, sealing the edges. Place rolls on greased cookie sheet. Cut each log into 6 slices and place in greased muffin cups. Bake at 350f for 15 minutes or until golden brown. Sprinkle with buttered chips and serve immediately.

Prepare an ice bath. Peel carrots and cut lengthwise in half. Cut each half lengthwise into 4 wedges. Add carrots and water to large pot. Bring to boil over high heat and cook 5 minutes. Drain and immediately add butter. Stir in salt and chili powder. Place carrots on large platter and sprinkle with parsley.

Combine cream cheese with sour cream and mayonnaise. Place in a serving dish. Top with shrimp. Blend seafood cocktail sauce with mozzarella cheese. Top with vegetables. Chill for 2 hours or overnight. Serve with crackers.

In a large skillet over medium heat cook onion and mushrooms until softened and slightly browned. Stir in pizza sauce and cook 2 minutes more. Spread half of meat mixture on bottom of each hamburger buntop with cheeses and remaining meat mixture.

Bring potatoes to boil in salted water. Boil for 15 minutes or until tender. Cool and slice into bite-size pieces. Mix together mayonnaise and soy sauce. Add potatoes and toss to coat. Add sugar and ginger and mix well. Add peppers and bell pepper. Toss to mix. Refrigerate for at least an hour or overnight. Mix in the chestnuts and scallions just before serving. Serve cold. Serves 6.
Mix first 3 ingredients in a bowl. Spread on a 9x13x2 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes. Cool and cut into bars.

Combine the first four ingredients in a medium bowl. Set aside. Divide the turkey mixture among the tortillas. Top with lettuce. Fold the tortilla over to enclose the filling. Serve immediately. Makes 4 servings.

Soak nuts in water for 2 hours. Drain. In a large bowl mix together soy sauce, cumin and lemon. Add the nuts and toss to coat. Cover and let stand for 4 hours. Drain the nuts again. Rinse the collard greens in a large bowl of cold water. Drain well. Wrap the greens in paper towels. Press to remove as much of the moisture as possible. Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic and stir until fragrant. Add the tomatoes and cilantro. Cook until liquid is reduced by half. Add the greens. Cook until just tender. Season with the cumin. Serve with the nuts on the side.
Boil cabbage with 2 cups of water. Drain. Cool. Combine sugar and vinegar in a bowl. Stir in mustard and pepper. Combine with cabbage and onion. Chill. Just before serving, mix in celery seed.

Mix the chicken, breadcrumbs, egg whites and celery in a large bowl until well combined. Add the chili sauce, pepper sauce and salt. Mix well. Form mixture into 1 inch patties. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Add the patties and cook until golden brown, about 4-5 minutes per side. Serve warm or refrigerate and serve cold. Serves 2.

Slice the bread into squares. Lay out the bread on a baking sheet. In a bowl, combine the eggs, milk, ham, cheese and seasoning. Pour the mixture into the bread squares. Bake for about 25 minutes or until the eggs are set.

Combine water, cornmeal, salt and pepper in a large sauce pan. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon or whisk until mixture thickens to desired consistency. Add cheese. Stir until melted. Remove from heat. Pour into a greased 3-qt. baking dish. Serve hot. Yields 4 servings.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift together the flour, baking soda and cinnamon. Beat together the butter and sugar until creamy, then beat in the golden syrup and water until smooth. Beat in the egg and vanilla until well mixed, then stir in the flour mixture until just combined. Stir in the coconut and dates until just combined. Drop the batter by teaspoonfuls onto baking sheets lined with parchment paper or a Silpat. Bake in the preheated oven until firm and golden brown around the edges, about 12 minutes.

Cut the apples in half horizontally. Remove the core. Sprinkle the apple halves with brown sugar. Fold the pastry in half, brush the edges of the dough with a little butter. Place the apples in the center of the dough. Fold the dough over the apples to form a half moon. Brush the outside of the pastry with butter. Bake in a preheated 400 degree oven for about 45 minutes or until the crust is golden brown. Drizzle the apples with the maple syrup. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Place the pecans into the pie shell. Beat together the honey, sugar, eggs, butter and vanilla extract until smooth. Pour the mixture into the pie shell. Bake for 1 hour in the preheated oven, or until the center is set. Cool and serve.

Grease 2 quart casserole dish with butter. In a large bowl stir together cereal, sugar, cinnamon, and nuts. Set aside. In saucepan melt butter add cereal mixture stirring until melted. Remove from heat add eggs, cream cheese, milk, vanilla, and raisins. Stir until combined. Pour into casserole dish. Bake at 350 for 45 minutes or until golden brown. Let cool 2 hours before serving.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Coat a shallow baking dish with nonstick cooking spray. Place pork chops into dish and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Mix together ketchup, water, vinegar, brown sugar, worcestershire sauce, and cayenne pepperpour over chops. Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour.

Preheat oven to 400f. In shallow bowl, combine cream cheese and milk until smooth. Stir in chicken breasts and sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste. Unroll crescent rollsseparate into 2 rectangles. Spoon cream cheese mixture evenly over each rectangle. Roll up and place in baking pan. Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through.

Brown sausage in a skillet. When browned remove sausage to a plate and pour off the excess grease from the skillet. In a small bowl combine the cheeses and place in a piping bag or zip-loc bag. Pipe the cheese mixture into the center of the wonton wrapper and top each one with a small piece of sausage. Place the wonton wrappers in a muffin pan and top each one with a little bit of ranch dressing. Bake in a pre-heated oven until the wontons are golden brown and the cheese has melted.

Season pork chops with garlic, salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add chops and cook until browned on both sides. Add apple juice, cranberry sauce and applesauce. Reduce heat and simmer for 10 minutes. Serve pork chops with mashed potatoes.

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add the olive oil and saut the onions and garlic until softened and lightly browned. Add the prosciutto and cook for about 2 minutes. Add the plum tomatoes and their juice. Season with salt and pepper. Simmer for about 15 minutes, then add the fresh basil. Serve with hot pasta.
Make batter per directions on box. I use about 2 cups batter to 4 slices bread. Dip both sides and then pan fry each side. Dust with powdered sugar.

In a non-stick frying pan melt the butter. Add the spinach and stir until the leaves begin to wilt. Remove from the heat. In a separate bowl combine the spinach with the eggs, parmesan cheese, nutmeg and seasoning. Preheat the oven to 400 F. Lightly brush a baking sheet with melted butter. Using a pastry brush, brush phyllo pastry sheets with melted butter. Place a sheet of phyllo over a square of parchment paper. Cut into 4 squares. Place 1/4 cup filling in the center of each square. Fold the corners over to form a triangle. Continue folding until a small triangular pastry is formed. Place the pastries on the baking sheet. Brush the tops with melted butter. Bake for 15 to 20 minutes or until golden brown.

In a large bowl combine the peppers, feta cheese and vinegar and toss gently. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Cover and refrigerate for at least one hour. Serve with pita bread or vegetable dippers.

Mix together the orange juice and strawberry gelatin. Chill until firm. Drain fruit and place in bottom of cups. Pour orange gelatin over fruit and chill. Mix the peach gelatin and lemon gelatin. Chill until firm. Add cold water until desired consistency is reached. Pour over fruit and chill. To serve, top with Cool Whip.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add the scallions, garlic, gingerroot, sea salt, peppercorns, chile and cilantro to the pan. Add the shrimpcook for 1 to 2 minutes. Add the winebring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowsimmer for 3 minutes. Transfer to serving plates. Garnish with fresh cilantro. Serve.

Combine sugar and evaporated milk in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil and cook for 5 minutes without stirring. Add the unsalted butter and salt. Continue cooking for 4 minutes. Add the milk chocolate chips and vanilla. Stir well. Pour the mixture into a 9 x 13 inch baking dish lined with wax paper. Sprinkle with marshmallows and nuts. Let cool completely. Cut into squares.

In a large pot of boiling water cook navy beans for 1 1/2 hours. Remove beans from pot and set aside. Add the potatoes and carrots and cook for 30 minutes. Add the onion and cook for 10 minutes. Add the cooked beans and ham. Add enough water to cover. Bring to a boil. Cook until potatoes are tender. Add noodles. Simmer 5 minutes. Ladle into bowls. Top with a dollop of cream. Serve immediately.

Beat together butter and sugar until light and creamy. Beat in egg. Add vanilla. Combine dry ingredientsstir into butter mixture just until blended. Form into small ballsroll in powdered sugar. Chill for several hours or overnight. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt butter. Add seasoning salt and worcestershire sauce. Stir constantly until blended. Add Rice Chex, Wheat Chex and Corn Chex. Pour into a large bowl. Stir until well mixed. Add nutstoss until thoroughly mixed. Spread mixture on waxed papercool. Store in an airtight container. Makes 12 cups.

In a large saucepan, combine beans and water. Cover and cook on high heat for 2-3 hours until beans are tender. Drain and reserve. In a large pot, saute onion, celery and carrots in oil until tender. Add cabbage and saute until wilted. Add tomato juice and tomatoes. Add beans and ham. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 1 hour. Add sausage links and cook for 10 more minutes. Add cooked macaroni and cook for 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Beat together eggs, milk and pepper. Add spinach and mushrooms. In muffin pan, place pie shells. Sprinkle with cheese. Divide filling evenly among shells. Bake 20 minutes or until firm. Serve warm.

Remove seeds and ribs from red bell peppers and discard. Process bell peppers in a food processor or blender until smooth. Add in garlic and olive oil and process until smooth. Transfer mixture to a bowl and mix in salt. Refrigerate overnight or up to a week.

Heat oil in large pan. Add chopped beef, soup mix & flour. Stir until beef is no longer pink. Add water, tomato paste & salt. Bring to boil. Reduce heat to low. Simmer 10 minutes. Add sour cream. Simmer 10 minutes more. Serve over rice or noodles.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a small bowl combine orange juice and sugar. In a large bowl combine apples, cinnamon and orange mixture. Unroll crescent rollsseparate into triangles. Place apple mixture into each triangle. Roll up each triangle and place in ungreased 9x13 baking dish. Sprinkle with butter. Bake at 350 for 20-30 minutes. Serve warm. Enjoy.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease 24 muffin cups or line with paper baking cups.In a large bowl, cream together flour, sugar, baking soda, ground cinnamon, and salt. Set aside.In a smaller bowl, beat together eggs and oil. Stir in vanilla extract and applesauce. Add flour mixture to egg mixture all at oncestir just until blended. Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling about 2/3 full. Bake for 20 minutes in the preheated oven, or until golden.Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.Meanwhile, cut pears into 1/2-inch piecestoss with pecans, lemon juice, and 1/2 cup sugarset aside.Remove muffin tops from pansdiscard paper liners. Place muffin tops bottom-side up on serving plates.Top each with a spoonful of fruit mixturesprinkle with remaining 1 tablespo

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. In a large bowl cream together cream cheese and brown sugar until smooth and well combined. Add eggbeat until combined. Stir together 1/4 cup of the flour with the pecansmix into cheese mixture until well combined. Roll dough into 1-inch balls. Place about 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheet. Flatten balls slightly with a forksprinkle with cranberries. Bake 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Cool on wire racks. Serve with powdered sugar if desired.

Slice Granny Smith apples diagonally about 1/2-inch thick. Spread one side of each slice of bread with butter. Place a slice of cheese on each piece of bread, then top with apple slices. Top with second slice of bread. Grill until golden brown on both sides. Spread apple butter on sandwiches before serving.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add flour, and stir constantly with a whisk until well mixed. Add milk all at oncewhisk constantly until sauce is thickened and smooth. Add salt, pepper, oregano, garlic clove, and simmer for 30 seconds or until flavorings are incorporated into sauce.

Preheat oven to 400F. Cut cauliflower into florets and place in a large bowl. Add anchovies, black olives, capers, red bell pepper, garlic, herbs, and 2 Tbsp. olive oil. Toss well to coat. Place in an ungreased 13x9x2-in. baking dish. Roast for 35-40 minutes or until tender. Stir in remaining 2 Tbsp. oil. Add red wine vinegartoss well. Cool. Arrange on serving platter. Yield: 8 to 10 servings.

Put lime rind and lavender flowers in a small pan and add 1 cup boiling water. Let steep 1 hour. Cut 2 pounds of peaches into thin wedges and add to lime and lavender infusion. Tie the remaining 1 cup lavender flowers in a piece of cheesecloth. Add to fruit along with the lemon juice. Cook over medium heat until fruit is tender and juice is thick. Stir in sugar and pectin. Bring to a boil and cook 1 minute. Remove from heat. Skim off foam. Ladle jam into hot jars and process 5 minutes in a boiling water bath. Remove and let cool. Makes about 6 half pints.

Combine the ketchup, soy sauce, sugar, molasses, and garlic in a slow cooker. Add the ribs and toss to coat. Cover and cook on low for 6 hours. Remove the ribs and place in a shallow dish. Combine the cornstarch and water in a small bowl. Stir and pour the mixture over the ribs. Toss to coat. Return the ribs to the slow cooker and cook on high for 15 minutes. Serve with rice.
Mix all together well in a jar or small bowl with a fork or whisk. Drizzle over sliced plum or heirloom tomatoes as a salad or a side dish.

Toast walnuts on cookie sheet at 400 degrees about 3 minutes or until golden. Pulse garlic and walnuts 10 times or until coarsely chopped in food processor. Pulse until desired consistency is reached. Stir in parmesan cheese, basil and lemon juice. Taste and adjust with salt and pepper.

Place the water in the bread pan of the machineadd the yeast and oilset on the crusty cycle. When cycle is finished, remove the doughknead it lightly in the pan with your handstransfer it to an oiled bowlcover and let rise for 2 hours, or until doubled in bulk. Punch down the dough and roll it out into desired shapelet rise again for 30 minutesbrush with egg whitesprinkle with the salt and the sesame seedbake in a preheated 350 degree F oven for 25 to 30 minutes, or until golden browncool on wire racks.
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl. Add beef and mix well. Place meat in a resealable plastic bag. Seal and place into a shallow baking pan. Refrigerate 4 hours.

In a large skillet heat margarine, add cabbage, onion, and sausage and saute until cabbage is tender but not mushy. Add the sugar and stir until melted. Add the rice and stir until heated through. Serve immediately.

Bring water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Add quinoa. Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until liquid is absorbed. Remove from heat and let stand covered for 5 minutes. Cool completely. In a small bowl combine carrot, parsley, sunflower seeds, garlic and lemon juice. In another small bowl whisk oil and soy sauce. Gently toss quinoa with carrot mixture and drizzle with oil mixture to serve. Serves 1.

In a medium bowl combine mustard and thyme and set aside. Preheat grill to medium-high heat. In a separate bowl combine potatoes and onions with mustard mixture and spray with nonstick cooking spray. Form into 4 equal patties and spray grill with nonstick cooking spray. Grill until potatoes are tender and onions are tender, about 25 minutes, flipping once. Remove from grill and allow to cool slightly. Melt butter in a small saute pan and add garlic, cooking until fragrant and garlic is golden, about 1 minute. Toss with potatoes and onions and season with salt and pepper to taste. Serve hot.

In medium bowl, beat together the cream cheese and butter until smooth. Beat in the sugars and vanilla until well combined. Fold in the chocolate chips and pecans. Cover and refrigerate 1 hour or until firm. Serve with graham crackers.

Heat oven to 350f. In a medium bowl combine beef, milk, egg, cumin, and oregano. Spread in a greased loaf pan or a nonstick loaf pan with a little cooking spray. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until the top is no longer pink and a thermometer reads 165f. To prepare the salsa mix the salsa and tortilla chips in a small bowl until well blended. Cut the meatloaf in half and place salsa in the center of each half. Serve with tortilla chips.

In a saucepan over medium heat, heat the oil and saute the garlic and onion for 2 minutes. Add the beans and the canned vegetables, and simmer for 5 minutes. Stir in the milk and bring back to a simmer. Stir in the parsley and remove from the heat. Serve with the tortilla chips.

Combine first 4 ingredients and add milk slowly. Beat in eggs. Stir in oil and vanilla. Mix well. Pour into lightly greased griddle or frying pan. Cook until golden brown on each side. Makes 5 pancakes.

Melt butter in slow cooker. Stir in rice and cook for 5 minutes. Add milk, eggs, sugar, almond extract and salt. Cook 1 hour. Stir in cherries. Cook 1 hour. Turn off slow cooker. Stir in almond slivers.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Peel acorn squash in half lengthwise and scoop out seeds and pulp with a spoon. Scrub sweet potatoes under running waterpierce with a sharp knife several times. Bake squash and sweet potatoes in shallow baking dish, cut sides down, until fork-tender, about 1 hour. Meanwhile, in large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1 tablespoon oiladd leeks. Cook, stirring occasionally until softened, 3 to 4 minutes. Add chicken thighs and season with salt and fresh ground peppercook until browned on both sides. Remove skillet from heatstir in marmalade, broth, orange juice, hoisin sauce, and maple syrupbring to a boil over high heat. Cook until thickened, 1 to 2 minutes. Transfer squash to 9-inch pie platetop with sweet potatoesevenly spoon chicken mixture over top. Bake until chicken is cooked through and sauce is thickened, 10 to 15 minutes.

In a small bowl combine chocolate chips and milk. Microwave for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently. Remove from microwave and let cool. In a large bowl beat heavy whipping cream until soft peaks form. Add marshmallows and beat until light and fluffy. Fold in chocolate mixture. Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes before serving. Makes 2 cups.

Cream together the first four ingredients until fluffy. Beat in the eggs one at a time. Stir in the flour, salt and baking powder. Stir in the chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls onto an ungreased baking sheet. Bake at 375 for 8-10 minutes or until set. Let cool on wire racks. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

In a small bowl combine honey, mustard, brown sugar, and cornstarch. Stir to combine. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add vegetable oil. Add chicken to hot skillet. Cook 5 minutes. Pour honey mixture over chicken. Stir to coat. Add carrots. Cover tightly. Cook 5 minutes. Stirring occasionally. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with parsley. Serve over rice or noodles.

Bring the water to a boil in a medium saucepan. Stir in the orzo. Cook, uncovered, until tender but firm to the bite, about 10 minutes. Drain.
