While the orzo is cooking, whisk the lemon juice and marjoram in a small bowl. When the pasta is done, add it to the bowl with the marjoram mixture and toss. Add the mustard and toss again. Add the oil and toss once more. Fold in the cheese and the remaining ingredients. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Brown ground beef with onion and green pepper. Add salt and pepper to taste. Stir in refried beans. Spread 1 tablespoon refried beans on each tortilla. Sprinkle 2-3 tablespoons beef mixture on top of the beans. Sprinkle with cheese. Place tortillas on a cookie sheet. Bake at 350 for 10-15 minutes or until crispy. Serve with salsa.

Mix together the flour, flax seeds and baking soda and salt in a large bowl. Beat the sugar and butter in a medium bowl until smooth and light. Add the egg and vanilla. Beat in the peanut butter. Stir the sugar mixture into the flour mixture. Divide into two balls. Wrap each in plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight. Heat oven to 350F. Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and place 2-inches apart on ungreased baking sheets. Bake until the edges are lightly browned and the cookies are set, about 10-12 minutes. Let the cookies stand for a few minutes before transferring them to wire racks to cool completely.

Slice the mango and banana into chunks and place into a food processor with the peanut oil. Puree until smooth. Add the remaining ingredients and puree again until the mixture is smooth. Chill for 2 hours or overnight before serving. Serve chutney with chicken or fish. Makes about 2 cups.

Combine oats, rum extract and water in a medium saucepan. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heat to medium-low and stirring constantly, cook until the oats are tender and the mixture is the consistency of thick oatmeal (about 5 minutes). Stir in the bananas. Serve immediately. Makes 2 servings.

Melt butter over medium heat. Add onion and cook until tender. Add cooked ham and cook for a few minutes. Add medium egg noodles and salt and pepper to taste. Add caraway seed to taste. Cook until noodles are tender. Stir together to combine all the ingredients. Serve hot.

Boil the cabbage for 5 minutes. Drain and set aside. Fry the bacon over medium heat until crispy. When crispy, remove from heat and set aside to cool. In a large skillet over medium heat, melt butter. Add cabbage and cook for 5 minutes. Add bacon and allspice. Cook for 3 minutes. Stir in the milk and stir gently for 2 more minutes. Serve hot. Serves 6-8.

Boil pasta al dente. Add cream cheese and sun-dried tomato vinaigrette dressing and toss together. In a skillet heat oil over medium heat. Add shrimp and cook until no longer pink. Add cherry tomatoes and basil and cook until the tomatoes are soft. Add pine nuts and mix together. Add to pasta and stir. Serve immediately.

Place beans, onions, brisket, paprika and garlic in a slow cooker. Add bay leaf. Pour water over all. Cover and cook on high 2 hours. Remove lid. Add barley. Cook on high 5 more hours. Add potatoes. Cook on high 1 hour. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 400f. Dip bread slices in olive oil and toast lightly in oven. In a large skillet heat oil. Add garlic and shallots. Saut for about a minute. Add red bell peppers. Saut about 3 minutes. Add fresh mushrooms. Saut until mushrooms are cooked. Add herbs. Season with salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Place mushroom mixture on toast. Top with swiss cheese. Broil until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

In a large mixing bowl combine the first five ingredients. Blend well. Add the sour cream. Next add the soup and corn. Stir until well blended. Pour into a lightly greased 2 quart baking dish. Bake at 350° for 30 minutes. In a separate bowl combine the green beans. Pour over the hot corn mixture. Sprinkle the top with the crackers. Bake another 5 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 350. Cream butter and sugar together. Add eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Add lemon juice and lemon essence. In a separate bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. Add to creamed mixture. Stir in lemon slices. Pour into a greased and floured 9x13 pan. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until golden. Cool. Dust lightly with powdered sugar.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease 2 shallow baking pansset aside. Beat together butter and sugar in a large bowl until smooth. Add vanilla and eggmix well. Stir together coconut and flourstir into butter mixture until combined. Pour evenly into prepared pansbake for about 15 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completelycut into small cubes for snacks or use in recipes such as "Coconut Bread".

Preheat oven to 425. Season chicken with salt & pepper. Dredge chicken in flour. Place chicken in a ziploc bag with enough honey dijon mustard to coat. Seal bag. Shake bag until chicken is coated with mustard. Remove from bag. Place chicken on a wire rack in a pan. Spray with vegetable oil. Bake at 425 for 40 minutes. After 40 minutes, brush with remaining mustard. Sprinkle with crumbs. Bake for another 5 minutes. Serve with your favorite side dish.

Heat oil in large skillet over medium heatsauté onion until translucent (about 3 minutes). Add greenssauté 3 minutes or until wilted. Stir in real maple syrup, barbecue sauce and butter. Reduce heat to medium-lowcover and simmer for about 10 minutes or until greens are tender. Stir in salt & pepper. Serve immediately with rice or potatoes.
Brown brats in butteradd cold waterbring to boiladd flourstiradd sour creambring to boiladd saltstirremove from heatadd cheesestirserve hot.

In a small bowl combine mustard, broth, water, juice and cornstarch. Heat to boilingcook 1 minute or until thickened. Brush over pork loin. In a shallow roasting pan, combine apple juice, mustard mixture, and pork. Bake at 350f for 2 1/2 hours. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 450. Spray 13 x 9 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Combine spice mix and season salmon to taste. Coat each salmon fillet with spice mixture. Place potatoes in a single layer in baking dish. Top with salmon fillets. Spray tops of fillets with cooking spray. Sprinkle potatoes with seafood seasoning. Bake for 15 minutes or until salmon is done.

In a small bowl, combine all marinade ingredients. Add beef tenderloins and turn to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 2 hours. Remove beef from marinadediscard marinade. Preheat grill for high heat. Place steaks on grill and cook to desired doneness.

In a medium bowl, combine the red cabbage and carrot. In a small bowl, combine the lime juice, vinegar, salt, chili powder. Pour dressing over cabbage mixture. Toss until coated. Cover and refrigerate for at least 30 minutes. Toss before serving. Serve over rice or noodles.

Heat oil in a 2-quart saucepan over medium-low heat. Cook onion, stirring frequently, for 1 to 2 minutes or until softened. Stir in garlic, cayenne, and greenscook, stirring frequently, for 2 minutes or until greens wilt. Stir in chicken broth. Bring to a boilreduce heat to lowcover and simmer for 10 to 15 minutes or until greens are tender and broth is reduced slightly (about 1/3 cup). Remove from heatstir in vinegar. Transfer to a serving bowlgarnish with chives or parsley. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Melt the butter in a skillet. Add the onions and cook until soft. Add the mushrooms and bacon. Cook until the bacon is crisp and the mushrooms are tender. Add the beaten eggs and stir until well mixed. Cook until the eggs are set. Season with salt and pepper. Serve on hot toast or rolls.

Preheat oven to 400f. In a large bowl toss together the beans and blue cheese crumbles. In a small bowl whisk together the vinegar, oil, pepper and salt. Pour dressing over bean mixture and toss well. Arrange beans and blue cheese mixture in a single layer on a baking sheet coated with cooking spray and bake at 400f for 30 minutes. Serve at room temperature. Garnish with the onion and pecans.

Line a 9 x 13 baking dish with foil or waxed paper. Spray with cooking spray. Melt chocolate in double boiler. Stir in sweetened condensed milk. Spread chocolate mixture into prepared baking dish. Refrigerate until firm. Melt chocolate again. Stir in maraschino cherry juice. Pour over chocolate layer. Stir in maraschino cherries. Sprinkle with pecans. Refrigerate until firm. Unmold. Cut into squares. Makes about 36.

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Cook pasta until al dentedrain and set aside. Heat oil in large skillet over medium high heat. Add broccoli and snap peascook and stir until crisp-tender, about 2 minutes. Add zucchini and cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in cream cheese and milk until smooth. Stir in cooked pasta and basilsprinkle with parmesan cheese. Toss to coat. Sprinkle with lemon juice and serve.

Heat oven to 375f. Spray a 9×13″ baking pan with cooking spray. In a large mixing bowl, combine cornmeal and 1 cup buttermilk. Set aside.In a separate large mixing bowl, combine remaining buttermilk, oil, sugar and eggs. Add cornmeal mixture and beat until well blended.Add remaining ingredients and stir well. Pour batter into pan and bake for 30 minutes or until golden brown and firm to touch. Serve warm with butter and honey or syrup if desired.

Pour 2 quarts water into saucepan and add the cinnamon sticks. Bring the water to boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Add the honey and the vanilla extract. Pour the hot mixture into a large pitcher. Add the 4 cups apple juice and the sliced apples. Stir. Cool. Serve with 3 cups sparkling water.

Preheat a grill pan over medium heat. Slice beef and saute in a pan with a small amount of oil for 5 minutes. Saute the onions and bell peppers for 2 minutes. Add the salsa and cook for 5 minutes. When the beef is done add the salsa mixture to the beef. In the meantime heat the hoagie buns in the microwave. Spread the mixture evenly on the hoagie buns and top with cheese. Broil for 1 minute. Serve hot.

In a large skillet heat butter over medium heat and add onion and garlic and sautee until soft and golden brown. Add the sliced mushrooms and sautee for a few more minutes. Add the nutmeg and stir. Add the beef bouillon cube and stir. Add the beef broth and let simmer until the liquid has reduced by half and the mushrooms have begun to soften and darken. Add the sour cream and mix thoroughly. Add the fresh ground black pepper and kosher salt to taste and serve over toast or noodles or rice.

Grease a 9-by-13-inch baking pan. Line bottom and sides with wax paper. Set aside. In a large heavy saucepan over medium heat, melt together the chocolate chips and peanut butter. Stir in the butterscotch chips. Pour into prepared pan. Refrigerate for 1 hour. Lift out of pan by lifting the wax paper. Cut into squares. Makes about 3 dozen.

Preheat oven to 375 F. Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in large nonstick skillet over medium heat. Cook onion and garlic 5 minutes. Add rice and cook 2 minutes more. Remove from heat. Stir in curry powder and salt and pepper. Stir in spinach and lentils. Transfer to greased 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Bake 20 to 25 minutes. Stir coconut milk into mixture. Bake 15 to 20 minutes more. Serve.
Cut the avocados into cubes. Combine avocados with green chili's, onion powder, garlic powder, lemon juice, and mayonnaise. Mix well. Serve with roma tomato slices.

Heat the oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add onions and saute until translucent. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the rice and simmer until tender about 10 minutes. Add the green beans and cook 3 minutes more. Season to taste with the pepper. Divide the rice mixture among four shallow bowls. Top each with a few tuna cubes. Sprinkle with basil leaves and cherry tomatoes. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a cookie sheet with foil, and place baguette slices on it. Bake for 4 minutes or until toasted. Rub toasted sides with garlic clove. Lay lettuce on toasted side of baguette slices. Top with tomato slices, bacon bits, pesto sauce, basil leaves, and drizzle with olive oil. Serve warm or at room temperature.

Mix sour cream and garlic powder in small bowl until blendedset aside. Season both sides of steaks generously with salt. Grill or broil steaks over medium-high heat (about 1 minute per side for medium-rare). Top each steak with sour cream mixture and sprinkle with blue cheese. Serves 2.
Cream cheese, ham, cheddar cheese, spring onions, black pepper, macadamia nuts.

Heat oil in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook 5 minutes or until soft. Add jalapeno pepper, cook 2 minutes or until soft. Add rice to pan and cook 2 minutes. Add red beans, coconut milk, broth and thyme. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Cover pot or Dutch oven, reduce heat to medium-low. Cook 20 minutes or until liquid is almost evaporated. Add salt and pepper to taste. Fluff rice with a fork. Serve.
Combine all ingredients and mash thoroughly. Let stand for 1 hour at room temperature before serving.

Preheat oven to 180 degrees c. Season chicken fillets with salt and pepper and place in a shallow dish. Beat egg with water in a small bowl and brush over chicken fillets. Thread 3 bacon pieces onto each skewer and place on top of chicken fillets. Arrange cherry tomatoes and capsicum around chicken fillets. Roast for 1 hour or until chicken fillets are cooked through. Serve with roasted potatoes.

In a bowl, combine the sour cream, milk and eggs. Season with salt and pepper. Add the green onion and cheese. Heat an oven-safe skillet over medium heat. Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in the pan. Add 2 tablespoons of the egg mixture. Cook until the bottom is browned and set, about 3 minutes. Flip the omelet over and top with the remaining tablespoon of butter and the remaining egg mixture. Cook 1 minute more. Place the skillet under the broiler and broil until the top is browned and the cheese is melted. Remove the skillet from the broiler and keep the omelet warm. Repeat with the remaining 2 tablespoons of butter and egg mixture. Serve with the remaining sour cream.

Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heatadd the chops and sprinkle with black pepper and crushed red pepper flakes. Brown the pork on both sides. Remove the pork from the skilletadd the garlic to the skillet and cook for 1 minute. Stir the garlic into the tomato mixtureadd the pork and spaghetti to the tomato mixture and toss to coat. Serve pork chops over pastasprinkle with parsley if desired.

Combine flour and salt. Cut in shortening and butter until mixture is crumbly. Add 1-2 tablespoons of ice water and blend in food processor until mixture holds together. Press into 9 inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown. Makes 1 pie.

Heat olive oil in saute pan over medium heat. Add onion, sweet potato and garlic cloves. Saute until sweet potatoes are tender. Sprinkle with cumin and chili. Remove from heat. Roll up into tortilla and top with sour cream, cheese and cilantro. Grill or heat in microwave.

Soak beans overnight. Wash beans in colander. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a large non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 2-3 minutes. Stir in remaining oil and brown beans in skillet for about 10 minutes. Stir in brown sugar, molasses, mustard, yogurt, salt and black pepper. Remove from heat and serve hot with cooked rice or cornbread.

Slice vegetables and mushrooms into small pieces. Add in Italian Dressing and mix well. Place vegetables and mushrooms onto skewer. Cook over medium heat for approximately 10 minutes or until vegetables are slightly tender.

Peel potatoes and dice them into small pieces. Place potatoes in a pan of cold water and bring to a boil. Simmer potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes in a colander. Mash potatoes until smooth. Beat egg in a bowl. Add flour, milk, sugar, salt, white pepper, and butter to the potatoes. Mix well until batter is smooth. Heat a lightly greased griddle over medium heat. Drop batter by the tablespoonful onto griddle. Brown on both sides. Serve hot.

Preheat the oven to 450f. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, italian seasoning, parsley flakes and onion powder. Add garlic powder and kosher salt and black pepper. In a second large bowl toss together oil and potatoes. Spray a baking sheet with olive oil flavored spray. Spread potatoes in a single layer on pan. Roast for 30-40 minutes or until potatoes are tender and golden. Sprinkle with fresh parmesan cheese.

Cut tortillas into pieces. Add chicken, cream of mushroom soup, cream of chicken soup, and chicken broth. Mix well. Spread mixture into a baking dish. Top with cheddar cheese and green chilies. Bake at 375 degrees for about 30 minutes.

Combine all ingredients in a sauce pan. Bring to a simmer over medium heat for about 5 minutes or until thickened. Let cool for a few minutes then pour into airtight containers or bottles. Yields 1 cup

Preheat oven to 375F. In a small bowl, combine the first 7 ingredients. Rinse chickenpat dry with paper towels. Sprinkle with the cornstarchturn to coat. Dip in the pineapple juice mixture. Place in a single layer in a shallow 13x9x2 inch baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake for 45 minutes or until a thermometer reads 160F. Sprinkle with the almonds. Yield: 4 servings.

Cook sausage in large skillet over medium-low heat until brown. Drain and crumble into bowl. Stir in sauerkraut and onion. In another bowl combine the soup and sour cream until well blended. Add the sausage mixture and stir well to combine. Spoon into 1-1/2-qt. casserole sprayed with cooking spray. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until bubbly. Sprinkle with cheese and bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese melts. Serve with hot crusty rolls. Makes 6 servings.

Peel and cut bananas lengthwise. In large saucepan combine bananas and lemon juice. Bring to boil over medium heat and boil for 1 minute. Remove from heat and stir in butter. Let mixture cool to room temperature. Place phyllo pastry on parchment paper and cover with plastic wrap to prevent drying out. Lay out one phyllo sheet and brush with butter. Place 2 tablespoons banana mixture at one end of phyllo sheet and roll to one corner and seal with brush of butter. Repeat until all phyllo sheets are used and banana mixture is gone. Brush all 4 corners of rolls with butter and place on greased baking sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 12 to 15 minutes until golden brown. Meanwhile melt hot fudge and caramel candies in saucepan over low heat. Drizzle warm caramel over baked rolls and top with powdered sugar and caramel candies.

Heat oven to 350 degrees. Melt butter in a large skillet. Add squash, onions and garlic. Cook over medium heat 5 to 6 minutes. Add water. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat. Cover. Cook for 15 minutes. Add pecans. Cook, covered 3 minutes. Stir in vanilla, brown sugar and parsley. Season to taste with salt and pepper. Serve.

Combine eggs, milk, flour and salt. Heat butter in skillet or frying pan on medium-high heat. Pour a small amount of batter into skillet or pan. Let cook for a few seconds then flip over and let cook for a few seconds on other side. Remove from skillet or pan and let cool for a few minutes. Repeat until all of batter is gone.

Peel 2 medium onions. Cut into large chunks. Chop 2 large red bell peppers. Peel 2 large cucumbers. Cut into large chunks. Combine all. In a large saucepan bring vinegar to a boil. Add sugar, ginger, turmeric, celery seed. Stir until sugar is dissolved. Pour over vegetables. Let stand for 1 hour. Add flour to a small saucepan. Stir over medium heat. Stir constantly until smooth. Add to vegetable mixture. Let stand for 1 hour. Stir. Refrigerate. Serve chilled. Makes 6 cups.

Defrost puff pastry according to package instructions. Lay pastry on a baking sheet. In a bowl combine spinach, feta, eggs, and sun-dried tomatoes. Spread over half of the pastry. Fold other half over filling. Using a fork pierce top in several places to release steam. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until puff pastry is golden brown. Serve with a side of cranberry sauce.

Combine first 4 ingredients in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer for 5 minutes or until sugar is dissolved. Let cool completely. Stir in vanilla. Strain through a fine sieve into a glass measuring cup. Use as needed to sweeten coffee or tea. Can also be used to make pancakes or waffles. Makes 1 cup syrup.

Line a 9-inch pie plate with crust made with 1 cup all-purpose flour and 3/4 cup cold margarine (or shortening). Bake for 10 minutes or until edges begin to turn golden brown. Remove from oven and let cool while you prepare the filling. Combine margarine and cocoa in a large mixing bowlbeat well with an electric mixer until well blended. Add sugar and eggsbeat until well combined. Add vanillabeat until blended. Stir together flour, baking powder and saltadd to margarine mixture and beat until well blended. Stir in walnuts. Pour into the cooled pie plate and bake for 30 minutes or until filling is set. Cool completely before cutting and serving.
Steep tea bags for 5 minutes in boiling water. Remove bags. Add apple juice, allspice and honey to tea. Add ice cubes and lemon slice. Serve.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Place hens in a shallow baking dish. In a food processor or blender puree the apple, onion and butter. Sprinkle the mixture over the hens. Cover the hens with the soy sauce. Bake for 1 hour, basting several times.

Mix powdered sugar with powdered egg whites. Add warm water and food coloring. Pipe icing with a piping bag or a zip top bag with a corner cut out. Use a spoon to swirl around to get a swirl effect. Decorate with sprinkles.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Place hot dogs on baking sheet, cut length wise on the diagonal, place cut side up on the baking sheet. Bake until the hot dogs are heated through and the bread is browned 12-15 minutes. Serve with mustard, cheese and pepper on the bun.

Remove seeds and membranes from jalapenos and dried chilies. In a food processor combine tomatoes, onion, jalapenos, cilantro, chilies and lime juice. Pulse until desired texture. Add lime zest. With processor running add olive oil. Season with salt and hot sauce. Chill in refrigerator.

In a bowl, combine shrimp and next 5 ingredients. Cover and refrigerate 4 hours. Drain shrimp, reserving marinade. Heat a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray over medium-high heat. Add 1/4 cup marinade and shrimp. Cook 2 minutes per side or until shrimp are opaque. Discard remaining marinade. Sprinkle with green onions. Serve with rice.

In saucepan mix sugar and light brown sugar together over medium heat until sugar dissolves. Add cocoa and stir until smooth. Bring to a boil then add cream and butter stirring constantly. Cook for 3 minutes until mixture thickens and is smooth. Stir in vanilla and pecans. Drop by teaspoonful on wax paper or foil. Let cool untill set and harden. Store in air tight container.
Place all ingredients in blender and puree until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve immediately.

Cream together sugar and butter. Add egg and milk. Stir in oatmeal. Sift together flour, baking powder and soda. Add to creamed mixture. Mix well. Chill for 2 hours. Roll into balls. Roll in sugar. Bake at 350 degrees for 10 minutes.

In a large bowl combine all the dry ingredients. Add the egg and butter and beat until smooth. Fold in the coconut, oatmeal, bananas and vanilla. Fill each paper lined or greased muffin cup 2/3 full with the batter. Bake for 20-25 minutes in preheated oven or until lightly browned and a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes in pan before removing to wire racks to cool completely.

Peel carrots and parsnips and cut into 1/4 inch pieces. In large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add carrots and parsnips and cook, stirring occasionally for about 20 minutes. Add 1/2 cup water. Cook until carrots are tender. Remove from heat. In food processor, puree vegetables in batches until smooth. Transfer puree to bowl. Whisk in nutmeg and season with salt and pepper. Serve hot as a side dish.
In a highball glass, add ice cubes. Pour in the schnapps, vodka, soda, and lime wedge. Stir and enjoy!

Cut broccoli into florets and steam until tender-crisp. Melt butter in small saucepan. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute. Add lemon juice and cook 1 minute more. Add broccoli and toss. Season with salt and pepper. Sprinkle with almonds. Serve warm.

Heat oil in a large pot or deep frying pan over medium-high heat until hot. Add garlic and cook and stir until garlic is lightly golden, 2 to 3 minutes. Add chili and cook and stir until fragrant, about 20 seconds. Add crabmeat and cook and stir until crabmeat is heated through, about 2 minutes. Add pasta and cook and stir until pasta is tender yet firm to the bite. Add parsley and stir until parsley is wilted and incorporated into pasta, about 2 minutes. Season with black pepper and sea salt. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Cream margarine and cake mix. Add egg. Beat until well blended. Stir in coconut and nuts. Drop by rounded spoonful onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes. Cool on wire rack. Dip in frosting. Makes 4 dozen.

Mix breadcrumbs with parmesan cheese in a shallow bowl. Season with sage, salt and pepper. Heat oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Dip each cutlet in egg then in breadcrumb mixture to coat thoroughly. Cook in hot oil until golden brown, turning once, about 3 minutes per side. Serve with lemon wedges for squeezing over cutlets.

Cook potatoes in boiling water for 5 to 7 minutes or until tender. Draincool slightly. Peel chickenremove meat and cut into 1/2-inch pieces. Combine chicken with potatoes and green beans in a large bowltoss to coat. Add mayonnaise, yogurt, milk, dill weed, and salt and pepper to taste. Chill overnight for best flavor.
Brown pork in skillet with diced onion. Drain fat. Add tomato sauce. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer covered 10 minutes. Add cooked pasta. Sprinkle with grated cheddar cheese.

Cube the steaks and cut the broccoli into florets. Slice the garlic. In a large skillet heat the oil and stir-fry the garlic and ginger until aromatic. Add the steaks and cook for a couple of minutes. Add the broccoli and stir-fry. Add the soy sauce and vinegar. Stir-fry for a few more minutes. Dust the steaks with the flour and stir-fry until the gravy thickens. Serve over rice.

Prepare pasta as directed on box, but use only 1/2 of the cooking water. Let cool. Combine pineapple with lemon juice and refrigerate for 24 hours. In a large bowl, beat eggs with flour, salt and sugar. Stir in pasta, 2 cups of fruit, and cooled pineapple mixture. Pour into a 13 x 9-inch pan. Bake at 350 for 25 minutes. Refrigerate 4 hours or overnight. Just before serving, fold in Cool Whip. Top with fruit cocktail and marshmallows. Serves 10-12.

In a bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a separate bowl, combine the flour, cinnamon, baking powder, and saltadd to creamed mixture alternately with milk. Fold in pecans. Pour batter into a greased 9x5x3-inch loaf pan. Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes or until a pick inserted near the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack to cool completely. Serve with whipped cream.
Puree all ingredients in blender. Add ice to thin out. Serve in glasses with a dollop of whipped topping and a mint garnish.

Sift the flour with the baking powder and salt. Cut in the butter until it resembles coarse crumbs. Combine the cream cheese and milk in a small bowl. Stir in the vanilla extract. Add the milk mixture and mix just to combine. On a lightly floured surface roll the dough into a 1-inch thick circle. Using a floured 2 1/2-inch biscuit cutter cut the dough into rounds. Place the scones 1 inch apart on the baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until they are lightly browned. Remove the scones and cool them on wire racks. Sprinkle the scones with confectioners sugar or drizzle them with icing. Serve them warm or at room temperature.

In a large bowl combine margarine and sugar and cream together. Add egg and vanilla and blend well. Add flour and combine thoroughly. Using a teaspoon measure out the dough and press into small balls and place on an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for approximately 8-10 minutes or until golden brown. Makes about 36 cookies.

Preheat oven to 450 degrees. In medium bowl, combine Bisquick and eggs. Stir in vegetable oil. Add onion and saute until tender. Stir in spinach and cook until wilted. Stir in garlic. Spread mixture in ungreased 12 inch pizza pan. Sprinkle with 1/2 of parmesan cheese and 1/2 of oregano. Top with 1/2 of breadcrumbs. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until crust is golden. Cool slightly. Garnish with remaining parmesan cheese and oregano. Serve immediately.

Cut up the cabbage and celery, cut the green peppers in half lengthwise and remove the seeds and membrane. Cut the onion in quarters. Heat the oil in a large skillet. Add cabbage, celery and green peppers. Stir-fry for 2 to 3 minutes. Add the onion. Stir-fry for 2 more minutes. Add the water and salt and pepper and cover. Cook for 15 to 20 minutes. Serve with a slice of bread.

In a skillet over medium heat, combine the sausage links and pineapple tidbits. Cook and stir until sausage links are done. Add brown sugar and cinnamon and mix well. Stir in banana slices. Cook for a few more minutes or until the banana slices are heated through. Serve warm.

In a large bowl combine the milk, sesame seeds & breadcrumbs. In another bowl combine the egg white & ground cayenne pepper & salt & freshly ground black pepper. Dip each wing in the egg white mixture & then into the sesame seed & breadcrumb mixture. Place in a large skillet. Drizzle the wings w/ 1-2 tbsp. olive oil & cook for 5-7 minutes. Turn the wings & cook for an additional 5-7 minutes or until the wings are golden brown. Remove from the skillet & set aside. Serve immediately.

Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion, pepper and garliccook until softened, stirring occasionally, about 4-5 minutes. Stir in chili powder and cumincook 1 minute longer, stirring constantly. Stir in chili sauce and 1 1/2 cups watercook 2 minutes more. Stir in chickencook 1 minute longer. Spoon 1/4 cup chicken mixture down center of each tortillatop with 1/4 cup cheese and 1 eggroll up tightly. Transfer to a 9 x 13-inch baking dish coated with cooking spraytop with remaining chicken mixture and remaining 1 1/2 cups cheese. Bake at 350 for 20 minutes or until heated through and top is golden brown. Garnish with lettuce and tomato, if desired. Serve with sour cream, if desired. Makes 12 servings.

Melt chocolate in a double boiler over simmering water. Remove from heat and stir in condensed milk and almond liqueur. Stir until smooth. Refrigerate until cooled. Put almonds in a food processor and grind until fine. Stir into the cooled chocolate mixture. Line a jelly roll pan with parchment paper. With a teaspoon measure out mixture and place on parchment paper. Sprinkle almonds on top of each truffle. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour or until firm. Store in a tightly closed container in the refrigerator.
Combine all ingredients in a food processor and process until smooth. Store in an airtight container in refrigerator. Will keep for up to 1 month. Makes about 2 cups.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or wide saute pan over medium-high heat. Add the garlic and saute for about a minute or until the garlic is fragrant and lightly browned. Add the pine nuts and cook for another minute or until the pine nuts are lightly browned and fragrant. Add the spinach and saute until it wilts about 5 minutes. Stir in the almonds and ham and cook until the ham is heated through about 2 minutes longer. Season with salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

Sauté leek and garlic in 1 tablespoon butter until softened, about 5 minutes. Add curry powder, ginger, salt, and peppercook 1 minute longer. Stir in 1 cup waterbring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Stir in peas, carrot, celery, milk and remaining 2 tablespoons butterheat through. Serve sprinkled with toasted almonds if desired.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan over a moderate heat. Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute. Stir in the cherry tomatoes and cook for 4 minutes. Stir in the basil, oregano, vinegar, salt and pepper. Cook for another 2 minutes. Serve scattered with feta cheese, olives and a sprinkling of parsley.
Place potatoes in large pot. Cover with cold water. Add salt. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and cook for 20 minutes or until tender. Drain. Melt butter in skillet. Add potatoes. Toss well. Serve warm.

In a skillet saute onions in butter until tender. Stir in green peppers and tomato saucecook for 2 minutes. Stir in beans and seasoning, bring to a boilreduce heat. Cook for 15 minutes. Serve on corn chips. Top with sliced hot dogs and cheese. Makes 2 servings.

Put together 8 squares of the graham cracker. Melt the butter in a microwave safe bowl and place the graham crackers into the melted butter. Tear the graham crackers into bite size pieces and put into a 9 x 13 pan. Layer the pudding on top of the graham crackers. Spoon the peanut butter on top of the pudding. Refrigerate for 2 hours. Slice into bars and eat or store in an airtight container for up to 2 weeks.

In a large bowl, cream butter, honey, brown sugar and corn syrup together until well blended. Stir in oats, raisins, and peanuts. Spread mixture into a well greased 9x13x2 inch baking pan. Bake at 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) for 30 minutes or until the mixture is set. Cut into bars while warm. Store in an airtight container. Makes 20 bars.

Prepare the cauliflower by rinsing it under cold water. Remove any wilted or discolored leaves. Cut the cauliflower into florets. In a medium bowl toss the cauliflower florets with the olive oil. Spread the florets onto a rimmed baking sheet and sprinkle with the black pepper and salt. Roast the cauliflower in the oven for about 10 minutes, stirring the cauliflower half way through cooking. While the cauliflower is roasting, prepare the cheese sauce. Melt the butter in a small saucepan. Add the flour and cook over low heat, stirring constantly, for 1-2 minutes. Slowly add the milk and continue stirring. Season with the salt and black pepper. Continue cooking over low heat, stirring constantly until the sauce is thickened. Add the gruyere cheese and stir until it is melted. Add the roasted cauliflower and mix together. Serve warm.

Heat oven to 425 degrees f. Place biscuits on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 15 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly. Combine sugar and butter. Spread over warm biscuits. Cool. Place berries over biscuits. Top with cool whip. Place in freezer. Take out 30 minutes before serving.

Melt butter in saucepan over medium heat. Add carrots and sugar, stirring to combine. Add salt to taste, and stir in wine. Cover, and cook over medium heat for about 40 minutes or until carrots are tender and liquid is syrupy. Serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients together in food processor. Serve with crackers or baguette slices. Makes about 2 cups.

Mix beef, onion, and pepper together with seasonings (salt & pepper). Spread mixture evenly over bottom of 9x13 inch pan. Mix can of cream of chicken soup with 1 can of milk. Pour over beef mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with shredded cheese and bake for 10 minutes more. Serve over cooked rice.

Mix soy sauce, light maple syrup, and sesame oil in a bowl. Pour mixture over salmon steaks in shallow dishturn salmon to coat. Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour or up to 24 hours. Remove salmon from marinadereserve marinade. Thread salmon onto skewersbrush with marinade. Grill or broil 8 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork. Garnish with green onions. Serve with rice.

Bring water and wontons to a boil in a large saucepan over high heatreduce heat to low, cover and cook until wontons are tender and floating, about 15 minutes. Strain wontons and return to saucepan with chicken broth and gingerrootbring to a boil. Add mushrooms and green onionsreduce heat to medium and cook until vegetables are crisp-tender and mushrooms are softened, about 2 minutes. Serve hot.
Dredge pork chops in flour. Brown chops in butter. Add honey, vinegar, and pecans. Cook until honey is bubbly.

Prepare cake mix according to package instructions. Grease and flour one 9x13-inch baking dish. Pour cake batter into prepared baking dish. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes. Cool completely before frosting. To make frosting, beat butter at medium speed with an electric mixer until light and fluffy. Gradually add sour cream and powdered sugar, beating until well blended. Stir in vanilla. Spread frosting on top of cake.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper. In a small bowl, combine shallots, light butter, and vinegar. Cook until shallots are soft, about 2 minutes. Add asparagus to the bowl and toss to coat. Season to taste with salt and black pepper. Spray asparagus evenly with cooking spray. Bake on baking sheet until spears are crisp-tender but still bright green.

In a bowl, combine the eggs and seasonings. Whisk until well blended. Heat the olive oil in a 10-inch cast-iron skillet over medium heat. When the oil is hot, add the hash browns and cook until well browned and crisp. Using a slotted spoon, transfer the hash browns to a plate. In the same skillet, pour the egg mixture and spread out evenly. Sprinkle the hash browns and cheese evenly over the eggs. Sprinkle with the green onions. Place the skillet in the preheated oven and bake for 10 to 12 minutes, or until the center is set and the eggs are cooked through. Cut the frittata into wedges and serve immediately.

Make jello according to package directions using 3/4 cup cold water instead of the boiling water. Mix in the cool whip when the jello is completely set. Refrigerate until ready to serve. Blend 3 cups ice cubes and 1/2 cup cold water in a blender. Pour the ice water mixture into glasses and add a scoop of the jello smoothie. Garnish with a cherry if desired.

Peel avocadoes and remove pits. Mash avocadoes in a bowl with the rest of the ingredients. If the mixture is too thick add a splash of water. I love avocados and this is the best guacamole i ve ever made. It s also much better than store bought. I can t wait to try some of the other recipes you have on here. Thanks for sharing.

Soak the lentils in water overnight or for about 8 hours. Rinse them and drain. In a large pot or deep skillet heat oil. Add hot red chili pepper and ginger and saute for 2 minutes. Add lentils and water and boil until lentils are soft. Stir in spinach and cook until spinach wilts. Stir in coriander and season with salt and black pepper to taste. Serve hot with plain rice.

Soak beans overnight in plenty of cold water. Drain beans and place in a large pot with cold water to cover by 2 inches. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low, cover, and simmer for 1 1/2 hours, or until beans are tender. Drain beans, reserving the liquid. Chop tomatoes, parsley, onion, and cucumber. Toss vegetables with beans. In a medium bowl, mix beans and vegetables with oregano. In a small bowl, whisk olive oil into vinegar. Pour dressing over bean mixture. Season with salt and pepper. Garnish with eggs.
Mix all together well and form into balls. Fry until brown on each side. Serve on a bed of lettuce or cabbage.

In a large bowl, combine the bok choy with the salt and stir well. Heat the oil in a wok or large frying pan over high heat. Add the garlic, ginger and chili and stir-fry for 20 seconds. Add the bok choy and toss well. Add the light soy sauce, fish sauce and stir well. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees fahrenheit. In a mixing bowl toss the tomatoes with the vinegar, basil, garlic, and pepper and a pinch of salt substitute until well combined. Add the olive oil and toss to coat the tomatoes well. Spread the tomatoes evenly onto a baking sheet and place the pan in the oven for 45 minutes or until the tomatoes are softened and lightly browned around the edges. Serve warm or room temperature.

Preheat grill to medium heat. Put yogurt in a small bowl with the mint and garlicmix well. Put the chicken breasts in a plastic bag and pound them with a mallet to flatten them out (you can skip this step if you like the breast thick). Toss the breasts in the yogurt mixture and put them in a plastic bag. Shake the bag a few times to coat the chicken with the yogurt mixture. Put the chicken breasts directly on the grill and grill for about three minutes per side or until they are cooked through. Serve with a greek salad and the sauce from the bag.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. In large bowl combine flour, baking soda and table salt. In small bowl combine butter, brown sugar and sugar. Beat until creamy. Beat in cocoa. Add egg whites and beat until well mixed. Gradually add flour mixture until blended. Stir in miniature chocolate chips. Drop dough by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 inches apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake 10-12 minutes. Cool on baking sheets 1 minute. Remove to wire rack. Cool completely. Store in tightly covered container. Yields about 1 dozen.

Heat 1 teaspoon oil in a small skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until just softened, about 3 minutes. Add garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Cool slightly then process in blender or food processor until smooth. Add chipotle chile in adobo, lime zest and 3/4 teaspoon salt and pulse until well combined. Pour into a large bowl and stir in remaining 2 tablespoons oil, cumin and coriander. Add steaks and turn to coat evenly with marinade. Cover and let marinate at room temperature for 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.

In a small bowl place dried mixed fruit with 125 ml boiling water and leave to soak for 20 minutes or until the fruit has absorbed some of the water. Put flour and sugar in a large bowl and add soaked fruit. Add tea and brandy and stir well. Add eggs and mixed spice and mix well with a wooden spoon until you have a soft dough. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead lightly for about one minute until smooth and elastic. Form into a ball and place on a floured surface, cover with a tea towel and leave to rest for about half an hour or until doubled in size. Turn out onto lightly floured surface and roll into a rectangle about 30cm x 25cm. Cut into six rectangles and place in a greased and base lined 30cm square cake tin. Brush with brandy and bake for about one hour or until golden brown and well risen. Remove from oven and leave to cool in tin for about 5 minutes, then turn onto wire rack to cool completely. When cold cut into 6 even squares and serve with butter or

Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Melt butter. Saute shallots and red bell peppers for 3-4 minutes or until tender-crisp. Add garlic powder and season with salt & pepper. Toss with beans and serve immediately.

In a large sauce pan, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the onion and cook, stirring occasionally, until it is soft and translucent, 5 to 7 minutes. Add the carrot and celery and cook, stirring occasionally, until the vegetables are soft and slightly tender. Add the lentils and the bay leaf. Add the water or broth and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low and simmer, covered, for 25 minutes. Add the mushrooms and the herbs. Simmer for another 10 minutes or so. Taste and adjust the seasonings with salt and pepper. Serve with crusty bread.
Melt the butter in a skillet. Add apples and brown sugar. Cook over low heat, stirring often, 15 minutes or so. Add the cinnamon and water. Cook for another 5 minutes. Serve as a condiment.

Bring large pot of salted water to boil. Add linguine and cook until al dente but still firm to bite (8 to 9 minutes). Drain. Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant (about 30 seconds). Add plum tomatoes and cook until sauce is reduced to a thick paste (about 5 minutes). Stir in cooked linguine and spinach and toss to combine. Serve immediately. Serves 2 to 3.

Peel and slice tomatoes into quarters. Remove and discard seeds. In a medium bowl combine tuna with mayonnaise and celery, capers, parsley and basil. Divide mixture evenly among the tomatoes. Garnish with additional parsley. Serve immediately or chill.

Peel and core apples and cut into small cubes. Combine lemon juice and zest with maple syrup in a large bowl. Add apples and mix well. Cover and refrigerate for 1 hour. Combine dates and lemon balm in a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Add to apples and mix well. Line mousse cups with plastic wrap. Spoon mousse into cups and refrigerate for 1 hour. Sprinkle with sesame seeds. Serve in cups or on plates.

Wash beans. Cook beans in boiling water for 10 minutes or until tender. Drain and cool in ice water. Cut green beans in 1-inch pieces, wax beans in 2-inch pieces, kidney beans in 1/4-inch pieces. Place in a bowl. Mix remaining ingredients in another bowl. Add dressing to vegetables and toss lightly. Refrigerate for 2 hours before serving.

Beat egg whites with vinegar until foamy. Gradually add sugar and beat until stiff but not dry. Form into 4 balls. Place one ball of meringue on a plate and spread it flat to form a round base. Bake in 200C/400F oven until dry to the touch (10-15 minutes). Spoon the cream over the meringue base. Top with remaining meringue and serve.

Heat olive oil in large skillet over medium heat. Sprinkle chicken with season salt and fresh coarse ground black pepper. Add chicken to skillet, cook about 3 minutes per side or until chicken is cooked through. Remove chicken from skillet. Add mushrooms to pan juicescook 2 minutes. Add wine. Cook 1 minute more. Stir in caperscook 1 minute more or until heated through. Spoon chicken over mushroom mixture in skillet.

Combine granola and tapioca in a medium saucepan. Stir in brown sugar. Stir over medium heat until melted. Pour mixture into an 8-inch square baking dish. Arrange cherries on top and dot with 1 tablespoon of butter. Bake at 350F for 30 minutes. In a small bowl, combine tapioca and almond extract. Spoon over piebake 5 minutes more. Cool slightly. Cut into 9 bars.

Bring 4 quarts of water to a boil. Add whole kernel corn. Cook for 5 minutes. Remove corn. Add spaghetti to water. Cook for 10 minutes. Drain. Add creamed corn. Toss until well blended. Add mozzarella cheese and butter. Serve hot.
Combine sugar, corn syrup, and chocolate. Bring to boil over medium heat. Stir constantly for 1 minute. Remove from heat. Add vanilla and butter. Stir until smooth. Cool to room temperature.

Saute onion, garlic and jalapeno in oil. Add beans. Stir in tomatoes. Add broth, cumin and oregano. Simmer for 30 minutes. Cool slightly. With an immersion blender, blend until smooth. Add salt if needed.

Mix ground beef with taco seasoning mix. Set aside. Heat olive oil in a skillet. Add ground beef mixture and cook until no longer pink. Place about 1/4 cup ground beef mixture in each taco shell. Add desired toppings. Serve with sour cream and salsa.

Heat olive oil over medium heat. Add diced onion and saute 5-7 minutes. Add breadcrumbs and saute 3-5 minutes. Add cheeses and cook until melted. Add chicken stock and bring to a boil. Add egg and beat with a fork until incorporated. Remove from heat and serve. Garnish with parsley.

Cube French bread and place in greased baking dish. In small bowl combine cheese, butter and garlic. Blend well. Mix in parsley and paprika. Spread over bread. Sprinkle with garlic powder. Bake at 400f for 15 minutes. Serve hot.

Melt butter over high heat. Add scallions, jalapeno, and garlic. Cook for 2 minutes. Add thyme and chicken broth. Bring to a boil. Add shrimp, cover and reduce heat to low. Cook for 2 minutes. Check shrimp for doneness. Add a little water or more broth if you find the soup to be too thick. If desired, add salt or seasoning to taste at the end of the cooking time. Serve hot.
Boil potatoes until tender. Drain and mash. Add kale and ricotta cheese. Stir together. Add butter & salt & pepper. Serve.

In a large saucepan, bring milk and cream to a simmer over medium-high heat. In a small bowl, combine flour with butter using a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal. Add flour mixture to milk in a steady stream, stirring constantly with a wooden spoon. Bring to a gentle boil. Cook over low heat until slightly thickened, about 4 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in smoked gouda until melted and smooth. Season with paprika, nutmeg and salt and pepper to taste.

Prepare cake mix according to package directions. Fold in crushed pineapple. Bake in greased 8x8 inch pan at 350f for 35 minutes. Cool completely. Drizzle cake with glaze. Combine powdered sugar, 1/4 cup milk and orange extract. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over cake. Cool 2 hours. Sprinkle with toasted coconut.

Add 1/4 cup of warm water to yeast and mix until dissolved. Add 2 cups of warm water to yeast mixture and mix until dissolved. Add honey to water mixture and mix well. Add all other ingredients to water mixture and mix on medium for 10 minutes. Add fruit or nuts on last 5 minutes. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 to 50 minutes or until done.

In large skillet, heat oil. Brown chicken, turning once. Sprinkle flour over chicken. Add 1/2 cup broth. Simmer until chicken is tender. Add lemon juice. Remove from heat. Stir in liqueur and honey. Taste and adjust seasonings. Serve hot.

Thaw pie shell. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). In a large skillet, cook bacon until crisp. Drain on paper towels. In a large bowl, combine the broccoli and onion. In a small bowl, combine the eggs, sour cream, thyme and worcestershire saucestir in the cheeses. Pour the egg mixture over the broccoli and onion. Sprinkle with the bacon. Place the broccoli mixture into the pie shell. Bake in the preheated oven for 18 minutes. Reduce the heat to 325 degrees F (160 degrees C). Continue baking for 40 minutes. Let stand for 10 minutes before serving.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. Lightly spray 2 shallow baking pans with cooking spray. In a small bowl combine the apricot preserves and next 5 ingredients. Brush half of the apricot mixture over chicken in each pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until juice of chicken is no longer pink when cut to the bone. Combine the remaining apricot mixture with ketchup and vinegar and brush over chicken. Bake for another 5 minutes. Yields 6 servings.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F. Grease muffin cups or line with paper baking cups. In large bowl combine first four ingredients and beat well. Beat in flour, baking powder, salt and cinnamon. Fill greased or paper-lined muffin cups three-fourths full. Bake 15 to 18 minutes or until tops are golden brown. Cool slightly. Serve warm.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cut shortening into flour and salt with fork or pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Gradually add water, mixing just until dough begins to clump together. Gather dough together and roll out to fit an ungreased 9-inch pie pan. Fit dough loosely into the pan and fold under overhang to form edge of crust. Prick crust with fork. Place pie shell in freezer for 30 minutes. Bake in preheated oven for 5 minutes or until edges are lightly browned. Remove from oven and reduce heat to 325 degrees. Combine filling and oats and spread in prepared crust. Dot with butter. Bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until top is golden brown and filling is bubbly. Cool on wire rack for 30 minutes before cutting.

In a large bowl mix the lean ground beef, onion and mushroom soup. Season to taste. Form into small patties. Mix the breadcrumbs and seasoning together. Dip each patty in the egg and then roll in the breadcrumb mixture. Place on an ungreased baking tray. Bake at 350 degrees for 30-35 minutes. Makes 20.
Place potatoes in a large bowl and toss with oil. Sprinkle with salt and toss until well coated. Add lemon zest, lemon juice, cilantro, scallions, pepper, and parsley. Toss until combined.

Beat eggs until foamy. Add sugar and beat until thick. Add sour cream. Slowly add in flour. Pour into pie crust and bake in preheated 400 degree oven for 15 minutes. Reduce temperature to 250 degrees and bake for 50 minutes more. Cool pie completely. Just before serving, sprinkle with almond extract and blueberry pie filling.

Spray a 4 quart casserole dish with cooking spray. In the dish layer the following in order starting from the bottom layer upward: bacon pieces (1/2 of the package), potatoes (2 lbs), onion (1/2 of large onion), celery (1/2 of large celery stalk), carrots (2 medium carrots), kielbasa (1/2 pound) and fresh broccoli (2 medium heads). Add salt and pepper to taste and cover the casserole dish and bake for 45 minutes or until the potatoes are cooked through and the broccoli is lightly browned and the kielbasa is hot. Serve with fresh steamed green beans on the side.

Place egg yolks in blender or food processor bowl. Add water and process until mixture is smooth and creamy. Add lemon juiceblend briefly. Heat butter slowly over low heat in small, heavy saucepan. When butter begins to foam, pour into bowl with egg yolk mixture. Process to combine. Continue to process until mixture thickens and is pale yellow. This should take about 5 minutes. The hollandaise will begin to thicken when it reaches 170 F to 180 F. Remove from processor bowl. Cover with a double thickness of plastic wrap to prevent skin from forming while refrigerating. Refrigerate up to 3 days or freeze up to 3 months. Makes 1 to 1 1/4 cups.

Heat oven to 325 degrees fahrenheit. Cut the potatoes into 2-inch pieces. Place the potatoes into a large bowl. Pour 1 1/2 cups of the water over the potatoes and stir to combine. In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the onion and saute until the onion is softened. Add the wine vinegar and thyme. Cook for 2 minutes. Add the potato water and bring to a simmer. Cover and cook for 30 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender. Drain the potatoes and return to the skillet. Mash the potatoes. Add the mustard, prepared horseradish and salt and pepper to taste. Add the half-and-half and mash until smooth. Transfer the potatoes to a serving bowl and serve immediately.

Remove the stem and center core of the cabbage. Cut into 1/2-inch shreds. Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Add the shredded cabbage. Cook for 1 minute. Drain and rinse with cold water. Drain. In a bowl, combine the cabbage with the carrot and scallion. In another bowl, mix together the white vinegar and water. Add the salt. Stir well. Pour over the cabbage mixture. Add the jalapenos. Toss to mix. Refrigerate. This salad tastes better the next day.

Cut the red onion in half and then cut into quarters. Arrange the red onion in a grill basket. Mix the soy sauce and mustard in a small bowl. In a small saucepan bring the honey to a boil. Remove from heat. Pour the soy sauce mixture over the red onion. Pour the honey over the red onion. Grill for approximately 15 minutes or until tender and golden brown. Serve as a side dish.

Heat oven to 375. In large bowl, mix first 4 ingredients. In small bowl, mix next 4 ingredients. Add egg whites to cornmeal mixturestir just until moistened. Stir in corn kernels and cheese. Spread batter into greased 8-inch square baking dish. Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until toothpick inserted near center comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Cut into squares. Yield: 8 servings. Per serving: 270 calories, 23g carbohydrate, 5g fat (2g saturated), 8g protein, 78mg cholesterol, 337mg sodium. Source: adapted from womans day magazine.

Spread both sides of bread with butter. Lay on a piece of ham and a slice of swiss cheese on each slice of bread. Heat a grill pan over medium heat. Place the sandwiches in the pan and grill on each side for about 2-3 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Cut sandwiches in half and serve on a plate. Serve with pickles or potato chips as a side.

Cut pork tenderloin in half lengthwise. Place in a dish with enough vegetable oil to cover. Marinate in fridge overnight. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place pork in a roasting pan and add wine and lemon juice. Cover with foil. Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Remove foil and sprinkle with garlic. Bake 1 hour longer until a meat thermometer reads 150 f. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Place chicken breasts in the bottom of a shallow 13 by 9-inch pan. Sprinkle chicken breasts evenly with parsley, salt and pepper. In small saucepan, melt butter. Add lemon juice and stir. Pour butter mixture evenly over chicken breasts. Sprinkle lemon slices and lemon peel over chicken. Cover pan tightly with foil. Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 1 hour. Remove pan from oven and uncover. Sprinkle chicken with herbs and continue to bake until juice from chicken is no longer pink and chicken is done, about 45 minutes more. An instant-read thermometer inserted into the thickest part of chicken will register 165 degrees. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

In a large mixing bowl combine meat, cream of mushroom soup, green chilies, evaporated milk, mozzarella cheese and cheddar cheese. Place mixture in 9x13 glass pan. Place tortilla strips on top of the meat mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Preheat oven to 375. In mixing bowl, cream sugar and shortening with mixer until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs and peanut butter until smooth. Stir in flour and vanilla. Drop by teaspoonfuls onto ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 8-10 minutes until edges are light brown. Cool on wire rack.

Cut salmon fillets into 2-3-inch portions. Mix together the light soy sauce and gingerroot. Add the salmon to the bowl and coat thoroughly. Allow to sit for about 30 minutes. Meanwhile, warm the sweet chili sauce. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a baking pan with non-stick cooking spray. Place the salmon on the pan and bake for 15 minutes. Serve over steamed rice with sliced spring onions and a squeeze of lime.

Cut fruitcake into small pieces. Soak fruitcake in brandy for several hours or overnight. Melt chocolate according to package directions. Spoon chocolate into molds or cups, place fruitcake into each one and top with decorative candies of your choice. Refrigerate for several hours and serve cold.

Preheat broiler. Slice mushrooms 1/4 inch thick. Mix oil, vinegar, lemon juice and pepper. Place mushrooms on broiler pan. Broil until lightly browned. Sprinkle with green onion tops. Serve with hot cooked rice.
Cream together icing sugar, butter and vanilla. Mix in flours. Press into a 13x9 inch pan. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes. Melt chocolate and spread over the top.

Rinse tuna steaks and pat dry. Rub both sides with the olive oil. Sprinkle with salt and pepper on both sides. Put in a nonstick pan and cook on medium high for 3 minutes on each side until a nice crust forms. Remove the tuna from the pan, place on a plate and drizzle with the balsamic vinegar. Squeeze the orange juice over the tuna and serve immediately.

Brew a 10-ounce cup of coffee and set aside. Combine water and sugar in a 12-ounce coffee mug. Add the coffee and half-and-half. Pour the mixture into a blender. Add the ice and blend until smooth. Pour back into the mug and stir in the chocolate syrup. Makes 1 serving.

In a small bowl, combine miso and rice vinegar. Stir in sake, brown sugar and soy sauce. Place salmon in a small bowl. Pour miso mixture over fishmarinate in refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Preheat the broiler. Remove the fish from marinadediscard the marinade. Dip fish in the panko. Broil 3 inches from heat for 6 to 8 minutes. Turn the fish over and broil for another 2 to 3 minutes until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Serve with rice.

Cook macaroni according to package directions. Drainreturn macaroni to pan. In a small skillet over medium heat, cook chicken in chicken broth until no longer pink. Stir in broccoliheat through. In a small saucepan over medium heat, melt cheese productstir until smooth. Spoon over macaroni mixturesprinkle with pepper. Serve immediately.

Mix together oyster crackers, parsley, lemon & herb seasoning and saltset aside. Slice scallops into thin rounds and place on a plate. Whisk together Dijon mustard and olive oilbrush on scallops and set aside. Dip scallops into the crumb mixture and place on baking sheet. Spray scallops with cooking spray and bake for 5-7 minutes until cooked through. Serve with lemon wedges and steamed vegetables of your choice.

In a large saucepan combine cranberries with the water. Bring mixture to a boil and cook uncovered for 3 minutes or until berries pop. Remove from heat and stir in sugar until completely dissolved. Allow mixture to cool slightly. Transfer mixture to a large bowl and stir in cinnamon and marmalade. Fold in lemon juice and walnuts. Spoon mixture into a greased 2-quart casserole and bake in a preheated 350 degree F oven for 35 minutes or until set. Cool for 1 hour and serve with pork roast.

Bring 1 quart water to boil with jalapeno, dried pepper flakes and garlicremove garlic before adding clams. Cover, steam 3 to 5 minutes or until clams open. Drain, reserve 1/3 cup liquidremove clams from shellsset aside. Melt butter in heavy skilletadd scallions, cook 1 minutestir in clams with 1/3 cup reserved liquidsprinkle with lemon juice. Remove from heatstir in tomato puree. Transfer to a serving dish. Garnish with parsley.

Heat butter and oil in skillet over medium heat until hot. Add onion and saute until tender. Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Beat eggs and milk together. Pour into skillet and cook for 2 minutes. Add mushrooms and sprinkle with cheese. Cook for 2 minutes longer or until eggs are set and cheese is melted. Serve immediately.

Mix together rice vinegar, soy sauce and ginger until well combined. Place 3 or 4 pieces of cod into a large bowl and pour the vinegar mixture over them. Cover the bowl and refrigerate for at least 2 hours and up to 3 days. Take the fish out of the fridge about 30 minutes before you want to eat. Prepare rice according to package directions. Cut the scallions into 1-inch pieces. After the rice is ready, pour it into a serving dish. Arrange the fish over the rice and top with the scallions. Garnish with fresh ground pepper. Serves 4.

Preheat oven to 350f. Cut each lemon into 4 wedges and place in a baking dish. Add whole chickens to baking dish and add wedges of lemon. In a small bowl combine paprika and butterrub onto chicken. Add salt and pepper. In a small bowl combine lemon juice and olive oildrizzle over chickens. Toss together thyme and butterrub onto chicken. Bake for 3 hours until done. Let stand for 10 minutes before carving. Serve with pan juices.

Melt butter in a heavy based saucepan over a medium heat. Add onion and cook for about 10 minutes until soft. Add bacon and lentils and stir well. Add vegetable stock and bring to the boil. Turn down heat to a simmer and cook for 20 minutes. Add chopped tomatoes and cook for 10 minutes. Season to taste. Just before serving add a swirl of double cream.

Combine all the above ingredients together in a mixing bowl. Form into a loaf shape, place into a baking dish and bake at 180 degrees celcius for 1 hour. Serve with tomato sauce and mashed potatoes or rice.

In a skillet fry hash brown potatoes according to directions on package. Add eggs, milk, onion flakes and dill. Cook over low heat until eggs are set. Remove from heat and let cool slightly. Spread onto 2 pie crusts that have been sprayed with nonstick baking spray. Cut fish sticks into 1 inch squares. Lay squares over hash browns. Sprinkle with cheese. Cover with remaining pie crusts. Bake at 350 degrees for 12 minutes or until golden brown. Cut into wedges to serve. Serve with ketchup and tartar sauce if desired.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Grease an 11x7x2-inch baking pan. In a large bowl, cream together the sugar and shortening. Add eggs and beat well. Combine the flour, baking powder and saltadd to creamed mixture. Stir in vanilla. Spread into prepared pan. Bake for 30 to 35 minutes or until done. Cool completely. Sprinkle with chocolate chips and nuts. Cut into bars. Yields 3 dozen.
Crush the heath candy bars and combine with instant vanilla pudding. Spread mixture on top of angel food cake. Layer with cool whip. Refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 425f. Cut butter in flour until mixture resembles fine crumbs. Add honey and milk and stir until dough is formed. Roll out dough on floured surface to about 1/2 inch thick. Cut out biscuits using a biscuit cutter or a glass. Place on greased cookie sheet and bake for 10-15 minutes or until lightly browned.

In a large Dutch oven or stockpot, combine the beef broth, macaroni, and round. Bring to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heatcover and simmer for 30 minutes. Stir in the beans. Remove from the heat. Add the spaghetti sauce. Serve immediately. Serves 6.

In a skillet over med-hi heat brown the kielbasa and ground beef. In a large pot over med-hi heat combine the rinsed pinto beans and the pork n beans. Add the white rice. Add the sausage and the beef. Stir. Add the kidney beans and stir again. Add the onions and stir. Add the ground cayenne pepper and stir. Cover and simmer for 45 minutes. Turn off the heat and let sit for 15 minutes. Serve over hot white rice. Makes 6 servings.

Boil about a minute or less until just cooked through. Stir in lemon juice, birds eye chile, garlic, salt, pepper. Heat the oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add shrimp, cook until just cooked through. Add the shrimp mixture to the oil. Remove from heat. Sprinkle with more salt if desired. Serve immediately.

Combine ketchup, vinegar, brown sugar, soy sauce and water in a bowlset aside. Mix cornstarch, sesame oil and red pepper flakes in another bowl. Dip each chicken breast into cornstarch mixture, then into ketchup mixture to coat, then back into cornstarch mixture. Set aside on paper towels for 10 minutes. Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Working in batches, fry chicken 4-5 minutes on each side, or until golden browndrain on paper towels.

Preheat oven to 375f. Peel and slice shallots into thin rounds or quarters. Put in a bowl and toss with the oil and vinegar and thyme. Spread out in one layer on a rimmed baking sheet and roast until tender and lightly browned and caramelized, 30-40 minutes. Remove from oven, discard thyme and sprinkle with salt and pepper and toss to coat. Let cool before serving. Great on top of a salad or as a garnish on steak or grilled chicken. Serves 4-6.

Heat oven to 375. Grease and flour a 9-inch loaf pan or 10-inch tube pan.In a large bowl cream shortening and sugar until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in mashed bananas. Combine the dry ingredients and add alternately with the banana mixture to the creamed mixture, beating well after each addition. Fold in pecans. Pour batter into prepared pan. Bake for 1 hour or until a skewer inserted in the center of the loaf comes out clean. Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes then turn out of pan and cool completely on rack.

Preheat oven to 400. Line 2 baking sheets with foil and lightly grease with nonstick spray. In a large bowl combine the potatoes, honey, orange juice, salt and pepper. Melt the butter in a small saucepan over medium heat. Once it is melted add the paprika, cayenne and cumin. Whisk to combine. Pour over potatoes and stir to combine. Transfer potatoes to prepared baking sheets. Roast potatoes for 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

In a small saucepan combine eggnog, milk and bourbon. Cook over medium heat until mixture just comes to a boil. Remove from heat and add chocolate syrup and nutmeg. Mix to combine. Ladle into mugs and top with a marshmallow. Sprinkle with additional nutmeg if desired. Makes 6 servings.

Beat egg whites in large bowl until stiff peaks form. Add coconut, sesame seeds, breadcrumbs and sesame oilbeat until well blended. Combine 1/4 cup water and the cornstarch in a small saucepanbring to a boil, stirring constantly. Remove from heatadd turkey. Spoon about 1/4 cup coconut mixture into each palmpress to form a strip about 1-inch wide. Repeat with remaining mixture. Coat strips with cooking spray. Bake at 450° for 10-13 minutes or until turkey is no longer pink. Yields 12 strips.

Cook basmati rice according to directions and set aside to cool. Combine the cranberries and walnuts together and set aside. In a small bowl mix together the olive oil and vinegar and season with salt and pepper. Combine all of the ingredients together and mix well.

Cut off fins, wash catfish and pat dry. Sprinkle both sides of fish with salt and pepper. Mix cornmeal, pepper and garlic powder together in a shallow dish. In another dish beat egg and milk together. Dip fish into egg mixture then into cornmeal mixture, pressing firmly against fish to coat well. Let stand for about 5 minutes. In a heavy skillet heat about 1/2 inch corn oil over medium heat until hot. Carefully add fish to skillet and fry on each side until golden brown. Drain fish on paper towels and serve hot. Serves 4.

Peel and cut sweet potatoes into 1/4 inch slices. Boil in salted water for 15 minutes. Mash with handblender. Mix with honey and soy sauce. Add egg and mix well. Melt butter in skillet. Form mixture into 1/2 inch patties and fry in butter for 2 minutes each side. Serve with lemon wedges.

Melt the white chocolate and vanilla in the microwave. I used a Pyrex measuring cup and it took about 4 minutes. Stir to combine. Add the coffee and milk and mix thoroughly. Put in a glass or mug and enjoy. I made it with a shot of espresso and it was heavenly!

In a bowl, combine the maple syrup, mustard, vinegar, garlic, rosemary and zest. Add a little water if needed to thin. Salt and pepper to taste. Lay out the lamb chops in a single layer and pour half of the marinade over them. Marinate for a minimum of an hour or overnight. Grill or broil the lamb chops on a grill pan or broiler pan for 10-12 minutes for medium rare or until desired temperature is reached. Cook time will depend on thickness of chops. Turn once for even browning. Baste with remaining marinade. Serve with a side of rice or couscous and steamed or grilled vegetables.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Lightly spray a bread loaf pan. In a large bowl combine flour, baking powder and salt. Set aside. In another bowl combine sugar and coconut. Set aside. In a medium bowl combine milk and egg. Set aside. In a large bowl cream oil and sugar together until fluffy. Add coconut and milk mixture. Beat until well blended. Stir in dry ingredients. Pour into prepared pan. Bake for 60-65 minutes. Remove from oven and cool in pan for 10 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely.

1. In a large skillet heat the oil over medium heat. Cook the onion until tender. Add the ground beef and seasoning. Cook until no longer pink. Drain any excess grease. 2. Spray a 9x13 inch baking dish with cooking spray. Line the bottom of the dish with a layer of potatoes. Add a layer of beef and cheese. Repeat until all the beef and potatoes have been used. 3. On a lightly floured surface roll out the dough to fit the pan. Cover the top of the casserole and seal the edges. With a sharp knife score the top of the dough. Brush the top of the pie with real butter. Bake for 20 minutes or until the crust is golden brown.

Preheat oven to 375. Cream peanut butter and sugar in a medium bowl. Beat in egg and vanillastir in baking soda. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto ungreased baking sheet 2 inches apart. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes or until set. Remove from pan to wire rack to cool completely. Store in air tight container.

Cook pasta in salted water until al dente. Drain and set aside. Cook chicken in salsa con queso until thoroughly heated. Blend in milk and tomatoesadd green onions and cook until heated through. Add pasta and stir until well coated. Sprinkle with cheese. Serve with crackers or tortilla chips.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place potatoes in a single layer in a shallow baking pan. Toss with the salt and pepper. Drizzle with the melted butter. Bake for 45 minutes, turning the potatoes every 15 minutes. Top with bacon bits and shredded cheddar cheese. Garnish with scallion.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. In a shallow dish combine the bread crumbs, parmesan cheese, parsley, salt & pepper. Dip chicken in butter, then in the bread crumb mixture. Place in single layer in an ungreased shallow baking dish. Bake for 1 hour or until the chicken is done. Turn once after 30 minutes. Remove from oven & sprinkle with chopped garlic & serve.

In a large saucepan, combine sugar, golden syrup, condensed milk and butter. Cook over low heat, stirring constantly for 5 minutes or so or until the mixture starts to turn golden in color. Pour into a greased 8-inch square pan. Pour in the water and use the back of a wet spoon to create a pattern. Leave in the fridge for at least 2 hours or overnight. Cut into 16 squares.
Preheat oven to 375. Peel and slice the potatoes and place them in a casserole dish. Cover with the dressing mix and butter. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.
Cook corn 1 minute or until tender, then cool slightly. Cut kernels from cobs. Toss with remaining ingredients. Serve at room temperature or chilled. Serves 4 to 6.

Preheat oven to 375f. Lightly spray a 2-1/2 to 3-quart casserole dish with cooking spray. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chickencook 5 minutes per side or until done. Remove from pan. In a large bowl, combine soup and sour cream. Add chickentoss to coat. Add onions, bell peppers, roasted red peppers and chiliestoss to coat. Spoon into prepared casserole dish. Sprinkle with cheese. Bake for 25 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with cilantroserve with chips.

Prepare penne according to package directions. Meanwhile, heat oil in large skillet. Add onions and cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Add radishes and cook until tender, about 5 minutes longer. Drain pasta. Toss with radish mixture and parmesan cheese. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 450. Slice each cod fish fillet into four equal portions and pound the fish thin with a meat tenderizer or rolling pin. Dip each piece of fish into the flour and shake off the excess flour. In a large bowl whisk together the baking powder with the water. Add the fish and gently stir until all pieces are coated with batter. Spoon the batter into a lightly greased muffin tin and bake for about ten minutes or until the fish puffs up and the crust is golden brown. Serve with chili sauce and lemon wedges for dipping.

Cook the chorizo and onion together in a skillet over medium heat until the sausage is cooked through and the onion is softened. Prepare the eggs by whisking together the milk and the eggs and season with the pepper and salt. Spray a small frying pan with nonstick cooking spray and heat over medium heat. Pour the egg mixture into the pan and cook until set. Cut the eggs into strips. Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Warm the tortillas in the microwave or in the oven until they are soft. Fill each tortilla with 1/4 of the eggs and 1/4 of the sausage mixture. Sprinkle with cheese and hot sauce. Place the taco in a baking dish and cover with foil. Bake for 15 minutes. Remove the tacos from the oven and serve with salsa.

Saute onion and garlic in butter until tender. Stir in green pepper and cook until tender. Add barley, chicken broth, and water. Cook over medium heat until barley is tender. Season with salt and pepper.

Boil 1 package of oriental-flavor instant ramen noodles according to package directions. Drain ramen noodles and return to pan. Stir in hamburger and onion until heated through. Add frozen mixed vegetablesheat through. Serve immediately.

Prepare an ice water bath and set aside. In a small bowl beat egg yolks. In another small bowl mix breadcrumbs with 1/4 cup of Parmesan cheese and nutmeg. In another small bowl beat light cream with salt water. In another small bowl combine bread crumbs with nutmeg and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Beat egg yolks and set aside. In another small bowl combine light cream with salt water. In another small bowl combine breadcrumbs with nutmeg and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Beat egg yolks and set aside. In another small bowl combine light cream with salt water. In another small bowl combine bread crumbs with nutmeg and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Beat egg yolks and set aside. In another small bowl combine light cream with salt water. In another small bowl combine bread crumbs with nutmeg and 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese. Beat egg yolks and set aside. In another small bowl combine light cream with salt water. In another

Cook the asparagus spears in boiling water for about 2 minutes. Drain them then rinse them under cold water. Heat the Spanish olive oil over low heat. When the oil is very hot add the asparagus spears and the Serrano ham slices. Cook for about 30 seconds stirring frequently. Serve immediately.

Cream together butter and sugar. Add hot water and stir till combined. Add in eggs and beat till combined. Stir in flour, baking powder and salt. Stir till flour is combined. Fold in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased cookie sheets. Bake in preheated oven at 400 for 12 minutes or until light brown. Cool for a few minutes, then transfer to cooling rack. Makes about 2 dozen.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Grease 12 muffin cups or line with paper muffin cups. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt. In another bowl, beat together granulated sugar, milk, eggs, oil, and vanilla extract. Stir into dry mixture just until moistened. Gently stir in marshmallows and chocolate chips. Fill muffin cups two-thirds full. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 to 20 minutes, or until lightly browned and the tops spring back when touched lightly. Remove from oven and allow to cool in the pan 10 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely. Makes about 1 dozen.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place chicken breast halves between two sheets of wax paper, and pound to 1/2″ thickness with a rolling pin, or a meat pounder if you have one. In a bowl combine hot sauce, vinegar, margarine, celery seed, pepper, and 1/2 cup of blue cheese dressingmix well. Place chicken on a large broiler pan. Brush each breast with some of the sauce mixture, reserving some for later use. Bake for 15 minutes per side or until no longer pink inside. Remove chicken from oven, cover with the remaining sauce mixture, and sprinkle with the remaining blue cheese dressing. Bake 5 more minutes to melt the cheese. Serve with crisp lettuce leaves and crisp celery sticks on the side.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Butter a 9 inch spring form pan. Break up vanilla wafers and place in blender. Pulse until fine crumbs. Add butter, sugar and egg white. Pulse until crumbs hold together when pressed. Press crumbs into bottom of pan. Bake 5 minutes. Cool. Beat cream cheese until soft. Add coffee liqueur and beat until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time. Beat in sugar. Pour over cooled crust. Bake 40 to 45 minutes. Cool. Refrigerate. Melt chocolate. Drizzle over top of cheesecake. Refrigerate.
