Put garlic, almonds, basil, cheese and salt in a food processor and pulse to combine. With the processor still running slowly add the oil. When the mixture begins to clump together add the lemon juice and a pinch of pepper. Transfer to a serving bowl and let stand for 10 minutes to let the flavors blend. Serve.

Slice turnips and potatoes into quarters and dice carrots and celery ribs. Saute onions and turnips and celery in butter until tender. Add broth and bring to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender. Remove from heat and puree with honey, garlic and seasonings to taste. Serve with crusty bread and a salad.

Heat oil in pan. Sauté onion, green pepper, celery and ham until onion is translucent. Add rice, stirring well. Add water and tomatoes. Cover pan and cook over low heat until rice is tender. Season with salt, pepper, and seasoning salt if desired.

Slice fat-free bread horizontally in half. Spread each piece of bread with mayonnaise. Lay out bacon slices on a plate. Heat in microwave on high for 10 seconds. Layer lettuce on bacon, then tomatoes. Place on top of bacon. Put the other half of the bread on top of sandwich. Wrap tightly in plastic wrap. Let set for 30 minutes. Cut into 4 triangles.

Brown ground chuck and pork sausage in skillet. Drain off fat and add tomato sauce. Add worcestershire sauce. Add velveeta cheese and oregano. Mix and heat through. Toast rye cocktail bread. Spread meat mixture over each piece of bread. Top with grated cheddar cheese. Broil until cheese is bubbly.

In a large skillet over medium heat, saute zucchini, carrots, scallions, garlic, 1 tablespoon olive oil and salt & pepper for about 10 minutes or until softened. Stir in lemon juice and basil. Transfer to serving dish and sprinkle with chives.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. In a roasting pan combine tomatoes, onion, orange rind, olive oil, garlic & green chilies. Roast for 15 minutes. Prepare the fish by coating with olive oil on both sides. Sprinkle with salt & freshly ground black pepper. Add basil leaves & bake in the oven for 10 minutes. Serve with tomato sauce.

Put sausage in crock pot. Add sauerkraut and apples. Add apple juice and water. Mix in brown sugar, salt and pepper. Add 2 teaspoons of caraway seed. Cover and cook on low 8 hours. Serve with buttered egg noodles. Serves 4-6.

Line a microwave safe dish with wax paper. In a microwave safe bowl combine cocoa, milk, butter & sugar. Stir until smooth. Add vanilla. Microwave for about 1 minute. Stir until smooth again. Add old fashioned oats & peanut butter. Stir until well blended. Drop by spoonfuls onto wax paper. Allow cookies to cool before eating. Makes about 2 dozen.

Bring water and vinegar to boil, then add garlic and boil 30 seconds. Remove from heat and cool completely. Transfer garlic to jar. Add salt, honey, olive oil, lemon juice and pink peppercornscover tightly with lid and refrigerate at least 4 hours or up to 2 days.

In saucepan combine butter, syrup, sugar. Bring to rolling boil over medium heat. Cook until mixture becomes a thick caramel. Remove from heat. Add eggs one at a time. Add lemon juice and vanilla. Pour into unbaked pie shells. Top with pecans. Bake at 350f for 30 minutes or until set. Cool before serving.

Dust the shrimp with the flour and season with salt and pepper. Heat the oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add the shrimp and fry for about 2 minutes on each side or until lightly browned. Remove the shrimp from the pan and set aside. Add the white wine to the pan and scrape the bottom with a wooden spoon. Add the shrimp back to the pan and let cook until the white wine is reduced by half. Add the butter and the lemon juice and let reduce until thickened. Add the heavy cream and bring to a low simmer. Turn off the heat and add the parsley. Serve with the shrimp.

Combine starter, butter, milk, salt, honey, sunflower seeds, and millet in large mixing bowl. Add multi-grain flour gradually, mixing well after each addition until all flour is added. Knead lightly until dough is smooth. Cover with plastic wraplet rise 2 hours at room temperature or overnight in the refrigerator. Punch down doughknead 5-6 minutes or until smooth. Shape into 2 loavesplace into greased 8 1/2 x 4 1/2 x 2 1/2-inch loaf pans. Cover with plastic wraplet rise 45 minutes at room temperature or until doubled in bulk. Bake at 350 degrees F for 45 minutes to 1 hour or until browned. Makes 2 loaves.

Mix sugar with ricotta cheese in a bowl until well combined. Add eggs one at a time, mixing after each addition until well blended. Stir in vanilla and pudding mix until well blended. Fold in 1 cup whipped topping. Pour into a 9-inch springform pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until cake is lightly browned and center is set when gently shaken. Cool on wire rack for 10 minutes. Remove side of springform pan. Invert cake onto wire rack. Remove topping from cakereserve for later use. Invert cake onto a serving dish. Top with remaining 1 cup whipped topping and drizzle with chocolate syrup. Top with reserved topping. Store cake in refrigerator.

Prepare ravioli according to package directions. Place cooked ravioli on a baking sheet and bake for 8 minutes. Meanwhile, in a small sauce pan, saute garlic in olive oil. In a large bowl, combine potatoes with garlic and sauteed garlic. Fold in ricotta cheese and chives. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Spoon potato mixture onto each ravioli. Broil for 2 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Mix the cornflour with 2 tablespoons cold water in a large bowl, then add the beef in batches, tossing to coat. Heat the oil in a large wok, then fry the beef over a high heat for 1-2 minutes until browned on both sides. Add the onions and garlic, then stir-fry for 1 minute until softened. Add the stock and soy sauce, then cook for a further 2 minutes until the liquid has reduced. Stir in the bok choy and sweet chili sauce, then cook for a further minute until the beef is tender and the bok choy is wilted.

Combine the spices in a small bowl. In a large bowl, combine the corn and butter. Add the spices and mix well. Grill the corn on a barbecue or on a stove top over high heat until lightly browned and cooked through. Serve with a sprinkle of salt, if desired.

Combine all the ingredients in a plastic bag. Add the chicken pieces. Seal the bag and marinate the chicken in the refrigerator for at least 2 hours or up to 12 hours. Drain off the marinade. Grill the chicken over medium heat for 4 minutes per side. Serve immediately.

Prepare a bowl with water and a second bowl with plain flour. Crack eggs and whisk them together in a third bowl with milk. Place a little oil into a frying pan over a medium heat. Dip each halloumi cheese into the bowl of flour then into the bowl of water. Dip each halloumi cheese into the whisked egg mixture and then back into the flour. Add the cornstarch and a pinch of salt and pepper to the flour bowl. Fry each cheese until golden brown and crispy. Serve with a sprinkling of mint.

Prepare pizza crust per directions. In a small bowl, combine cream cheese and garlic. Spread 1/2 of the mixture over the crust. Arrange chicken, red onion, tomatoes and mushrooms over the cream cheese layer. Sprinkle with remaining cream cheese mixture and 2 tablespoons of the parmesan cheese. Sprinkle with the remaining parmesan cheese and bake as directed.

Juice the lemon, squeeze the orange halves into a bowl. Put the lemon juice into a jug, add the water, honey and ginger powder and stir to dissolve the honey. Stir in the orange juice and cinnamon stick. Pour over ice cubes and serve immediately. Garnish with a slice of orange if you like.

Heat oil in a pan. Add brussels sprouts, salt and masala powder. Cook for 3-4 minutes or till the brussels sprouts are softened and the oil comes to top. Add some water if needed to avoid dryness. Serve hot with any main dish of your choice or as a side dish with rice and chapattis.

Mix mandarin oranges, pineapple juice, lemon juice, jalapeno pepper, salt and pepper together in a bowl. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken. Cook 6 to 8 minutes on each side or until chicken is no longer pink in centre. Serve with mandarin orange salsa.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees f. Rinse chicken pieces in cold water and pat dry. Combine ranch dressing, salsa and sour cream in large bowl. Stir in chicken piecesturn to coat. Cover. Chill 4 hours or overnight. Uncover. Stir in 2/3 of the cheese, 2 tablespoons of the cumin and 1 tablespoon of the chili powder. Spread mixture into 9-inch deep-dish pie plate. Bake uncovered 30 minutes. Sprinkle remaining cheese over top. Bake 5 minutes longer or until cheese melts. Garnish with bacon.

Cut pumpernickel bread into squares. Place into the bottom of an 8 inch pie dish. Layer sliced raspberries on top of bread. Top with chocolate shavings. Whisk together the cherry juice and chambord raspberry liquor. Beat whipping cream until stiff. Gently fold in vanilla and sugar. Spread over raspberries. Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours or until set. Serve with yoghurt.

Thaw the cut green beans in a colander for 45 to 60 minutes. Drain. In a small bowl, combine the orange rind with the honey. In a large skillet, cook the bacon until crisp. Remove bacon to paper towels to drain. Set aside. Add the green beans to the bacon drippings in the skillet. Cook on high heat for two minutes. Add the orange honey mixture. Cook for an additional two minutes. Stir in the cranberries. Sprinkle with the bacon bits. Serve hot. Serves six.

Saute onions in hot oil. Add chicken. Cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink. Add corn. Cook for 1 minute. Stir in oregano and chili powder. Add salt and pepper. Remove from heat. Let stand for 5 minutes. Serve with low-fat sour cream.

Preheat oven to 375f. Place paper liners in a 12-cup muffin pan and spray with olive oil flavored cooking spray. In a mixing bowl, combine cake mix, pumpkin puree, egg beaters, agave nectar and cinnamon. Stir well until the mixture is smooth. Add the water and the salt to the batter. Stir well and fill the paper liners about 2/3 full. Bake for 20 minutes. Remove from the oven and let the cupcakes cool in the pan for 5 minutes. Then remove from the pan and let cool completely. To make the frosting, combine the powdered sugar with the egg beaters and the water. Stir well until the mixture is smooth. Spread a generous amount of frosting onto each cupcake and serve. Makes 12 cupcakes.

Prepare jalapeno and bell pepper. In a blender puree together bell pepper and jalapeno pepper. Strain. Add remaining ingredients. Stir until sugar dissolves. Pour into 2-1/2-quart jar. Process in boiling-water canner 5 minutes. Remove from canner and let cool. Makes about 12 1/3-cup jars.

Cook shrimp in large saucepan in boiling water 2 minutes. Drain and cool completely. Chop coarsely. Stir mayonnaise into shrimp. Add ketchup and next 5 ingredients. Stir well. Refrigerate at least 1 hour. Serve on lettuce leaves or in tomato wedges. Sprinkle with parsley. Makes 4 servings.

In a small bowl combine crushed pineapple and mandarin oranges. In a separate bowl beat the eggs and sugar together. Add the salt and cornstarch and beat well. Stir in pineapple mixture and mix well. Add the orzo and cool whip and mix well. Chill and serve. Serves 8-10.

Cook chicken in a nonstick skillet over medium heat. Stir in chilies and cook 1 minute longer. Stir in chili salsa and cook 1 minute longer. Remove chicken from skillet to a plate. Stir in fat-free half-and-half. Add chicken to mixture. Heat through. Preheat oven to 350f. Spray a baking dish with fat-free cooking spray. Lay tortillas flat on work surface. Spoon 1/4 cup chicken mixture in center of each tortilla. Sprinkle with cheese. Tightly roll tortillas around filling. Place in baking dish. Pour remaining chicken mixture over enchiladas. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until cheese is melted and enchiladas are hot throughout.

Grease four 1-cup ramekins or custard cups. Set aside. In a medium bowl, combine the margarine, marshmallows and chocolate chips until well blended and crumbly. Place the crumb mixture in a resealable plastic bag. Refrigerate until needed. In a medium bowl combine the cereal and peanut butter until well blended and crumbly. Add 2 cups of the ice cream to the crumb mixturefold gently to blend. Divide the ice cream mixture evenly between the four ramekins. Press the remaining crumb mixture over the ice cream mixture. Freeze until set. Makes 4 servings.

In a large bowl add shrimp and stir fry sauce. Marinate shrimp for 30 minutes. Heat a large wok or skillet over medium high heat. Add 1 1/2 TBS of the hot oil and swirl. Add garlic powder and stir fry for 30 seconds. Add shrimp and cook until they turn pink. Remove shrimp from wok. Add the remaining hot oil and swirl again. Add lemon juice and stir fry 1 minute. Add the soy sauce, honey and green onions. Stir fry 1 minute longer. Spoon shrimp over noodles and sprinkle with fresh cilantro.

Heat oil in a 10-inch oven-proof skillet over medium-high heat until hot. Cook sausage until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in onion. Reduce heat to medium and cook for 3 minutes or until onion is tender. Beat together eggs, milk and sour cream in a small bowl. Pour mixture into pan. Cook over medium heat without stirring for 3 to 4 minutes or until top is almost set. Sprinkle with cheese. Continue cooking over medium heat for 1 to 2 minutes or until top is set and cheese is melted. Serve immediately or place in a warm oven.

Melt the chocolate squares in a double boiler or microwave over low heat (watch carefully). Cool slightly. In a medium bowl, mix together the sugar, butter, milk and vanilla extract until fluffy. Slowly add the cooled chocolate to the sugar mixture. Stir until smooth. Chill in the refrigerator before serving. Use this icing as an icing between layers of cake or as a decoration on cakes. To make more icing, multiply the recipe by the number of people you are serving.

Cut angel food cake into cubes. Place cubes into serving glasses or bowls. Divide pudding and spread evenly over cake cubes. Spoon strawberries over cake cubes and pudding. Fold whipped cream into serving bowl or glasses and spoon over cake cubes and pudding. Garnish with strawberry slices and serve immediately.
Brown hamburger. Drain fat. Stir in noodles. Add onion and gravy mix. Heat to boiling. Stir until thickened.

In saucepan over medium heat, add apricots, sherry and water and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about 10 minutes or until apricots are tender. Stir in honey and simmer for 1 minute. Stir in fresh cranberries and simmer for another minute or until cranberries are tender and sauce is thick. Let cool completely and refrigerate. Makes about 2 cups.

Cream the bananas, sugar and vanilla together. Blend in the margarine. Mix in the skim milk and beaten egg. Add the flours and bicarbonate of soda. Fold in the walnuts and divide the batter between greased muffin cups. Bake in a moderate oven for about 25 minutes.

Sprinkle seasoned tilapia fillet on all sides with 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper. Melt butter in large skillet on medium heat. Add fish and cook for 3 minutes. Turn and cook for 3 more minutes. Add the onions and green onions. Cook for 2 more minutes. Add tomatoes and fresh basil leaf. Cook for 2 more minutes. Add monterey jack cheese. Serve warm.

Peel carrots and cut into bite-sized pieces. Place carrots in a medium saucepan with 1 cup water. Bring to a boil and cook for 15 minutes. Drain carrots, reserving water. Add carrots to a food processor or blender with ginger, onion, salt, pepper, water and 1 Tbsp. peanuts. Process until smooth. Taste for seasoning. Transfer carrot mixture to a serving bowl. Heat remaining 1 Tbsp. peanuts in a dry skillet until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle over carrots and garnish with parsley or cilantro. Serve warm with chicken or fish.

In a large mixing bowl combine 4 cups flour, yeast and salt. Add water and milk. Stir to form soft dough. Turn onto floured surface and knead until smooth and elastic. Cover and let rise in warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour. Punch down dough. Divide into 3 pieces. Roll each out into 18x12-inch rectangle. Spread each rectangle with 1/4 cup melted butter. Sprinkle with 1/4 cup sugar. Arrange apple slices and raisins over each rectangle. Roll up tightly starting with the long side. Seal the seam with the remaining melted butter. Place each roll seam down in a greased 15x10x1-inch pan. Cover with greased plastic wrap and let rise in warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour. Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Bake olie bollen until lightly browned, about 30 minutes. Remove from pan and cool on wire racks. To make glaze, combine confectioners sugar and water until smooth.

Combine spinach, salt, pepper, chicken broth, and creole seasoning. Place chicken in the mixture. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes. Arrange tomato halves on top of each chicken breast half. Top each with 2 tablespoons green onions.

Heat oil in skillet and saute ground beef and onion until well browned and crumbled. Add tomato soup and cook until thickened and well heated. In casserole dish layer noodles, then ground beef mixture, then add cheddar cheese, and finally sprinkle with black olives and mushrooms (optional). Bake at 350 for about 40 minutes or until noodles are tender and cheese is melted. Top with fresh parsley before serving.

Melt butter in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add onionsaute 5 minutes. Combine soup, milk, broccoli and 1/2 cup of the Velveeta in a 3-quart casserole. Combine rice, remaining Velveeta and milk in a saucepanbring to a boil. Stir in sauteed onions. Pour into casserole. Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes. Broil 2 minutes or until bubbly and golden brown. Let stand 10 minutes. Serve immediately.
Cut cabbage into fine strips. Saute onions in butter until clear. Stir in flour until brown. Add milk gradually. Add eggs and oysters. Add cabbage. Simmer about 10 minutes. Season to taste.

Combine all the above ingredients in a saucepan, bring to a boil. Simmer for 10 minutes or until thick. Cool slightly then pour into a blender or food processor. Puree until smooth. Pour into a bowl or jar. Refrigerate until serving.

Beat eggs and brown sugar together. Add vanilla and mix well. Add dates to mixture and mix well. Stir in walnuts and cereal. Add candied fruit and stir until evenly coated with mixture. Spoon mixture onto a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Bake at 350 degrees until golden brown. Cool slightly on baking sheet before transferring to cooling rack to cool completely.

In a medium-sized pot over medium-high heat, add the rice and toast for about 3 minutes. Add the shallots, turmeric, coriander and cumin and toast for about 30 seconds. Add the coconut milk and bring to a boil. Add the lime leaves and simmer for about 20 minutes or until the rice is cooked through. Remove the leaves and discard. Season to taste with the salt and pepper. Garnish with fresh coriander and serve with the curry.

Place chicken breasts between sheets of plastic wrap and pound with a meat mallet or the side of a heavy skillet until they are 1/2-inch thick. Sprinkle with salt and shake off excess. Place flour in a shallow dish. Dip chicken breasts into flour, shaking off excess, and set aside. In wok or large skillet over high heat, heat oil until it is very hot. Add chicken breasts in batches and cook until golden brown on one side and crisp, about 1 1/2 minutes on each side. Transfer chicken breasts to plate. Pour off all but 1 tablespoon of wok oil. Stir vinegar and chicken broth into hot wok oil until mixture boils. Add chicken breasts and turn to coat. Reduce heat to low and cover wok or skillet with lid. Cook until chicken breasts are cooked through, about 2 minutes. Divide chicken breasts among 4 plates. Stir chicken broth mixture into hot chicken broth until smooth. Stir lemon curd into hot mixture until smooth. Garnish ch

Soak the barley in a bowl of cold water for an hour. In a saucepan bring to the boil 4 cups of water. Add the barley and cook for 30 minutes. Add the lime juice and a little salt and pepper. Serve hot.

In a large saucepan over medium high heat combine the butter and flour. Stir until the mixture is well blended. Remove from heat and slowly add the milk. Continue stirring until it is smooth. Add the cheese and cook for 2 to 3 more minutes. Remove from heat and stir in the Rice Krispies. Spread onto waxed paper to cool. When cool enough to handle, shape into small balls. Roll in the chopped pecans. Store in the refrigerator. Serve chilled.

Heat oven to 400f. In medium bowl, mix beef, egg, seasonings and onion. Shape mixture into 4 patties. Arrange patties on ungreased baking sheet. Bake 30-35 minute until cooked through. Serve with bun.

In a large mixing bowl combine cream cheese with pineapple, green peppers, green onions, seasoning salt and pimentos until well blended. Shape into a round ballroll in pecan pieces to coat. Refrigerate until serving time. Serve with crackers or celery sticks. Serves 20 to 24 people.

Mix cream cheese and jalapeno in small bowl. Spread evenly onto bottom of 13x9 inch pan. Top with chili. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake at 350 for 15 minutes or until hot and bubbly. Garnish with green onions. Serve with tortilla chips or crackers.

Boil red potatoes until tender, then let cool slightly before cutting them into bite size pieces. Place potatoes in a large bowl and toss with the dressing and spices until coated. Chop the bacon into tiny bits. Add bacon bits and green onions to potatoes and toss until evenly distributed. Chop celery and red bell pepper into bite size pieces. Add to potatoes along with chopped parsley. Chill to blend flavors. Serve cold or at room temperature.

Heat oven to 350. In a small bowl, mix butter, chili powder, cumin, white pepper, salt, oregano. Place butter mixture in a roasting pan. Add the raw peanuts. Roast for about 20-30 minutes. Remove pan from oven. Stir in dried cherries. Roast for another 5 to 10 minutes. Serve warm.
Melt butter in skillet over medium heat. Add bananas and raisins. Stir in sugar and cornstarch. Cook stirring constantly until thickened. Stir in lemon juice. Serve warm.
Cut bananas, oranges and strawberries into slices. Place all the fruit in a glass bowl. Drizzle with orange juice. Top with sour cream and drizzle with honey. Serve chilled.

In a large bowl, combine butter, powdered sugar, vanilla, flour and salt. Mix well. In another bowl, combine pecans and chocolate kisses. In another bowl, combine butternut squash puree with cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg. Mix well. Combine all three mixtures together in one bowl and mix well. Roll mixture into balls and roll in powdered sugar.

Crush the graham cracker in a ziplock bag. Mix the cream cheese and sugar in a bowl. Add the milk and mix with an electric mixer. Fold in the cool whip. Press into the crust. Bake at 400 degrees F for 10 minutes. Mix the pudding with milk. Spread on top and sprinkle with toasted coconut. Bake for an additional 10 minutes. Let cool and serve.

Heat oil over medium high heat. Add onion and saute until onions are clear. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add chicken and saute until just cooked through. Add cumin and stir. Add broth and lemon juice. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until chicken is tender. Stir in orange zest. Add orange juice and capers. Heat through and serve.

Place salmon fillets on greased grill rack. Brush with oil. Grill for 5-6 minutes on each side or until salmon flakes easily with a fork. Combine horseradish, soy sauce, garlic clove, salt & pepper. Brush over salmon while cooking on each side. Combine mayonnaise and sour cream. Spread over salmon to serve. Garnish with basil and lemon juice.

Fry the bacon and remove from pan. Add onion and green pepper and cook over medium heat until tender. Add tomatoes and cook 5 minutes or until heated through. Add cooked rice, salt and pepper. Mix well. Bake in a 2 quart casserole at 350 degrees F for 30 minutes.

In a small bowl combine cheeses until smooth. In another bowl mix together mayonnaise, mustard, and Worcestershire sauce until well blended. Spread one slice of bread with cheese mixture. Top with sliced ham. Spread other slice of bread with cheese mixture. Place over ham and press down. Refrigerate until firm. Cut in the shapes of your choice. Store in the refrigerator.

In a large bowl combine sour cream, cottage cheese, parsley, Tabasco, and lemon juice. Season to taste with salt and pepper. To assemble the salad, layer spinach and carrots into each plate. Top with cherry tomato halves. Spoon sour cream mixture over the top. Garnish with almonds and serve immediately.

In a small mixing bowl combine the ingredients for the dressing and whisk until smooth. Put the broccolini in a large bowl and pour the dressing over the top. Toss well and refrigerate for 1 to 3 hours to marinate. Drain and serve.

Melt the butter and saute the shallot until transparent and light brown. Add the beer and vinegar and bring to a boil. Add the lemon juice and season with cayenne pepper and hot pepper sauce. Chill and garnish with fresh parsley and serve with seafood at your next bbq.

Cut the ends off the eggplants. Slice lengthwise about 3/4 of an inch thick. Place in a shallow baking dish. In a bowl, combine the marina sauce with the basil. Pour over the eggplant. Bake uncovered for 30 minutes. Remove from oven and top with fat free mozzarella cheese. Return to oven and bake for another 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted. Serve with pasta.

Heat oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add onion and cook until it starts to brown, about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and begin to brown. Add potatoes and cook until they start to brown and the liquid is reduced. Stir in lemon juice and season with salt and black pepper. Mash with a potato masher or fork. Transfer mixture to a large bowl. Add sour cream and mix well. Spoon into a greased 10-inch pie plate. Bake at 350 degrees for 40 minutes, or until golden brown. Sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serves 4.

Heat oven to 350 degrees F. Unroll crescent rolls and press together into 12x15-inch rectangle on ungreased cookie sheet. Bake 6-8 minutes until lightly browned. Spread with 1/2 cup of the saucesprinkle with 1 cup of the cheese and the meatballs. Roll up jelly-roll style, starting with long side. Cut crosswise into 3/4-inch slices. Return to cookie sheet and sprinkle with remaining sauce and cheese. Bake an additional 5-8 minutes until heated through. Serve with remaining sauce.

In a large saucepan or wok heat oil over medium heat. Stir in bay leaves and cumin seeds. Stir fry for 2 minutes or until spices are fragrant. Stir in onion and cook for 5 minutes. Stir in cabbage and cook for 5 minutes or until tender. Stir in green chilies and cook for 1 minute. Stir in salt to taste. Pour into a serving bowl. Sprinkle with coconut and cumin to taste. Serve hot or at room temperature.

Combine the lamb with the lemon juice and olive oil in a food processor or blender containermix well. Season with garlic powder, salt and pepper to taste. Set aside for 10 minutes or until the mixture becomes firm. Skewer the meat mixture onto small metal or wooden skewers about 1-inch apart. Grill for 5 to 7 minutes or until cooked through. Serve with grated zest of 1 lemon and pita bread or your favorite bread.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F. In a medium-sized mixing bowl, beat together the butter and sugars until well-blended and light. Beat in the egg and vanilla. Combine the flour and baking soda. Add the dry mixture to the creamed mixture and mix well. Add the chocolate chips and mix well. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake for 10 minutes. Allow cookies to cool on the sheet for 1 minute. Transfer to wire racks to cool. Store tightly covered at room temperature. Makes approximately 3 1/2 dozen.

In a large dutch oven or kettle, brown chicken halves over medium high heat. Remove from pan and set aside. In same pan saute garlic powder and cumin until fragrant, about one minute. Add chili powder and cook one minute longer. Stir in salsa, water, corn and beans. Bring to boilreduce heat and cover. Simmer for 10 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve with cornbread and your choice of toppings if desired.

Heat oven to 350F. Line 8 x 8-inch square pan with foil, letting ends extend over sides. Grease foil.Combine flour, baking powder, cocoa, baking soda and salt. Beat butter and granulated sugar until light. Add eggs one at time beating after each addition. Beat in flour mixture alternately with lemon juice and lemon zest, beginning and ending with flour mixture. Stir in chopped nuts. Spread batter in prepared pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes. Cool completely. Remove from pan using ends of foil as handles. Sprinkle with icing sugar. Yields 12 brownies.

Prepare the marinade by stirring together the lime juice, garlic, cumin and oregano. Let stand for about 2 minutes. Add the chicken and marinate for at least 1 hour or longer at room temperature. Preheat the grill for medium-high heat or heat a grill pan over medium-high heat. Remove the chicken from the marinade, discarding the marinade. Grill the chicken for about 1 minute per side or until the outside is grilled and no longer pink in the center. Remove from the grill and let rest for about 2 minutes. Meanwhile, prepare the garnishes by stirring together the olives, parsley and lime juice in a small bowl. Cut the chicken into slices about 1-inch thick and arrange on the tortillas. Top with the garnishes and serve.
Place peas in a bowl and add enough butter to coat. Microwave on high for 1 1/2 minutes. Stir in honey and pecans. Serve warm.

Place pie shell into pie pan. Combine swiss cheese & mozzarella cheese. Sprinkle pepperoni & onion. In a mixing bowl combine milk, eggs, salt & oregano. Pour over cheese mixture. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees for 1 hour. Serve warm.

In a large nonstick skillet or wok, heat 1 tablespoon of the oil over medium-high heat. Add the squash and cook until tender and lightly browned, about 3 minutes per side. Transfer to a platter and keep warm. In the same skillet, add the remaining 1 tablespoon of oil and the onion and cook until translucent, about 3 minutes. Stir in the garlic and cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Stir in the jalapeno and cook until just softened, about 1 minute more. Stir in the tomatoes and cook until most of the juices have evaporated, about 2 minutes more. Stir in the corn and cook until warmed through, 1 minute more. Return the squash to the pan and sprinkle with the chili powder, salt and pepper. Transfer to a platter and serve immediately, garnished with the cheddar cheese if desired. Serves 4

Whisk together flour, salt and baking powder in a large bowl. In a separate bowl combine the egg and vanilla. Then add the milk and melted butter and whisk until smooth. Add the egg and vanilla mixture to the flour mixture and whisk until smooth. Add the applesauce and stir until smooth. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add a small amount of butter. Use a 1/4 cup measuring cup to scoop the batter into the skillet. Cook for about 3 minutes on each side or until the pancakes are golden brown and cooked through. Serve warm.

In a small bowl, combine the oil and sesame seeds. Set aside. In a small skillet, cook the beans in the broth for 2 to 3 minutes or until crisp-tender. Drain well. Toss the beans with the oil mixture and season with the salt and pepper to taste. Makes about 4 servings.

In large skillet or wok, heat sunflower oil over medium heat. Add carrots and leeks and saute until tender. Add orange segments and ketchup and cook until thickened. Add brown sugar and cook until melted and carrots are tender-crisp, 3 - 5 minutes. Stir in soy sauce and heat through. Remove from heat and sprinkle with peanuts. Serve over rice. Serves 4

In a small skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Cook onion and celery for 3 minutes or until tender. Stir in soup and cook for 3 minutes or until hot. Set aside. Cut biscuits into 1/2-inch slices. Combine with onion mixture and poultry seasoning and pepperset aside. Place pork chops on a baking sheet and coat with cooking spray. Bake for 15 minutes or until no longer pink in the center. Meanwhile, in a medium saucepan, bring milk to a boil over medium heat. Reduce heat and simmer for 3 minutes or until thickened slightly and bubbly. Remove from heat and stir in poultry seasoning and pepper. Spoon milk mixture and biscuit mixture over pork chops. Bake 8 minutes longer or until biscuit mixture is golden brown and bubbly.

Heat olive oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, celery, carrots and pecans and cook until vegetables are tender, 5-6 minutes. Add the rice and broths and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover the pan and simmer until rice is tender, about 30 minutes. Fluff the rice with a fork. Stir in the mushrooms just before serving. Serve with grated cheese if desired.
Mix all ingredients together until smooth and batter-like. Cook on a hot griddle in batches until lightly browned on both sides. Serve with fruit jam or real maple syrup and enjoy.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (180 degrees C).In a medium bowl, combine the chicken thighs with the potatoes. Pour over the tomatoes. Combine the garlic with the dried oregano, fresh rosemary, lemon juice, and 1/4 teaspoon of salt and 1/8 teaspoon of pepper. Pour over the chicken mixture. Toss well to coat. Place the chicken thigh mixture into a casserole dish. Bake for 1 1/2 hours. Serve hot.

Place quinoa in a saucepan with a splash of water. Bring to a boil and then turn down to low for around 20 minutes until the quinoa has absorbed all of the water. Add the rest of the ingredients in a large mixing bowl. Stir well. Serve at room temperature.

Rinse ribs and pat dry. Mix together mustard and water until smooth. Place ribs in pressure cooker. Add enough water to cover ribs by one inch. Add the rest of the ingredients except for the beer. Stir well. Cover and cook on high pressure for 40 minutes. Add beer and cook for 5 minutes. Open and serve.

Slice onion into thin slices. Slice garlic cloves into thin slices. Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Saute the onions and garlic until the onions are transparent and the garlic is golden. Add the zucchini and green pepper and cook until tender crisp. Add the parsley and the basil and cook for about 1 minute. Add the salt and pepper and remove from heat. Serve immediately over pasta. Garnish with parmesan cheese and fresh parsley.

In a 12-inch nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray, saute peppers and onion until tender. Stir in tomatoes and saltbring to boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer 5 minutes or until thickened. Make 6 indentations in pepper mixturebreak 1 egg into each indentation. Sprinkle with pepper. Reduce heat to lowcover and cook just until egg whites are set but yolks are still runny. Sprinkle with parsley, if desired.

Heat oven to 350f. In medium bowl, combine beef with oregano, salt and pepper to taste. Shape into 4 patties. In a small bowl, combine feta and olive with 1/2 cup of water. Place patties and feta mixture in a baking dish and bake for 10 minutes or until beef is done. Top with lettuce and tomato and serve with pita bread round and tzatziki sauce.

Place graham cracker crumbs into a medium bowl. Add sugar, margarine, and water. Mix until thoroughly combined. Press mixture into bottom of a lightly greased 9x13x2 inch pan. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 12 minutes. Combine pineapple juice, cornstarch, and sugar. Stir constantly until thickened. Add crushed pineapple, coconut, mini marshmallows, and cherries. Pour into prepared pan. Chill for at least 1 hour. Fold Dream Whip into prepared pineapple mixture. Spread over top of pineapple mixture. Refrigerate for at least 2 hours.
Heat butter in a small skillet over medium heat. Add wine, water, parsley, hot sauce, salt and pepper. Bring to a boil. Add clams. Cover and steam for 5 minutes. Serve clams with lemon wedge.

Slice potatoes into 1/4 inch thick rounds (use leftover mashed potatoes for this). Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Saute potatoes in hot oil until browned on each side. Reduce heat to low. Add onion, green bell pepper, garlic powder, and paprika. Cook until onions are softened. Serve hot. Makes 4 servings.
Soak dates in hot water until soft. Drain them and mash them in a bowl with the cocoa and salt. Add hot water. Mash in avocado. Blend in vanilla. Chill for several hours. Serves 6.

In a medium saucepan combine milk and chocolate chips. Heat until chocolate is melted stirring constantly. Add peanut butter and stir until well combined. Heat until melted and smooth. Add marshmallow creme and stir until smooth. Serve fondue in a fondue pot with graham cracker crumbs and dippers. For dippers, use apple wedges and whole strawberries.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line 24 cup muffin pan with paper liners. Combine flour, baking powder and cinnamon. Add oatmeal, brown sugar and applestoss to combine. In another bowl combine skim milk, egg whites and yogurt. Add to apple mixture and stir until just combined. Spoon batter evenly into prepared muffin cups. Bake 25 to 30 minutes or until toothpick inserted comes out clean. Cool 5 minutes. Serve with butter.

Heat oil in skillet over medium heat. Add mushrooms and cook until tender. Stir in eggs and cook until set. Add milk and mayonnaise. Add stuffing. Cook over low heat for 1 minute. Add tomatoes and green onions. Cook another minute. Add cheese. Serve with crackers.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Peel and wash potatoes and cut into 1 inch chunks. Boil in water for about 10 minutes or until fork tender. Drain and set aside. In a large mixing bowl mash sweet potatoes with butter and cream until smooth. Add brown sugar and spices and continue mashing. Add vanilla and salt. Serve immediately.

Heat the oil in a heavy skillet or saucepan over medium-low heat. Add the garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes or until lightly golden. Add the bay leaves and stir to combine well. Add the red and green bell peppers and saute for 3-4 minutes or until lightly browned. Add the onions and saute for 5-6 minutes or until translucent and lightly browned. Add the tomatoes and saute for 2-3 minutes or until heated through and well combined with the peppers and onions. Season with salt and freshly ground black pepper. Serve with pasta or pizza.

Boil potato until done, about 15 minutes. Drain in colander. Allow to cool. Peel potato and place in food processor. Process until smooth. Place in mixing bowl. Add eggs, sour cream, onion, lemon juice, dill and mustard. Mix well. Adjust seasoning to taste. Spread on toast points and top with smoked salmon. Serve immediately.
Marinate the chicken pieces in the yogurt and spices overnight. Heat oil in a pan and cook chicken until tender. Garnish with chopped coriander. Serve with rice.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F. Beat eggs until light. Add sugar, potato starch and lemon zest. Beat until smooth. Fold in nuts and crumbs. Bake in greased cake pan for 30 min. Cool. Remove from pan. Spread with orange marmalade. Cut into 8 squares. Refrigerate. Serve cold.

Butter one slice of sourdough bread. Layer with slices of turkey breast, thinly sliced onion and a generous amount of cheddar cheese. Butter the other slice of bread and place over the filling. Grill sandwich on both sides until cheese is melted, about 5 minutes. Cut sandwich in half and serve immediately.

Combine rice and water in a heavy saucepan. Bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Reduce heat to low and simmer, covered, for about 50 minutes or until rice is tender. Add tomatoes and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat. Cool and fold in remaining ingredients. Store in the refrigerator for up to 1 week. To serve, reheat casserole in a bain marie in the oven until warm. Serve hot.

Cream together margarine, sugar, honey and peanut butter. Add the vanilla extract and mix thoroughly. Beat the egg well and add to the mixture along with the rice flour and quinoa. Finally add the baking soda and salt. Pour the batter into a lightly greased baking pan and bake for 30 minutes at 350f. When done let cool for 20 minutes then break into pieces. Mix together the icing sugar, milk and vanilla and drizzle over the cookies.

Cut shrimp in half lengthwise and place in shallow dish. In a small bowl, combine lemon juice, oregano and salt and pepper to taste. Stir in garlic and butter and set aside for at least 15 minutes (up to 1 hour). In a small skillet over medium heat, melt butter and add onion and garlic and cook until onion is soft and fragrant, about 10 minutes. Add tomatoes and cook until softened and slightly reduced, about another 10 minutes. Remove from heat and stir in feta cheese and cream. Arrange shrimp on a rimmed platter or baking dish and pour the tomato sauce over top. Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes or until shrimp are just cooked through. Top with green onion before serving.

In a large heavy saucepan over medium heat, heat the butter until it is melted. Add the garlic and onions and saute for a minute or two until the onions are translucent. Add the water and bring the mixture to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for about ten minutes, until the flavors are blended and the water has reduced by half. Add the heavy cream and stir until well blended. Add the cilantro and stir. Season with the salt and pepper to taste and serve immediately.

Lay chicken breasts on a plate and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Put in fridge for about 2 hours. In a food processor, combine the catalina dressing and bacon. Spread onto the bottom of a 9x13 inch pan. Lay chicken breasts on top. Sprinkle monterey jack cheese. Bake at 400F for about 30 minutes. Let cool. Top with green onion. Serve on a bed of lettuce.

Mix together the spinach and strawberries. Drizzle with poppy seed dressing and sprinkle with slivered almonds. Spread goat cheese on the french bread slices. Broil until cheese is lightly browned. Serve with the salad.

Combine shortening and sugars in a large bowl and cream well with a mixer. Add the eggs and mix well. Add the flour and graham flour and mix well. Add baking soda and baking powder and mix well. Add the sour milk and mix well. Add the vanilla extract and mix well. Drop by teaspoon fulls onto a ungreased baking sheet and bake at 350 degrees for about ten minutes or until they are a little brown around the edges. Cool and crumble into small pieces and store in an airtight container.

Beat sweetened condensed milk and lemon juice together until smooth. Add pineapple and mix well. Pour into cooled pie shells. Chill for 2 hours. Top with whipped cream. Garnish with cherries and pecans.

Remove the wing tips and discard the wing bones from the drumettes and flats and put them into a large plastic bag with the dressing and the seasoning and mix well. Marinate at least 2 hours or overnight. Bake at 375 degrees for 1 hour or until crispy and golden brown. Serve with celery and blue cheese dressing.

Mix together the Dijon mustard, lime juice and brown sugar. Put the pineapple into the bottom of a large glass baking dish. Place the chicken on top of the pineapple and pour the Dijon mixture on top of the chicken. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until the chicken is cooked through. Serve on top of rice.

In large skillet, heat oil over medium-high heat. Add onion and saute until soft. Stir in bell pepper and sausage. Cook until sausage is browned. Stir in chicken, celery salt and Cajun seasoning. Saute until chicken is browned and no longer pink. Add tomatoes and water. Cover and simmer for 5 to 6 minutes. Stir and heat until hot. Serve over hot cooked rice.

In small bowl, combine garlic and all spices. Place chicken breasts in a large re-sealable plastic bag. Add the spices. Seal bag. Massage the chicken breasts until the meat is thoroughly covered. Refrigerate 30 minutes. Preheat grill for high heat. Thread chicken breasts onto skewers. Place skewers on grill and cook 3-4 minutes per side or until the meat reaches an internal temperature of 160f. Remove from grill and serve with lemon wedges.

Marinate chicken overnight or 6 hours at least. In a large bowl, combine the marinade ingredients and mix well. Add the chicken, cover and refrigerate overnight or at least 6 hours. Cook in a skillet at medium heat until cooked through.

Preheat oven to 180C/Gas Mark 4. Lightly grease and line two 20cm x 10cm (8in x 4in) loaf tins. Beat together bananas, eggs, brown sugar, buttermilk and oil in a large bowl. Stir in flour, baking powder and cinnamon. Spoon into loaf tins. Bake for 45-55 minutes or until a skewer inserted into the centre of the loaf comes out clean. Cool in tins for 5 minutes, then turn out onto a wire rack to cool completely. Spread both loaves with strawberry jam. Serve warm or cold.

In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine milk, brown sugar, cinnamon, and margarine. Cook until the margarine is melted. Reduce heat to low. Add the oats. Cook for 3 minutes while stirring constantly. Add the apples. Remove from heat. Add cranberries. Sprinkle with walnuts. Serve warm.

Boil potatoes in water for about 20 minutes or until tender. Mash potatoes with a potato masher. Add cream, butter and seasonings and mix well. Add roasted garlic and lavender flowers and mix well. Serve immediately.

In a large pot, melt the butter and add the flour. Cook for 2 minutes while stirring. Slowly add the milk and stir until smooth. Add the broth and bring to a boil. Add the chicken, chili pepper, garlic powder and salt and pepper. Simmer for 10 minutes. Serve warm.

Combine all ingredients except wine. Mix well. Form into meatballs. Place in 9x13 baking pan. Combine wine and 3/4 cup water. Pour over meatballs. Cover and bake at 350 for 1 hour. Serve warm. I think this could be done in a crock pot.

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Sift the flour and muesli together into a large bowl. Mix in the sultanas. Set aside. Melt the butter with the brown sugar in a pot over medium heat. Bring to a boil and let boil for 3 minutes while stirring. Remove from heat and let cool for 5 minutes before stirring in the egg. Pour the mixture into the flour mixture and stir to combine well. Scoop 1 teaspoon of dough onto an ungreased baking sheet and roll into a ball. Space the cookies 1 inch apart on the baking sheet. Bake for 12 to 15 minutes in the preheated oven, or until the cookies are golden brown. Allow to cool for 5 minutes before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

Combine cream cheese, horseradish, and mayonnaise in a small bowl. Cover and refrigerate until ready to serve. Cut each slice of ham in half lengthwise and cut each half into three slices. Spread the cut side of each ham slice with the cream cheese mixture and roll up jelly-roll style. Wrap each roll in a slice of cooked bacon and secure with a small wooden pick. Chill until ready to serve. Serve with horseradish sauce for dipping and seasoning salt sprinkled on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray 8-inch square baking dish with cooking spray. Mix together yellow cake mix and eggs until smooth. Add rhubarb and mix until just incorporated. Stir together 3/4 cup of sugar, heavy cream and cornstarch. Add to batter. Pour into baking dish. Bake 45-50 minutes. Let cool. In a small bowl combine powdered sugar and milk until smooth. Drizzle over cake. Serve at room temperature.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f (175 degrees c). Grease baking sheets. In large bowl, cream margarine and sugars until light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla and eggs, one at a time. Combine pudding mix, milk, and oilstir well. Add to margarine mixture alternately with flour and baking soda, ending with the flour. Stir in chocolate chips. Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto baking sheets about 2 inches apart. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven, or until edges begin to brown.

Melt butter in a large saucepan over medium heat. Add onions and saute until softened, about 5 minutes. Add mushrooms and cook until softened. Add water. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce heat to low, and simmer until mushrooms are tender, 15-20 minutes. Stir in tomatoes and basil. Bring mixture to a boil and cook until thickened, about 5 minutes. Add noodles and cook until tender, 10-12 minutes. Ladle into bowls. Garnish with croutons and Parmesan. Serve immediately.

Line 9x9 pan with parchment paper. Combine margarine, brown sugar and milk in a large saucepan. Cook over medium heat until boiling. Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter and vanilla until melted. Stir in icing sugar. Pour into pan. Let set for at least 1 hour. Cut into 9 pieces and store in airtight container.

Prepare the baking mix according to the directions on the box. Preheat the oven to 325 degrees. Spray a deep dish pie plate with a little non-stick cooking spray. Peel asparagus spears. Cut spears into small pieces. Cook the asparagus in a large skillet over medium heat until tender-crisp. Stir in the ham and continue to cook until the ham is heated through. Remove from the heat. Whisk the eggs in a large bowl. Add the milk and buttermilk. Add the asparagus/ham mixture to the egg mixture. Stir in the swiss cheese. Pour mixture into the pie plate. Sprinkle with the vegetable flakes. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until a knife inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool before serving.

Cut each breast half into two pieces and flatten into a thin slice about 1/2 inch thick. Sprinkle each piece with poultry seasoning. Lay bacon slices across the chicken pieces and roll up. Put the sandwiches onto a greased shallow baking pan. Bake at 425 farenheit for 20 minutes or until chicken is cooked through. Serve on hamburger buns with lettuce, tomatoes and dill pickle slices, if desired.

Cut squash in half lengthwisescoop out seeds and pulp. Cut halves crosswise into 1/2-inch slices. In a saucepan over medium heat, cover squash with water. Bring to boilcook 10 minutes or until tender. Draindiscard water. In another saucepan over medium heat, melt butteradd squash. Cook until squash is heated through, about 5 minutes. Add maple syrupheat through. Add salt and pepper to taste. Serve.

In a medium bowl combine the neufchatel and cream cheese until smooth and blended. Fold in the salsa and lump crabmeat. Spread into a medium baking dish coated with cooking spray. Bake for 20-25 minutes at 350° or until heated through and lightly browned. Serve with corn chips.

Rinse the lentils in a colander under cold running water. Combine the lentils with the cold water in a large saucepan, add the bay leaves and bring to a boil over high heat. Lower the heat and simmer for 25 to 30 minutes or until the lentils are cooked through but firm. Add the carrots, celery, and mushrooms to the soup. Cover and simmer for 10 minutes. Stir in the corned beef, potato, beef stock cube, pepper, and Worcestershire sauce and simmer uncovered for 15 minutes or until the potato is cooked through. Stir in the parsley just before serving.
Slice the cherry peppers and jalapeno peppers. Mix all the ingredients together. Makes a great dip or spread for sandwiches.
In a large saucepan combine carrots and apple with chicken broth, bring to a boil. Reduce heat to low and simmer until carrots are tender, about 30 minutes. Stir in evaporated milk and nutmeg.

Place a large saucepan over medium high heat. Melt butter, stirring constantly. Place marshmallows in saucepancook and stir constantly until melted and combined. Remove saucepan from heat. Stir in peanut butter until well blended. Stir in rice krispies. Pour mixture onto a greased cookie sheet or into a greased bowl. Spread the mixture to form a thin layer. Press the chocolate covered english toffee bars into the mixture to form a layer of chocolate on top. Sprinkle the chocolate chips on top. Let stand for 1 hour or untill set. Cut into 2 inch squares.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). In a large skillet over medium heat, brown turkey in 2 tablespoons of butter. When browned, drain excess fat and discard. In a large bowl, combine the remaining butter, Greek seasoning and mushrooms. Stir well. Place turkey in a casserole dish and cover with mushroom mixture. Bake in the preheated oven until heated through, 30 to 40 minutes.
Rub radish slices with coarse salt. Layer radishes and goat cheese on top of baguette slices. Cut into triangles with a sharp knife. Serve immediately.

Mix together cornstarch and sugar in a medium-size bowl. Add water and lemon juice. Stir until mixture thickens. Add berries and stir until well blended. Pour into a serving bowl. Chill. Sprinkle with slivered almonds. Serve at once.

Melt 1 tablespoon of butter in a 13 x 9-inch baking dish. Sautee diced onion in 2 more tablespoons of butter until tender. Sprinkle 2 cups of cheese on top of potatoes and add cooked and drained bacon bits. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine 1 cup of half-and-half and 2 tablespoons of butter. Add 1 tablespoon of flour and whisk. Slowly add 1 can of cream of mushroom soup and 1 can of cream of celery soup, whisking continuously. Stir in 1 cup of shredded cheese and 1 cup of frozen southern style hash brown potatoes. Add mixture to the 13 x 9-inch dish and bake in a preheated 375 degree F oven for 25 minutes. Sprinkle with remaining 2 cups cheese and bake uncovered for an additional 15 minutes. Serve immediately.

Cut cauliflower into florets. Combine pickling salt, sugar, vinegar, mustard seeds, celery seeds and hot pepper flakes in a large non-reactive saucepan (a non-reactive pan is one made of glass or stainless steel). Stir well to dissolve the salt and sugar. Bring to a simmer over medium heat and add cauliflower florets and pearl onions. Simmer for five minutes or until cauliflower is tender-crisp. Cool before serving.

Combine graham cracker crumbs and melted butterpress onto bottom and up sides of a 9-inch pie pan. Bake at 400 degrees f for 5 minutes. Cool on a wire rack. For fillingCombine nonfat milk and pudding mix in a large bowlbeat with a mixer at low speed 2 minutes or until well blended. Beat at high speed for 2 minutes or until smooth. Spread in the crust. Refrigerate for 15 minutes or until firm. Combine cream cheese and equal in a large bowlbeat at medium speed with a mixer for 1 minute or until smooth. Spread over fillingrefrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Top with whipped toppingrefrigerate for 1 hour or until firm. Cut into wedgesserve immediately or cover and chill up to 1 day.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add butter and allow it to melt. Spread one side of bread with jam and place in skillet. Top with slices of turkey breast and provolone. Add slices of ham and top with other slice of bread. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Flip and cook until golden brown on both sides. Brush with beaten egg and top with slices of turkey breast and provolone. Add slices of ham and top with other slice of bread. Cook until golden brown on both sides. Flip and cook until golden brown on both sides. Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with salt. Serve hot.

Heat oven to 350f. Brown sausage in a 12-inch cast iron skillet. Stir in salsa and water and bring to boil. Remove from heat. Stir in cheese until melted. Spoon into baking dish. Bake 20-25 minutes. Serve with tortilla chips.

Melt margarine in large heavy saucepan. Stir in sugar. Heat to boiling. Boil 2 minutes stirring constantly. Stir in evaporated milk and chocolate. Heat to boiling stirring constantly. Add vanilla. Remove from heat. Stir in marshmallow cream and walnuts. Pour into buttered 13 x 9 inch pan. Cool. Cut into squares.
Combine all ingredients in food processor until smooth. Store in refrigerator. Makes about 1 cup.

Mix broth, mayonnaise, sour cream and celery ribs in a bowl. Cut chicken into 1/2 inch cubes. Add to broth mixture. Add grapes. Refrigerate 3 hours. Drain, reserving liquid. Place in a bowl. Add apple, cantaloupe, almonds. Drizzle with reserved liquid. Add lemon, juice. Toss gently. Refrigerate 1 hour. Makes 4 servings.

Combine all the dry ingredients in a bowl and stir well to blend. Make a well in the center of the mixture and add the wet ingredients and egg and stir just enough to blend. Pour into a greased and floured 10 inch tube pan or a loaf pan and bake at 350 for about 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center of the cake comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan and cooling completely on a rack.

Combine tapioca flour and 1 egg in a big bowl. Mix very well until tapioca flour is completely mixed with egg. Add rest of the eggs and mix well. Add butter and mix well until you see that the dough is soft and creamy, add salt and pepper and mix well. Make sure you don t over mix. Place the dough on your work surface and knead it with your hands for about 2 minutes until the dough is soft and elastic. Cover the dough and let it rest for 30 minutes at room temperature. On the surface of your work area sprinkle some flour and take the dough out of the bowl and roll it with the help of your hands into a long sausage shaped log. Cut the log into small pieces around 2 cm thickness and place them on the surface of your work area, cover them with plastic wrap and let them rest for another 30 minutes at room temperature. Take each piece and roll it out with the help of your hands into small circles of around 14 cm in diameter. Place each circle on your work surface and add one tablespoon of cheese in the middle of each circle

In a small bowl combine the juices of 1 orange and 1 lime, 1 tbs. minced cilantro and 1/4 tsp. minced garlic. Place in a resealable plastic bag along with the snapper fillets. Season with a little salt and pepper. Close bag, pressing out as much air as possible. Marinate in the refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours. Remove fish from the bag and drain any remaining marinade into a bowl. Cook the snapper on the grill over direct high heat for 4 to 6 minutes per side or in a saute pan over medium-high heat for 3 to 5 minutes per side.

In large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder and salt. Cut in butter until mixture is crumbly. Stir in milk and vanilla. Stir in water and syrup. Drop by rounded teaspoon onto greased baking sheet. Bake at 375f for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot. Makes about 36.

In a large bowl, combine oats with oil and maple syrup. Let stand 10 minutes. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Combine oats mixture with honey and orange juice. Spread mixture onto a baking sheet and bake for 40 minutes. Remove from oven and stir in cinnamon and nutmeg. Spread back onto baking sheet and bake 10 minutes. Stir in raisins and bake 15 minutes more. Cool completely on a baking sheet and store in an airtight container. Makes 12 cups.

Cut avocados in half. Scoop flesh into large bowl. Peel onion and chop. Squeeze lime juice over avocadoes. Add onion. Season with cumin and cayenne. Mash avocadoes with fork. When mixture is smooth add tomato and cilantro. Stir to combine. Serve with tortilla chips.

Cut 1/4 inch off bottom of each green bean. Trim the ends. Heat olive oil in a 12 inch nonstick skillet over medium heat. Add the green beans and garlic. Cook the garlic 1 minute. Add the dry white wine to deglaze the pan. Bring the wine to a boil. Add the lime juice and salt and pepper to taste. Cook the beans until they are tender. Top with cheese. Serve immediately.

Cut pork roast in half and place in the crock pot. Add soup, gravy mixes and seasoning mixes. Add water to just cover roast. Cook on low for 6-8 hours. Slice pork into 1 inch strips and serve over mashed potatoes.

Place the green beans in a saucepan. Cover with cold water. Bring to a boil, then drain. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the garlic, salt, and pepper to taste. Add the green beans. Cook until the beans are heated through. Sprinkle with the cilantro. Serve hot.

Spread each side of bagels with 2 teaspoons of pesto sauce. Top with cheese and ham. Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with basil. Broil for 2 minutes or until the cheese is melted and the bread is browned.

Mix biscuit mix and milk until dough forms. Roll into ball and place on floured surface. Roll out dough into a circle about 12 inches in diameter and 1/8-inch thick. Crumble sausage into pan. Add green chilies and stir until sausage is evenly distributed and cooked through. Beat eggs with milk in separate bowl until smooth. Pour over sausage mixture and stir until eggs are evenly distributed. Sprinkle on half the cheese. Roll up the dough into a log and wrap with plastic wrap. Chill for at least 2 hours or until dough is firm enough to roll up again. Unwrap the dough and roll into a circle about 12 inches in diameter and 1/8-inch thick. Sprinkle with remaining cheese. Bake at 425 for about 15 minutes or until golden and cheese is melted. Slice into wedges and serve with salsa.
Place the tea bags in the teapot. Add the mint leaves. Pour the boiling water over. Cover the pot and let the tea steep for 5 minutes. Strain the tea. Add the lemon juice and lemon slices. Serve.

Bring beans to boiling in salted water. Cook 3 minutes until just tender-crisp. Remove from heat and drain. Rinse beans under cold running water to stop the cooking process. In a medium bowl whisk together mustard, vinegar and red onion. Add beans and toss to coat. Add hazelnuts and toss to mix well. Transfer to serving plate. Drizzle with oils, tossing to combine. Add sea salt to taste, tossing to combine. Let stand 5 minutes to let flavors combine before serving.

Place roast in a crock pot. In a bowl, combine barbecue sauce, apricot preserves, mustard, brown sugar, onion, and beef broth. Pour mixture over roast. Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or high for 4 to 5 hours. Shred meat with two forks. Serve on rolls with toppings of choice.

Spread 1/4 cup cream cheese over tortillasprinkle with 1 tsp prepared horseradish and 1 tsp dijon-style mustard. Top with spinach and roast beef. Fold up sides and roll up tightlywrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate 2 hours or overnight before serving. Cut in halfserve with cheddar cheese.

Steep gingerroot and lemongrass in 1 quart of cold water for 1 hour. Remove gingerroot and lemongrass. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat to simmer. Simmer for 10 minutes. Strain. Pour over tea bag. Remove bag when tea is done brewing. Stir in honey. Serve with lemon slice. Serves 4.

Melt butter over medium heat. Sautee onion until translucent. Add potatoes, squash, and stock. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Mash with an immersion blender or regular blender. Add vinegar, pepper and spinach. Serve with chopped green onion.

Place olives in a bowl and add lemon juice, thyme sprigs, salt, and peppercorns. Massage well with your hands until olives are well coated with mixture. Place in 2-quart jar with tight fitting lid and add oil to cover olives. Let stand for 2 daysthen taste and adjust seasonings if necessary. Can be stored in refrigerator up to 2 months.

Cook spaghetti as directed. Drain, rinse under cold water, drain again and return spaghetti to pot. Melt oil in pan over medium heat. Add onion and cook until translucent. Add sauce and heat through. Add pasta, olives, capers and tuna. Mix well. Add salt and pepper and red pepper flakes to taste. Serve hot.

Place the potatoes in a large saucepan. Cover with cold water by 1 inch. Bring to a boil over high heat. Reduce heatcover and cook until tender. Drain the potatoes. Cut the pork into 1/2-inch cubes. In a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat, cook the pork until browned. Add the onions and mushroom soupbring to a boil. Reduce heat to lowcook 8 to 10 minutes or until heated through. Add the milkheat through. Stir in the cheese until melted. Pour the mixture into a 1-1/2-quart baking dish. Add the drained potatoes. Top with the chops. Bake at 350 for 25 to 30 minutes or until heated through. Sprinkle with parsley.

In a large bowl combine oats, flour, brown sugar, baking powder and cinnamonblend well. In a separate bowl combine apples with 1/2 cup flour, the lemon juice and zest and cinnamontoss lightly to blend. Stir apple mixture into oat mixture. Spread mixture evenly in a 13x9 inch baking dish. Bake at 375 for 10 minutessprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup flour and 1/3 cup sugarbake an additional 20 minutes. Cool in the pan on a wire rack for 15 minutescut into squares and serve topped with whipped cream and a dollop of frozen yogurt if desired.

Spread cream cheese to thin layer on each tortilla. Top each with 4 ham slices. Top with 3 pickle slices. Roll up. Secure with toothpicks. Wrap securely in plastic wrap and refrigerate until ready to serve. May be cut in half to serve as appetizer. Serve with sweet mustard or ranch dressing.

Beat egg whites with salt until stiff peaks form. Gradually add the sugar and vanilla and beat until stiff. Fold in the crumbs and nuts. Spread in a 9-inch pie plate. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely on a wire rack. Top with the topping and refrigerate until ready to serve. Sprinkle with the chocolate before serving. Makes 8 servings.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees f. Grease and flour 2 (8 inch) round cake pans. In a large bowl cream together the butter and sugar. Add the vanilla and the eggs one at a time. Beat well after each addition. Stir in the sour cream and mashed bananas. Sift together the flour, baking soda and salt. Stir into the banana mixture. Fold in the walnuts. Pour the batter into the prepared pans. Bake for 25-30 minutes or until a wooden pick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from the pans. Cool completely. Spread the frosting between the layers and on the top and sides of the cake. Store in the refrigerator.

Cook rice as directed on package. Meanwhile, in a 10-inch skillet brown sausage over medium heat until no longer pinkdrain. Stir in salsa until heated throughremove from heat. Spread rice in a 9-inch square baking dish. Sprinkle with half of sausage mixturetop with 2 cups of cheddar cheese. Beat together eggs and milk. Pour over cheesetop with remaining sausage mixture and 2 cups cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered at 375 for 30 minutes or until a knife inserted 1-inch from edge of pan comes out clean. Let stand 10 minutes before cutting into squares to serve. Makes 12 squares.
Combine all in a heavy sauce pan. Heat until it boils. Boil for 2 minutes. Pour into a sterile jar and seal. Will keep in the refrigerator for several weeks. Great for ice cream.

In a large bowl, combine ricotta cheese, tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, basil, oregano, salt and pepper. In another bowl, beat eggs until frothy. Add ricotta mixture to eggsstir well to combine. Heat olive oil in oven-proof frying pan over medium-high heat. Pour egg mixture into panspread to cover bottom of pan. Bake uncovered for 20 to 30 minutes or until golden brown and set. Slice into wedges to serve.

Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add the butter and garlic and cook until the butter is melted and the garlic is fragrant. Add the noodles and toss until they are coated in the butter mixture. Remove the pan from the heat. Stir in the seasoning blend and sauce mixture. Transfer the noodles to a serving platter and sprinkle with the Parmesan cheese.

Peel, core and slice apples. Put into a saucepan with sugar, passion fruit pulp and 40 ml of water. Simmer on low heat for 10 minutes or until tender. Allow to cool. Preheat oven to 190c/375f. To make the crumble, place biscuits in a food processor and process until fine. Place butter in a small saucepan over low heat. When melted add biscuit mixture and stir well to combine. Remove from heat and stir through vanilla ice cream. Pour apple mixture into an ovenproof dish. Spread the crumble mixture over top and bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown. Serve hot with vanilla ice cream or cream on the side.

In a large pot of salted water over high heat, cook potatoes until tender. Drain potatoes. In a saute pan over medium heat, heat extra virgin olive oil. Add onion and garlic salt. Saute until onion is tender. Add potatoes. Stir until potatoes are coated with the onion. Add pepper. Serve.

Spray inside of crock-pot with cooking spray or nonstick spray. Layer ham slices over bottom of crock-pot, followed by onion and pepper. Top with half of hash browns and half of cheese. Pour milk over the top. Crack eggs on top of all, sprinkle with salt and pepper. Cover crock-pot and cook on low setting for 4 hours or until eggs are cooked through. Serves 6-8.

In a 12 inch nonstick skillet over medium high heat, cook the chicken until no longer pink. In a small bowl combine the egg beaters, milk and seasonings. In a separate bowl combine the mushrooms and onions. In the same skillet in which you cooked the chicken, add the cooking oil and mushroom/onion mixture. Cook until the mushrooms are lightly browned. Add the egg mixture and chicken. Cook until the eggs are set. Sprinkle with parsley. Top with cheese. Cook until the cheese is melted. Remove from heat. Cut into 4 wedges. Serves 4.

Soak bread in milk. Beat together eggs and spices. Dip bread in egg mixture and fry in hot oil until golden brown on each side. Remove from heat and drain on paper towel. Drizzle with honey and sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Serve with sour cream and a lemon wedge.

In medium sauce pan, saute onion & celery in butter until tender. Add flour & stir until smooth. Add chicken broth & stir until smooth. Add crabmeat & cook for 2 minutes or until heated through. Add milk & season with Old Bay seasoning & pepper. Simmer for 2 minutes. Serve hot with garlic toast & fresh parsley sprinkled on top.

Cook couscous as directed on package. Strain and set aside. Heat oil in large skillet over medium heat. Stir in onion and garlic. Saute for a few minutes. Add broth and soy sauce. Simmer until broth has reduced. Stir in couscous and parsley. Cook for a few minutes. Stir in ginger and lemon juice. Serve hot.

Combine sugar and butter in a saucepan. Stir over medium low heat until sugar is dissolved. Raise temperature and boil for about 1 minute. Stir in evaporated milk and pumpkin. Reduce heat and simmer for about 1 minute. Add spices. Stir in marshmallow creme and vanilla. Remove from heat and pour into a greased 11x17 inch baking pan. Cover the mixture and refrigerate overnight. Cut into 2 inch squares and roll in the chocolate chips. Allow the fudge to dry before serving.

Combine the Italian dressing and soy sauce. Place the roast in a resealable plastic bag. Pour marinade over roast. Marinate for 2 hours. Preheat oven to 350 F. Heat oil in a large frying pan. Place roast in pan. Bake for 1 1/2 hours or until a meat thermometer reads 150 F. Remove from heat. Cover. Let stand for 10 minutes. Slice. Serves 6.

Cut cherry tomatoes in half lengthwise. Scoop out some of the inside of each tomato half so it will hold more cream cheese filling. Scoop out enough of each half so it will hold 1 teaspoon of filling. Combine tuna, cream cheese, onion, salt, pepper, lemon juice, heavy cream, and mayonnaise in small bowlmix well. Spoon 1 teaspoon of tuna mixture into each tomato half.

Place the tortilla chips in a single layer on a large baking sheet. Top evenly with the refried and ranch style beans. Bake until the chips are crisp and golden, about 5 minutes. Remove from oven. Top with the cheddar cheese. Bake until the cheese melts and the chips are heated through, about 2 minutes. Top with the sour cream and jalapeno peppers. Serve with the tabasco sauce.

Place bread pieces into the bowl of a food processor. Pulse until bread is very finely ground. In a small bowl mix oil, vinegar, chile, cumin and garlic together until the garlic is finely minced but the mixture is not pasty. Put the bread crumbs on a plate and add the egg yolks one at a time, dunking them into the crumbs after each one to make sure the yolks are completely coated with bread crumbs. Heat oil for frying. Gently break each yolk into the oil with a spoon. Fry over medium heat until the whites are cooked and the yolks are just set. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with the bread crumbs and the oil mixture for dipping.

In a large bowl, toss the blueberries, peaches, sugar and lemon juiceset aside. In a medium bowl combine the flour, baking powder and saltstir with a whisk. Using your fingers, rub the butter into the dry ingredients until it resembles a coarse meal. Add the milkstir until just combined. On a lightly floured surface, knead the dough until smooth (you may have to add more milk). Roll the dough into a large rectangle about 1/4 inch thick. Spoon the fruit mixture evenly over the dough. Starting at the long edge, roll the dough up like a jelly rollcut the roll crosswise into 1/2-inch slices. Place the dumplings in a large saucepancover with cold water. Bring to a boilreduce the heat and simmer for 10 minutes or until the dumplings are cooked through. Serve warm.

Cook bacon in a large pot over medium heat until crisp. Remove bacon from pot. Add onion to potcook until tender, stirring occasionally. Stir in potatoes. Add waterbring to a boil. Reduce heatcover and simmer until potatoes are tender, about 15 minutes. Stir in fat-free half-and-half, corn, corn kernels, bacon, salt, and pepper. Simmer over low heat 10 minutes longer or until potatoes are very tender. Stir in milk. Garnish with green onions.

Place roast in 4-quart slow cooker. Cover with baby carrotspour water and soup over all. Mix together basil, worcestershire sauce, minced onionpour over roast and vegetables. Covercook on low-heat setting for 8-10 hours or until meat is tender. Serve with mashed potatoes.

Prepare graham cracker crust in a pie pan. Mix pudding and drink mix in a small bowl until well-blended. Add skim milk and continue stirring until smooth. Refrigerate. Whip cool whip. Spread cool whip on pie crust. Fill crust with pudding mixture. Refrigerate. Garnish with fresh lemon rind.

Place the first 5 ingredients into the bread pan. Add the dried onion. Place the remaining ingredients into the bread machine. Select the basic white bread cycle. When the cycle is complete, remove the bread from the bread machine and place on a wire rack to cool.

In a large skillet saute beef over medium heat until cooked through, about 12-15 minutes. Stir frequently. Drain excess fat from skillet. Add remaining ingredients. Cook over medium heat until mixture boils, stirring occasionally. Simmer until mixture thickens slightly, about 10-15 minutes. Serve over rice or pasta. Garnish with green onions if desired.

Trim ends of haricots verts. Place in pot of boiling salted water. Cook until tender, 3 to 4 minutes. Drain and set aside. In a small saute pan over medium heat, cook bacon until crisp. Remove from heat. In a medium bowl, whisk together vinegar, salt to taste, shallot and walnut oil. Add the warm bacon vinaigrette to the haricots verts and toss. Serve immediately with chopped parsley.

Preheat oven to 375 degrees. Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper or spray with cooking spray. In medium skillet cook bacon over medium heat until browned, drain on paper towels. Crumble baconset aside. In large skillet cook onion in butter until tender. Stir in milk, flour and garlic powdercook 1 minute, stirring constantly. Stir in cream cheesecook 2 minutes or until cheese is melted. Stir in baconremove from heat. On each crescent roll place 1 teaspoon of onion mixturetop with 1 teaspoon cheese. Cut each triangle in half diagonally. Roll up trianglesplace cut side down on prepared baking sheets. Sprinkle with parsley. Bake 12 minutes or until golden brown. Serve warm with additional cheese if desired.

Heat the oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the livers and brown them on both sides. Add the onions and garlic and cook for another minute or two. Add the tomatoes and peas and cook for about five minutes more. Season with the basil and pepper. Serve the marinara sauce over pasta. Garnish with parsley and Parmesan cheese, if desired.

Snip chop pepper into 1/4-inch pieces and chop onion into 1/2-inch pieces. In 12-inch skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat. Cook onion and pepper in oil until onion is translucent and pepper is tender crisp about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic, diced tomatoes and oregano. Cover and cook for 30 minutes or until pasta is tender. Stir in seafood. Cook for 2 minutes or until seafood is cooked through. Serve over angel hair pasta.
Stir together blue cheese, olives, and gin in large mixing glass. Stir in vermouth. Serve in martini glass with cocktail onions on top.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C).Line muffin cups with paper liners. In a medium bowl, combine the graham cracker crumbs and melted butter. Press into the bottom and up the sides of the paper liners. Bake for 6 minutes in the preheated oven.Cream the cream cheese and cocoa powder together until smooth. Beat in the fat free sweetened condensed milk and vanilla. Stir in the chocolate chips. Spoon the mixture into the paper lined cups. Bake for about 23 minutes in the preheated oven. Cool completely in the pans. Serve chilled.

Bring water to boil. Add cinnamon sticks and sugar. Boil 5 minutes until sugar is dissolved and sticks are flavored. Remove from heat and let cool. Combine all ingredients and pour into 1 quart souffle dish or glass pie dish. Bake uncovered at 350 for 30 minutes. Serve warm with whipped cream. Refrigerate leftovers.

Combine milk and cream in a medium saucepan set over medium heat. Bring to a simmer and then remove from heat and set aside to cool completely to room temperature, about 1 hour. Combine sugar and white chocolate in a medium heatproof bowl and set it over a double boiler set over medium heat. Heat until the chocolate is melted and the mixture is smooth, 3 to 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Stir in vanilla and brandy and let cool to room temperature. Whisk the cooled milk and cream mixture into the white chocolate mixture until well combinedreturn the mixture to the saucepan and set it over medium heat. Heat until the mixture is warm and smooth, about 5 minutes, whisking frequently. Remove from the heat and stir in vanilla. Pour into mugs and serve immediately.

In a large pan cook the apples in a little water until they are tender. Drain the apples and set aside in a bowl. Heat the olive oil in the same pan over medium-high heat then add the garlic and cook for a minute or two, stirring continuously. Add the pork fillets and cook for about 2 minutes on each side until they are sealed on the outside and slightly cooked on the inside. Pour in the maple syrup, then add the vinegar and mustard and stir until the sauce thickens. Add the apples and toss through for about one minute until heated through then serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or aluminum foil (or you can use a silpat mat). Wash the vegetables thoroughly and cut into bite-sized pieces (I cut the potatoes into cubes and the onions and squash into half-moons). Toss the vegetables with the olive oil and garlic and spread them out on the baking sheet. Roast the vegetables for 30 minutes or until tender and lightly browned on the edges.
