When the vegetables are done roasting, sprinkle them with rosemary, bay leaves and sea salt. Serve as is or top with freshly grated parmesan cheese.

Cook the quinoa according to directions on the box. Drain the quinoa and allow it to cool. In the meantime, cut the apple into small pieces. In a bowl combine the quinoa, almonds, apple, raisins, cinnamon, vanilla extract, brown sugar, vanilla yogurt. Mix well and serve.

Sauté onion in oil until tender. Add garlic and ginger seasoning. Add beef, breaking up with back of a wooden spoon. Stir until beef is completely browned. Drain fat. Stir in chili seasoning mix, tomato sauce and water. Bring to a boil. Add macaroni and return to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer for 15 minutes. Stir in cheese. Serve with sour cream. Serves 8.

Mix the peanut butter and brown sugar in a bowl. Add the mashed bananas and golden syrup. Beat with an electric mixer. Beat in the egg and then mix in the flour. Stir in the baking soda and mix thoroughly. Drop by spoonfuls onto an ungreased cookie sheet. Bake in a preheated 325F oven for 10 minutes. Cool slightly. Store in an air tight container. Makes 40 small cookies.

Place frozen hash browns in bottom of a 6-8 qt crock pot. Top with bacon. Lay onion & bell pepper on top of bacon. Mix eggs & milk together and pour over potatoes. Sprinkle with cheese. Cook on high 3-4 hours or on low 6-7 hours.

In a large bowl, combine the lettuce, rice, and mild chili pepper. Toss until well mixed. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil. Add the tomatoes and cook for 2 minutes. Add the chicken and cook for 3 minutes or until the chicken is no longer pink. Add the vinegar and season with black pepper. Toss with the rice mixture. Serve on individual plates.

In 4-quart Dutch oven over medium heat, heat oil and sauté garlic 2 minutes. Add broccoli and cook 3 minutes or until bright green. Add beef and sauté 5 minutes or until no longer pink. Stir in oyster sauce, water and fish sauce and cook over medium heat until heated through and slightly thickened. Serve beef and broccoli with rice.

Broil grapefruits for 10 minutes until skin is starting to bubble. In a small bowl, combine butter, sugar, cinnamon. Remove grapefruits from broiler. Brush with butter mixture. Sprinkle with cinnamon sugar. Top each grapefruit with cherry. Broil for an additional 10 minutes.

In a large skillet, heat 1/2 cup butter over medium heat. Add shallots and saute 2 minutes. Add zucchini and saute until soft. Stir in lemon juice and vinegar and cook 1 minute. Add tomato and saute 2 minutes. Add remaining 1/2 cup butter, basil and tabasco. Season with salt and pepper. Serves 2.

In a shallow dish combine flour, white pepper and egg. Dip each fillet in flour mixture. Brown in skillet over med.-high heat in margarine. Turn and brown other side. In a shallow dish combine ham, cheese, orange rind and parmesan cheese. In a small bowl combine milk and egg yolk. Brush each fillet lightly with milk mixture. Top each fillet with ham and cheese mixture. Bake at 350 deg. F for 25-30 min. or until done. Serve immediately.

Preheat the oven to 450f. Mix together salt, sugar, cider vinegar and tarragon vinegar in a bowl large enough to hold the beets. Add the beets and turn them to coat with the vinegar mixture. Place on a baking sheet and bake for 1 hour and 15 minutes or until tender when pierced with a knife. Remove the beets from the oven and set aside to cool slightly. When cooled enough to handle, peel the beets and cut them in half lengthwise. Cut each half crosswise into slices about 1/2 inch thick. Combine the lemon juice, oil and flour in another bowl large enough to hold the beets. Add the beets and turn to coat with the lemon juice mixture. Spread the beets on the baking sheet and bake for about 45 minutes or until browned on the outside. To serve, put a heaping spoonful of beets on the plate and top with a spoonful of sour cream.

Preheat oven to 400f. Mix macaroni and cheese according to directions on box. Grease a 9 x 13 x 2-inch baking dish. Pour in macaroni mixture and spread to the edges of the dish. Layer with ground beef, pepperoni slices and mozzarella cheese slices. Mix pizza sauce with 2 tablespoons water and pour over top. Bake for 20 to 25 minutes. Serve hot.

Preheat oven to 375. Place crusts on cookie sheets. In a small bowl stir together olive oil, chicken breast and wing sauce. Cook in skillet for 3 minutes on each side or until done. Top with blue cheese dressing. Bake for 10 minutes. Top with blue cheese crumbles. Serve with celery and cheddar cheese.
In a large pot, combine all the ingredients. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for about 1 hour or until the sauce thickens. Remove bay leaves before serving. Serve over pasta.

Make the ice cream: In a medium saucepan over medium heat combine the milk, granulated sugar and heavy cream. Stir frequently until sugar has dissolved. Bring to a boil and remove from heat. Stir in vanilla extract and allow to cool slightly. In a medium bowl combine the cake mix with 2 tablespoons of milk to form a paste. Add the remaining milk to the paste and mix well to combine. Fold in the slightly cooled cream mixture and pour into a 1-quart container. Cover and place in the freezer until solid (about 3 hours). Make the ice cream topping: In a small bowl combine the milk and sprinkles until well coated. Place the ice cream in the freezer and allow to harden (about 15 minutes). Gently crush the sprinkle covered ice cream with a fork to break up the ice cream. Top each serving with the crushed ice cream and sprinkles. Serve immediately.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Spray muffin tin. Combine eggs, milk and oil in medium bowl. Stir in biscuit mix and chocolate chips. Spoon batter into muffin cups. Bake for 15-20 minutes. Cool in pan for 5 minutes. Remove from pan and cool completely. Makes 12 muffins.

Melt butter in a large pot over medium heat. Add garlic and cook until fragrant. Add orzo and cook for 1 minute. Add water. Cover pot and cook until pasta is tender. Drain orzo and set aside. Melt butter in a skillet over medium heat. Add shrimp and cook until pink and curled. Season with salt and pepper. Drain shrimp and set aside. Stir half-and-half into orzo pot and heat over medium heat. Add shrimp and basil and heat through. Serve.
Mix together all ingredients in order listed. Pour into prepared pan and bake at 350 for about 45 minutes. When done, invert onto rack.

Preheat oven to 350. In large bowl, beat together eggs, milk and margarine. In medium bowl, combine flour, cornmeal, baking powder and salt. Add to eggs. Stir just until combined. Heat 12 inch skillet sprayed with cooking spray over medium heat. Pour half of the egg mixture into skillet. Cook 3 minutes or until edges start to set. Flip and cook 2 minutes or until golden brown. Repeat with remaining mixture. In separate bowl, combine salsa and cheese. Serve eggs with salsa mixture. Top with salsa and cheese mixture. Serve with flour tortillas.

Peel and slice the fennel bulb and apple thinly and arrange in a large bowl. Slice onion into paper thin slices and scatter over fennel and apple. Toss with oil and lemon juice and season with sugar and pepper. Arrange corn kernals on top of salad and scatter fennel leaves over the top.

Spread each slice of bread with a thin layer of cream cheese, and a thin layer of smoked salmon. Sprinkle with cucumbers, if desired. Drizzle with lemon juice to taste. Serve as is or with crackers or chips.

Cook noodles until they are tender but not mushy. Drain them well and return them to the pot. Add the butter, stirring it into the noodles until it melts. Add the sour cream and stir well. Season the noodles with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium high heat. Add the yellow onions and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Add the golden raisins and continue cooking until the onions begin to brown and carmelize, about another 5 minutes. Add the capers, fresh dill and the seasoning. Cook for an additional minute or two, stirring frequently. Remove from the heat. Top the baguette slices with the onion mixture and top with the shrimp. Serve with a side salad.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Cut French bread in half lengthwise. Spread cut side of bread halves with butter. Rub cut sides of bread halves with garlic cloves. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Wrap in foil. Bake for 5 minutes. Unwrap breadbake for 10-15 minutes or until crisp.

Slice onion thinly. Fry in oil until light brown. Add salt and pepper to taste. Grill hot dogs in the same skillet you fried the onions in. Place on bun bottoms with onions and top with cheese whiz. Serve on bun tops.

Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Melt margarine in large pan or skillet. In large bowl, mix flour and 3 cups of the skim milk. Gradually stir into the margarine mixture until smooth. Bring to boil on stovetop and stir constantly until mixture thickens and forms a thin paste. Pour half the mixture into 2 quart casserole dish. Layer with half the potatoes and ham, spread with half the remaining mixture. Repeat layers and top with remaining mixture and cheddar cheese. Bake until heated through and top is lightly browned.

In a large bowl, combine the pasta, vegetable oil, vinegar, sugar, mayonnaise, cucumber, red onion, cauliflower, broccoli, black olives and Italian dressing. Stir well to mix. Cover and refrigerate. Serve cold. Makes 4 servings.

Grease 9-inch square pan. Roll dough to fit pan. Bake at 375 F for 10 minutes. Cool for 5 minutes. Beat together eggs, sugar, flour, baking powder. Beat until well blended. Stir in lemon juice. Spread over the warm cookie base. Bake at 375 F for 20 to 25 minutes or until lightly browned. Cool completely. Dust with powdered sugar. Cut into squares.

In a large bowl combine olive oil with rosemary. Cut bell peppers in half, remove seeds. Slice bell peppers into thin strips. In a small bowl combine cherry tomatoes with parmesan cheese. Place flatbread on cookie sheet. Brush with olive oil mixture. Arrange bell peppers, tomatoes and cheese on flatbread. Broil for 5 minutes or until flatbread is crisp. Sprinkle with parmesan cheese. Serve with tandoori chicken.

Preheat grill to medium high heat. In a small bowl combine the parsley, garlic, shallot, italian seasoning and rosemary. Combine the mustard and lemon juice and mix well. Brush the chicken breasts on both sides with the oil and season with salt and pepper. Place the chicken breasts on the grill and cook for 3 minutes per side or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken from the grill and spread the mustard mixture on the top side of the chicken breasts. Return the chicken to the grill and cook for 2 minutes more. Serve while hot.

Mix flours, sugar, baking powder, salt and baking soda in a bowl. Cut in shortening with pastry blender or fork until mixture is crumbly. Stir in buttermilk until a soft dough forms. Turn onto a lightly floured surface and knead gently about eight times until smooth. Pat dough into a rectangle about an inch thick and cut into eight triangles. Place on greased baking sheets and bake at 375 for about ten minutes or until lightly browned. Makes two servings.
Mix dry ingredients together well. Stir in sour cream, milk and egg until smooth. Heat oil in skillet or cast iron pan. Pour batter in skillet. Bake at 350 for 35-55 minutes (depending on thickness).

Preheat oven to 400f. Spray or grease a muffin tin well. In a bowl combine the beef, stuffing mix, and egg until well blendedadd in the BBQ sauce and mix well. Spoon the mixture into the prepared muffin tins. Sprinkle each muffin with 1 tsp cheddar cheese and bake for about 20 minutes or until cooked through. Cool slightly before removing from the muffin tin and serving. Serve warm or at room temperature with BBQ sauce for dipping.

In a double boiler melt the butter and chocolate until smooth. Remove from heat and stir in condensed milk until well combined. Stir in the nuts and pour into a greased 11x7x2 inch baking pan. Chill for 2 hours or until firm. Cut into squares and dust with coconut or a dusting of powdered sugar.

Heat olive oil in saucepan. Add garlic and chili peppers. Cook 1 minute. Add chicken and water. Cook 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Stir in lemon juice and oregano. Cook 3 minutes. Serve over pasta.

In a small saucepan bring preserves to a boil. Add ginger. Cook until mixture thickens. Remove from heat. Stir in lime juice, mustard, and lime zest. Remove ham steak from package. Cut each steak in half to make 2 thin steaks per package. Rub steaks with lime juice. Sprinkle generously with pepper. Grill over medium heat for 4 minutes on each side or until desired doneness. Brush glaze on steaks while they are still hot.

Preheat grill. In a small bowl, combine soy sauce, ginger, and green onion. Set aside. Combine orange juice with lime juice. Drizzle salmon steaks with teriyaki sauce. Place on preheated grill and grill 6 minutes on each side. Baste with orange/lime mixture. Cook another 1 1/2 minutes on each side. Baste again and cook about 1 minute per side or until salmon is firm and no longer translucent. Serve with rice and sliced tomatoes and lime wedges.
In a medium saucepan combine water, brown sugar and heavy cream. Bring to a boil. Add cinnamon and vanilla. Boil 2 minutes. Cool and serve.

Preheat the oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C). In a large bowl, stir together the flour, baking powder and salt. Cut the cold cream cheese into small pieces and stir into the flour mixture until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs. Add the sugar and milk and stir just until the dough starts to come together. Turn out onto a lightly floured surfaceknead lightly. Roll out to 1/2 inch thickness. Cut with a 2 1/2 inch biscuit cutter. Place 1 inch apart onto ungreased baking sheets. Bake for 10 to 12 minutes in the preheated oven, until the tops are lightly browned. Serve warm. Makes 12 biscuits.

Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Wash potatoes and remove all eyes or sprouts. Cut each potato into 6 wedges. Place on baking sheet and brush lightly with oil and sprinkle with sea salt. Bake potatoes for 35-40 minutes, or until tender. Remove from oven and set aside to cool slightly. Prepare sour cream by combining all ingredients. Slice chives and add to sour cream mixture. Toss potatoes with sour cream mixture until well coated. Refrigerate until serving time. Garnish with chives.
